fields.name: Pecan Chicken Casserole
fields.title: Pecan Chicken Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole with a pecan-cheddar crust, filled with chicken, cheese, dill, onion, and a hint of hot pepper sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup (4 ounces) finely shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Peel and grate potato.
Finely shop onion.
Mix well - all ingredients.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally featured in Taste of Home magazine in February/March 2004 and was submitted by Jackie Heyer from Cushing, Iowa. It gained popularity after being shared on a radio show.

fields.name: Hamburger Casserole
fields.title: Tater Tot Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole with hamburger, onion, mushroom soup, and tater tots.
instructions: Brown ground beef in a pan.
Add chopped onion to the pan and cook until softened.
Pour cream of mushroom soup over the beef and onion mixture.
Top with tater tots.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
fields.comment: Tater tot casserole is a classic comfort food dish that has been popular in the United States since the 1950s.  It's known for its simplicity and affordability.

fields.name: Walter's Ham and Egg Salad Sandwiches
fields.title: Walter
fields.description: A simple open-faced sandwich featuring ham, eggs, cheese, and a flavorful sauce, broiled to perfection.
instructions: Broil on hamburger buns.
notes: The amount of cheese isn't specified, so adjust to your preference.
The recipe mentions 'Doll weed', which could be a typo for 'dill weed', please verify based on your preference
'Little' mustard and Worcestershire sauce are subjective, start with a small amount and add more to taste.
The mayonnaise or Miracle Whip is used 'to cover', suggesting a generous spread.
fields.comment: Open-faced sandwiches, also known as melts, offer a versatile and quick meal option. Variations exist across cultures, often featuring local ingredients and cheeses. The broiling step adds a satisfyingly crisp texture to the sandwich.

fields.name: Super Bean Bake
fields.title: Super Bean Bake
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful baked bean dish with bacon, onion, and a variety of beans.
ingredients: 1 can each green beans, lima beans, kidney beans, cut wax beans and garbonzo beans (well drained)
instructions: Cook bacon until crisp, remove, drain, and crumble.
In 3 tbsp. bacon grease, cook onion until limp.
Combine all ingredients.
Put in 3 qt baking pan.
Bake uncovered in 350° oven for 1 hour or until bubbly throughout.

fields.name: Noodle & Cornbeef Casserole
fields.title: Noodle & Corned Beef Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring noodles, corned beef, condensed milk, cream of chicken soup, and onion, topped with cheese and bread crumbs.
instructions: Prepare noodles according to package directions.
Brown corned beef for about 5 minutes.
Combine corned beef, condensed milk, cream of chicken soup, and chopped onion in a bowl.
Add cooked noodles to the mixture and stir well.
Pour the mixture into a casserole dish.
Top with grated cheese and crushed bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.

fields.name: Chinese Hamburger Casserole
fields.title: Chinese Hamburger Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole featuring hamburger, soups, vegetables, soy sauce, and a crunchy noodle topping.
instructions: Brown hamburger with onions.
Mix browned hamburger, onions, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, celery, water, soy sauce, and uncooked rice.
Pour mixture into a casserole dish and cover.
Bake at 300°F for 1 hour.
Uncover and top with dry Chinese noodles.
Bake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes.

fields.name: Adrienne's Delight
fields.title: Adrienne's Delight (Sweet Cheese Ball)
fields.description: A sweet cheese ball made with cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, butter, gelatin, raisins, almonds, and lemon rind.
instructions: Cream together sugar, butter, cream cheese, and sour cream.
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Dissolve gelatin over hot water.
Add gelatin to cream cheese mixture.
Add raisins, almonds, and lemon rind.
Pour into a one-quart mold (or divide into smaller molds).
Refrigerate until firm.
Unmold and serve with Ritz, Club, or soda crackers.

fields.name: Cheese Ball
fields.title: Cheese Ball
fields.description: A classic cheese ball recipe with cheddar, cream cheese, walnuts, green pepper, onion, Worcestershire sauce, and pineapple.
ingredients: 8 oz Cheddar Cracker Barrel Cheese food
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Refrigerate for a while.
Remove from refrigerator and shape into balls.
Roll the balls in chopped nuts.

fields.name: Daffodil Dip
fields.title: Daffodil Dip
fields.description: A creamy dip made with cream cheese, salad dressing, parsley, egg, onion, garlic, and pepper.
instructions: Soften cream cheese.
Blend with salad dressing and other ingredients.
May be garnished with another egg, sliced on top, and a parsley sprig.

fields.name: Mystery Appetizer
fields.title: Mix Print Cat
fields.description: A refreshing mix of tomato juice, citrus fruits, Worcestershire sauce, and flaked crab.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.

fields.name: Sauerkraut Balls
fields.title: Sauerkraut Balls
fields.description: Savory sauerkraut balls made with pork sausage, cream cheese, and a crispy breadcrumb coating.
ingredients: 1 can (14 to 16 oz.) sauerkraut, drained and chopped
2 tablespoons plus 3/4 cup fine, dry breadcrumbs, divided
1 small package (3 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt OR garlic powder
instructions: In a skillet, cook sausage and onion until meat is crumbled and browned; drain.
Add sauerkraut and 2 tablespoons breadcrumbs; mix well.
In a bowl, combine cream cheese, parsley, mustard, garlic salt and pepper.
Stir in sausage mixture.
Chill.
Shape into 3/4-inch balls.
Coat with flour.
Dip floured balls into combined egg and milk mixture.
Roll in remaining breadcrumbs.
Heat oil to 375°F.
Deep fry sauerkraut balls until browned. Drain and serve.
Or, after frying, they may be frozen and reheated in a 350°F oven, for about 10 to 15 minutes, until hot.

fields.name: Sweet Potato Cheese Ball
fields.title: Sweet Potato Cheese Ball
fields.description: A creamy and flavorful cheese ball made with sweet potatoes, jalapeno, and spices, served with crackers, breadsticks, or vegetables.
ingredients: Assorted crackers, breadsticks, or raw vegetables
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sweet potatoes until smooth.
Add the onion, jalapeno pepper, seasoned salt, Worcestershire sauce, Louisiana hot sauce, and hot pepper sauce; mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or until easy to handle.
Shape into a ball; cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or until firm.
Serve with crackers, breadsticks, or vegetables.
notes: When cutting or seeding hot peppers, use rubber or plastic gloves to protect your hands. Avoid touching your face.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Edwina Harper, a sweet potato farmer in Bastrop, Louisiana, who often shares this recipe at fairs and school functions.

fields.name: Tomato Shrimp Cocktail
fields.title: Tomato - Shrimp Cocktail
fields.description: A chilled seafood appetizer made with shrimp, tomato juice, and various seasonings.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Chill for at least 24 hours before serving.
fields.comment: Shrimp cocktail, in various forms, has been a popular appetizer since the early 20th century, particularly in North America.  It's often served in a stemmed glass or small bowl, making it elegant and easy to enjoy.

fields.name: Veg Dip
fields.title: Veg. Dipe
fields.description: A creamy vegetable dip with hard-boiled eggs, parsley, and a hint of garlic.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly.

fields.name: Veg Pizza
fields.title: Veggie Pizza
fields.description: A creamy, veggie-packed pizza made with crescent roll dough.
instructions: Spread crescent roll dough onto a jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350°F for 7-8 minutes. Let cool.
In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, cream cheese, and ranch dressing mix.
Spread mixture over the cooled pastry.
Top with the chopped vegetables and cheddar cheese.
Gently pat the vegetables and cheese into the mayonnaise mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours.
fields.comment: Veggie pizzas are generally thought to have originated around the same time as standard pizzas, though their specific history is tough to trace. They likely began in Italy with simple flatbreads adorned with fresh, in-season vegetables.  The Americanized veggie pizza, often using ranch dressing, is a more modern spin on this historic concept.

fields.name: Zucchini hors d'oeuvre
fields.title: Zucchini Hors D'oeuvre
fields.description: A savory baked appetizer made with zucchini, Bisquick, cheese, and herbs.
instructions: Mix all ingredients well, except the zucchini and cheese, in a medium bowl.
Add zucchini and mix well.
Spread on a well-greased cookie sheet that is about 2 inches deep.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes.
Cut into squares.
Serve hot or cold.

fields.name: Bishops Haslets Punch
fields.title: Bishop Haslets Punch
fields.description: A refreshing frozen punch made with cranberry juice, lemonade, almond extract, and vanilla extract.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Serve chilled.
fields.comment: Haslet is an old word that means 'edible leftovers of meat'. In the 1800s, 'punch' meant a mix of spirits, fruit, and sugar. Sometimes this even meant tea. In modern times, 'punch' might mean a mixed drink such as a 'fruit punch', often containing alcohol. Bishops generally didn't eat haslet, it was food of the poor, but this punch is clearly named as a reference to this food.

fields.name: Caribbean Cocktail Cooler
fields.title: Caribbean Cocktail Cooler
fields.description: A refreshing and fruity cocktail perfect for warm weather.
notes: No ingredients or instructions were provided in the OCR text.
fields.comment: Hotel and brand names suggest this cocktail may have been featured at a Courtyard by Marriott hotel, possibly in partnership with Darigold dairy products. The lack of recipe details indicates the OCR likely captured only a promotional image or label, not the full recipe itself.  It might be interesting to search for vintage Courtyard by Marriott promotional materials or Caribbean cocktail recipes from the era when 1-800 numbers were commonly used.

fields.name: Cran Raspberry Punch
fields.title: Cran-Raspberry Ice Cream Float
fields.description: A simple and refreshing ice cream float made with cranberry-raspberry juice, vanilla ice cream, and a lemon-lime soda.
instructions: Pour the cran-raspberry juice into a large pitcher.
Add the vanilla ice cream.
Slowly pour in the lemon-lime soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Serve immediately in tall glasses.
fields.comment: This simple recipe is easily adaptable for large gatherings or parties by increasing the ingredient amounts proportionally.

fields.name: Creamsicle Drink
fields.title: Ka lin Creams Drink
fields.description: A refreshing slushy-like drink made with vanilla ice cream, orange sherbert, and 7-Up.
instructions: Soften ice cream & sherbert in large container.
Gradually add 7-Up and mix until slush consistency.

fields.name: Delicious Punch
fields.title: Delicious Punch
fields.description: A refreshing and easy punch recipe made with frozen orange juice, lemonade, and a hint of almond.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl or dispenser.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Chill until ready to serve.
fields.comment: Punch is a party staple. The name 'punch' may derive from the Hindi word 'panch' meaning 'five,' referring to its traditional five ingredients of alcohol, sugar, lemon, water, and tea or spices. This recipe offers a non-alcoholic, kid-friendly version of the classic party beverage.

fields.name: Hot Chocolate
fields.title: Ti Punch
fields.description: A classic rum cocktail from the French Caribbean islands.
instructions: Pour rum and sugar syrup into a small tumbler. Add lime wheel then muddle to extract the lime juice
Top up with ice
fields.comment: The Ti' Punch is a traditional rum cocktail from the French Caribbean islands of Martinique and Guadeloupe.  It's a simple mix of rum, cane sugar, and lime, yet offers a complex flavor profile.  The specific type of rum used, agricole rum, is made from freshly pressed sugarcane juice rather than molasses, giving it a distinctive grassy and vegetal note. The simplicity of the drink highlights the quality of the ingredients, making it a favorite among rum enthusiasts.

fields.name: Orange Juice Pineapple
fields.title: Russell Bothme
fields.description: A simple mixed drink recipe made with orange juice, pineapple, Kool-Aid, sugar, and ice.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a container, and stir well until sugar and/or Kool-Aid is fully dissolved into the liquids
Pour into a cup over ice and serve.
notes: The original recipe image does not contain instructions, so generic instructions were added.

The recipe's OCR text has an entry "10 phys. Flange", which may be due to an image misreading of a fruit or a misspelling.  It may also be an old colloquial or slang for something common. Please verify whether this should be corrected to an alternate ingredient if needed.
fields.comment: This drink recipe appears to be user-submitted. Based on its name and simple combination of common household items, it may be a personalized creation rather than a traditional or standardized recipe.  It is possible it was submitted to some type of recipe contest, or posted on a bulletin board, given the presence of a name and what appears to be a phone number accompanying the drink's name and ingredient list. It appears to be a sugary non-alcoholic drink popular amongst kids.

fields.name: Punch for a Crowd
fields.title: Punch for a Crowd
fields.description: A large-batch punch recipe using flavored drink mix, pineapple juice, lemon juice, and sugar.
ingredients: 40 packages Flavoraid or Koolaid (grape, cherry, strawberry, raspberry)
6 small cans frozen pineapple juice concentrate
instructions: Combine all ingredients except water and ice.
Add water and ice to make 20 gallons.

fields.name: White Christmas Punch
fields.title: White Christmas Punch
fields.description: A festive and refreshing punch perfect for Christmas celebrations.
instructions: Dilute frozen lemonade concentrate as directed with 8 cups of water.
Combine lemonade, sugar, and 7 Up/Sprite in a punch bowl or pitcher.
Stir until sugar dissolves.
Pour mixture into a round mold and freeze.
Before serving, remove from freezer and let thaw slightly.
Garnish with fresh lime slices and halved maraschino cherries.
fields.comment: This punch is a classic holiday beverage, often served at Christmas parties and gatherings. Its vibrant color and refreshing taste make it a popular choice for both adults and children.

fields.name: Apple Orange Bread
fields.title: Apple-Orange Bread
fields.description: A refreshing citrusy bread perfect for bake sales or holiday gatherings.
ingredients: 2 large unpeeled baking apples, cored and quartered
instructions: In a blender or food processor, process apples, orange and raisins until finely chopped; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition; beat until light and fluffy.
Beat in extract.
Combine dry ingredients; add to creamed mixture alternately with orange juice.
Stir in fruit mixture and nuts.
Pour into three greased 8-in. x 4-in. x 2-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
fields.comment: This recipe was contributed by Norma Poole from Auburndale, Florida, who makes these loaves for her church's Christmas bazaar.

fields.name: Apple Walnut Bread
fields.title: Apple Walnut Bread
fields.description: A moist and flavorful quick bread with apples, walnuts, and warm spices.
instructions: Mix and sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and spices.
Stir in cereal flakes and wheat germ, walnuts and apple.
Combine egg, brown sugar, buttermilk and oil; add to mix just enough to moisten dry ingredients. Do not beat.
Turn into well-greased loaf pan 9"x5"x3"
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Parade Magazine's Test Kitchen, published on November 25, 1973.  During this time, quick breads were popular for their ease and versatility.

fields.name: Apricot Banana Bread
fields.title: Apricot Banana Bread
fields.description: A delightful twist on traditional banana bread with apricots and walnuts, perfect with cream cheese or butter.
ingredients: 1 cup mashed ripe bananas (2 to 3 medium)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs; mix well.
Combine bananas and buttermilk.
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with banana mixture.
Stir in bran, apricots and nuts.
Pour into a greased 9-in. x 5-in. x 3-in. loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 55-60 minutes or until bread tests done.
Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.
fields.comment: This recipe, discovered in 1955 by Betty Hull from Stoughton, Wisconsin, is a popular choice for bake sales and gifts.

fields.name: Banana Pineapple Bread
fields.title: Banana Pineapple Cup
fields.description: A simple recipe for a delicious Banana Pineapple Cup.
instructions: Mix the shortening and sugar until smooth, then add in the eggs.
Mix until light and fluffy.
Add the mashed bananas and the crushed pineapples.  Mix until well blended.
Sift the flour.  Add to the mixture and blend until smooth.

fields.name: Banana Pineapple Bread 2
fields.title: Banana Pineapple Bread
fields.description: A moist quick bread made with bananas, pineapple, and nuts.
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs.
Sift dry ingredients and add alternately with bananas and pineapple.
Add nuts.
Grease & flour loaf pans.
Bake 1 hr at 350°.
fields.comment: This recipe combines the sweetness of banana bread with the tangy, tropical flavor of pineapple. It's a delicious variation on classic banana bread that's particularly popular in the summer months. The combination of banana and pineapple has been a favorite in desserts for decades, with recipes appearing in community cookbooks and home magazines throughout the 20th century.

fields.name: Berry Mini Breads
fields.title: Berry Mini Breads
fields.description: A buttery, sweet-tart mini bread perfect for the holidays.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Combine dry ingredients; add to the creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in cranberry sauce and blueberries.
Pour into four greased 5-3/4-in. x 3-in. x 2-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally a holiday gift shared by Heidi Naylor from Boise, Idaho, and published in Taste of Home in 1999. It has become a beloved tradition for many during the Christmas season.

fields.name: Bran Muffins
fields.title: Bran Muffins
fields.description: A hearty muffin recipe using both Nabisco 100% Bran and Kellogg's All-Bran.
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs, buttermilk, and soaked bran (Nabisco 100% Bran soaked in boiling water).
Sift together flour, salt, and baking soda. Add Kellogg's All-Bran to the dry ingredients.
Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients.
Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
notes: The batter can be stored in a covered container in the refrigerator for 6-8 weeks.
fields.comment: Bran muffins were particularly popular in the mid-20th century as a healthy and convenient breakfast option.  The use of both Kellogg's All-Bran and Nabisco 100% Bran in this recipe suggests a desire for a particularly high-fiber muffin.

fields.name: Bran Muffins 2
fields.title: Bran Muffins
fields.description: A hearty and healthy bran muffin recipe.
instructions: Combine boiling water and whole oats. Let cool.
Add the oat mixture to the sugar, oil, buttermilk, bran, and eggs.
In a separate bowl, combine the white flour, whole wheat flour, and baking soda.
Gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
Fill muffin tins and bake at 375 degrees for about 22 minutes.
notes: Can add dates, apples, or blueberries.
fields.comment: Bran muffins have been a breakfast staple for generations, appreciated for their fiber content and hearty texture.  Adding fruits like dates, apples, or blueberries provides a burst of flavor and additional nutrients.

fields.name: Butter Pecan Bread
fields.title: Butter-Pecan Bread
fields.description: A delicious quick bread with pecans and a buttery flavor.
instructions: Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, spices; stir in sugar and nuts.
Combine remaining ingredients (egg, buttermilk, melted butter); add to flour mixture, stirring just until moistened.
Bake in greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan in preheated 350° oven for 45 minutes or until done.
Cool slightly before removing from pan.
Slice it with an electric knife.

fields.name: Carrot Banana Bread
fields.title: Carrot Banana Bread
fields.description: A moist and delicious quick bread combining the sweetness of bananas with the subtle earthiness of carrots.
ingredients: 1 cup mashed ripe bananas (2 to 3 medium)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine oil and sugar.
Add eggs; mix well.
Combine flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon; gradually add to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas.
Stir in carrots and pecans.
Transfer to a greased 9-in. x 5-in. x 3-in. loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
fields.comment: Carrot banana bread, a riff on the classic banana bread, emerged as a popular variation sometime in the mid-20th century, possibly as a way to incorporate more vegetables into baked goods or utilize surplus garden produce. It speaks to a trend of adding moisture and complexity to quick bread recipes, offering a subtly sweet and spiced loaf.

fields.name: Cherry Nut Bread
fields.title: Cherry Nut Bread
fields.description: A pound cake-like bread studded with chopped pecans and maraschino cherries, resulting in rich, moist slices with a crisp golden crust.
ingredients: 2 jars (10 ounces each) maraschino cherries, drained and chopped
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add egg yolks and vanilla; mix well.
Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk just until blended (batter will be thick).
In a small mixing bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Fold into batter.
Fold in cherries and pecans.
Transfer to four greased and floured 8-in. x 4-in. x 2-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean and loaves are golden brown.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks.
fields.comment: This recipe was a favorite of the submitter's husband and was featured in Taste of Home magazine in December/January 2003, suggesting it might be a popular choice for the holiday season.

fields.name: Cinnamon Oatmeal Raisin Bread
fields.title: Cinnamon Oatmeal Raisin Bread
fields.description: A sweet bread made with cinnamon, oats, and raisins.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Butter or Margarine, cut into 4 pieces
instructions: Add milk to bread pan.
Add dry ingredients (flour, oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt).
Cut butter into 4 pieces and place in corners of the pan.
Make a hole in the center of the dry ingredients and add yeast.
Select "Sweet" bread setting on bread machine.
After 17 minutes, add raisins.

fields.name: Cinnamon Rolls
fields.title: Fern Savage's Yeast Squares
fields.description: Sweet yeast dough squares perfect for various treats.
instructions: Dissolve 3 yeast cakes in 1/2 cup tepid water.
Scald 2 1/2 cups milk.
Combine milk, sugar, salt, and shortening.
Sift 10 cups of flour.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
Add the dissolved yeast mixture to the dough.
Knead the dough until smooth.
Cover and store in the refrigerator as needed.
Shape the dough into squares.
Bake at 375°F for 10-15 minutes.
fields.comment: Storing yeast dough in the refrigerator allows for flexible baking.  It's a time-saving method for preparing dough in advance.

fields.name: Cinnamon Rolls 2
fields.title: Diamond Glass Cinnamon Rolls
fields.description: Soft, sweet cinnamon rolls with a delicious vanilla icing.
instructions: Heat milk, salt, and shortening until sugar and shortening dissolve.
Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Beat 6 eggs.
Mix cool liquid with 2 cups of flour and mix.
Mix in yeast mixture.
Gradually add 10 cups of flour and shortening until the dough is smooth but sticky.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Punch down dough and roll out.
Spread with butter, sugar, and cinnamon.
Cut and shape into rolls.
Let rise again until bigger.
Bake at 425°F for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F and bake until golden brown on the middle rack.
Make icing with powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla.
fields.comment: Named after the Diamond Glass company, with two locations listed in Salt Lake City and West Jordan, Utah, this recipe for cinnamon rolls might have been shared by an employee or found on some promotional material. Contact details for both branches are included. Baking at high heat initially, and then lowering the temperature is a common technique to achieve a good rise and even browning.

fields.name: Coconut Bread
fields.title: Coconut Bread
fields.description: A moist and delicious coconut bread with a hint of nuttiness.
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; set aside.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, oil, eggs and coconut extract.
Add dry ingredients alternately with buttermilk; stir just until moistened.
Fold in coconut and nuts.
Pour into two greased and floured 8-1/2-in. x 4-1/2-in. x 2-1/2-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour or until breads test done.
Cool 10 minutes in pans before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
fields.comment: This recipe was a popular request and stands out from other quick breads.

fields.name: Cranberry Fruit Nut Bread
fields.title: Cranberry Fruit Nut Bread
fields.description: A delicious holiday bread with cranberries, pecans, and a hint of orange.
instructions: Sift 1st 5 ingredients.
Cut in shortening until coarse.
Combine orange juice and beaten egg.
Pour all at once into dry ingredients, mix just enough to dampen.
Carefully fold in nuts and cranberries.
Spoon into greased and wax paper-lined loaf pan.
Spread corners and sides higher than center.
Bake at 350°.
Remove from pan and cool.

fields.name: Cranberry Nut Bread
fields.title: Cranberry Nut Bread
fields.description: A sweet and tart quick bread studded with cranberries and nuts.
ingredients: 16-ounce package Ocean Spray® Craisins sweetened dried cranberries, any flavor
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a medium mixing bowl.
Stir in orange juice, orange peel, shortening and egg.
Mix until well blended.
Stir in dried cranberries and nuts.
Spread evenly in loaf pan.
Bake for 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool on a rack for 15 minutes.
Remove from pan; cool completely.
Wrap and store overnight.
fields.comment: Cranberry nut bread is a popular holiday treat, often made with fresh or dried cranberries and a variety of nuts such as walnuts or pecans.  It's delicious toasted and served with butter or cream cheese.

fields.name: GIFT OF THE MAGI BREAD
fields.title: Gift of the Magi Bread
fields.description: A Christmas banana bread loaded with coconut, mandarin oranges, dates, cherries, chocolate chips, and almonds.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Combine the flour, baking soda and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas.
Stir in the oranges, coconut, chocolate chips, 1/2 cup almonds, cherries and dates.
Pour into two greased 8-in. x 4-in. x 2-in. loaf pans.
Sprinkle with remaining almonds.
Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
fields.comment: This recipe is named "Gift of the Magi Bread" likely as a reference to the O. Henry Christmas story "The Gift of the Magi."  The story emphasizes thoughtful gift-giving, and this bread, packed with many delicious ingredients, evokes the same spirit of generosity.

fields.name: Hamburger Buns
fields.title: Hamburger Buns
fields.description: Soft and fluffy homemade hamburger buns.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups warm water, cooking oil, sugar, and salt.
Add yeast and let sit for 5 minutes.
Add 3 eggs and blend for 1/2 minute.
Add the flour to the mixture.
Beat at high speed for 3 minutes.
Knead the dough until soft, then place it in a greased pan and let it rest for 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide it into 3 portions.
Cover and let rest for 5 minutes.
Divide each portion into 8 balls.
Press each ball between your hands to form 3 1/2-inch circles.
Place the circles onto greased cookie sheets and let them rise for 30 minutes.
Bake at 375°F for 10 minutes.
Split the buns when cool.

fields.name: Honey Nut Sticky Buns
fields.title: Honey Nut Sticky Buns
fields.description: Gooey and delicious sweet rolls perfect with coffee, tea, or as a dessert.
ingredients: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast
instructions: In a mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in water.
Add eggs, sugar, butter, salt and vanilla; mix well.
Add 2 cups of flour; beat until smooth.
Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, about 6-8 minutes.
Place in a greased bowl; turn once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1-1/2 hours.
In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, honey, butter and salt; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Boil for 1 minute.
Pour into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan; sprinkle with pecans. Set aside.
Punch dough down.
Turn onto a lightly floured surface; roll into a 24-in. x 8-in. rectangle; brush with butter to within 1 in. of edges.
Combine the pecans, brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter.
Roll up from long side; seal seam.
Cut into 1-in. slices; place cut side down in pan.
Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.
Bake at 350° for 25-28 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 1 minute; invert onto a serving platter.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Bobbie Talbott of Veneta, Oregon, who suggests enjoying these buns with coffee or tea, or as a dessert.

fields.name: Irish Soda Bread
fields.title: Irish Soda Bread
fields.description: A quick bread made with baking soda instead of yeast.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.
Whisk together 4 cups of flour, the sugar, salt, and baking soda into a large mixing bowl.
Using your (clean) fingers (or two knives or a pastry cutter), work the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal, then add in the raisins.

Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Add beaten egg and buttermilk to well and mix in with a wooden spoon until dough is too stiff to stir. Dust hands with a little flour, then gently knead dough in the bowl just long enough to form a rough ball. If the dough is too sticky to work with, add in a little more flour. Do not over-knead!
Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and shape into a round loaf.
Transfer dough to a large, lightly greased cast-iron skillet or a baking sheet. Using a serrated knife, score top of dough about an inch and a half deep in an "X" shape.

Transfer to oven and bake until bread is golden and bottom sounds hollow when tapped, about 35-45 minutes. (If you use a cast iron pan, it may take a little longer as it takes longer for the pan to heat up than a baking sheet.) Check for doneness also by inserting a long, thin skewer into the center. If it comes out clean, it's done.

Remove pan or sheet from oven, let bread sit in the pan or on the sheet for 5-10 minutes, then remove to a rack to cool briefly. Serve bread warm, at room temperature, or sliced and toasted. Best when eaten warm and just baked.
notes: If the top is getting too dark while baking, tent the bread with some aluminum foil.

If you use a cast iron skillet to cook the bread in the oven, be very careful when you take the pan out. It's easy to forget that the handle is extremely hot. Cool the handle with an ice cube, or put a pot holder over it.

fields.name: Lemon Loaf
fields.title: Lemon Loaf
fields.description: A tangy and moist lemon loaf with a sweet glaze.
instructions: Cream butter or margarine.
Add sugar and eggs, and beat until fluffy.
Grate lemon rind and add to mixture.
Blend in buttermilk alternately with flour, baking soda and salt.
Pour into 2 greased 9x4-inch loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 40-50 minutes until top springs back to the touch.
Cool in pans 10 minutes.
Mix confectioner's sugar with juice of the lemon to glaze loaves.
Cool and remove from pan.
notes: You can use smaller pans to make gift loaves. Adjust baking time accordingly.
fields.comment: Lemon loaf is a classic dessert bread, variations of which have been around for centuries. Its bright citrus flavor and moist texture make it a popular choice for tea parties, brunches, or simply an afternoon treat.

fields.name: Lemony Zucchini Bread
fields.title: Lemony Zucchini Bread
fields.description: A moist quick bread featuring lemon, poppy seeds, and zucchini.
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 ounces) instant lemon pudding mix
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, pudding mix, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, oil, lemon juice and extract.
Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Fold in the zucchini, poppy seeds and lemon peel.
Pour into two greased 9-in. x 5-in. x 3-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Carol Funk, a field editor from Richard, Saskatchewan, and was featured on Taste of Home.

fields.name: Les Poppy Seed Cake
fields.title: Les Poppy Seed Cake
fields.description: A moist and flavorful poppy seed cake with a sweet glaze.
instructions: Combine dry ingredients (flour, sugar, salt, baking powder).
Add wet ingredients (water, oil, milk, eggs, OJ concentrate, soft butter, vanilla, butter flavoring, almond flavoring).
Mix well.
Add poppy seeds.
Pour into 2 greased and floured long pans.
Bake at 375° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

fields.name: Mystery No Knead Bread
fields.title: Simple Dough Recipe
fields.description: A basic dough recipe using flour, shortening, sugar, and water.
instructions: Mix flour and salt.
Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add water, mixing until dough forms.
Knead dough until smooth and elastic.
Let dough rest for at least 30 minutes before using.
fields.comment: This recipe is a foundation for many baked goods, from biscuits to pie crusts, showcasing its versatile nature in baking traditions worldwide.

fields.name: Old Fashion Walnut Streusel Bread
fields.title: Old Fashioned Walnut Streusel Bread
fields.description: A classic walnut streusel bread with a moist crumb and crunchy streusel topping.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Resift flour with sugar, baking powder and salt.
Add egg, shortening, milk and vanilla to dry mixture.
Stir just until all of the flour is moistened.
Fold in walnuts.
Pour half of the batter into a greased loaf pan.
Blend: 1/3 cup brown sugar (or more), 1/2 Tbsp. flour, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 2 Tbsp. butter
Pour the above mixture (streusel) over the batter in the pan.
Add remaining batter.
Sprinkle the 2nd half of the streusel mixture over the top.
Bake for one hour or until toothpick comes out clean.

fields.name: Orange Rolls
fields.title: Refrigerator Orange Rolls
fields.description: Sweet rolls filled with a citrusy orange filling and topped with a tangy orange glaze.
instructions: Sprinkle yeast over warm water; set aside.
Combine sugar, shortening and salt with 'hot' water and stir until shortening is melted.
Add 'beaten eggs and 1 cup flour; mix well.
Stir in dissolved yeast thoroughly.
Add remaining flour and stir until well mixed.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Turn dough onto floured board. Divide into two portions.
Roll each portion into rectangle, 14-inch thick and spread with half of Orange Filling.
Roll up as for Jelly roll; cut into 1-inch slices and place into buttered muffin tins; allow to rise 3 to 4 hours.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 10 to 12 minutes or until done.
Remove from oven and while still hot pour Orange Glaze over top.

fields.name: Orange Buttermilk Muffins
fields.title: Orange Buttermilk Muffins
fields.description: Delicious orange buttermilk muffins with a delicate orange flavor.
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add egg.
In blender, chop up orange with buttermilk.
Then mix this alternately with dry ingredients into egg mixture.
Bake in pre-heated 400-degree oven for 20-25 minutes.
fields.comment: Submitted by Karen Evans, South Sandy. Evaluated as very easy with a nice appearance and good texture.

fields.name: Orange Nut Bran Bread
fields.title: Orange-Nut Bran Bread
fields.description: A delicious bran bread infused with orange and nuts.
instructions: Pour milk over cereal in a bowl; set aside.
Mix flour with sugar, baking powder and salt; add orange rind.
Add egg, oil and orange juice to softened cereal.
Add flour mixture; stir just to moisten all flour.
Fold in pecans.
Pour into greased 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 60 minutes or until cake tester inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and finish cooling on rack.
Wrap in waxed paper, plastic wrap or aluminum foil and store overnight before slicing.
notes: Alternate Baking Pans: Three 5-1/2x3-inch aluminum foil pans for about 45 minutes.
fields.comment: Bran bread, often sweetened and containing dried fruit, has been a popular breakfast and snack item for centuries.  Its popularity increased significantly in the 20th century with the rise of health food movements, as bran is a good source of fiber.  Variations with nuts and citrus zest add flavor and texture, aligning with modern preferences for diverse and interesting baked goods.

fields.name: Orange Walnut Bread
fields.title: Orange Walnut Bread
fields.description: A moist and flavorful quick bread studded with walnuts and infused with orange zest and juice.
instructions: Sift flour, baking powder, sugar, soda, and salt into a large mixing bowl.
Stir in chopped walnuts.
Combine melted shortening, beaten egg, and grated orange peel.
Add orange juice to the wet ingredients and combine.
Add the liquid mixture to the dry ingredients. Stir until just combined, do not overmix.
Pour batter into a greased 9 1/2 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350° for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool thoroughly before slicing. Bread slices best when one day old.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from the Mountain Fuel Supply Company's Home Service materials, suggesting it was shared with customers perhaps to promote the use of their gas appliances for baking.

fields.name: Peanut Butter Pumpkin Bread
fields.title: Peanut Butter Pumpkin Bread
fields.description: A moist and delicious fall treat combining the flavors of pumpkin and peanut butter.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the sugar, pumpkin, eggs, oil, water and peanut butter; beat well.
Combine the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Gradually add to pumpkin mixture; mix well.
Pour into two greased 9-in. x 5-in. x 3-in. loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks.
fields.comment: This recipe has been enjoyed for over 20 years, a testament to its deliciousness and the tradition of sharing baked goods during the fall season.

fields.name: Pineapple Cookies
fields.title: Pineapple Cookies
fields.description: Sweet and tangy cookies with a tropical twist.
instructions: Mix brown sugar, white sugar, shortening, eggs, and vanilla.
Add crushed pineapple and soda to the mixture.
Sift flour and baking powder, then add to the wet ingredients.
Mix everything until combined.
Add coconut if desired.
Bake at 400F for 15-16 minutes.
fields.comment: Pineapple became a popular ingredient in American desserts during the mid-20th century due to increased imports and availability of canned pineapple.

fields.name: Pineapple Pecan Loaf
fields.title: Apple Spice Cake
fields.description: A moist and delicious apple spice cake with pecans and a hint of cinnamon.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine applesauce, sugar, oil, and eggs in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, and allspice.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the chopped pecans.
In a small bowl, combine brown sugar and cinnamon.
Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle the brown sugar-cinnamon mixture evenly over the batter.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a wooden skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool completely before frosting or serving.
fields.comment: Apple cakes have a rich history, with recipes dating back centuries.  Variations exist worldwide, using different spices and additions like nuts or raisins. The addition of pecans and brown sugar topping adds a delightful textural and flavor contrast.

fields.name: Pumpkin Bread
fields.title: Pumpkin Bread
fields.description: A spiced pumpkin bread with dates and walnuts.
instructions: Sift dry ingredients together. Set aside.
Mix oil, water, pumpkin, eggs.
Blend in dry ingredients.
Fold in dates and nuts.
Turn into greased 9×5×3-inch loaf pan.
Bake in pre-heated 3250 oven for 1 1/2 hours. Turn out on rack to cool.
fields.comment: Oven plus freezer equals easier holiday entertaining.

fields.name: Rhubarb Muffins
fields.title: Rhubarb Muffins
fields.description: Delicious rhubarb muffins topped with a sweet and crunchy crumble.
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients and beat well.
Stir in rhubarb and nuts.
Sift dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt) and add to rhubarb mixture. Do not overmix.
Combine topping ingredients (sugar, melted butter, cinnamon).
Pour batter into muffin tins.
Sprinkle topping mixture over the batter and press down gently.
Bake at 400° for 20-25 minutes.

fields.name: Sabbath Day Rolls
fields.title: Sabbath Day Rolls
fields.description: Soft, no-knead rolls perfect for a leisurely Sabbath morning.
instructions: Scald milk and cool.
Mix margarine, 1 tbsp sugar, and yeast. Moisten with the cooled milk.
Mix together eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, and salt, and then add to the milk mixture.
Add 4 cups of flour and mix with a spoon. No kneading required.
Let the dough stand overnight.
The next morning, divide the dough in half.
Roll out each half into 2 circles, using a little flour to prevent sticking.
Cut each circle into 16 pie-shaped pieces and roll them up into crescents.
Let the rolls rise for about 4 hours.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Southwestern Savory Muffins
fields.title: Southwestern Savory Muffins
fields.description: Savory muffins with bacon, cheddar cheese, and green chilies, perfect for a Southwestern-inspired breakfast or brunch.
instructions: In a skillet, cook the bacon until crisp; reserve 1/3 cup drippings.
Crumble bacon and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar and baking powder.
In a mixing bowl, beat milk, egg and drippings.
Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Fold in the cheese, chilies and bacon.
Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths full.
Bake at 400° for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.
fields.comment: This recipe was adapted by Laura Parker from Los Alamos, New Mexico, and is a favorite breakfast treat for her and her husband.

fields.name: Spicy Pineapple Zucchini Bread
fields.title: Spicy Pineapple Zucchini Bread
fields.description: A moist and delicious quick bread with the tropical sweetness of pineapple and a hint of spice.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
With a rotary mixer, beat 3 eggs until blended.
Add 1 cup salad oil, 2 cups sugar, and 2 teaspoons vanilla; continue beating the mixture until thick and foamy.
Stir in 2 cups coarsely shredded zucchini and 1 can (8.5 oz) well-drained crushed pineapple.
In a separate bowl, combine 3 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, and 3/4 teaspoon nutmeg.
Add 1 cup each of finely chopped walnuts and currants to the dry ingredients.
Gently stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until well blended.
Pour batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
fields.comment: Zucchini bread, a staple of American baking, offers a delicious way to use up summer's bounty of zucchini.  Adding pineapple gives it a fun, tropical twist that's perfect for any time of year.  The "spicy" likely comes from the generous amount of cinnamon and nutmeg.

fields.name: Sugar Plum Tree
fields.title: Sugarplum Tree Bread
fields.description: A festive sweet bread decorated to resemble a Christmas tree.
ingredients: 2 pkgs. dry yeast or cakes compressed yeast
instructions: Bring milk, 2 Tbsp butter, ⅓ cup sugar, and salt to a boil.
Cool to lukewarm.
Sprinkle yeast over warm water. Let stand a few minutes, then stir until dissolved.
Combine milk mixture and yeast.
Add eggs and stir well.
Add 7 cups flour and beat until smooth.
Sprinkle raisins, citron, and cherries over batter and mix gently.
Add remaining flour to make a soft dough.
Turn out on floured board and knead 8-10 minutes until smooth and springs back when pressed.
Place in greased bowl, turning to coat.
Cover and let rise in a warm place (80°) until doubled, about 1 hour.
Turn out on a lightly floured board and roll into an 8x17 inch rectangle.
Cut a 1-inch strip from the short side, double to 4 inches, and twist to make a tree trunk.
Transfer dough to a greased cookie sheet.
Brush dough with melted butter.
Combine 12 Tbsp butter, ⅓ cup sugar, and cinnamon; sprinkle over dough.

Bring upper corners of dough down to meet at center of lower edge. Turn vertical edges back along center and make several diagonal cuts along edges to resemble branches. Make about 5 deep diagonal cuts along both outer edges. Turn lower point of each branch up. Place trunk under lower edge at center.
Cover and let rise until doubled, 30-40 minutes. Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes.
Spread top immediately with Snowtop Frosting. When cool, trickle remaining frosting on branch tips and decorate with gumdrops or candies.

fields.name: Whole Wheat Pancakes or Waffles
fields.title: Whole Wheat Pancakes or Waffles
fields.description: A quick and easy whole wheat pancake or waffle recipe, perfect for a weekend breakfast.
ingredients: 1/4 cup whole wheat flour or cornmeal
instructions: Blend buttermilk/yogurt, water, and whole wheat flour in a blender for 4-6 minutes.
Add brown sugar/honey, eggs, and oil. Blend for 1 minute.
Add whole wheat flour/cornmeal to achieve desired consistency. Blend for 1 more minute.
Add baking powder and soda. Blend briefly and let stand for 2-3 minutes.
Stir the batter and cook on a hot griddle or waffle iron.
notes: For waffles, consider separating the egg whites and folding in the beaten whites later for a fluffier texture.
fields.comment: Whole wheat pancakes offer a nutritious twist on traditional pancakes, providing added fiber and whole grains.  The trend towards healthier breakfast choices has made recipes like this increasingly popular.

fields.name: Wholewheat Bread
fields.title: Wholewheat Bread
fields.description: A recipe for making wholewheat bread.
instructions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast, sugar, and salt in warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy.
In a separate bowl, mix white flour. Let sit in a warm place until doubled in bulk.
Dissolve brown sugar and shortening in boiling water. Add this mixture to the white flour mixture.
Add brown flour to the mixture and knead the dough.
Bake at 375°F for 50 minutes.

fields.name: Zucchini Pancakes (2)
fields.title: Zucchini Pancakes
fields.description: Savory pancakes made with shredded zucchini, Parmesan cheese, and biscuit mix.
instructions: In a bowl, combine zucchini, egg, biscuit mix, cheese and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; drop batter, by 1/4 cupfuls and flatten.
Fry until golden brown; turn and cook the other side.

fields.name: Zucchini Bread
fields.title: Zucchini Bread
fields.description: A moist and delicious quick bread made with zucchini, spices, and nuts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine brown sugar, white sugar, oil, zucchini, vanilla, and eggs in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in the chopped nuts.
Pour batter into a greased loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
fields.comment: Zucchini bread is a popular way to use up a summer zucchini harvest.  It became particularly popular in the United States during the 1960s.

fields.name: Zucchini Pancakes
fields.title: Zucchini Pancakes
fields.description: These savory pancakes are made with shredded zucchini, egg, lemon peel, and pancake mix.
ingredients: 1/2 cup [unknown ingredient - likely milk or flour]
instructions: Shred zucchini - drain on paper towel.
Mix other ingredients and add zucchini.
Refrigerate 30 min.
notes: The OCR missed an ingredient after '1/2 cup'. Context suggests it is likely milk, water, or flour.  Please refer to the original image for clarity if possible.
fields.comment: Zucchini pancakes are a delicious way to use up a summer zucchini harvest.  They can be eaten plain, or topped with sour cream or applesauce. This recipe's addition of lemon adds brightness and complements the zucchini flavor.

fields.name: Zucchini Pineapple Bread
fields.title: Zucchini-Pineapple Bread
fields.description: A moist and flavorful quick bread combining zucchini, pineapple, and warm spices.
instructions: In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nuts. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs until light and fluffy. Add sugar, oil, and vanilla. Blend well.
Fold in zucchini and pineapple.
Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Spoon batter into two well-greased and floured 9x5x3-inch loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing and cooling completely.

fields.name: Christmas Blondies
fields.title: Christmas Blondies
fields.description: Festive blondies with cherries, white chocolate, and nuts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 13x9 inch baking pan.
Cream together butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Mix in cherry juice, baking powder, vanilla, and salt.
Gradually add flour, mixing until just combined.
Stir in walnuts, white chocolate, and cherries.
Spread batter in prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely before cutting into 24 bars.

fields.name: Never Fail Or Seven Minute Icing
fields.title: Never Fail or Seven-Minute Icing
fields.description: A fluffy white icing made with egg whites, sugar, and cooked over boiling water.
instructions: Combine all ingredients except vanilla in the top of a double boiler.
Cook over boiling water, beating constantly with a rotary egg beater.
Cook for 7 minutes or until mixture holds a point when beater is lifted.
Remove from heat, add vanilla and continue beating until cool enough to spread.

fields.name: Fluffy White Frosting
fields.title: Fluffy White Frosting
fields.description: A fluffy white frosting made with sugar, water, cream of tartar, egg whites, and vanilla.
instructions: Combine sugar, water, cream of tartar, and salt in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring very slowly.
Gradually add the sugar syrup to 2 large egg whites in a mixing bowl.
Beat constantly with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form, about 7 minutes.
Beat in vanilla extract.
fields.comment: This type of frosting is also known as seven minute frosting because it traditionally takes about seven minutes of beating to achieve the desired stiff peaks. It's a classic frosting for cakes and cupcakes, known for its light and airy texture.

fields.name: Texas Sheet Cake
fields.title: Texas Sheet Cake
fields.description: A classic Texas dessert, this sheet cake is known for its rich chocolatey flavor and simple preparation.
ingredients: 1/4 lb. margarine (Note: OCR likely misread, should probably be 1/4 cup or 1/2 cup)
1/2 cup shortening (Note: OCR likely misread, should probably be 1/2 cup)
1/4 cup cocoa (Note: OCR likely misread, should probably be 1 cup)
1 tsp baking soda (Note: Only add if using regular milk)
instructions: Mix sugar and flour in a large bowl.
In a saucepan, bring margarine, shortening, cocoa, and water to a boil.
Pour the boiling mixture over the flour and sugar mixture and beat.
Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition.
Stir in sour milk or buttermilk (If using regular milk with baking soda, add baking soda to milk first).
Add vanilla.
Bake in a large sheet pan for 15 minutes at 350°F (Note: OCR likely misread, should probably be 350°F).
fields.comment: Texas Sheet Cake gained popularity in the 1950s and 1960s, becoming a staple at potlucks and celebrations. Its convenient sheet pan format makes it perfect for serving large crowds.  While the exact origins are debated, it's a beloved Southern treat.

fields.name: Poppyseed Bundt Cake
fields.title: Poppy Seed Bundt Cake
fields.description: An old-fashioned, yet simple cake starting with a mix, featuring a hint of coconut and tender texture, dusted with powdered sugar.
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 ounces) instant coconut cream pudding mix
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine cake and pudding mixes, water, oil and eggs.
Beat on low speed until moistened.
Beat on medium for 2 minutes.
Stir in the poppy seeds.
Pour into a greased and floured 10-in. fluted tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 48-52 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home February/March 2001, submitted by Kathy Schrecengost from Oswego, New York.

fields.name: Upside-Down Raspberry Cake
fields.title: Upside-Down Raspberry Cake
fields.description: A moist, upside-down cake featuring fresh or frozen raspberries, perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 1-1/2 cups fresh or frozen unsweetened raspberries, divided
instructions: Line the bottom and sides of a 9-inch square baking pan with foil; coat with nonstick cooking spray.
Place 1/2 cup raspberries in the prepared pan; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs, lemon juice, and vanilla; mix well.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with milk.
Fold in the remaining raspberries.
Carefully spoon batter over the berries in the pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before inverting the cake onto a serving platter.
Carefully remove the foil and cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar.
notes: If using frozen raspberries, do not thaw before adding to batter.
fields.comment: This cake was submitted to Taste of Home Magazine from a home cook from Cincinnati, Ohio.

fields.name: Peach Poundcake
fields.title: Peach Pound Cake
fields.description: A tender, moist cake perfect for peach season.
ingredients: 2 cups diced fresh or frozen peaches
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in extracts.
Combine the flour, baking soda and salt; add to the batter alternately with sour cream.
Fold in the peaches.
Pour into a greased and floured 10-in. fluted tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 15 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home June/July 2003, submitted by Betty Jean Gosnell from Inman, South Carolina.

fields.name: Milk Chocolate Bundt Cake
fields.title: Milk Chocolate Bundt Cake
fields.description: A moist and mild chocolate cake that cuts cleanly and doesn't need frosting, perfect for sharing.
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the candy bar and chocolate syrup over low heat until melted; set aside to cool.
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in chocolate mixture and vanilla.
Combine flour, salt and baking soda; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk.
Pour into a greased and floured 10-in. fluted tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 65-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack for 15 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured by Taste of Home from Sharan Williams of Spanish Fork, Utah, highlighting the cake's travel-friendly nature, making it easy to share.

fields.name: Buttermilk Cocoa Cake
fields.title: Buttermilk Cocoa Cake
fields.description: A moist and tender cocoa cake with a delightful buttermilk frosting.
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the cocoa and water until smooth; add butter. Bring just to a boil. Remove from the heat.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar and baking soda; add cocoa mixture. Combine eggs, oil and buttermilk; add to cocoa mixture and beat until smooth.
Pour into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish. Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
In a large saucepan, bring the cocoa, butter and buttermilk to a boil. Remove from the heat. Whisk in the confectioners' sugar and vanilla.
Spread over the warm cake. Sprinkle with pecans if desired. Cool on a wire rack.
fields.comment: This cake is a classic recipe found in an old community cookbook, perfect for various occasions like family dinners, picnics, or potlucks.

fields.name: Fudgy Chocolate Cherry Layered Cake
fields.title: Ruby Cherry Sauce + Fudgy Chocolate Cherry Layer Cake
fields.description: A decadent chocolate cherry layer cake featuring a rich, fudgy cake base, a sweet cherry filling, and a creamy cherry cloud frosting.
ingredients: 1 package (18.25 oz.) regular or low-fat devil's-food cake mix
1 can (21 oz.) Comstock, Thank You or Wilderness Cherry Pie filling
Eggs, use amount indicated on cake mix
1 can (21 oz.) Comstock, Thank You or Wilderness Cherry Pie Filling
instructions: Heat oven to 350°. Grease and flour two 9" cake pans.
With electric mixer, beat cake mix, 1 can cherry filling and eggs. Do not add water or oil to cake mix.
Blend on low speed and beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Divide between 2 pans and bake for 25-35 minutes or until toothpick tests clean. Cool 10 minutes and remove from pans. Cool completely.
To frost, stir all frosting ingredients until combined. Spread generously between layers and over top and sides of cake. Refrigerate.
notes: High Altitude: Stir 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 cup water into cake mix. Bake at 375° 33-37 minutes, until toothpick tests clean.
fields.comment: Cherry desserts have been a beloved treat for centuries, with recipes dating back to medieval times. This cake represents a modern take on this classic flavor combination, showcasing the enduring popularity of cherries in baking.

fields.name: Pumpkin Sheet Cake
fields.title: Pumpkin Sheet Cake
fields.description: A moist and delicious pumpkin sheet cake, a festive alternative to chocolate cake.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat pumpkin, sugar and oil.
Add eggs; mix well.
Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt; add to pumpkin mixture and beat until well blended.
Pour into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until cake tests done.
Cool.
For frosting, beat the cream cheese, butter and vanilla in a mixing bowl until smooth.
Gradually add sugar; mix well.
Add enough milk until frosting reaches desired spreading consistency.
Frost cake.
Sprinkle with nuts.
fields.comment: This cake is so popular, it's known to shorten church services on carry-in dinner days!

fields.name: Chocolate Cookie Torte
fields.title: CHOCOLATE COOKIE TORTE
fields.description: A layered chocolate cookie torte with a rich chocolate frosting, perfect for special occasions.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Beat in the egg, yolk and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt; gradually add to the creamed mixture and mix well.
Form into a long log; cut in eight equal pieces.
Shape each into a ball; wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Roll balls in additional sugar; place between two sheets of waxed paper.
Roll each into a 6-in. circle. Remove top sheet of waxed paper; flip the circles onto ungreased baking sheets.
Remove waxed paper; prick dough with a fork.
Bake at 350° for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Carefully loosen cookies and cool on paper towels.
For frosting, melt chocolate chips with half-and-half in a heavy saucepan, stirring occasionally. Cool.
Combine whipped cream and vanilla; fold into chocolate mixture.
Layer cookies, spreading 1/4 cup frosting between each layer.
Spread remaining frosting over sides and top. Decorate with chocolate sprinkles.
Refrigerate overnight before cutting.
fields.comment: This recipe, contributed by Irene Bigler from Pennsylvania, is a family favorite for gatherings, known for its ease of preparation and elegant presentation.

fields.name: Poundcake Ring
fields.title: Pound Cake Ring
fields.description: A classic pound cake recipe that can be halved and used for other cake variations.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Combine the milk, lemon juice, vanilla, lemon peel and extract.
Combine the flour, salt and baking soda; add to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk mixture and mix well.
Pour 4-1/2 cups of batter into a greased and floured 10-inch fluted tube pan. (Use the remaining batter to prepare a second pound cake or other cake variations.)
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 325°F; bake 45 minutes longer or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely.
If desired, dust with confectioners' sugar and garnish with fruit and mint.
notes: Recipe can be halved.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from a reader named Joan, who uses half the batter for a traditional pound cake and the other half for other cake variations. This highlights the versatility of pound cake batter as a base for various desserts.

fields.name: Pineapple Poundcake
fields.title: Pineapple Pound Cake
fields.description: A moist, upside-down pound cake featuring pineapple, cherries, and pecans.
ingredients: 4-1/2 cups pound cake batter (from Pound Cake Ring recipe)
instructions: Drain pineapple, reserving 1 tablespoon juice; set aside (discard remaining juice or save for another use).
In a saucepan over low heat, cook and stir brown sugar and butter until sugar is dissolved; add the reserved pineapple juice.
Pour into an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Cut pineapple slices in half.
Arrange in a single layer in three lengthwise rows, alternating the direction of each row.
Place a cherry, cut side up, between pineapple slices. If desired, place pecan halves around the edges of the dish.
Carefully pour pound cake batter over pineapple and cherries.
Bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate.
fields.comment: This cake is a great option for entertaining large groups, as it serves 12-20 people. The recipe suggests using homemade pound cake batter from a separate recipe, but store-bought batter could be substituted.

fields.name: Turtle Sunday Dessert
fields.title: Turtle Sundae Dessert
fields.description: A chocolate cake-based dessert with caramel, nuts, and chocolate chips, topped with ice cream and pecans.
ingredients: 1 package (18-1/4 ounces) German chocolate cake mix
instructions: Mix the cake according to package directions.
Set aside half of the batter.
Pour remaining batter into a greased and floured 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 18 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan over low heat, melt the caramels, milk, and butter.
Remove from the heat and add nuts.
Pour caramel mixture over cake.
Sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Pour the reserved batter over the top.
Bake 20-25 minutes more or until cake springs back when lightly touched.
Cool.
Cut into squares.
If desired, top each square with a scoop of ice cream and a pecan half.
fields.comment: This dessert is endorsed by the recipe creator's six grandchildren, suggesting it's a kid-friendly treat.

fields.name: Pancakes
fields.title: Pancakes
fields.description: A classic breakfast recipe for fluffy pancakes.
instructions: Mix 2 cups of pancake mix with 1 ½ cups of water.
Stir with a fork until slightly lumpy.
Cook on a lightly greased griddle at 365-375° F.
fields.comment: Pancakes are one of the oldest and most universal breakfast foods, enjoyed in various forms across cultures for centuries.

fields.name: Sheet Cake Recipes
fields.title: Orange Refrigerator Sheet Cake
fields.description: A refreshing and easy sheet cake with a citrusy twist.
ingredients: 1 package Duncan Hines White Deluxe Cake Mix
1 envelope whipped topping mix (2-2.5 cup yield)
1 package vanilla instant pudding mix (4 serving size)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Dissolve gelatin in 3/4 cup boiling water. Add 1/2 cup cold water and set aside at room temperature.
Mix and bake cake as directed on the cake mix box in a 13x9x2-inch pan (using egg whites if specified on the box).
Cool cake 20-25 minutes.
Poke deep holes through the top of the warm cake (still in pan) with a meat fork or toothpick; space holes about one-half inch apart.
Slowly pour gelatin mixture into the holes.
Refrigerate cake while preparing topping.
TOPPING: In a chilled, deep bowl, blend and whip topping mix, instant pudding, cold milk, and vanilla or orange extract until stiff (3-8 min.).
Immediately frost cake.
If desired, garnish with thin orange slices.
Store cake in the refrigerator and serve chilled. Frosted cake may be frozen for storage.
fields.comment: Refrigerator cakes like this one were especially popular in the mid-20th century due to their ease of preparation and refreshing flavors.

fields.name: Sheet Cake Recipes (2)
fields.title: Double Orange Refrigerator Sheet Cake
fields.description: A refreshing orange-flavored sheet cake perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 1 package Duncan Hines Orange Supreme Deluxe Cake Mix
1 envelope whipped topping mix (2-2½ cup yield)
1 package vanilla instant pudding mix (4 serving size)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Dissolve gelatin in 3/4 cup boiling water. Add 1/2 cup cold water; set aside at room temperature.
Mix and bake cake as directed in a 13 X9X2-inch pan.
Cool cake 20-25 minutes.
Poke deep holes through top of warm cake (still in pan) with meat fork or toothpick; space holes about one inch apart.
With a cup, slowly pour gelatin mixture into holes.
Refrigerate cake while preparing topping.
TOPPING: In a chilled, deep bowl, blend and whip topping mix, instant pudding, cold milk and orange extract until stiff (3-8 min.).
Immediately frost cake.
If desired, garnish with thin orange slices.
Cake must be stored in refrigerator and served chilled. Frosted cake may be frozen for storage.
fields.comment: Refrigerator cakes, like this one, gained popularity in the mid-20th century with the rise of convenience foods and refrigeration.

fields.name: Pumpkin Raisin Cake
fields.title: Pumpkin Raisin Cake
fields.description: A nutty, golden pumpkin cake with a holiday taste.
instructions: Combine the flour, sugar, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, baking soda and salt; set aside.
In a large bowl, beat eggs.
Add pumpkin and oil; stir in cereal just until moistened.
Add dry ingredients and stir just until combined.
Fold in pecans and raisins.
Pour into a greased 10-in. tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 60-65 minutes or until the cake tests done.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving if desired.

fields.name: Sour Cream Chocolate Frosting
fields.title: Sour Cream Chocolate Frosting
fields.description: A rich and tangy chocolate frosting made with sour cream.
instructions: Melt chocolate and butter.
Blend in sour cream, vanilla and salt.
Gradually add sugar until frosting is of spreading consistency.
Beat well.
Spread.

fields.name: Yellow Cake Mix Creation
fields.title: Pineapple Dream Dessert
fields.description: A simple no-bake dessert made with yellow cake mix, crushed pineapple, instant pudding, and whipped topping.
ingredients: 1 (20 oz) can crushed pineapple, juice and all
1 container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip)
instructions: Bake the yellow cake according to package directions. Let cool completely.
Use the handle of a wooden spoon or a straw to poke holes all over the cake.
In a bowl, combine the crushed pineapple (with juice) and the milk.
Add the instant pudding mix and whisk until smooth and thickened.
Spoon the pudding mixture over the cooled cake, ensuring it fills the holes.
Spread the whipped topping over the pudding layer.
Sprinkle the top with shredded coconut.
fields.comment: This dessert is a retro classic, often seen at potlucks and picnics. Its popularity stems from its ease of preparation and refreshing flavor profile, making it a crowd-pleaser across generations.

fields.name: Peppermint Ice Cream Cake
fields.title: Peppermint Ice Cream Cake
fields.description: A festive ice cream cake perfect for special occasions, made with a crisp rice cereal crust, peppermint stick ice cream, and whipped topping.
ingredients: 1/2 gallon peppermint stick ice cream, softened
Peppermint candy canes or crushed peppermint candies
instructions: Place cereal in a large bowl.
Grate or shave 2 tablespoons of chocolate from candy bar; set aside.
In a heavy saucepan, melt butter and remaining chocolate.
Pour over cereal and stir to coat.
Press into the bottom of a greased 10-in. springform pan.
Freeze for 30 minutes.
Spoon ice cream over crust.
Freeze for 15 minutes.
Spread with whipped topping; sprinkle with the shaved chocolate.
Cover and freeze for several hours or overnight.
Top with candy.
Remove cake from freezer 5-10 minutes before serving.
Remove sides of pan; cut with a sharp knife and serve immediately.

fields.name: Chocolate Zucchini Cake
fields.title: Chocolate Zucchini Cake
fields.description: A moist and delicious chocolate cake with the added goodness of zucchini.
ingredients: 2 sticks (1 cup) butter or margarine, melted
6 tablespoons cocoa powder or 3 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted
instructions: Melt butter or margarine and add sugars and eggs, mixing thoroughly.
Add melted chocolate or cocoa, vanilla and zucchini.
Stir in dry ingredients, then nuts.
Bake in well-greased and lightly floured loaf pans (2), or a single Bundt pan at 375 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes, or until done.
Cool in pan 15 to 20 minutes before turning out.
fields.comment: Zucchini cake, often a way to sneak vegetables into desserts, gained popularity in the mid-20th century with the rise of readily available home refrigeration making zucchini more accessible year-round, along with cookbooks promoting home baking.

fields.name: Banana Split Snack Cake
fields.title: Banana Split Snack Cake
fields.description: A rich and delicious snack cake reminiscent of a banana split, complete with marshmallows, chocolate chips, and cherries.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Beat in the egg, banana, and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture.
Add walnuts.
Spread evenly into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with the marshmallows, chocolate chips, and cherries.
Bake 10 minutes longer or until lightly browned.
Cool on a wire rack.
Cut into squares.
fields.comment: This recipe was a blue-ribbon winner at a county fair.

fields.name: Banana Upside Down Cake
fields.title: Banana Upside Down Cake
fields.description: A delicious year-round cake featuring caramelized bananas and a moist, tender crumb.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Halve bananas lengthwise, then crosswise.

In a saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar with about 2 tablespoons water (so the mixture looks like damp sand). Melt over high heat, swirling the pan occasionally, until the sugar caramelizes. When the caramel is dark amber, add the butter and stir to combine. Pour mixture immediately into an 8-inch cake pan. Arrange the bananas in the caramel, cut-side down.

Sift the flour, baking powder and salt; set aside. In a mixer, using the whisk attachment, combine the remaining sugar and the clarified butter. With the mixer on low, add the eggs, one at a time. Add the buttermilk and vanilla. Add the flour mixture to the batter a third at a time. Pour the batter over the bananas and bake until the cake springs back and begins to pull away from the sides about 50 minutes. Allow the cake to cool for 5 minutes, then invert onto a serving plate. Serve warm or at room temperature.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally published in Parade magazine on February 22, 2004.  Upside-down cakes have been a popular dessert since the early 20th century, particularly with the rise of cast iron cookware.

fields.name: Orange Zucchini Cake
fields.title: Orange Zucchini Cake
fields.description: A moist and delicious cake with the refreshing flavors of orange and zucchini.
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder, soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg. Set aside.
In large bowl, beat sugar, oil and eggs.
Stir in cereal, peel and vanilla.
Add flour mixture, zucchini and nuts. Mix well.
Spread evenly in greased loaf baking pan.
Bake at 326 degrees for 35 minutes.
Cool completely.
Spread with orange cream cheese frosting.
In small bowl, beat cream cheese, butter and peel until light and fluffy.
Gradually add sugar, beating until fluffy.
If mixture is too thick, add 1 to 2 teaspoons orange juice.

fields.name: Barry Glaze Chocolate Cake
fields.title: Berry-Glazed Chocolate Cake
fields.description: A decadent chocolate cake with a vibrant berry glaze, adapted from a recipe by Betty Crockett of St. Louis, Missouri.
ingredients: 1 package (18-1/4 ounces) devil's food cake mix
1 package (3.9 ounces) instant chocolate pudding mix
fields.comment: This recipe comes from St. Louis, Missouri, shared by Betty Crockett. She describes it as "wickedly delicious!" and "quite easy to prepare."

fields.name: Apple Walnut Harvest Cake
fields.title: Apple Walnut Harvest Cake
fields.description: A delicious fall cake featuring fresh apples, walnuts, and a browned butter icing.
instructions: Combine all cake ingredients in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer for three minutes.
Pour into a greased and lightly floured Bundt cake pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until cake tests done.
For the icing: Heat butter in a one-quart saucepan over medium heat until melted and lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat; add confectioners' sugar and milk, mixing until smooth.
Drizzle icing over cooled cake.
Sprinkle top with chopped walnuts, if desired.

fields.name: Celebrity Hummingbird Cake
fields.title: Celebrity Hummingbird Cake
fields.description: A moist and delicious cake with bananas, pineapple, and pecans, topped with cream cheese frosting.
ingredients: 2 packages (8 oz. each) cream cheese, softened
instructions: Preheat oven to 350° F.
In a large bowl, combine dry ingredients (flour, sugar, salt, baking soda, cinnamon).
Add eggs and oil; stir until moistened.
Stir in vanilla, pineapple, bananas, and 1 cup chopped pecans.
Spoon batter into 3 greased and floured 9-inch cake pans.
Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks.
For the frosting: In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and butter or margarine until smooth.
Add confectioners sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
Stir in vanilla and salt.
Generously spread frosting between cooled cake layers and on the sides and top of cake.
Garnish with remaining 1 cup pecans.
fields.comment: The Hummingbird Cake is a classic Southern recipe originating from Jamaica. Its tropical flavors and moist texture have made it a popular choice for special occasions.

fields.name: Butter Pecan Cake
fields.title: Butter Pecan Cake
fields.description: A delicious butter pecan cake with crunchy toasted pecans in the cake and frosting.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in vanilla and 1 cup toasted pecans.
Pour batter into two greased and floured 8-in. round baking pans.
Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes; remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
For frosting, cream butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.
Add milk and vanilla; beat until light and fluffy. Add additional milk if needed.
Stir in remaining toasted pecans.
Spread between the layers and over the top and sides of the cake.
notes: Toasting Nuts: To toast 1-1/3 cups chopped nuts, pour 3 tablespoons melted butter or margarine into a baking pan. Stir in nuts. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes; stirring twice. Cool Use as directed in recipes.
fields.comment: Toasting the pecans in butter before adding them to the cake enhances their flavor and maintains a satisfying crunch in both the cake and the frosting.

fields.name: Holiday Brownies
fields.title: Holiday Brownies
