fields.description: A festive holiday treat featuring chocolate, candied cherries, and walnuts.
ingredients: 1-1/2 cups halved red and/or green candied cherries, divided
instructions: In a heavy saucepan, melt butter and chocolate over low heat.
Cool for 10 minutes.
In a bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cinnamon and salt.
Stir in the cooled chocolate mixture, eggs and vanilla until smooth.
Fold in 1-1/4 cups cherries and the walnuts.
Transfer to a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Arrange remaining cherries over top.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.
Cut into bars.
fields.comment: This recipe is a popular choice for holiday gift-giving.

fields.name: Boiled Raisin Cake
fields.title: Boiled Raisin Cake
fields.description: An old-fashioned boiled raisin cake.
instructions: Combine raisins, water, and sugar; boil for 20 minutes.
Add shortening and allow to cool.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the raisin mixture with beaten eggs.
Sift dry ingredients (flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves) together and add to the raisin mixture.
Stir in vanilla and nuts.
Bake in 3 greased and lightly floured 5 x 9 x 4-inch baking loaf tins in a 350-degree oven for 40 to 45 minutes, or until cake tests done.
Alternatively, bake in a greased and lightly floured 9 x 13-inch baking pan at 350 degrees for 50 to 55 minutes, or until cake tests done.
Top with vanilla frosting, if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe is a classic example of a boiled cake, a type of cake popular in the earlier half of the 20th century.  Boiled cakes often featured dried fruits and spices and were known for their moist texture.

fields.name: Boiled Raisin Cake 2
fields.title: Boiled Raisin Cake
fields.description: A moist and flavorful raisin cake topped with a sweet icing.
instructions: Combine raisins, water and sugar in large saucepan. Boil for 20 minutes.
Add shortening; cool.
Beat eggs and add to raisin mixture.
Sift dry ingredients together and add to batter.
Stir in vanilla and nuts.
Pour into 3 greased and lightly floured 5x9-inch loaf pans.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes, or until cake tests done.
Cool and top with Icing.
fields.comment: This recipe includes the historical use of 'shortening', a generic term for solid fat used in baking.  Today, it's often replaced by specific fats like butter or vegetable shortening.  Boiled cakes, like this one, were common historically as the boiling process helped soften dried fruits and blend flavors before baking.

fields.name: Cake Mix Derivations
fields.title: Chocolate Cherry Bars
fields.description: Chocolatey bars with a cherry filling and a rich chocolate frosting.
ingredients: 1 package Pillsbury Plus Devil's Food Cake Mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour 15x10-inch jelly roll or 13x9-inch pan.
In large bowl, combine cake mix, cherry filling, almond extract, and eggs. Stir by hand until well mixed.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake: jelly roll pan 20 to 30 minutes: 13x9-inch pan 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
In small saucepan, combine sugar, margarine, and milk. Boil, stirring constantly, for 1 minute.
Remove from heat; stir in chocolate pieces until smooth.
Pour over warm bars.
notes: High Altitude Above 3500 Feet: Bake at 375°F. 13x9-inch pan 25 to 35 minutes; 15x10-inch pan 20 to 30 minutes.
fields.comment: Recipes using premade cake mixes were popular in the mid-20th century as a way to make baking easier.

fields.name: Cake Mix Derivations 2
fields.title: Creamy Apple Squares
fields.description: A simple dessert recipe featuring a buttery cinnamon crumble topping, thinly sliced apples, and a creamy egg and sour cream filling.
ingredients: 1 package Pillsbury Plus Yellow Cake Mix
½ cup soft margarine or butter
¼ cup firmly packed brown sugar
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Combine cake mix and margarine/butter; mix until crumbly.
Reserve ¼ cup of the crumb mixture for topping.
Add brown sugar and cinnamon to reserved topping mix. Mix well; set aside.
Press remaining crumb mixture onto the bottom of an ungreased 13x9-inch pan.
Arrange apple slices over the base.
Blend sour cream and egg; spread evenly over apples.
Sprinkle reserved topping mixture over all.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until topping is golden brown and bubbly.
Serve warm. Refrigerate leftovers.
notes: HIGH ALTITUDE ABOVE 3500 FEET: Bake at 375°
fields.comment: Recipes using pre-made cake mixes gained popularity in the mid-20th century for their convenience and ease of preparation.

fields.name: Chocoholic Cake
fields.title: Choco-Holic Cake
fields.description: A rich, decadent chocolate cake with a smooth chocolate glaze.
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 oz) chocolate instant pudding and pie filling mix
2 cups (12 oz package) Nestle Toll House semi-sweet chocolate morsels
1 bar (2 oz) Nestle Toll House unsweetened chocolate baking bar
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a 12-inch Bundt pan or other tube pan.
Combine cake mix, pudding mix, milk, sour cream, and eggs in a large mixer bowl. Beat on low speed just until blended. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in chocolate morsels and walnuts.
Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake for 55 to 65 minutes, or until a wooden pick inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 20 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Melt baking bar and butter in a small, heavy-duty saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat.
Stir in powdered sugar alternately with water until desired consistency is reached.
Stir in vanilla extract.
Pour glaze over cake.

fields.name: Pumpkin Cake
fields.title: Pumpkin Cake
fields.description: A delicious and moist pumpkin cake with a creamy cream cheese frosting.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat eggs, sugar, oil and pumpkin.
Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Gradually add to pumpkin mixture and mix well.
Pour into an ungreased 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes. Cool completely.
For icing, beat cream cheese, sugar, butter and vanilla.
Add enough of the milk to achieve desired spreading consistency.
Spread over the cake.

fields.name: Peaches And Cream Torte
fields.title: Peaches 'N Cream Torte
fields.description: A layered torte featuring butter pecan cake, peaches, vanilla pudding, and a peach-flavored glaze.
ingredients: 1 package Betty Crocker® SuperMoist butter pecan cake mix
1 can (29 ounces) sliced peaches, drained (reserve ½ cup syrup and ¾ cup peaches)
1 package (3½ ounces) vanilla instant pudding and pie filling
2 cups frozen (thawed) whipped topping or sweetened whipped cream
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour two 8 or 9x1½ inch round pans.
Prepare cake mix as directed on package, adding orange peel with the water.
Pour batter into pans and bake as directed. Cool 10 minutes, remove from pans, and cool completely.
Prepare Glacé and cool to room temperature (about 15 minutes).
Beat pudding mix, milk, and sour cream on low speed until blended (about 2 minutes).
Split cake horizontally to make 4 layers.
Spread about ½ cup of the pudding mixture to the edge of 1 layer, top with ½ cup of the peaches (slicing any thick slices). Repeat layers 2 times.
Frost the side of the cake with whipped topping, forming a ¼-inch ridge above the top of the cake.
Arrange reserved peach slices on top of the cake.
Spoon cooled Glacé over peaches.
Refrigerate any remaining torte.

fields.name: German Chocolate Cake Mix
fields.title: Chocolate Cake Mix Bars
fields.description: Easy no-bake bars made with chocolate cake mix, caramel, and whipped topping.
ingredients: 1 tub (8 oz) whipped topping (such as Cool Whip)
instructions: Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides for easy removal.
Press the dry cake mix evenly into the prepared pan.
In a saucepan over medium heat, melt caramels and sweetened condensed milk until smooth, stirring occasionally.
Pour caramel mixture over the cake mix base, spreading evenly.
Spread whipped topping over the caramel layer.
Sprinkle crushed Skor bar pieces over the top.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or until set.
Lift bars out of the pan using parchment paper and cut into squares.
fields.comment: Cake mix bars are a popular and convenient dessert option. They offer a simple way to create a variety of treats without the fuss of traditional baking.

fields.name: Crumb Cake
fields.title: Simple Shortening Cake
fields.description: A classic cake recipe using shortening, flour, sugar, and buttermilk.
instructions: Mix shortening, flour, white sugar, brown sugar, and salt with hands. Save 1 cup of this mixture for topping.
In a separate bowl, beat 2 eggs.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water and add it to the buttermilk.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, mixing well.
Pour batter into two 9-inch square cake pans.
Sprinkle the reserved dry mixture over the top of the batter before baking.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.
fields.comment: Shortening cakes were especially popular during the mid-20th century when shortening became a readily available ingredient.  These cakes are known for their moist and tender crumb.

fields.name: Buttery Almond Crunch
fields.title: Buttery Almond Crunch
fields.description: A crisp candy similar to peanut brittle but with a toffee-like center, made with almonds, butter, sugar, and corn syrup.
instructions: Line an 8-inch square pan with foil.
Butter the foil with 1/2 tablespoon of the softened butter.
Spread the sides of a heavy saucepan with another 1/2 tablespoon of softened butter.
Add the remaining 1/2 cup butter, sugar, and corn syrup to the saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly.
Cook and stir until the mixture is golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the almonds.
Quickly pour the mixture into the prepared pan.
Chill until firm.
Invert the pan and remove the foil.
Break the candy into pieces.
fields.comment: This recipe was contributed by Mildred Clothier from Oregon, Illinois. It evokes a classic, homemade candy experience, reminiscent of simpler times.

fields.name: Cadbury Eggs
fields.title: Cadbury Eggs
fields.description: A homemade version of the classic Cadbury Creme Egg.
instructions: Combine corn syrup, butter, vanilla, and salt in a large bowl. Beat well with an electric mixer.
Gradually add the powdered sugar, one cup at a time, mixing by hand after each addition.
Remove about 1/3 of the mixture and place it in a small bowl. Add yellow and red food coloring to this portion and stir to combine.
Cover both mixtures and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Once firm, roll a small ball from the orange filling and wrap it with twice the amount of white filling. Shape into an egg.
Place the formed eggs onto a cookie sheet brushed with shortening.
Refrigerate the eggs for 3-4 hours.
Combine chocolate chips and shortening in a glass bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir, and microwave for another minute.
Dip each egg center into the melted chocolate using a fork. Place on wax paper to dry.
After 1-2 hours of chilling, dip each candy one more time and chill.
fields.comment: Homemade Cadbury Eggs are a fun and rewarding project, especially around Easter.  They allow for customization of the filling-to-chocolate ratio and offer a fresh take on the store-bought version.

fields.name: Candied Nuts
fields.title: Roasted Spiced Nuts
fields.description: A simple recipe for sweet and spiced roasted nuts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F.
In a bowl, stir together sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
In another bowl, gently mix egg white and water.
Stir in the almonds and pecans.
Pour the sugar mixture over the nuts and stir until evenly coated.
Spread nuts on a wax-paper-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Let cool for a few minutes before removing from sheet.
fields.comment: Recipes for spiced nuts have existed for centuries, with variations appearing across numerous cultures. The combination of sweet and savory flavors makes them a versatile snack.

fields.name: Candy Bar Bars
fields.title: Candy Bar Bars
fields.description: A sweet and chewy bar cookie loaded with chopped candy bars.
ingredients: 3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) butter OR margarine, softened
2 cups chopped candy bars of your choice
instructions: Heat oven to 350° F (325° F for glass dish).
In a large bowl, combine butter and peanut butter.
Add brown sugar and baking soda and beat well.
Stir in flour and oats.
Set aside 1-3/4 cups of the peanut butter mixture.
Stir egg into remaining peanut butter mixture.
Pat into a 15- by 10-inch baking pan.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Spread sweetened condensed milk over the crust.
Stir together reserved peanut butter mixture and chopped candy bars.
Sprinkle candy bar mixture over the condensed milk.
Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool and cut.
Store leftovers, loosely covered, at room temperature.

fields.name: Candy Eggs
fields.title: Vanilla, Maple, and Chocolate Fudge
fields.description: Three variations of fudge with vanilla, maple, and chocolate flavors.
instructions: Cream all ingredients together.
Blind bake like you would a pie crust.
notes: Maple Fudge: Omit vanilla, add 1 tbsp maple.
Chocolate Fudge: Add 2 tbsp cocoa, 2 tbsp peanut butter and use only 1 tsp vanilla.

fields.name: Caramel Marshmallows
fields.title: Carmels
fields.description: A simple recipe for making carmels with marshmallows and caramel candies.
ingredients: 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
instructions: Melt caramels with margarine in a double boiler.
Cut marshmallows in half.
Put marshmallows on a toothpick, dip in melted caramel, and shake off excess.
Keep caramel warm in the double boiler while dipping marshmallows.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to be an older method for making a type of caramel candy, possibly similar to a caramel apple but using marshmallows.  The use of a double boiler suggests a delicate process to prevent burning the caramel.

fields.name: Caramel Popcorn
fields.title: Popcorn Balls
fields.description: A sweet and crunchy treat made with popcorn, syrup, brown sugar, and Karo syrup.
instructions: Boil add condensed milk
Cook to 237 degrees
Pour over popcorn and shape into balls
fields.comment: Popcorn balls are a classic treat enjoyed around the world, often associated with holidays and celebrations.  Their simple combination of ingredients and ease of preparation makes them a popular homemade snack.

fields.name: Carmel Corn
fields.title: Carmel Corn
fields.description: A sweet and crunchy treat made with popcorn, brown sugar, butter, and a touch of corn syrup.
instructions: Boil brown sugar, corn syrup, butter, and cream of tartar for 5-7 minutes until it reaches a soft ball stage.
Pour caramel mixture over popcorn in a large bowl or pan and stir well.
Pour into large flat pan and bake in oven at 250°F for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
notes: Use a large roasting pan to catch the popcorn and pour the caramel mixture over it.

fields.name: Cashew Caramel Fudge
fields.title: Cashew Caramel Fudge
fields.description: A delicious caramel and cashew fudge that makes a wonderful present.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons plus 1/2 cup butter (no substitutes), softened, divided
instructions: Line a 9-in. square baking pan with foil; butter the foil with 2 teaspoons butter. Set aside.
In a large heavy saucepan, combine milk, sugar and remaining butter.
Cook and stir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved.
Bring to a rapid boil; boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from the heat; stir in chocolate chips and marshmallow creme until melted.
Fold in caramels, cashews and vanilla; mix well.
Pour into prepared pan. Cool.
Remove from pan and cut into 1-in. squares.
Store at room temperature.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by Cathy Grubelnik from Raton, New Mexico, who enjoys baking throughout the year for her four children.

fields.name: Cathedral Windows
fields.title: Cathedral Windows
fields.description: A no-bake dessert with chocolate, marshmallows, and nuts.
ingredients: 3 large - 7oz or 2 large 9 oz. Hershey's bar
instructions: Melt chocolate and butter with boiling water.
Beat 2 eggs well.
Add powdered sugar and blend well.
Add vanilla.
Pour chocolate mixture into egg mixture.
In a large bowl, place nuts and marshmallows.
Pour chocolate mixture over nuts and marshmallows.
Place 1/4 cup mixture on each foil.
Roll and refrigerate.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to be a variation of classic "Rocky Road" treats, but using the colorful marshmallows to create a "stained glass" effect.

fields.name: Chocolate Pecan Caramels
fields.title: Chocolate Pecan Caramels
fields.description: A holiday favorite since 1964, these caramels are made like upside-down bars and taste like caramel pecan candies.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon plus 1 cup butter (no substitutes), softened, divided
instructions: Line a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan with foil; butter the foil with 1 tablespoon butter.
Sprinkle with pecans and chocolate chips; set aside.
In a heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt remaining butter.
Add brown sugar, corn syrup and water.
Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil.
Stir in milk.
Cook, stirring constantly, until a candy thermometer reads 248° (firm-ball stage).
Pour into prepared pan (do not scrape saucepan).
Cool completely before cutting.
notes: Editor's Note: We recommend that you test your candy thermometer before each use by bringing water to a boil; the thermometer should read 212°. Adjust your recipe temperature up or down based on your test.
fields.comment: This recipe has been a holiday tradition since 1964, passed down from a friend. It's a classic caramel pecan candy made in a unique way, like upside-down bars.

fields.name: Chocolate Truffles (2)
fields.title: Chocolate Truffles
fields.description: Easy no-bake chocolate truffles coated in various toppings.
instructions: In a large saucepan, melt chocolate chips and sweetened condensed milk over medium heat.
Remove from heat; stir in vanilla.
Pour into a medium-size bowl.
Cover and chill for 2 to 3 hours, or until firm.
Shape chilled mixture into 1-inch balls.
Roll in desired coating.
Store tightly covered in refrigerator.

fields.name: Chocolate Truffles
fields.title: Chocolate Truffles
fields.description: Rich and decadent chocolate truffles coated in cocoa, confectioners' sugar, or chopped nuts.
ingredients: Cocoa, confectioners' sugar or finely chopped nuts, as desired
instructions: In a 1-quart saucepan, combine Karo, butter or margarine, and cream.
Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Remove from heat.
Add semisweet and unsweetened chocolate; stir until completely melted.
Pour into shallow baking pan lined with plastic.
Cover; refrigerate about 3 hours or until firm.
Lift plastic wrap and chocolate mixture out of pan.
Shape teaspoonfuls of chocolate mixture into 1-inch balls.
Roll in the cocoa, confectioners' sugar or chopped nuts, as desired.
Store in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Corn Pops
fields.title: Dee Carlow's Corn Pops
fields.description: A sweet and buttery treat made with Corn Pops cereal.
instructions: Bring sugar, butter (or margarine), and water to a boil.
Boil for 4 minutes.
Pour over 2 bags of Corn Pops.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Fern Walter and appears to be a vintage treat, possibly from the mid-20th century based on the listed copyright.

fields.name: Cow Pies
fields.title: Cow Pies
fields.description: Chocolate treats packed with raisins and almonds, perfect for a barnyard birthday party.
instructions: In a double boiler over simmering water, melt the chocolate chips and shortening, stirring until smooth.
Remove from the heat; stir in raisins and almonds.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Chill until ready to serve.
fields.comment: Featured on page 14 of the publication.

fields.name: Easter Eggs
fields.title: Easter Eggs (Vanilla, Maple, Chocolate, Peanut Butter)
fields.description: Four variations of Easter egg candies: Vanilla, Maple, Chocolate, and Peanut Butter.
instructions: Vanilla Eggs:
Blend powdered sugar and butter like pie crust.
Add evaporated milk and vanilla extract.
Cream all ingredients together.
Add nuts (optional).
Maple Eggs:
Follow the vanilla egg instructions, omitting the vanilla extract and adding maple extract instead.
Chocolate Eggs:
Follow the vanilla egg instructions, adding cocoa powder and vanilla extract.
Peanut Butter Eggs:
Follow the vanilla egg instructions, adding peanut butter and vanilla extract.

fields.name: English Toffee
fields.title: English Toffee
fields.description: A buttery toffee covered in chocolate and sprinkled with pecans.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon plus 2 cups butter (no substitutes), softened, divided
instructions: Grease a 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan with 1 tablespoon butter; set aside.
In a heavy 3-qt. saucepan, melt the remaining butter.
Add sugar, corn syrup and salt; cook and stir over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 295° (hard-crack stage).
Quickly pour into prepared pan.
Let stand at room temperature until cool, about 1 hour.
In a microwave, melt chocolate chips; spread over toffee.
Sprinkle with pecans.
Let stand for 1 hour.
Break into bite-size pieces.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
notes: Test your candy thermometer before each use by bringing water to a boil; the thermometer should read 212°. Adjust your recipe temperature up or down based on your test.
fields.comment: This recipe was a reader submission to Taste of Home magazine, published in the December/January 2003 issue.  Around the holidays, many people share homemade treats with loved ones and colleagues.

fields.name: Nestle Recipes
fields.title: Indoor S'mores
fields.description: A no-bake treat made with Golden Grahams cereal, marshmallows, and chocolate.
ingredients: One 11 1/2 oz. pkg. (2 cups) Nestle Milk Chocolate Morsels
1 package (10 oz.) Golden Grahams Cereal (about 8 cups)
instructions: Butter a 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
In a 3-quart saucepan, heat corn syrup, margarine, and Nestle Milk Chocolate Morsels to a boil, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Pour the chocolate mixture over the cereal in a large mixing bowl and toss quickly until completely coated.
Fold in marshmallows, 1 cup at a time.
Press mixture evenly into the prepared pan with a buttered spoon or spatula.
Let stand until firm, at least 1 hour.
Cut into about 1 1/2 inch squares.

fields.name: Never Fail Divinity
fields.title: Never Fail Divinity
fields.description: A classic candy recipe made with sugar, corn syrup, egg whites, and nuts.
instructions: In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, water.
Cook over low heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
Cover, cook 1 minute, or until sugar crystals on side of pan melt.
Uncover, bring to boiling, without stirring, to 255° on candy thermometer or until small amount forms a soft ball in cold water.
Meanwhile, in large bowl of electric mixer, beat egg whites with salt at high speed until stiff peaks form.
Pour hot syrup in thin stream over egg whites, beating constantly at high speed.
Do not scrape saucepan.
Beat until mixture is stiff enough to hold its shape when dropped from spoon.
Add vanilla, walnuts.
Drop onto greased cookie sheet or wax paper.
Let candy stand until firm.
fields.comment: Divinity is a nougat-like candy that is especially popular during the holidays.  Its texture can vary from soft and chewy to light and airy, depending on the beating and cooking process.  It's believed to have originated in the Southern United States in the early 20th century.

fields.name: Nutty Chocolate Marshmallow Cups
fields.title: Nutty Chocolate Marshmallow Cups
fields.description: Large marshmallows dipped in a chocolate and nut coating.
instructions: In a microwave or heavy saucepan, heat chocolate chips, milk and marshmallow creme just until melted; stir until smooth (mixture will be thick).
With tongs, immediately dip marshmallows, one at a time, in chocolate mixture.
Shake off excess chocolate; quickly roll in pecans.
Place on waxed paper-lined baking sheets. (Reheat chocolate mixture if necessary for easier coating.)
Refrigerate until firm.
Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Texas, where things are done big!

fields.name: PECAN DELIGHTS
fields.title: Pecan Delights
fields.description: Rich, chewy caramel candies covering crunchy pecans and drizzled with sweet chocolate.
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine brown sugar, butter, corn syrup, and salt.
Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Gradually add condensed milk and mix well.
Continue cooking until candy thermometer reads 248° (firm-ball stage).
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Fold in pecans.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a greased or parchment-lined cookie sheet.
Chill until firm.
Loosen from paper.
Melt chocolate chips and shortening in a microwave-safe bowl or double boiler.
Drizzle melted chocolate over each cluster.
Cool.
notes: Test your candy thermometer before each use by bringing water to a boil; it should read 212°. Adjust recipe temperature accordingly.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally shared by Linda Jonsson from Marion, Ohio, and has become a holiday favorite.

fields.name: Philly Nuggets and Bonbons
fields.title: Philly Nuggets and Bonbons
fields.description: Cream cheese-based confections coated in pecans and coconut.
instructions: In a bowl, cream the cream cheese until soft and smooth.
To make the nuggets: Gradually blend in the confectioners' sugar.
Add the melted chocolate and mix well.
Stir in the vanilla extract and salt.
Shape the mixture into small nuggets and press a pecan half into the top of each.
Chill until firm.
To make the bonbons: Gradually blend the confectioners' sugar into the softened cream cheese.
Add the vanilla extract and salt, mixing well.
Roll the mixture into balls and then roll in shredded coconut.
Chill until firm.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the popularity of cream cheese-based desserts in the mid-20th century.

fields.name: Rice Krispies Caramel Marshmallows
fields.title: Caramel Krispie Treats
fields.description: A simple no-bake dessert made with marshmallows, caramel, and Rice Krispies cereal.
instructions: Melt caramels in a double boiler or microwave.
Dip marshmallows in melted caramel using a fork.
Roll caramel-covered marshmallows in Rice Krispies cereal.
fields.comment: These treats are a variation of the classic Rice Krispie treat, adding a layer of caramel for extra flavor. They are a popular treat for parties, holidays, and snacks.

fields.name: Saltine Candy
fields.title: Saltine Candy
fields.description: A sweet and salty treat made with saltine crackers, toffee, chocolate, and nuts.
instructions: Line a jelly roll pan with foil.
Spread the saltine crackers out in a single layer (try to find a pan that the crackers just fit inside of).
In a saucepan, melt the butter, add the sugar.
Bring to a full boil stirring constantly for three minutes.
Pour the sugar mixture over the saltines.
Bake in a 400 F oven for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle evenly with chocolate chips, when melted spread then add nuts.
Refrigerate for two hours, then break into pieces.

fields.name: See's Fudge
fields.title: The Marg
fields.description: A simple recipe involving chocolate, nuts, vanilla, and milk.
instructions: mixest together
it centil mixest together

fields.name: Smores Bars
fields.title: NESTLE TOLL HOUSE S'Mores Bars
fields.description: A no-bake dessert bar made with chocolate, marshmallows, and graham crackers.
ingredients: 1-3/4 cup (11.5-oz. pkg.) NESTLE TOLL HOUSE Milk Chocolate Morsels
1 package (7.5 oz.) chocolate-covered graham crackers, broken into bite-size pieces
instructions: Line 9-inch-square baking pan with heavy-duty foil.
Heat cream in medium saucepan over medium-high heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until bubbles appear around edges. Remove from heat.
Add morsels; stir until smooth.
Cool, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 12 minutes.
Add marshmallows; stir to coat.
Gently stir in graham cracker pieces until combined.
Spread mixture into prepared pan; press down lightly.
Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm.
Cut into bars.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted by Andrea DeVore from Dover, NH, who noted that her kids loved making and eating these bars.

fields.name: Spiced Popcorn
fields.title: Spiced Pepcoin
fields.description: A simple spiced pepcoin recipe with a sugar topping.
ingredients: ½ cup por (unclear ingredient, consider verifying)
To top meetmag (unclear ingredient, consider verifying)
I thaps, melted butter (unclear ingredient, consider verifying)
as faith spice (unclear ingredient, consider verifying)
instructions: Mix all ingredients except topping ingredients.
Combine topping ingredients and sprinkle over the mixed base.
Bake until golden and soft.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to have some OCR errors, resulting in unclear ingredient names. It's recommended to review and correct these ingredients based on the original image or context if available. The name "Pepcoin" suggests a type of cookie or baked treat, possibly related to pecan or pepper, but this can't be confirmed without further information.

fields.name: Sugared Walnuts
fields.title: Sugared Walnuts
fields.description: Candied walnuts with a hint of cinnamon.
instructions: Step 1: Cook sugar, cinnamon, milk, and salt until the soft-ball stage.
Step 2: Pour the mixture over the walnuts and vanilla.
Step 3: Stir until the mixture is grainy. Then, spread the sugared walnuts on wax paper to separate and cool.

fields.name: Ultimate Chocolate Dip
fields.title: Ultimate Chocolate Dip
fields.description: A rich and decadent chocolate dip perfect for fresh fruit, marshmallows, brownies, or cookies.
ingredients: Fresh fruit, marshmallows, brownies or cookies, as desired
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine Karo and cream; bring it to a boil over medium heat.
Remove from heat.
Add chocolate and stir until melted.
Serve warm, dipping fruit, marshmallows, brownies or cookies, as desired.
fields.comment: Karo Syrup, introduced in 1902, has become a pantry staple, often used in recipes for its unique texture and sweetness. It's especially popular during the holidays for making candies and other sweet treats like this chocolate dip.

fields.name: Peach Raspberry Jam
fields.title: Grandma's Peach-Raspberry Jam
fields.description: A sweet and fruity jam made with peaches, raspberries, and raspberry jello.
instructions: Boil peaches, raspberries, and sugar for 20 minutes.
Add raspberry jello and boil 15 minutes more.

fields.name: Dill Pickles
fields.title: Dill Pickles
fields.description: A simple recipe for homemade dill pickles.
instructions: Put cucumbers in jars.
Add dill seed, salt, garlic clove, and hot red pepper to each jar.
Combine vinegar, water, sugar, and alum in a pot. Bring to a boil.
Pour boiling liquid over cucumbers in jars.
Cold pack for 5 minutes.
fields.comment: Pickling is a time-honored tradition used to preserve vegetables and enhance their flavors.  Dill pickles are a classic example, offering a tangy, crunchy complement to a variety of dishes.

fields.name: Plum Conserve
fields.title: Plum Conserve
fields.description: A sweet and fruity plum conserve with oranges, raisins, and walnuts.
instructions: Wash plums and remove pits.
Add raisins and sliced oranges.
Measure and add 1 cup of sugar to each cup of fruit.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for about 14-15 minutes, or until thick.
Add lemon juice and walnuts during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Seal in sterilized jars.

fields.name: Mustard Pickles
fields.title: Mustard Pickles
fields.description: Sweet and tangy mustard pickles made with cucumbers, onions, and cauliflower.
ingredients: 3 qt cucumbers, peeled and diced (20 cups)
Thickening agent (made of 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, 1 scant cup Coleman's mustard, 1 tsp celery seed, 1/4 tsp curry powder, 1 tsp turmeric)
instructions: Dice cucumbers, peel onions, and cover with water and canning salt (not iodized). Let stand overnight.
Wash off the salt mixture.
Add vinegar and brown sugar to the vegetables and bring to a boil.
In a separate bowl, combine sugar, flour, mustard, celery seed, curry powder, and turmeric. Mix with some water and a little vinegar until smooth.
Add the thickening agent to the boiling vegetables.
Cook until vegetables are clear, about 20 minutes.
Dilute vinegar with water, 2/3 vinegar to 1/3 water.

fields.name: Chili Sauce
fields.title: Chili Sauce
fields.description: A tangy chili sauce made with onions, peppers, tomatoes, and spices.
instructions: Drain tomatoes.
Combine all ingredients.

fields.name: Peach Raspberry Jam #2
fields.title: Peach Raspberry Jam
fields.description: A sweet and fruity jam made with ripe peaches and raspberries.
ingredients: 2 10 oz. Packages Frozen Raspberries (Not in Syrup)
instructions: Combine peaches, raspberries, and sugar in a large pot.
Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and add raspberry jello, stir until dissolved.
Seal in sterilized jars and process in a boiling water bath.
fields.comment: This Peach Raspberry Jam is a delightful way to enjoy the sweet flavors of summer's fruits. Preserving these flavors in a homemade jam is a great way to savor the essence of ripe peaches and raspberries throughout the year. Its combination of fruity and tangy notes can be enjoyed on bread, biscuits, or as a filling for pastries. It is a perfect treat for breakfast, brunch, or as an anytime snack.

fields.name: Pickled Beets
fields.title: Pickled Beets
fields.description: A simple recipe for pickled beets using fresh beets, vinegar, sugar, and salt.
instructions: Top beets, ensuring they do not bleed.
Cold pack for 15-20 minutes.
fields.comment: Pickled beets are a popular side dish or condiment, enjoyed for their sweet and tangy flavor. They offer a vibrant color and add a unique touch to salads, sandwiches, and other dishes. Beetroots have been cultivated for centuries and pickling them helps preserve their freshness and flavor.

fields.name: Crisp Pickle Slices
fields.title: Crisp Pickle Slices
fields.description: A simple recipe for crisp pickle slices using cucumbers, onions, peppers, and a vinegar-based brine.
ingredients: Optional: medium red bell peppers, sliced
instructions: Slice cucumbers and onions (and optional peppers).
Salt the vegetables and cover with cracked ice.
Let stand for 3 hours, then drain.
Combine sugar, turmeric, celery seed, mustard seed, and cider vinegar in a pot.
Pour the mixture over the drained cucumbers and onions.
Heat just to a boil and seal in jars.
Cold pack for 5 minutes.

fields.name: Salsa
fields.title: Salsa
fields.description: A flavorful salsa recipe.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pot.
Boil for 5 minutes.
Simmer for 1 hour.
Add 1 teaspoon of lemon juice per quart before canning.
Cold pack for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Chili Sauce #2
fields.title: Chili Sarace
fields.description: A flavorful chili sauce made with tomatoes, onions, peppers, celery, and spices.
instructions: Squeeze water out of tomatoes.
Cook 2½ hrs.
fields.comment: Chili Sarace is a versatile condiment used in various cuisines. Its blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy flavors makes it an excellent addition to many dishes. This historical recipe is simple to make and provides a great way to preserve fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers and celery

fields.name: Lasagne
fields.title: Lasagne
fields.description: A classic baked Italian casserole with layers of pasta, meat sauce, and cheese.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic (or 1/4 tsp minced dried garlic)
instructions: Sauté hamburger and onion until hamburger loses its color and onions are transparent.
In a 9x13 pan or two smaller pans, put a small amount of sauce on the bottom.
Cook lasagne noodles according to package directions.
Add one layer of lasagne noodles to the pan(s), covering the bottom.
Cover noodles with a small amount of sauce.
Sprinkle on Parmesan, mozzarella, and gorda cheese.
Repeat layers two more times.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, or until thoroughly heated through and cheese is melted.
Let stand at least 10 minutes before cutting to serve.

fields.name: Chinese Sundae
fields.title: Chinese Sundae
fields.description: A savory and sweet dish featuring chicken, rice, noodles, and a variety of toppings.
instructions: Combine cooked rice, Chinese noodles, cubed chicken, chicken gravy, grated cheddar cheese, sliced celery, chopped tomatoes, crushed pineapple, slivered or sliced almonds, sliced green onions, coconut, and a maraschino cherry in a bowl or sundae glass.
For a thicker gravy, combine chicken broth and cream of chicken soup (1 1/2 cans of broth per can of soup).
fields.comment: This dish, while called a "sundae," is a savory creation, showcasing a blend of sweet and savory flavors popular in some American Chinese cuisine.

fields.name: Private Eye Pie
fields.title: "Private Eye" Pic
fields.description: A savory pizza-like dish made with ground beef, beans, cheese, and vegetables.
instructions: Brown ground beef and drain.
Add chopped green pepper and cook until tender.
Stir in beans (not mentioned in ingredients, but implied), pizza sauce (not mentioned in ingredients, but implied), and herb seasoning (not mentioned in ingredients, but implied).
Divide the meat mixture in half.
Press each half onto the bottom and sides of a greased 9-inch pie plate.
Layer half of the meat mixture in each pie plate, alternating with half of the shredded cheese.
Top with sliced onions, green pepper rings, and grated cheese.
Bake at 425°F for 15-18 minutes.

fields.name: Jack Pot Casserole
fields.title: Jack Pot Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish with ground beef, noodles, corn, and cheese in a tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Brown meat in skillet.
Add onion, soup, water and noodles.
Cook until noodles are tender.
Add corn and cheese.
Season to taste.
Serve when cheese has melted.

fields.name: Pepperoni Pizza Chili
fields.title: Pepperoni Pizza Chili
fields.description: A savory chili with the flavors of pepperoni pizza.
ingredients: 1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 teaspoon pizza seasoning or Italian seasoning
instructions: In a large saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Stir in the beans, pizza sauce, tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, pepperoni, green pepper, pizza seasoning and salt.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until chili reaches desired thickness.
Garnish with cheese if desired.

fields.name: Tuna-Lima Bean Casserole
fields.title: Tuna-Lima Bean Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole made with precooked rice, tuna, lima beans, cream of chicken soup.
ingredients: 1 No. 2 can baby lima beans, drained
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Cook rice in skillet according to package directions.
Add remaining ingredients and heat through gently.

fields.name: Spam And Rice Casserole
fields.title: Spam and Rice Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole dish made with Spam, rice, cheese, and chicken gumbo soup.
instructions: Blend soup and water in pan--heat to simmer.
Add rice and cheese.
Slice Spam on top.
Bake in oven at 350 degrees until rice is done, about hour.

fields.name: Zucchini Rice With Sausage
fields.title: Zucchini Rice with Sausage
fields.description: A savory dish featuring zucchini, rice, sausage, and cheddar cheese.
instructions: In a large skillet, brown sausage. Push to one side and remove all but 2 tablespoons of fat.
Add rice, zucchini, and chopped onion to the skillet. Cook until lightly browned.
Stir in  hot water, prepared mustard, garlic salt, and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in cheddar cheese. Heat just until the cheese is melted.
notes: The original recipe suggests ground beef as a substitute for sausage.
One small, chopped onion was added to the ingredients and instructions. This common addition enhances the flavor profile.
fields.comment: Zucchini rice dishes gained popularity as low-carb alternatives.  Ground beef is also frequently used in this dish and other similar dishes where sauage and zuchini are used.

fields.name: Tuna Casserole
fields.title: Tuna Casserole
fields.description: A classic tuna casserole recipe.
instructions: Place layer of some cheese in bottom of 9x13 casserole dish.
Put can of mushroom soup over next.
Spoon fish over the mushroom soup.
Place remaining cheese over fish.
Bake until warmed through.

fields.name: Meal Casserole
fields.title: Meal Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish made with ground beef, vegetables, cream of mushroom soup, and crushed potato chips.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Brown ground beef.
Put browned ground beef in casserole dish.
Top with chopped celery and peppers.
Mix cream of mushroom soup with frozen peas and pour over the meat and vegetables.
Cover top with crushed potato chips.
Bake for 45 minutes at 350°F.

fields.name: Zingy Zucchini Casserole
fields.title: Zingy Zucchini Casserole
fields.description: A cheesy and flavorful zucchini casserole topped with herb-seasoned stuffing.
instructions: Cook the squash and onion in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain.
In a bowl, combine the soup, sour cream, and cheese.
Fold the drained vegetables into the soup mixture.
Combine the stuffing mix and melted butter.
Spread half the crumb mixture over the bottom of a 2-quart casserole dish.
Spoon the vegetable mixture over the crumbs.
Cover with the remaining stuffing.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Pot Pie
fields.title: Pot Pie
fields.description: A comforting pot pie recipe from Marilyn Walter.

fields.name: Stroganoff
fields.title: Straggeney
fields.description: A creamy casserole dish with beef, mushrooms, and sour cream, served over noodles.
ingredients: 1 lb Round Steak, cut into cubes
instructions: Brown seasoned steak cubes in a pan.
Add 1 cup of water and simmer for 1 hour or more.
Mix together cooked steak, chopped onion, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and mushrooms.
Bake for 45 minutes at 350°F.
Serve over noodles.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this one were popular in the mid-20th century as a way to combine simple ingredients and create a hearty meal. Beef stroganoff, a Russian dish with similar flavors, may have been an inspiration.

fields.name: Frank's Burritos
fields.title: Frank's Burritos
fields.description: A quick and easy burrito recipe featuring refried beans, a flavorful filling, and warm flour tortillas.
ingredients: 2 cups filling (scrambled eggs, cooked rice, diced cooked chicken or pork, shredded beef)
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine refried beans, cayenne pepper sauce, and cumin.
Cook and stir over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, or until heated through and flavors are blended.
Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the bean mixture into the center of each tortilla.
Top with 1/2 cup of the desired filling.
Fold into burritos.
Garnish as desired.
To heat tortillas: Place tortillas in a damp microwave-safe paper towel. Microwave on high for 1-2 minutes, or until heated through.
notes: A tip for folding burritos: Place filling in the center of the tortilla. Fold the bottom third of the tortilla over the filling. Fold over both sides of the tortilla. Roll up to enclose.
fields.comment: Burritos, a popular Tex-Mex dish, have a rich history dating back to the 19th century.  While the exact origins are debated, they represent a delicious fusion of cultures and continue to be a beloved food item worldwide.

fields.name: Meat Balls
fields.title: Meat Balls (morart)
fields.description: Savory meatballs made with ground beef, sausage, and a flavorful lachoy sauce.
instructions: Boil Lipton onion soup mix in a small amount of water for 3 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together (except cornstarch and lachoy sauce).
Roll the mixture into small balls, about 1/2" in size.
Roll the balls in cornstarch.
Fry the balls in grease until browned.
Place the meatballs in a double-boiler.
Brush each meatball with Lachoy sauce.
Pour additional Lachoy sauce, diluted with water, over the meatballs

fields.name: Creamy Spam And Broccoli Casserole
fields.title: Creamy SPAM® and Broccoli Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy casserole featuring SPAM®, broccoli, and elbow macaroni.
ingredients: 2 cups frozen cut broccoli, thawed and drained
1 (12-ounce) can SPAM Lite luncheon meat, cubed
½ cup chopped red bell pepper
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F.
Spray 2-quart casserole with vegetable cooking spray.
Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
In casserole, combine macaroni, broccoli, SPAM, and red pepper.
In small saucepan, stir together milk, cornstarch, and pepper until cornstarch is dissolved.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Reduce heat to low.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
Combine sauce with other ingredients.
Combine bread crumbs and margarine; sprinkle on top of casserole.
Bake 40 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
fields.comment: SPAM gained popularity during World War II and continues to be a popular ingredient in some cultures.

fields.name: Hamburger-Corn Bake
fields.title: Hamburger-Corn Bake
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring ground beef, corn, noodles, and a creamy sauce, topped with buttery bread crumbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
In a skillet, brown the ground beef with the chopped onions; drain the excess fat.
Cook the noodles according to package directions, then drain.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked beef and onion mixture, cooked noodles, canned corn, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, pepper, salt (if using), and chopped pimientos.
Pour the mixture into a casserole dish.
In a small bowl, mix the soft bread crumbs and melted butter.
Top the casserole with the buttered bread crumbs.
Bake for 1-1½ hours.

fields.name: Corn And Potato Casserole
fields.title: Corn and Potato Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy casserole with corn, potatoes, and a crunchy cornflake topping.
ingredients: 32 oz. Potatoes, hash brown, frozen, fat-free
10.75 oz. Cream of celery soup, reduced fat
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Coat 11x7-inch baking dish lightly with nonstick cooking spray.
In nonstick skillet, sauté onion and green pepper in water until tender, about 5 minutes.
In large bowl, combine hash browns, corn, onion, pepper, sour cream, soup and cheese and stir well.
Spoon into prepared baking dish and top with cornflake crumbs.
Bake, uncovered, 1 hour, or until golden brown.
fields.comment: This recipe is adapted from "More So Fat, Low Fat, No Fat" cookbook and offers a lower-fat version of a classic comfort food by using fat-free ingredients. Casseroles like this were particularly popular in the mid-20th century as a convenient and economical way to feed families.

fields.name: Creamy Meatballs And Potatoes
fields.title: Creamy Meatballs and Potatoes
fields.description: A creamy, comforting dish made with potatoes, meatballs, broccoli, and a creamy onion sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups refrigerated potato wedges (from 1 lb. 4-oz. pkg.)
(10 3/4-oz.) can condensed cream of onion soup
2 cups Green Giant Select Frozen Broccoli Florets (from 1-lb. pkg.)
18 cooked Italian Square Meatballs or 24 frozen cooked meatballs (about 12 oz.), thawed
instructions: In 12-inch nonstick skillet, combine potatoes, soup and water; stir gently to mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in broccoli and meatballs; simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until broccoli and potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Stir in sour cream; cook just until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally.
notes: INGREDIENT SUBSTITUTIONS: Green beans or peas can be substituted for broccoli.
SERVING SUGGESTION: Serve with sliced cantaloupe and honeydew melon. For a heartier meal, serve with Pillsbury Refrigerated Breadsticks.

fields.name: Spaghetti Casserole
fields.title: Spaghetti Casserole
fields.description: A layered casserole with ground beef, spaghetti sauce, vegetables, and noodles baked with sour cream and mozzarella cheese.
ingredients: 2 cups vermicelli or angel hair noodles, cooked
instructions: Brown ground beef in a pan and add it to simmering spaghetti sauce along with salt, basil, oregano, mushrooms and diced tomatoes.
Cook vermicelli or angel hair noodles according to package directions.
Layer half the noodles, sauce, sour cream and mozzarella cheese in a casserole dish.
Repeat layers.
Bake for 30-45 minutes at 325°F.

fields.name: Ground Beef And Vegetables Over Rice
fields.title: Ground Beef and Vegetables over Rice
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish of ground beef and vegetables simmered in a tomato-based sauce and served over rice.
ingredients: 1 can (14 to 16 oz.) whole tomatoes, with juice
1 can (16 oz.) pork and beans in tomato sauce
1 medium onion, sliced and separated into rings
instructions: Cook beef in 10-inch skillet with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper until meat is no longer pink; stir to crumble. Pour off fat.

Add tomatoes, beans, onion, carrots, Italian seasoning and remaining salt and pepper to skillet. (If you prefer not to use so much salt or pepper, you can omit this remaining salt and pepper, and season to taste.)
Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Add zucchini, and flour mixed with water. Cook until zucchini is tender and sauce is thickened.
Serve over rice.

fields.name: Six Veggie Casserole
fields.title: Six-Veggie Casserole
fields.description: A comforting and easy casserole featuring six different vegetables.
ingredients: 1 package (16 ounces) frozen cut green beans, thawed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the green beans, celery, carrots, onions, green pepper, and tomatoes.
Add the melted butter, tapioca, sugar, salt, and pepper; mix well.
Transfer the mixture to an ungreased 2-1/2-quart baking dish.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle with french-fried onions.
Bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this one rose in popularity in the mid-20th century with the advent of readily available convenience foods like canned and frozen vegetables.

fields.name: Cabbage Casserole
fields.title: Cabbage Casserole
fields.description: A tangy, creamy, comforting cabbage side dish that pairs well with pork roast.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: Cook cabbage in boiling salted water until tender; drain thoroughly.
In a large skillet, saute onion in 5 tablespoons butter until tender.
Add soup and mix well.
Add cheese; cook and stir until melted.
Remove from the heat.
Stir in the cabbage, salt and pepper.
Transfer to an ungreased 2-qt. baking dish.
In a small skillet, melt the remaining butter.
Cook and stir bread crumbs in butter until lightly browned; sprinkle over casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20-30 minutes or until heated through.

fields.name: Country Pineapple Casserole
fields.title: Country Pineapple Casserole
fields.description: A sweet and tangy casserole made with crushed pineapple, lemon juice, and bread cubes.
ingredients: 2 cans (20 ounces each) crushed pineapple, drained
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in pineapple and lemon juice.
Fold in the bread cubes.
Pour into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 35-40 minutes or until set.

fields.name: Omelet Biscuit Cups
fields.title: Omelet Biscuit Cups
fields.description: Savory omelet filling baked in biscuit cups.
ingredients: 1 tube (12 ounces) large refrigerated buttermilk biscuits
instructions: Press biscuits onto the bottom and up the sides of greased muffin cups; set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs, milk, salt and pepper.
Add ham, 1/4 cup cheese and mushrooms; mix well.
In a skillet, melt butter; add the egg mixture.
Cook and stir until eggs are nearly set.
Spoon into biscuit cups.
Bake at 375° for 10-15 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

fields.name: Scrambled Egg Casserole
fields.title: Scrambled Egg Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole with scrambled eggs, bacon, mushroom soup, and cheddar cheese.
instructions: Fry bacon until crisp.
Cool and break into small pieces.
Drain grease from pan and scramble the eggs until done.
Add bacon and put it into a 9X13 glass baking dish.
Combine soup and milk and pour over eggs.
Top with grated cheese.
Warm at 350 degrees in oven for about 30 min. or warm thoroughly in a microwave.
notes: Ham or sausage may be used in place of bacon.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this were particularly popular in the mid-20th century as a convenient and economical way to feed a family.

fields.name: Brunch Egg And Cheese And Ham Casserole
fields.title: Brunch Egg, Cheese, and Ham Casserole
fields.description: A savory breakfast casserole with bread, ham, cheese, eggs, and a creamy mushroom soup topping.
ingredients: 8 slices of bread, buttered and crusts trimmed
instructions: Place bread in a buttered 9x13 inch pan.
Add the ham, then cover with cheese.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, 1 1/2 cups milk, salt, dry mustard, and minced onion.
Pour the egg mixture over the ham and cheese.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Mix cream of mushroom soup with 1/2 cup milk.
Pour soup mixture over the casserole.
Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this were particularly popular in the mid-20th century as a convenient and make-ahead dish for brunch or potlucks.  Variations often include different cheeses, vegetables, or meats.

fields.name: Beef And Asparagus Skillet Dinner
fields.title: Beef and Asparagus Skillet Dinner
fields.description: A savory skillet dinner featuring marinated beef, asparagus, and other fresh vegetables, served over rice.
ingredients: 1/2 cup white wine vinegar or dry white wine
2-1/2 pounds sirloin steak, cut into thin strips
1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, cut into 2-inch pieces
1 medium onion, cut into thin strips
1 green pepper, cut into thin strips
instructions: In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, white wine vinegar (or dry white wine), sugar, garlic powder, and ground ginger.
Add the steak strips to the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight.
Drain the marinated steak and reserve the marinade.
In a large skillet or wok, brown the steak in cooking oil.
Add the reserved marinade to the skillet. Cover and simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the meat is tender.
Add the asparagus pieces and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the sliced onion, green pepper, and mushrooms to the skillet.
In a separate bowl, mix the beef broth and cornstarch until smooth.
Pour the cornstarch mixture into the skillet.
Bring the mixture to a boil to thicken the sauce.
Cook for another 3-5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Serve the beef and asparagus mixture over cooked rice.
fields.comment: This recipe, created by Barbara Calhoun, a retired teacher, is a family favorite she often makes for her husband and grandsons, as well as for church suppers.

fields.name: Franks 'N' Beans Supper
fields.title: Franks n' Beans Supper
fields.description: A hearty one-pan meal featuring hot dogs, beans, potatoes, and a creamy sauce, topped with crispy bacon.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 cup frozen cut green beans, thawed
instructions: In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside; drain, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings.
Saute hot dogs and onion in drippings until onion is tender.
Combine soup, water, thyme and pepper; add to skillet with potatoes and beans.
Mix well; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until heated through.
Top with bacon.

fields.name: Philippine Fried Rice
fields.title: Philippine Fried Rice
fields.description: A savory fried rice dish with ground beef, vegetables, and a flavorful blend of soy sauce and seasonings.
ingredients: 1 green pepper, sliced thin in long strips
instructions: Cook hamburger and onion until done. Push to one side.
Scramble beaten eggs and keep stirring in small pieces.
Add cold cooked rice, chopped vegetables, soy sauce, and remaining seasonings.
Keep stirring until well mixed and hot.

fields.name: Smoke Sausage And Beans
fields.title: SMOKED SAUSAGE AND BEANS
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish of smoked sausage, beans, and spices simmered in chicken broth.
ingredients: 1 pound fully cooked smoked sausage, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15-1/2 ounces) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large skillet, saute onions and garlic in oil until tender.
Add sausage; cook and stir until lightly browned.
Add broth, beans and seasonings.
Cover and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Discard bay leaves.
Serve in a bowl over rice or pasta.
notes: Recipe uses less fat, sugar, and salt.
Includes Nutritional Analysis and Diabetic Exchanges.
fields.comment: This recipe combines pantry staples with fresh ingredients for a simple, satisfying meal that can be enjoyed year-round.  Beans and smoked sausages have been paired for centuries in various cuisines across the world.

fields.name: Mashed Potato Sausage Bake
fields.title: MASHED POTATO SAUSAGE BAKE
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring sausage, savory seasonings, and mashed potatoes, perfect for colder months.
ingredients: 1 pound fully cooked light kielbasa or Polish sausage, sliced
instructions: Place potatoes in a saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until very tender; drain.
Transfer potatoes to a mixing bowl. Add sour cream and broth; beat on low speed until smooth.
In a skillet, cook sausage, mushrooms, onion and garlic until vegetables are tender.
Spread half of the potato mixture into a 9-in. x 5-in. x 3-in. loaf pan coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Top with sausage mixture and remaining potatoes.
Sprinkle with cheese, parsley and oregano.
Bake at 350° for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with a spoon.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Jennifer Seevers of North Bend, Oregon, who highlights its comforting nature, especially during colder weather.

fields.name: Sausage Skillet Supper
fields.title: Sausage Skillet Supper
fields.description: A quick and easy one-pan meal with sausage, beans, rice, and tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a medium skillet, cook and crumble sausage; drain.
Add remaining ingredients; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until rice is tender.

fields.name: Apricot Beef Stir-fry
fields.title: Apricot Beef Stir-Fry
fields.description: A sweet and savory stir-fry dish featuring beef, broccoli, and apricots.
ingredients: 1-1/2 pounds boneless beef round or sirloin steak, cut into thin strips
instructions: Drain apricots, reserving 1/4 cup juice.
Cut apricots into quarters and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch, broth, soy sauce and reserved apricot juice until smooth; set aside.
In a large skillet or wok, stir-fry beef in oil for 3 minutes.
Add broccoli and onion; stir-fry 2-3 minutes longer or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Stir sauce and add to the pan.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Add tomatoes and reserved apricots; heat through.
Serve over rice.
notes: Nutritional Analysis: One 1-cup serving (prepared with unsweetened apricots, reduced-sodium beef broth and reduced-sodium soy sauce; calculated without rice) equals 249 calories, 10 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 72 mg cholesterol, 324 mg sodium, 10 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 28 g protein.
Diabetic Exchanges: 3 lean meat, 2 vegetable, 1 fat.
fields.comment: This recipe offers a healthier take on stir-fry by using less fat, sugar, and salt. It also provides nutritional information and diabetic exchanges, making it a suitable choice for health-conscious individuals.

fields.name: German Macaroni
fields.title: German Macaroni
fields.description: A comforting dish of macaroni, bacon, onion, and tomatoes.
ingredients: 3-4 medium tomatoes, chopped (about 3 cups) OR a 20-oz. can tomatoes with juice
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
Cook bacon until crisp. Drain; reserve 2 tablespoons drippings.
When bacon has cooled, chop; reserve.
In skillet, sauté onion in reserved bacon drippings.
Add tomatoes, macaroni and bacon; stir gently.
Heat through. Season to taste.

fields.name: Ground Beef And Rice Pie
fields.title: GROUND BEEF 'N' RICE PIE
fields.description: A comforting ground beef and rice pie with a seasoned ground beef crust, baked until golden and cheesy.
instructions: In a bowl, combine beef, 3/4 cup tomato sauce, bread crumbs, onion, green pepper (if using), and seasonings.
Press the mixture evenly onto the bottom and up the sides of an ungreased 9-inch pie plate, forming a crust.
In another bowl, combine the tomato paste and remaining tomato sauce.
Stir in the rice and 3/4 cup cheese, then pour into the crust.
Place the pie plate on a baking sheet.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes, or until the meat is no longer pink.
Uncover, drain any excess liquid, and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 10-15 minutes longer, or until the cheese is melted.
Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.
fields.comment: Rhonda Van Gelderen of Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin created this recipe. It's a time-saver because the ground beef doesn't need to be browned separately.

fields.name: Eggs Over English Muffins
fields.title: Creamy Dried Beef on English Muffins
fields.description: A classic comfort food, creamy dried beef is served over toasted English muffins for a quick and satisfying meal.
instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Gradually whisk in milk until smooth.
Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Reduce heat to low and stir in cream cheese until melted and smooth.
Toast English muffins.
Top each muffin half with sliced dried beef, a spoonful of the cream cheese sauce, and sliced hard-boiled eggs.
fields.comment: Creamy dried beef, often called "SOS" (Something on a shingle) gained popularity in the United States during World War II due to its simplicity and affordability. Today, it continues to be a beloved comfort food classic.

fields.name: Skillet Beef And Green Beans
fields.title: Skillet Beef and Green Beans
fields.description: A hearty skillet dish with ground beef, green beans, and other vegetables, simmered until tender and topped with melted mozzarella cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 lb. green beans, cut in half
instructions: Brown ground beef and onion in a skillet.
Add all remaining ingredients except cheese.
Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in half of the mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle the rest of the cheese on top and cover for 2-3 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

fields.name: Grandma's Casserole
fields.title: Grandma's Casserole
fields.description: A layered casserole with a tomato-meat mixture, noodles, and mozzarella cheese.
instructions: Sauté onion and green pepper in butter until softened.
Add hamburger, seasoned salt, MSG, pepper, and sugar. Stir until browned.
Mix in diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and water. Heat to boiling, then simmer for 15 minutes.
In a 13x9 inch pan, layer half of the tomato-meat mixture, then the noodles, and top with mozzarella slices. Repeat layers.
Cover and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this were popular in the mid-20th century as a way to utilize pantry staples and create hearty, family-friendly meals.  Variations often included different vegetables, meats, or cheeses.

fields.name: Lasagne (2)
fields.title: Lasagna
fields.description: A classic Italian lasagna recipe.
instructions: Brown ground beef with onion and garlic.
Add tomato sauce, tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for at least 15 minutes.
Layer ingredients in a baking dish starting with noodles, then meat sauce, followed by cheeses. Repeat layers.
Bake at 350°F for 30-40 minutes.

fields.name: One Step Tamale Pie
fields.title: One-Step Tamale
fields.description: A quick and easy tamale recipe made with ground beef, corn, and spices.
instructions: In a large skillet, cook hamburger, onion, and garlic until browned.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Pour into a 12x7 1/2x2 baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until a clean knife comes out.
Cut into squares.

fields.name: Tamale Skillet Meal
fields.title: Tamale Skillet Meal
fields.description: A quick and easy skillet meal with tamales, beef, corn, tomatoes, and cheese.
instructions: In a skillet, cook onions in butter until tender.
Add sauce from tamales.
Stir in beef, corn, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes.
Cut tamales lengthwise and arrange cut-side up in the mixture.
Top with remaining cheese and olives.

fields.name: Cindy's Diner Garbage Pie
fields.title: Cindy's Diner Garbage Pie
fields.description: A savory pie made with potatoes, ham, onion, eggs, and cheddar cheese.
instructions: In a skillet, fry potatoes, ham and onion in butter until brown.
Mix eggs and cheese; add to potato mixture.
Brown until egg mixture is cooked.
notes: Added butter to ingredients list, as it was mentioned in the instructions but not originally included in the ingredient list.
fields.comment: Garbage pie, despite its name, is a delicious and adaptable dish with roots in making the most of available ingredients, often leftovers. It's enjoyed across various cultures with different names and ingredient variations. Its popularity in diners like Cindy's highlights its comfort food appeal and resourcefulness.

fields.name: Mexican Taters And Beans
fields.title: Mexican Taters and Beans
fields.description: A cheesy and flavorful casserole featuring layers of potatoes, onions, salsa, chili, and two kinds of cheese, topped with tortilla chips.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 ounces each) chili with beans
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
instructions: Place potatoes in the bottom of a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Sprinkle with onion.
Mix salsa and butter; pour over onion and potatoes.
Top with sliced cheeses.
Spread with chili.
Sprinkle shredded cheeses over top.
Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.
Sprinkle with chips just before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe was created by E. Marilyn Nix from Truth or Consequences, New Mexico, and was a hit at her church potluck.

fields.name: Sunday Brunch Casserole
fields.title: Sunday Brunch Casserole
fields.description: A hearty and versatile casserole perfect for brunch or a family supper.
ingredients: 1 package (16 ounces) frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
instructions: In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove bacon with a slotted spoon; crumble and set aside.
In the bacon drippings, saute onion and green pepper until tender.
Remove onion and green pepper with a slotted spoon.
Beat eggs and milk in a large bowl.
Stir in hash browns, cheese, salt, pepper, dill, onion, green pepper and bacon.
Transfer to a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 35-45 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
fields.comment: This casserole is nicknamed "egg pie" by the author's family.

fields.name: Beef Nacho Casserole
fields.title: Beef Nachos Casserole
fields.description: A quick and easy casserole with ground beef, salsa, beans, and tortilla chips, topped with cheese.
instructions: Brown ground beef.
Stir in salsa, beans, Miracle Whip, and chili powder.
Layer half of the meat mixture in a baking dish.
Top with half of the crushed tortilla chips and half of the shredded cheese.
Repeat layers.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Top with shredded lettuce and chopped tomato.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this one were popular in the 1990s as a convenient weeknight meal. They often incorporated readily available ingredients like canned soup, ground meat, and processed cheese.

fields.name: Lasagna
fields.title: Lasagna
fields.description: A classic Italian lasagna recipe.
instructions: Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes.
fields.comment: Lasagna is a wide, flat pasta shape, and possibly the oldest type of pasta. It has been purported to have originated in the city of Naples during the Middle Ages.

fields.name: Easy Pasta Skillet
fields.title: Easy Pasta Skillet
fields.description: A quick and easy pasta skillet dish with ground beef, mozzarella, and parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 1 pkg. (8 oz.) KRAFT Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided
instructions: Brown meat in large skillet; drain.
Add 2 1/2 cups water. Bring to boil; reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in pasta; cover. Simmer 15 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Stir in spaghetti sauce and 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with remaining cheeses; cover. Cook 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.
notes: Consider serving with toasted garlic bread and a bagged salad with Italian dressing.
fields.comment: One-pot pasta dishes like this are convenient for weeknight meals and minimize cleanup.

fields.name: Cheesy Chicken And Broccoli Macaroni
fields.title: Cheesy Chicken & Broccoli Macaroni
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy macaroni dish with chicken and broccoli.
ingredients: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 1-1/4 lb.), cut into small pieces
3/4 lb. (12 oz.) VELVEETA Pasteurized Prepared Cheese Product, cut up, or 1 pkg. (8 oz.) KRAFT Cheddar Classic Melts
2 cups (8 oz.) elbow macaroni or 1 pkg. (10 oz.) frozen small shells, uncooked
1 pkg. (10 oz.) frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
instructions: SPRAY large skillet with no stick cooking spray. Add chicken; cook and stir 2 minutes or until no longer pink.
STIR in broth. Bring to boil. Stir in macaroni. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender.
ADD VELVEETA and broccoli; stir until VELVEETA is melted.
notes: Try serving with whole wheat rolls and sliced fruit.

fields.name: Boiled Dinner
fields.title: Boiled Dinner
fields.description: A hearty one-pot meal with potatoes, carrots, onion, knockwurst, and cabbage boiled in chicken broth.
instructions: In a dutch oven, bring chicken broth to a boil.
Wash and quarter potatoes.
Peel carrots and split in half lengthwise.
Slice onion.
Slice knockwurst at 1-inch intervals.
Add potatoes, carrots, onion, and knockwurst to the boiling broth. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Wash cabbage and cut into wedges. Add to the pot with the other vegetables.
Sprinkle with salt and caraway seed. Cover and cook for 10 minutes more.

fields.name: Pineapple Stuffing Casserole
fields.title: Pineapple Stuffing Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole featuring frankfurters, pineapple chunks, and seasoned stuffing mix.
ingredients: 1 can (15 1/4 oz.) pineapple chunks in juice
1 package (7 or 8 oz.) seasoned stuffing mix
instructions: Score 4 or 5 frankfurters.
Coarsely chop the remaining frankfurters or cut into 1/4-inch slices.
Melt butter in a 2-quart saucepan.
Add cut-up frankfurters, celery, and onion. Saute over moderate heat until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Drain pineapple, reserving juice.
Add 1/2 cup pineapple juice, water, and vinegar to the vegetable mixture. Heat to boiling.
Add pineapple chunks and stuffing mix, tossing to moisten evenly and mix well.
Turn into an ungreased shallow 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Arrange whole frankfurters in the stuffing.
Cover and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes.
Remove cover and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake uncovered for 20 minutes longer.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured as a bright idea for low-cost, low-calorie meals at the Deseret News Food and Crafts Fair in October 1974.

fields.name: Spaghetti Primavera
fields.title: Spaghetti Primavera
fields.description: A vibrant pasta dish featuring fresh, seasonal vegetables.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon oil (olive oil or a mixture of olive oil and cooking oil)
1 garlic clove, pressed or finely chopped
1 1/2 cups sugar snap or snow peas (optional)
6 asparagus spears, sliced on the diagonal (optional)
1/2 cup pine nuts or slivered almonds, toasted
instructions: Sauté tomatoes in oil with garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
In another pan, lightly sauté mushrooms (which have been washed, trimmed, and sliced vertically through stems) in oil.
Blanch all other vegetables in boiling water until tender-crisp.
Drain well; add to mushrooms. Keep hot.
Cook spaghetti as package directs, adding 1 tablespoon oil to cooking water. Drain.
Lightly mix cheese, butter, and cream into spaghetti. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve spaghetti on a large platter topped with vegetables.
Garnish with sautéed tomatoes and nuts.
notes: Vary vegetables with the season.
fields.comment: Spaghetti Primavera, meaning "Spring Spaghetti," became popular in the 1970s.  Its fresh, vibrant flavors and adaptability to seasonal ingredients have made it a classic.

fields.name: Spaghetti Pie
fields.title: Spaghetti Pie
fields.description: A rich and flavorful dish that combines common ingredients like spaghetti, ground beef, and tomatoes in an uncommon pie format.
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef or bulk pork sausage
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions; drain.
Stir butter or margarine into hot spaghetti.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and eggs.
Form spaghetti mixture into a crust in a buttered 10-inch pie plate.
Spread cottage cheese over the bottom of the spaghetti crust.
In a skillet, cook ground beef or pork sausage, onion, and green pepper until vegetables are tender and meat is browned. Drain off excess fat.
Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, oregano, and garlic salt; heat through.
Turn meat mixture into spaghetti crust.
Bake, uncovered, in a 350-degree oven for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top.
Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese melts.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted by Thelma Ivie of West Jordan. It's described as very easy to prepare and features a unique combination of flavors, enhanced by a touch of sugar.

fields.name: Vegetable Beef Casserole
fields.title: Vegetable Beef Casserole
fields.description: A classic one-dish casserole featuring layered ground beef, potatoes, carrots, celery, green beans, and tomatoes, topped with cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh or frozen green beans
4 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded and chopped
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese
instructions: In a 3-qt. casserole, layer half of the potatoes, carrots, celery, green beans and onion.
Crumble half of the uncooked beef over vegetables.
Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon each of thyme and pepper.
Repeat layers.
Top with tomatoes.
Cover and bake at 400° for 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350° bake about 1 hour longer or until vegetables are tender and meat is done.
Sprinkle with cheese; cover and let stand until cheese is melted.
fields.comment: This recipe, submitted by Evangeline Reu of Manassas, Virginia, has been passed down through generations and is known for its ease of preparation and satisfying flavors. It represents a classic American comfort food, often enjoyed as a main course with a side salad.

fields.name: Tuna Crunch Casserole
fields.title: Tuna Crunch Casserole
fields.description: An easy and economical tuna casserole topped with crunchy chow mein noodles.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1 can (3 ounces) chow mein noodles, divided
instructions: In a skillet, saute the almonds, onion and celery in butter.
Meanwhile, combine cabbage, tuna, soup and half of the chow mein noodles in a bowl.
Stir in almond mixture.
Spoon into an ungreased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining noodles on top.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until bubbly.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted by Alberta McKay from Bartlesville, Oklahoma.  Casseroles like this were popular weeknight meals, especially in the mid-20th century, as they were easy to assemble and could feed a family.

fields.name: Crusty SPAMbake
fields.title: Crusty SPAMbake
fields.description: A quick and easy recipe featuring SPAM coated in a flavorful crust of Kellogg's Corn Flake Crumbs, baked with pineapple slices.
ingredients: ½ cup KELLOGG'S CORN FLAKE CRUMBS or 2 cups KELLOGG'S CORN FLAKES
instructions: If using KELLOGG'S CORN FLAKES, crush into fine crumbs. Combine CORN FLAKE CRUMBS with brown sugar and cloves.

Cut SPAM crosswise into 8 slices. Spread both sides of slices with mustard, then coat generously with the flavor crust of CORN FLAKE CRUMBS mixture. Place SPAM and pineapple slices individually in a foil-lined shallow baking pan; do not overcrowd. Brush pineapple slices with melted butter.
Bake in a preheated moderate oven (350°F) for 20 minutes. Serve on a heated platter, placing a SPAM slice on each pineapple slice. Garnish with parsley, if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the popular use of convenience foods like SPAM and ready-made cereals in mid-20th-century American cuisine.

fields.name: Lasagna Roll-Ups
fields.title: Lasagna Roll-Ups
fields.description: A baked dish of lasagna noodles rolled up with a ricotta and mozzarella cheese filling, covered in spaghetti sauce.
ingredients: 8 ounces cooked lasagna noodles (about half a box)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Pour sauce over the bottom of a medium sized baking dish.
In a bowl, mix the ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and eggs.
Lay a lasagna noodle flat on a surface.
Spread some of the cheese mixture on one side of the noodle, leaving room at the edges.
Roll up the noodle.
Place the noodle, edge down, in the baking dish.
Repeat steps 4-7 for all noodles.
Pour spaghetti sauce over the top of each roll-up.
Bake for about 15 minutes.
Serve hot.

fields.name: Chicken Tuna Casserole
fields.title: Tuna Noodle Casserole
fields.description: A classic comfort food made with tuna, noodles, and a creamy sauce.
instructions: Sauté onion and pepper in butter.
Blend in flour and milk.
Add soup, pimiento, and tuna.
Stir in water chestnuts (if using).
Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Combine cooked spaghetti and sauce.
Pour into a baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30-40 minutes.
fields.comment: Tuna Noodle Casserole is a dish that evokes feelings of nostalgia and comfort.  It became popular in the mid-20th century in part thanks to the convenience of canned ingredients.

fields.name: Beef And Cabbage Taco Casserole
fields.title: Beef and Cabbage Taco Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring a potato crust filled with seasoned ground beef, cabbage, and green chilies, topped with melted cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (4 ounces) green chili peppers, chopped and drained
instructions: Mix together potatoes, cheese, pepper and onion salt.
Press into the bottom and up sides of a greased shallow baking dish.
Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes.
Brown ground beef. Drain well and set aside.
In same skillet, stir-fry cabbage over high heat 2 to 3 minutes.
