Remove from heat and stir in ground beef, green chili peppers, taco sauce, pepper and onion salt. Mix well.
Mound into partially baked potato crust and bake 20 minutes in a 350 degree oven.
Top with remaining cheese and bake until cheese melts.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
notes: Serve with taco sauce.

fields.name: Chili Spaghetti
fields.title: Chili Spaghetti
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish combining ground beef, kidney beans, and spaghetti in a savory tomato-based sauce.
ingredients: 1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a skillet over medium heat, cook beef, onion and garlic until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Transfer to a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish; stir in the remaining ingredients.
Cover and bake at 350° for 65-70 minutes or until spaghetti is just tender.
Let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.

fields.name: Spam Potato Casserole
fields.title: Spam Potato Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring Spam, potatoes, and peas in a creamy mushroom sauce.
ingredients: 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
2 (16 oz.) cans whole potatoes, drained and sliced OR 2 cups sliced boiled potatoes
1 (12 oz.) can Spam luncheon meat, cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, combine soup, water, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and cheese.
Stir in potatoes, peas, and Spam luncheon meat.
Spoon into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes, or until hot.

fields.name: Butternut Squash Bake
fields.title: Butternut Squash Bake
fields.description: A slightly sweet and crunchy-topped butternut squash casserole.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Beat in eggs, milk and vanilla.
Stir in squash (mixture will be thin).
Pour into a greased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 minutes or until almost set.
Combine topping ingredients; sprinkle over casserole.
Return to the oven for 5-10 minutes or until bubbly.
fields.comment: This dish is a popular choice, often requested and enjoyed at potluck dinners, leaving the baker with an empty dish.

fields.name: Sweet Potato - Apple Casserole
fields.title: Sweet Potato Apple Casserole
fields.description: A layered casserole featuring sweet potatoes, apples, and a sweet sauce.
ingredients: 3/4 cup water or 1 cup water and apple juice
instructions: Mix dry ingredients (sugar, cornstarch, salt) and pour boiling water over them.
Let the mixture boil until thick, then add lemon juice.
Create a layer of cooked yams in a buttered casserole dish.
Add a layer of apple slices over the yams.
Pour half of the sauce over the apples.
Repeat layers: yams, apples, and the remaining sauce.
Bake in a covered casserole dish or cover with foil at 300 degrees for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Savory Spaghetti
fields.title: Savory Spaghetti
fields.description: A hearty spaghetti dish with ground beef, pork sausage, and a flavorful tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Brown meat in large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, green pepper, and cook 5 min.
Add tomato sauce and mix lightly.
Stir mixture of tomatoes, water, salt & pepper, worchestershire, tabasco into meat mixture
Add uncooked spaghetti and bring to boil.
Cover tightly, reduce heat to low and simmer about 40 min., stirring occasionally.
When bringing to a gathering or potluck, simmer it 15 min. longer after transporting.

fields.name: Red Beans And Rice
fields.title: Red Beans & Rice
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish of red beans, ham, sausage, and rice.
ingredients: 1 pound dry red beans or dry red kidney beans
1 pound meaty ham bone or pork hocks
1 pound smoked sausage cut into bite size pieces
instructions: Rinse the beans. In a large Dutch oven cover beans with the 6 cups cold water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover; let stand 1 hour. (Or, soak beans in water overnight in covered pan.)
Drain and rinse the beans.

In the same Dutch oven combine the rinsed beans, 6 cups hot water, the ham bone, onion, garlic, bay leaf, and red pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 2 hours or till the beans are tender, adding more water, if necessary, and stirring occasionally.
Remove ham bone or hocks; cut meat from bone and add to bean mixture.
Add sausage. Boil gently, uncovered, 15 to 20 minutes more or till a thick gravy forms, stirring occasionally.
Serve over rice. Sprinkle with green onions.
fields.comment: Red beans and rice is a staple of Louisiana Creole cuisine, with origins tracing back to African and French culinary traditions. The dish gained popularity in the early 20th century and remains a beloved comfort food today, often served on Mondays in New Orleans.

fields.name: Scallop Potatoes With Ham
fields.title: Scalloped Potatoes with Ham
fields.description: A creamy, comforting dish of thinly sliced potatoes, ham, and a flavorful sauce, baked to perfection.
instructions: In a saucepan, melt 4 tablespoons butter.
Stir in flour, parsley, salt, thyme and pepper until smooth.
Gradually add milk; bring to a boil.
Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Combine potatoes, ham and onion; place half in a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Top with half of the sauce; repeat layers.
Cover and bake at 375° for 65-75 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake, uncovered, 15-20 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender.
fields.comment: This recipe, submitted by Wendy Rhoades of Yacolt, Washington to Taste of Home magazine in 1999, showcases a classic comfort food.  Scalloped potatoes have long been a staple, with variations appearing in cookbooks since the 1800s.  Adding ham elevates the dish, making it a hearty and satisfying meal.

fields.name: Macaroni, Zucchini Casserole
fields.title: Macaroni Zucchini Casserole
fields.description: A cheesy and comforting casserole dish featuring macaroni, zucchini, and a creamy white sauce.
instructions: Cook macaroni until tender. Drain.
Make a white sauce by melting 2 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk and cook until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir the cheddar and swiss cheese into the white sauce over low heat until melted.
Spread half of the macaroni in the bottom of a 3-quart casserole dish. Top with half of the zucchini and half of the cheese sauce.
Repeat the layers with the remaining macaroni, zucchini, and cheese sauce.
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter and mix with the bread crumbs. Sprinkle over the casserole.
Sprinkle with nutmeg, if desired.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this one were especially popular in the mid-20th century as a way to utilize leftover ingredients and create a hearty, budget-friendly meal.

fields.name: Beef And Bacon Casserole
fields.title: Beef + Bacon Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole featuring beef, bacon, mushrooms, and a creamy mushroom soup base.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms or 1 tall can of mushroom pieces and stems
2 cans condensed cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Cook bacon until crisp in a large skillet. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of bacon fat, reserving the rest for later use. Set aside the cooked bacon.
Sauté minced onions in the bacon fat until golden. Place in a bowl.
Add hamburger, cracker meal, eggs, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the onions. Mix well.
Form the mixture into balls the size of table tennis balls. Brown them well using reserved bacon fat.
In the same skillet, sauté mushrooms until golden, adding more bacon fat if necessary.
Stir in the cream of mushroom soup and consomme. Mix well.
Pour the soup mixture over the meatballs in a 3-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.
Bake covered at 350°F for 45 minutes. Cool before freezing.

fields.name: Quick Taco Rice
fields.title: Hot Jaco Rice
fields.description: A flavorful ground beef and rice dish topped with your favorite garnishes.
instructions: Brown beef and onion in a skillet.
Add salsa, tomato sauce, and bouillon cube.
Bring to a boil.
Simmer 5 min, covered.
Prepare rice as directed.
Serve beef mixture over rice.
Top with garnishes.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to be a quick and easy weeknight meal.  It's adaptable to different spice preferences by using mild, medium, or hot salsa.  The variety of toppings allows for customization and adds textural interest.

fields.name: Busy Day Casserole
fields.title: Busy Day Casserole
fields.description: A layered casserole with potatoes, carrots, ground beef, rice, and tomato soup.
instructions: Layer sliced potatoes, sliced carrots, ground beef, thinly sliced onions, and uncooked rice.
Repeat layers of vegetables and ground beef.
Pour 1 can of tomato soup and 1 can of water over the casserole.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake slowly in the oven at 250° for at least 2 hours.

fields.name: Beef And Bacon Casserole (2)
fields.title: Beef Bacon Casserole
fields.description: A savory casserole featuring ground beef, bacon, mushrooms, and a creamy mushroom soup base.
ingredients: Sliced mushrooms or 1 can of pieces and stems
instructions: In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside, reserving 1 tablespoon of bacon fat.
Finely mince onions and sauté in the reserved bacon fat until golden. Place in a bowl with the ground beef.
Season with salt and pepper, mix well, and form into a loaf.
In the same skillet, brown beef loaf in remaining bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
Sauté sliced mushrooms in the skillet until golden, adding more bacon fat if necessary.
Stir in mushroom soup and consommé until well combined.
Pour soup mixture over beef loaf in a 3-quart casserole dish.
Crumble reserved bacon and sprinkle over the top.
Bake covered at 350° for 45 minutes.
Cool before freezing.

fields.name: Quick Taco Bake
fields.title: Quick Taco Bake
fields.description: A quick and easy taco bake made with ground beef, taco seasoning, corn, and cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Brown ground beef and onion, then drain.
Spoon into a 9x13 inch ungreased pan.
Stir in taco seasoning and tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with cheese.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk and eggs.
Pour over the meat mixture.
Bake for 35 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve with sour cream, chopped tomatoes, and shredded lettuce.

fields.name: Microwave Tuna Casserole
fields.title: Microwave Tuna Casserole
fields.description: A quick and easy tuna casserole recipe with a fresh twist of zucchini and tomato, perfect for busy weeknights.
ingredients: 2 cans (6 ounces each) tuna, drained and flaked
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, salt, dried thyme, and dill weed; mix well.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked egg noodles, drained and flaked tuna, chopped celery, and sliced green onions.
Stir in the sour cream mixture from the first step.
Spoon half of the tuna noodle mixture into a greased 2-quart microwave-safe dish.
Top with half of the sliced zucchini.
Repeat layers with the remaining tuna noodle mixture and zucchini.
Microwave, uncovered, on high for 6-8 minutes or until heated through.
Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese and chopped tomato.
Microwave, uncovered, for 2 minutes longer.
Let stand for 3 minutes before serving.
notes: Light or fat-free mayonnaise may not be substituted for regular mayonnaise.
This recipe was tested in an 850-watt microwave.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the trend of convenient cooking in the late 1990s with the use of microwave ovens and pre-cooked ingredients like canned tuna and egg noodles, catering to busy families.

fields.name: Orange Rice Medley
fields.title: Orange Rice Medley
fields.description: A vibrant and slightly sweet side dish featuring rice, colorful peppers, and mandarin oranges.
ingredients: 1 can (11 ounces) mandarin oranges, drained and coarsely chopped
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, saute onion and peppers in oil until tender.
Add rice; stir until lightly browned.
Add broth, orange juice, salt and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Stir in the oranges.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured on page 13 of a publication and submitted by Zita Wilensky from North Miami, Florida. She notes that her family enjoys it as a side dish.

fields.name: Sauerkraut Casserole
fields.title: Sauerkraut Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring sauerkraut, sausage, apples, and a blend of spices.
ingredients: 1 pound mild Italian sausage links, cut into 1-inch slices
instructions: In a skillet, cook sausage and onion until sausage is brown and onion is tender; drain.
Stir in apples, sauerkraut, water, brown sugar and caraway seed.
Transfer to a 2-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Garnish with parsley if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Rosemary Pryor of Pasadena, Maryland and was featured on page 46 of a publication. It highlights a traditional way of preparing sauerkraut using homegrown ingredients, a testament to resourceful and flavorful country cooking.

fields.name: Upside Down Pizza
fields.title: Upside-Down Pizza
fields.description: A savory dish where the pizza toppings are baked beneath a layer of egg and cheese batter.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons plus 1 cup all-purpose flour, divided
instructions: In a saucepan, cook the sausage, onion and green pepper over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in 2 tablespoons flour, basil and fennel; mix well.
Add tomato sauce.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Transfer to an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Place the remaining flour in a mixing bowl.
Beat in the eggs, milk, oil and salt until smooth; stir in Parmesan cheese if desired.
Pour over casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 425 for 25-30 minutes or until browned.
fields.comment: This recipe is attributed to Debra Derstine from Mapleton, Pennsylvania. It offers a unique twist on traditional pizza by inverting the layers and eliminating the need for a traditional pizza crust. The method of cooking the toppings first and then covering them with a batter creates a comforting casserole-like dish.

fields.name: Sausage Bean Burritos
fields.title: Sausage Bean Burritos
fields.description: A frugal and creative way to use bulk sausage in a flavorful weeknight dinner.
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese, divided
instructions: In a large saucepan, cook sausage, green pepper and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in beans, rice and 1 cup salsa; mix well.
Spread about 1/2 cup sausage mixture down the center of each tortilla; sprinkle with 1 tablespoon cheese.
Roll up and place, seam side down, in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Top with remaining salsa. Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Uncover; sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5-10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in a recipe contest, submitted by Eleanor Chlan from Ellicott City, Maryland. It highlights the resourcefulness of home cooks and their ability to create delicious meals using simple, affordable ingredients. Sausage and bean burritos represent a popular trend in combining economical protein sources with flavorful fillings.

fields.name: Apple Sausage Bake
fields.title: Apple Sausage Bake
fields.description: A savory bake with pork sausage, apples, onions, and crushed saltines.
ingredients: 1 cup finely chopped peeled tart apple
instructions: In a large bowl, beat eggs; add milk, saltines, apple and onion.
Add the sausage and mix well.
Lightly press into a greased 6-cup ring mold or other mold.
Invert onto a lightly greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan; remove mold.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour or until a meat thermometer reads 170°; drain.
fields.comment: Recipe by Lynn McAllister from Mt. Ulla, North Carolina. She enjoys cooking, and this is one of her favorite dishes. It's usually the talk of the party.

fields.name: Zucchini Lasagna
fields.title: Zucchini Lasagna
fields.description: A delicious lasagna recipe featuring zucchini, ground beef, and a blend of cheeses.
instructions: In a large skillet, brown beef and onion over medium heat; drain fat.
Add tomato sauce and seasonings. Bring to a boil; simmer 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, slice zucchini crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a small bowl, combine cottage cheese and egg.
In a greased 12-in. x 8-in. x 2-in. baking pan, place half the zucchini and sprinkle with half the flour.
Top with cottage cheese mixture and half the meat mixture.
Repeat layer of zucchini and flour.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and remaining meat mixture.
Bake at 375° for about 40 minutes or until heated through.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with additional cheese, if desired.
To cut more easily, let stand 10 minutes before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe was created by Charlotte McDaniel from Williamsville, Illinois as a way to use up an abundance of zucchini from her garden.

fields.name: Texas Style Spanish Rice
fields.title: TEXAS-STYLE SPANISH RICE
fields.description: A flavorful rice dish with tomatoes, green chilies, and spices.
instructions: In a skillet, saute onion and green pepper in oil for about 2 minutes.
Add rice and stir until coated with oil.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, cumin, salt, garlic powder and water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, about 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Add cilantro if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe, adapted by Melissa Pride from Plano, Texas, is a personalized take on a dish shared by a Mexican friend. It gained considerable popularity in the early nineties enough to be featured in Country Woman Magazine around 1993.

fields.name: Pecan Crescent Cookies
fields.title: Pecan Crescent Cookies
fields.description: Rich, buttery, and irresistible pecan cookies.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter, sugar and vanilla.
Gradually add flour.
Stir in pecans.
Shape rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into 2-1/2-in. logs and shape into crescents.
Place 1 in. apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 325° for 20-22 minutes or until set and bottoms are lightly browned.
Let stand for 2-3 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool.
Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.
fields.comment: These old-fashioned cookies were a specialty of Grace Yaskovic's mother from Branchville, New Jersey, making any meal memorable. Featured in Taste of Home June/July 2000.

fields.name: Peanut Butter Rolled Oats Clusters
fields.title: Peanut Butter Rolled Oats Clusters
fields.description: A simple no-bake recipe for peanut butter and oat clusters.
ingredients: 3 cups rolled oats, uncooked (quick or regular)
instructions: Combine sugar, milk, butter or margarine, and salt in a saucepan.
Stir and bring to a full boil. Boil for 1 minute.
Remove from heat. Add vanilla and peanut butter, and stir until smooth.
Add rolled oats and mix well.
Cool slightly until the mixture holds its shape.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Cool completely.
fields.comment: These no-bake clusters are a classic treat, combining the satisfying flavors of peanut butter and oats. They offer a good source of fiber and protein, making them a popular snack or quick breakfast option. Variations include adding chocolate chips, dried fruit, or nuts for extra flavor and texture.

fields.name: Hershey Brownies
fields.title: Hershey Brownies
fields.description: Classic fudgy brownies made with Hershey's syrup.
instructions: Cream together 1 cup sugar, 1 sq. margarine, and 4 eggs.
Add 1 cup Hershey's syrup.
Add 1 cup flour (optional) and 1 cup nuts.
Pour into large pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or less in a 350° oven.
For the frosting: Boil 1/4 cup sugar, 1/3 cup margarine, and 1/3 cup milk or cream for 1 minute.
Add 1/2 cup of chocolate chips. Stir until spreading consistency.

fields.name: Brown Sugar Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.title: Brown Sugar Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description: Chewy brown sugar chocolate chip cookies with a touch of cinnamon.
instructions: Combine milk and vinegar let sit while mixing other ingredients.
Beat eggs then brown sugar, shortening, vanilla, and salt until light and fluffy.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour and baking powder. Gradually add to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.
In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon.
Roll rounded teaspoons of cookie dough in the cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Place cookies on a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 375° for 10 minutes.
fields.comment: This recipe card gives a charming glimpse into home baking in the 1980s, with its simple layout and classic cookie combination.

fields.name: Fortune Cookies
fields.title: Fortune Cookies
fields.description: A classic dessert with a customizable message inside.
instructions: Heat oven to 300°.
Generously grease a cookie sheet.
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Add almond extract, egg whites, and vegetable oil.
Beat until smooth.
Bake only 1 cookie at a time. Cool cookie sheet after each baking and grease generously each time.
For each cookie, spoon 1 heaping tsp. of batter onto the cookie sheet.
Spread into a 3 1/2-inch circle with the back of a spoon.
Bake about 10 minutes until golden.
Working quickly, remove one cookie at a time with a wide spatula.
Flip into protected hand, leaving remaining cookies in the oven.
Place paper fortune on center of cookie and fold in half.
Holding points of folded cookie in both hands, place center of fold over a bowl and pull downward to make a crease across the center.
Place cookie in ungreased muffin tin cup to hold shape while cooling.
fields.comment: Fortune cookies, despite being associated with Chinese cuisine, are not traditionally Chinese. Their exact origin is debated, but they likely originated in 19th or 20th century Japan and were later popularized in Chinese-American restaurants.

fields.name: Molasses Crinkles Cookies
fields.title: Molasses Crinkles Cookies
fields.description: Chewy molasses cookies rolled in sugar and baked until crinkled.
instructions: Mix ingredients in the order given.
Roll dough into small balls.
Roll balls in granulated white sugar.
Press down lightly with fingers.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or 7-8 minutes for a softer cookie.

fields.name: Jam Cookies
fields.title: Jam Cookies
fields.description: Chewy and sweet jam cookies made with simple ingredients.
instructions: Cream together shortening and jam.
Add egg and vanilla.
Sift together flour, soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.
Mix until just combined.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350° for 10-12 minutes.
fields.comment: Jam cookies offer a delightful combination of textures and flavors. The soft, chewy cookie base complements the sweet and fruity jam filling, creating a satisfying treat. These cookies have been enjoyed for generations, often appearing at bake sales, holiday gatherings, and as a simple everyday dessert.

fields.name: Chocolate Cookies
fields.title: Chocolate Cookies
fields.description: Chewy chocolate cookies topped with marshmallows and a rich chocolate frosting.
instructions: Sift dry ingredients (flour, cocoa, sugar, soda, salt).
Blend sugar, shortening, and egg.
Combine dry ingredients with milk and vanilla.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet, two inches apart.
Bake at 350°F for 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and top each cookie with 3 or 4 small marshmallows.
Return to oven for 2 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Make the frosting: Combine powdered sugar, salt, cream or milk, cocoa, melted butter, and vanilla.
Frost the cooled cookies.
fields.comment: Adding marshmallows to the top of chocolate cookies creates a gooey, textured topping.  The combination of chocolate and marshmallow is a classic flavor pairing.

fields.name: Peanut Butter Crinkles
fields.title: Peanut Butter Crinkles
fields.description: Peanut butter cookies with a crinkled surface, made with peanut butter, butter, sugars, egg, flour, and leavening agents.
ingredients: ½ cup brown sugar, firmly packed
instructions: 1. Cream peanut butter and butter until soft.
2. Add sugars gradually, continuing to cream until light and fluffy.
3. Add egg and beat well.
4. Sift flour, salt, and soda together; add to the mixture in portions, beating well after each addition.
5. Drop from teaspoon, 2 inches apart, onto ungreased cooky sheet.
6. Press down each cooky with a fork; press a second time so that ridges are at right angles.
7. Bake for 8-10 minutes in a moderate oven at 350° F.
fields.comment: Crinkle cookies, characterized by their cracked surface, became popular in the United States in the early 20th century.  The peanut butter variety adds a nutty and savory element to this classic cookie type.

fields.name: Cranberry Oatmeal Cookies
fields.title: Cranberry Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: Dotted with cranberries, orange peel and vanilla chips, these colorful cookies are a festive addition to any dessert tray.
ingredients: 1 cup coarsely chopped fresh or frozen cranberries
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda; add to the creamed mixture.
Stir in oats, raisins, cranberries and orange peel.
Stir in vanilla chips.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 in. apart onto greased baking sheets.
Bake at 375° for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.
fields.comment: These cookies were featured in Taste of Home magazine in the October/November 1999 issue, submitted by Pat Habiger from Spearville, Kansas.

fields.name: Crispy Butter Cookies
fields.title: Crispy Butter Cookies
fields.description: Crisp and light butter cookies, perfect with milk or coffee.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar.
Beat in egg whites and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and baking soda; gradually add to the creamed mixture
Roll into 1-1/2-in. balls, then roll in sugar.
Place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets.
Flatten with a fork.
Bake at 350° for 12-14 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
Remove to wire racks to cool.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Betty Ferrell of Jasper, Georgia.

fields.name: Butterscotch Cashew Bars
fields.title: Butterscotch Cashew Bars
fields.description: Chewy, nutty, and oh-so-addictive, these Butterscotch Cashew Bars are a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.
ingredients: 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened
3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons light corn syrup
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar.
Combine flour and salt; add to creamed mixture just until combined.
Press into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Meanwhile, combine butterscotch chips, corn syrup, butter and water in a saucepan.
Cook and stir over medium heat until chips and butter are melted.
Spread over crust.
Sprinkle with cashews; press down lightly.
Bake for 11-13 minutes or until topping is bubbly and lightly browned.
Cool on a wire rack.
Cut into bars.
fields.comment: These bars were so popular they won Runner-Up in the Taste of Home June/July 2001 contest!

fields.name: Banana Oatmeal Cookies
fields.title: Banana Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: A classic cookie recipe featuring the combination of banana, oats, and chocolate chips.
instructions: In a large bowl, cream sugar, shortening, eggs and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, cloves and cinnamon; add to creamed mixture.
Stir in bananas, oats and chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375° for 10-12 minutes.
Immediately remove cookies to wire racks to cool.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Yvonne Miller of Chenango Forks, New York, passed down from her mother. They often baked these cookies together during Yvonne's childhood.

fields.name: Chocolate Oat Squares
fields.title: Chocolate Oat Squares
fields.description: Chock-full of chocolate and walnuts, these squares will satisfy any sweet tooth.
ingredients: 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened, divided
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream 1 cup butter and brown sugar.
Beat in eggs and 2 teaspoons vanilla.
Combine the oats, flour, 1 teaspoon salt and baking soda; stir into creamed mixture.
Press two-thirds of oat mixture into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
In a saucepan, combine milk, chocolate chips and remaining butter and salt.
Cook and stir over low heat until chocolate is melted.
Remove from the heat; stir in walnuts and remaining vanilla.
Spread over the crust.
Sprinkle with remaining oat mixture.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool.
Cut into squares.
fields.comment: Featured in Taste of Home October/November 2000, this recipe by Jennifer Eilts from Central City, Nebraska, is so popular she often makes a second batch just for her family.

fields.name: Cream Cheese Finger Cookies
fields.title: Cream Cheese Finger Cookies
fields.description: These melt-in-your-mouth cookies are a rich treat with cream cheese, butter, and pecans, perfect with coffee or milk.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and cream cheese.
Beat in vanilla.
Combine the flour, sugar and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture.
Stir in pecans (dough will be crumbly).
Shape tablespoonfuls into 2-in. logs.
Place 2 in. apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 375° for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned.
Roll warm cookies in confectioners' sugar; cool on wire racks.
fields.comment: Featured in Taste of Home October/November 2001, submitted by Jeanne Voss from Anaheim Hills, California.

fields.name: Frosted Banana Bars
fields.title: Frosted Banana Bars
fields.description: Moist banana bars with creamy frosting, perfect for sharing at potlucks.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, sour cream and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda and salt; gradually add to the creamed mixture.
Stir in bananas.
Spread into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool.
For frosting, in a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, butter and vanilla.
Gradually beat in enough confectioners' sugar to achieve desired consistency.
Frost bars.
Store in the refrigerator.
fields.comment: Featured in Taste of Home June/July 2000, submitted by Debbie Knight from Marion, Iowa.

fields.name: Sugar Cookies
fields.title: Sugar Cookies
fields.description: Classic sugar cookies rolled into balls, dipped in sugar, and baked until lightly browned.
instructions: Cream sugar and margarine.
Add vanilla and eggs.
Add oil and the dry ingredients.
Chill dough overnight (or until a soft dough at first).
Roll into balls about the size of a walnut.
Butter the bottom of a glass and then dip in sugar.
Press down the balls on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 350 degree oven for 12 minutes, or until lightly browned on edge.
notes: Cookies may burn easily so keep an eye on them while baking.
fields.comment: Sugar cookies have been a beloved treat for centuries, enjoyed at celebrations and holidays around the world.

fields.name: Leadership
fields.title: Leadership
fields.description: A recipe for effective leadership.
instructions: Sift together with about De
mix well; dish out responsibly
Blend praise with reproof
Serve those you lead.

fields.name: Danish Tea Drops
fields.title: Danish Tea Drops
fields.description: Chocolate chip cookies with a hint of orange.
instructions: Combine shortening, flour, baking powder, and salt.
Beat eggs, orange rind, and orange juice together.
Blend the wet and dry ingredients.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes.
fields.comment: These cookies, also known as "Klejnerkager," are a traditional Danish treat often enjoyed during the Christmas season with coffee or tea.

fields.name: Apple Sauce Cookies
fields.title: Apple Sauce Cookies
fields.description: A simple cookie recipe featuring apple sauce and chocolate chips.
instructions: Combine apple sauce and soda. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs, dry ingredients, chocolate chips and nuts.
Bake at 400 F. for 12 to 15 min.

fields.name: Lemon Squares (#3)
fields.title: Lemon Squares
fields.description: Tangy lemon squares with a buttery crust and a sweet, powdered sugar topping.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Cream together butter and 1 cup granulated sugar.
Mix in 2 cups flour and 1/2 tsp baking powder.
Press into an 8" square pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
While the crust bakes, prepare the filling: combine 1 cup sugar, 1 beaten egg, and 2 tbsp lemon juice.
Pour the filling over the crust.
Reduce oven temperature to 300° and bake for 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar after cooling slightly.
fields.comment: Lemon squares are a classic American dessert, often served at potlucks and picnics. Their popularity can be attributed to their simplicity and refreshing taste.

fields.name: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
fields.title: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: A classic recipe for chewy chocolate chip oatmeal cookies.
instructions: Cream together margarine, sugar, and brown sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in oatmeal and chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.
fields.comment: Chocolate chip cookies first appeared in 1938.  Ruth Graves Wakefield added chopped up chunks of a Nestle semi-sweet chocolate bar to her cookie recipe and the rest is history!

fields.name: Pumpkin Oatmeal Cookies
fields.title: Pumpkin Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: Soft and chewy pumpkin oatmeal cookies spiced with cinnamon.
instructions: Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the shortening, sugar, and eggs until fluffy.
Stir in half of the flour mixture.
Add the evaporated milk and pumpkin.
Blend in the remainder of the flour mixture and rolled oats. Batter will be thick.
Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.
notes: Raisins and nuts may be added if desired.

fields.name: Banana Peanut Buffer Cookies
fields.title: Banana Peanut Butter Cookies
fields.description: Soft and chewy cookies with a sweet banana and peanut butter filling.
ingredients: 1/2 cup light brown sugar, firmly packed
instructions: In a small mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light.
Beat in egg and vanilla.
Blend in peanut butter.
In another small bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring well.
Slice bananas into 3/4-inch pieces.
Using 1 tablespoon of peanut butter dough, cover each banana slice by pressing dough around the banana with your fingers.
Place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 375-degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes, or until browned.
Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes.
Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.
notes: Because of the banana slices inside the cookies, they are best when eaten within a day or two. Otherwise, they should be frozen.
fields.comment: This recipe combines the classic flavors of peanut butter and banana in a delightful cookie. The combination of the soft cookie and the sweet banana creates a unique texture and flavor experience. This is a recipe that would appeal to those who enjoy both these popular flavors.

fields.name: Peppermint Cookies
fields.title: Peppermint Cookies
fields.description: Chewy or crisp peppermint cookies made with crushed peppermint candies.
ingredients: 1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
3/4 Butter Flavor CRISCO* Stick or 3/4 cup Butter Flavor CRISCO Shortening
2/3 cup crushed peppermint candy canes or peppermint candies
instructions: Heat oven to 375°F.
Combine brown sugar, CRISCO Shortening, milk and vanilla in large bowl. Beat at medium speed of electric mixer until well blended.
Beat egg into creamed mixture.
Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Mix into creamed mixture at low speed just until blended. Stir in crushed candy.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes for chewy cookies or 11 to 13 minutes for crisp cookies. Do not overbake.
Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet. Remove cookies to rack to cool completely.
notes: For crushed candy, place candy in a plastic food storage bag. Secure the top and run a rolling pin over the bag of candy to break into very small pieces.

fields.name: Joan's Lemonade Cookies
fields.title: Joan's Lemonade Cookies
fields.description: Tangy and sweet cookies with a refreshing lemon flavor.
ingredients: 1 can (6 ounces) frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed
instructions: Cream butter and sugar, beat in eggs.
Mix flour, salt, and soda, then add alternately with ½ cup concentrate.
Add grated rind.
Drop from teaspoon 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375 degrees 8 to 10 minutes, or until lightly browned around edges.
Brush hot cookies lightly with remaining concentrate, then sprinkle with sugar.

fields.name: Sugar Cookies (2)
fields.title: Sugar Cookies
fields.description: Classic sugar cookies, perfect for any occasion.
instructions: 1. Cream butter and sugar.
2. Add eggs, milk and vanilla.
3. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together. Add to creamed mixture. Combine thoroughly.
4. With hands shape dough into a ball.
5. Wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2-3 hours or overnight.
6. Grease cookie sheets lightly.
7. On lightly floured board or counter, roll 1/2 to 1/3 of dough at a time, keeping rest in fridge.
8. For soft cookies, roll 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.
9. Cut with floured cookie cutter. Place 1/2 inch apart on cookie sheet.
10. Bake at 400°F for 8 minutes or until a VERY light brown.

fields.name: Raisin Filled Refrigerator Cookies (With Notes)
fields.title: Raisin Filled Refrigerator Cookies
fields.description: These raisin-filled refrigerator cookies are made with a simple dough and a sweet raisin filling, perfect for making ahead and baking fresh.
instructions: Filling: Combine the raisins, 1 tablespoon flour, 3/4 cup sugar, and 1 cup water in a small saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring until thick.
Remove from heat, add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 to 1 cup chopped nuts.
Chill.
Cookie Dough: Cream together 2 cups shortening, 2 cups white sugar, and 1 cup packed brown sugar.
Beat in 4 eggs, 2 tablespoons milk, and 2 teaspoons vanilla.
Add 6 cups flour, 2 teaspoons baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt (sifted).
Blend thoroughly and store in the refrigerator until thoroughly chilled. (Can be frozen)
To bake, slice cookie dough into thin slices and place on greased cookie sheets.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon filling and cover with another slice. Do not pinch together.
Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.
notes: Can be made a month in advance.
Roll dough into 2-inch thick and 9-inch long rolls. Wrap in wax paper and freeze. Slice when ready to bake.
fields.comment: Refrigerator cookies gained popularity in the 1930s due to their convenience and make-ahead nature.  The dough can be stored in the refrigerator or freezer, allowing for fresh cookies on demand.

fields.name: Brownie In A Mug
fields.title: Brownie in a Mug
fields.description: A quick and easy single-serving brownie made in the microwave.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp canola oil or vegetable oil
1 small scoop of ice cream or 1 or 2 teaspoons heavy whipping cream
instructions: Place flour, sugar, cocoa, salt, and cinnamon in a microwave safe ceramic mug. Stir with a fork or spoon to mix well and break up any clumps.
Add the oil, water, and vanilla to the cup and stir until the mixture is smooth and there are no lumps.

Place in microwave and heat on high until the mixture is cooked through, about 1 minute and 40 seconds for a 1000 watt microwave. You may have to experiment and adjust the time for less or more powerful microwaves. If you don't know the power level on your microwave, start with 60 seconds and increase until the brownie is done. It should still be moist when cooked through, not dry.
Let cool for a minute and serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a teaspoon or two of whipping cream poured over.
notes: Some mugs don't microwave well because there is metal in their ceramic glaze. They'll work but they may get very hot. Best to use a plain old everyday un-fancy mug.

fields.name: Raisin Filled Refrigerator Cookies
fields.title: Raisin Filled Refrigerator Cookies
fields.description: These raisin-filled refrigerator cookies are a delightful treat, featuring a buttery cookie dough and a sweet, spiced raisin filling.
instructions: Prepare the Filling: Combine raisins, 1 tablespoon flour, 3/4 cup sugar, and 1 cup water in a small saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring until thickened.
Remove from heat and add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 to 1 cup chopped nuts. Chill.
Prepare the Cookie Dough: Cream together shortening, white sugar, and brown sugar.
Beat in eggs, milk, and 2 teaspoons vanilla.
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to the wet ingredients and blend thoroughly.
Refrigerate (or freeze) the dough until thoroughly chilled.
Assemble and Bake: Slice chilled dough thinly and place on greased cookie sheets.
Top each slice with 1/2 teaspoon of raisin filling and cover with another slice. Do not pinch edges.
Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.
fields.comment: Refrigerator cookies gained popularity in the early 20th century because of their make-ahead nature. The dough can be stored in the refrigerator or freezer, allowing for fresh cookies to be baked whenever desired.  Variations on the fillings are common, with options like dates, jams, or other dried fruits.

fields.name: Oatmeal Fudge Bars
fields.title: Oatmeal Fudge Bars
fields.description: Chewy oatmeal bars with a rich fudge layer.
instructions: Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan, set aside.
In large mixer bowl, cream margarine and brown sugar, add eggs and vanilla.
In small bowl, sift flour, baking soda, and salt; add to creamed mixture. Mix in oats.
In heavy saucepan, mix sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, and margarine, heat just till melted.
Stir in vanilla and nuts.
Spread two-thirds of dough into prepared baking pan.
Spread with chocolate mixture.
Drop remaining one-third of dough on top by spoonfuls.
Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
Cool, then cut into bars.

fields.name: Picnic Brownies
fields.title: Picnic Brownies
fields.description: Rich and decadent chocolate brownies perfect for picnics.
ingredients: ¾ cup walnuts, pecans, or almonds, chopped
instructions: Grease two 9-inch round pans.
In top of double boiler or microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate and butter.
In medium bowl, mix sugar, vanilla, and salt; add to melted chocolate mixture and blend well.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add flour and mix well.
Divide batter equally into prepared pans.
Spread evenly and sprinkle top of each with chopped nuts and chocolate chips.
Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. (Do not overbake.)
Allow to cool completely before cutting.
Run a thin knife between pan and brownies and turn upside down.
You may need to shake hard to release brownies from pan.
With knife that is longer than brownies are wide, cut brownies by pressing knife straight down through brownies; cut into 8 pie-shaped pieces.
notes: These brownies are named Picnic Brownies because they stack and travel very well.
fields.comment: Brownies became popular in the United States and Canada during the first half of the 20th century.  Many variations on the basic recipe exists, with differing amounts of chocolate, inclusion of nuts, frosting, and other ingredients.  Today, they are a ubiquitous treat for bake sales, potlucks, holidays, and other gatherings.

fields.name: Walnut Fruit Squares
fields.title: Walnut Fruit Squares
fields.description: A layered dessert with a walnut crust, creamy fruit filling, and a chilling time for optimal flavor.
ingredients: 1 can (8 oz.) DEL MONTE Crushed Pineapple In Its Own Juice
1 can (17 oz) DEL MONTE Fruit Cocktail, drained
instructions: Combine flour and sugar; cut in butter.
Stir in nuts.
Press into bottom of lightly greased 13x9-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Cool.
Drain pineapple reserving 1 tablespoon juice.
Combine reserved juice, cream cheese and powdered sugar; beat until fluffy.
Fold in fruits.
Spread over crust.
Chill overnight.
notes: Dessert holds well several days.

fields.name: Pudding Sugar Cookies
fields.title: Pudding Sugar Cookies
fields.description: Soft and chewy sugar cookies with a hint of pudding flavor.
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 ounces) instant lemon pudding mix or instant pudding mix of your choice
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter, oil and sugars.
Beat in eggs, vanilla and dry pudding mix.
Combine the flour, cream of tartar and baking soda; gradually add to creamed mixture.
Drop by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Flatten with a glass dipped in sugar.
Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove to wire racks.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Sharon Reed of Catlin, Illinois, who notes that substituting other pudding flavors makes for a fun twist.

fields.name: Zucchini Granola Cookies
fields.title: Zucchini Granola Cookies
fields.description: Wholesome, soft-textured cookies perfect for using up garden zucchini.
ingredients: 1 package (10 to 12 ounces) semisweet chocolate or butterscotch chips
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and brown sugar.
Beat in the egg, orange peel and vanilla.
Combine flour, granola, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with zucchini.
Stir in chips.
Drop by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto greased baking sheets.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Janice Brady of Des Moines, Washington, as a way to use abundant garden zucchini.

fields.name: Butterscotch Pecan Cookies
fields.title: Butterscotch Pecan Cookies
fields.description: Crumbly cookies with butterscotch and pecan flavors.
ingredients: 1 package (18-1/4 ounces) butter recipe cake mix (Pillsbury brand)
1 package (3.4 ounces) instant butterscotch pudding mix
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, flour, oil, and egg; mix well.
Stir in pecans (the dough will be crumbly).
Roll tablespoonfuls of dough into balls.
Place balls 2 inches apart on greased baking sheets.
Bake at 350° for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool for 2 minutes on baking sheets before removing to wire racks.

fields.name: Marshmallow Treats & Galaxies
fields.title: Marshmallow Treats and Galaxies
fields.description: Two tasty confections made with Rice Krispies and Kellogg's Stars.

instructions.step: Melt butter in 3-quart saucepan. Add marshmallows and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until marshmallows are melted and mixture is syrupy. Remove from heat.
Add Rice Krispies and stir until well coated.
Press warm mixture evenly and firmly into buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Cut into squares when cool.

Combine sugar, corn syrup and butter in medium-sized saucepan. Cook over moderate heat, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture begins to bubble. Do not overcook. Remove from heat. Stir in Kellogg's Stars and peanuts.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper for buttered baking sheets. Let stand in cool place to harden.

notes: About 2 cups marshmallow creme may be substituted for marshmallows. Add to melted butter, and cook over low heat about 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Proceed as directed in Step No. 2 above.

fields.name: Rosy Raisin-Nut Cookies
fields.title: Rosy Raisin-Nut Cookies
fields.description: Chewy raisin-nut cookies with a tangy orange glaze.
ingredients: 1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
instructions: Cream butter or margarine until consistency of mayonnaise.
Beat in sugars gradually.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Add vanilla.
Mix and sift flour, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with catchup.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop batter by rounded measuring teaspoonfuls on greased baking sheet, spacing two inches apart.
Bake at 300-325°F for 12-15 minutes or until edges are golden and cookies spring back when touched with a finger.
Remove to racks.
Spread with Orange Glaze while hot.
Orange Glaze:
Combine confectioners sugar and orange juice and beat until smooth. If not thin enough for transparent glaze, add a little more orange juice.
fields.comment: The combination of tomato ketchup and orange glaze in these cookies creates a unique flavor profile that balances sweetness with a subtle tang.

fields.name: Sugar Diamonds
fields.title: Sugar Diamonds
fields.description: Easy-to-make diamond-shaped cookies with a pecan topping.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add egg yolk and vanilla; mix well.
Combine flour, cinnamon and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture.
Spoon into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Cover dough with plastic wrap and press evenly into pan; remove wrap.
In another mixing bowl, beat egg white until foamy; brush over dough.
Sprinkle with pecans.
Bake at 300° for 30 minutes.
Cut into 1-1/2-in. diamond shapes while warm.
fields.comment: These cookies offer a delightful balance of ease and visual appeal, perfect for those who prefer simpler decorating techniques. The recipe contributor, Gladys De Boer, highlights this aspect, emphasizing the treat's deliciousness without the fuss.

fields.name: Chocolate Sugar Puff Cookies
fields.title: Chocolate Sugar Puff Cookies
fields.description: Soft and fluffy chocolate cookies rolled in powdered sugar.
instructions: Mix margarine, sugar, and eggs until very fluffy and beat.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Chill well about 2 hrs.
Roll in small balls in powdered sugar.
Bake on greased baking sheet at 350 degrees for 12 minutes.
notes: The original recipe does not specify the amount of powdered sugar. Use as needed to coat the cookie dough balls.

fields.name: Snickerdoodles
fields.title: Snickerdoodles
fields.description: Classic cinnamon-sugar cookies.
instructions: Blend shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Sift dry ingredients together.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Mix cinnamon and sugar for rolling.
Roll dough balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 400° oven for 8-10 minutes.
fields.comment: Snickerdoodles are a type of drop cookie traditionally made with cream of tartar, which gives them a distinctive tangy flavor and chewy texture. They are often rolled in cinnamon sugar before baking. The origin of the name "Snickerdoodle" is uncertain, but some speculate it comes from a German or Dutch word.

fields.name: Cherry Crunch Cookies
fields.title: Cherry Crunch Cookies
fields.description: Cherry crunch cookies are a delightful treat with a soft, chewy center and a satisfyingly crunchy exterior.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add milk and vanilla; mix well.
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda; add to creamed mixture.
Stir in the pecans, dates and chopped cherries.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls; roll in cornflakes.
Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets; press a cherry half into center of each.
Bake at 350° for 14-15 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove to wire racks to cool.

fields.name: Carrot Cookies
fields.title: Carrot Cookies
fields.description: A simple recipe for soft and chewy carrot cookies.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs; mix well.
Stir in carrots.
Combine the flour, baking powder and salt; gradually add to carrot mixture.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 in. apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 400° for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove to wire racks to cool.
fields.comment: Carrot cookies, a delicious treat enjoyed throughout the year, showcase the versatility of carrots in baking. They offer a delightful balance of sweetness and subtle spice, perfect for any occasion. Several variations exist, some incorporating nuts, raisins, or cream cheese frosting for added flavor and texture, reflecting the adaptability of this classic recipe across different culinary traditions.

fields.name: Chocolate Walnut Squares
fields.title: Chocolate Walnut Squares
fields.description: Chocolate Walnut Squares are a decadent dessert with a rich, chocolatey layer topped with a creamy frosting.
ingredients: 2 squares (1 ounce each) unsweetened chocolate, melted
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Add flour and salt; mix well.
Fold in walnuts.
Spread half of the batter into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Add chocolate to the remaining batter; mix well.
Carefully spread over batter in pan.
Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes or until cake tests done.
Cool completely.
For frosting, mix flour and milk in a saucepan.
Cook and stir over medium heat until a thick paste forms, about 10 minutes.
Cool completely.
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar.
Add vanilla and mix well.
Gradually add the milk mixture; beat for 5 minutes.
Frost cake.
Store in the refrigerator.
notes: The amount of vanilla is correct.

fields.name: Peaches 'N' Cream Bars
fields.title: Peaches 'n' Cream Bars
fields.description: A delicious dessert bar with a crescent roll crust, cream cheese filling, peach pie filling, and a crumbly almond topping.
instructions: Unroll crescent dough into one long rectangle. Press onto the bottom and slightly up the sides of a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan; seal perforations. Bake at 375° for 5 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.
In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar and extract until smooth. Spread over the crust.
Spoon pie filling over cream cheese layer.
In a bowl, combine flour and brown sugar. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in nuts; sprinkle over peach filling.
Bake at 375° for 25-28 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool for 1 hour on a wire rack. Store in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Lemon Bars (#2)
fields.title: Lemon Bars
fields.description: Sweet and tart lemon bars with a buttery crust and a dusting of powdered sugar.
instructions: Combine crust ingredients (flour, softened butter, and confectioners' sugar) and pat into an 8-inch square baking pan.
Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes.
While the crust is baking, prepare the topping: combine sugar, eggs, flour, lemon juice, lemon extract, baking powder, and salt in a mixing bowl.
Mix topping ingredients until frothy.
Pour topping over the baked crust.
Bake at 375°F for 18-22 minutes, or until light golden brown.
Dust with confectioners' sugar.

fields.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description: A classic recipe for delicious chocolate chip cookies.
instructions: Cream sugars and butter, add eggs, beat well.
Add salt, baking powder, soda, vanilla and cinnamon - mix well.
Mix flour and oatmeal.
Mix in by hand the chocolate and nuts into the dough.
Mold the dough into golf ball sized rounds and put onto cookie sheet 2" apart.
Press down to slightly flatten.
Bake at 400° for six minutes.
Do not overbake. Let cool before removing from the cookie sheet, they are crumbly when warm.

fields.name: Chocolate Sugar Puff Cookies (Handwritten)
fields.title: Chocolate Puff Cookies
fields.description: Soft and fluffy chocolate cookies rolled in powdered sugar.
instructions: Melt margarine.
Beat until very fluffy.
Add sugar and beat well.
Add eggs one at a time and child well.
Mix in chocolate.
Add flour, baking powder, and salt.
Roll into balls.
Coat in powdered sugar.
Place on a greased baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees.

fields.name: Fruit Drops
fields.title: Fruit Drops
fields.description: A festive drop cookie packed with pecans, cherries, and dates.
instructions: Mix well shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Stir in buttermilk.
Add flour, soda, and salt.
Stir in pecans, cherries, and dates.
Chill at least 1 hour before baking.
notes: Candied pineapple can be substituted for cherries.
fields.comment: Drop cookies are a classic holiday treat often made with dried fruits and nuts.  Their simple preparation and customizable nature make them a popular choice for cookie exchanges and festive gatherings.

fields.name: Brownies
fields.title: Brownies
fields.description: Classic chocolate brownies with walnuts.
instructions: Melt shortening and chocolate in saucepan on low heat. Cool.
Place cooled chocolate mixture, eggs, sugar, and vanilla in mixing bowl. Beat vigorously until well mixed and smooth.
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Add with nuts to chocolate mixture. Beat until thoroughly blended.
Pour into greased 12x8x2 inch pan. Bake in oven at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.
fields.comment: Brownies are a classic American dessert, with the first known published recipe appearing in the late 19th century.  They've evolved from their fudgy beginnings to include variations like cakey brownies, blondies, and those with various mix-ins.

fields.name: Butter Scotch Squares
fields.title: Butter Scotch Squares
fields.description: Chewy and delicious butter scotch squares made with brown sugar, coconut, and walnuts.
instructions: Cook butter and sugar over low heat until bubbly.
Cool the butter and sugar mixture.
Add eggs one at a time, beat well after each egg.
Add vanilla.
Sift in dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder) and cocoanut.
Mix well.
Spread on greased pan 12x8x2.
Bake at 350F for 25-30 minutes.
Cool and cut into squares.
fields.comment: Butter scotch squares, also known as scotcheroos, are a popular treat in the United States, especially during the fall and winter holidays.  They are often made for potlucks and cookie exchanges.

fields.name: Choco-Marshmallow Cookies
fields.title: Choco-Marshmallow Cookies
fields.description: Chocolate cookies topped with marshmallows, cocoa frosting, and pecans.
instructions: Sift together flour, salt, baking soda, and cocoa.
Cream shortening and sugar; add egg, vanilla, and milk, beating well.
Add dry ingredients and mix.
Drop by teaspoons onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 8 minutes.
Remove from oven and press half a marshmallow, cut side down, on top of each cookie.
Bake 2 minutes longer.
Cool.
Top with Cocoa Frosting, then with a pecan half.
For the Cocoa Frosting: Combine confectioners' sugar, cocoa, salt, butter, and light cream. Spread on cooled cookies.
fields.comment: Marshmallow cookies were popularized by recipes using Campfire® marshmallows which first started appearing in magazines in the 1920's.

fields.name: Zesty Italian Dressing
fields.title: Good Seasons Zesty Italian Salad Dressing
fields.description: A classic Italian dressing mix made with oil and vinegar.
ingredients: 1 envelope Good Seasons Zesty Italian Salad Dressing Mix
instructions: Pour vinegar to -V- line (1/4 cup) in a Good Seasons cruet or jar.
Add water to -W- line (2 tablespoons).
Add contents of envelope.
Shake well.
Add salad oil to -O- line (2/3 cup).
Shake again.
notes: Can be used as a brush-on baste for chicken, hamburgers, steak, or pork chops. For baste: combine 1 envelope salad dressing mix, 2 tablespoons oil, and 2 tablespoons water. Enough for 2 1/2 lbs of chicken.
fields.comment: Good Seasons salad dressing mixes were introduced in the 1950s and quickly became a pantry staple in many American households.  The convenience of the mix and the ability to customize the flavor by using different oils and vinegars made it a popular choice.

fields.name: Mustard Ham Sauce
fields.title: Mustard Ham Sauce
fields.description: A sweet and tangy mustard-based sauce, perfect for glazing ham.
ingredients: Salt and onion salt to taste
instructions: Beat eggs and add all ingredients except whipped cream.
Cook on low heat till thickened.
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Add softened gelatin to the egg mixture and cool.
Whip the cream and fold into the mustard mixture.

fields.name: Dressing
fields.title: Carrot Bread Dressing
fields.description: A savory bread dressing featuring carrots, herbs, and poultry seasoning.
instructions: Place in buttered pan.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

fields.name: Fruit Dip
fields.title: Fruit Dip
fields.description: A simple fruit dip made with lemon yogurt and whipped topping.
instructions: Combine the lemon yogurt and Cool Whip in a bowl.
Mix until smooth and well combined.
Serve with your favorite fruits.
fields.comment: This type of fruit dip is very popular for parties, picnics, and potlucks because of its refreshing flavor and how easy it is to make. The combination of creamy and tangy yogurt with the light and airy texture of whipped topping makes it enjoyable for people of all ages.  Sometimes cream cheese is added to make the dip thicker and creamier.

fields.name: Munching Onion Spread
fields.title: Munching Onion Spread
fields.description: A creamy spread made with cream cheese, Miracle Whip, green onions, and Worcestershire sauce, perfect for crackers.
ingredients: 1/2 Cup MIRACLE WHIP Salad Dressing or MIRACLE WHIP Light Reduced Calorie Salad Dressing
18-oz. package PHILADELPHIA BRAND Cream Cheese, softened
instructions: Combine salad dressing and cream cheese, mixing until well blended.
Add remaining ingredients, mix well.
Chill.
Serve with crackers.

fields.name: Shrimp Dip
fields.title: Shrimp Dip
fields.description: A creamy, chilled dip made with shrimp, cream cheese, and mayonnaise.
instructions: Soften the cream cheese.
Add mayonnaise.
Add cream.
Add chopped green onions or grated yellow onion to taste.
Add a dash of garlic salt.
Add shrimp.
Chill.

fields.name: Cherry Chiffon Dessert
fields.title: Wilderness Cherry Chiffon Dessert
fields.description: A creamy, no-bake dessert made with cherry pie filling, condensed milk, whipped topping, pineapple, and marshmallows.
ingredients: 1 can (21 oz) Wilderness Cherry or Light Cherry Pie Filling
1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk or 1 cup (8 oz. carton) non-fat plain yogurt
1 container (8 oz) frozen whipped topping, thawed
1 can (15 oz) crushed or chunk pineapple, drained
instructions: Combine ingredients in large bowl, folding together until blended.
Spoon into decorative serving bowl.
Chill.
notes: Try this recipe with Wilderness Peach or Strawberry, too.
For a lighter dessert: Use light whipped topping. Use pineapple packed in juice.
fields.comment: Pot-luck suppers gained popularity in the mid-20th century as a way for communities and families to share meals and reduce the burden on a single host.

fields.name: Warm Cherry Puff
fields.title: Wilderness Warm Cherry Puff
fields.description: A warm, baked dessert featuring cherry pie filling over a fluffy, almond-flavored base.
ingredients: 1 can (21 oz) Wilderness® Cherry or Light Cherry Pie Filling
instructions: Heat oven to 400°.
Blend milk, eggs, biscuit mix, sugar, extract and margarine in blender for 15 seconds, or beat on high speed of mixer for 1 minute.
Pour into greased 10-inch pie pan or 11x7-inch baking pan.
Spoon cherry filling over the top.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes, until golden brown.
High Altitude: Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.
notes: Try this recipe with Wilderness Peach or Apple, too.
For a lighter dessert: Use skim milk.
For a lighter dessert: Use light margarine.

fields.name: Midway Mud Pie
fields.title: Midway Mud Pie
fields.description: A decadent chocolate dessert made with brownie base, ice cream, fudge topping, and nuts.
instructions: Prepare brownies according to package directions; bake in 9-inch pie pans and cool.
Soften ice cream; spread over brownies and freeze.
When firm, spoon heated fudge sauce over ice cream.
Sprinkle with nuts and return to freezer for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Easy Cheesecakes
fields.title: Easy Cheesecakes
fields.description: A simple cheesecake recipe using vanilla wafers, cream cheese, and a few other ingredients.
ingredients: 3 (8 oz) packages of softened Cream Cheese
instructions: Line muffin cups with foil baking cups and paper liners.
Combine all ingredients and blend at medium speed.
Spoon batter into muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
Bake at 325°F for 20 to 25 minutes, or until set.
Cheesecakes can be frozen for up to one month. Before serving, allow to thaw to room temperature.

fields.name: Lemon Pie
fields.title: Lemon Pie
fields.description: A simple lemon pie made with lemonade, sweetened condensed milk, and whipped topping.
ingredients: 1 (13.3 oz) container of whipped topping (such as Cool Whip)
1 small can of lemonade concentrate (no water added)
instructions: Combine the lemonade concentrate and sweetened condensed milk in a bowl. Stir until well combined.
Gently fold in the whipped topping until smooth.
Pour the mixture into the pie crust.
Refrigerate for 2-3 hours before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe is a modern variation of lemon icebox pie, a popular dessert in the mid-20th century known for its ease of preparation and no-bake nature.  It leverages convenience ingredients for a quick and refreshing treat.

fields.name: Icebox Dessert
fields.title: Icchol Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert featuring vanilla wafers, nuts, and ice cream.
instructions: Melt margarine.
Mix egg yolks and powdered sugar.
Fold in egg whites.
Layer crushed vanilla wafers and chopped nuts in a dish.
Pour mixture over the wafers and nuts.
Top with ice cream.

fields.name: Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding
fields.title: Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding
fields.description: A comforting dessert, this Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding is a classic way to end any meal.

meta.Calories: 177 per 1/2 cup serving (with skim milk and no salt)

instructions: In a saucepan, combine milk, rice, sugar and salt (if using); bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Pour into a greased 1-1/2-quart baking dish.
Cover and bake at 325°F for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
Add raisins and vanilla; cover and bake for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with cinnamon (if using).
Serve warm or chilled. Store in the refrigerator.
notes: This recipe uses less sugar, salt, and fat.
Recipe includes Diabetic Exchanges.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured on page 15 of the source material and submitted by Sandra Melnychenko from Grandview, Manitoba.  She mentions enjoying this pudding since childhood, while her husband likes to add a scoop of ice cream on top.

fields.name: Lemon Sauce
fields.title: Lemon Sauce
fields.description: A tangy and rich lemon sauce thickened with cornstarch.
ingredients: Juice and grated rind of one lemon
instructions: Mix cornstarch and sugar.
Add 1 cup boiling water slowly to the cornstarch-sugar mixture, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Boil for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and add butter, lemon rind, and lemon juice.
fields.comment: Lemon sauces have been used in various cuisines for centuries. In French cuisine, they often accompany seafood or desserts. In some cultures, lemon is believed to symbolize freshness and purity. This tangy sauce is great on crepes, waffles, or cheesecakes.

fields.name: Butterscotch Pecan Dessert
fields.title: Butterscotch Pecan Dessert
fields.description: A light and creamy dessert with a fluffy cream cheese layer topped with cool butterscotch pudding and pecans.
ingredients: 1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed, divided
2 packages (3.4 or 3.5 ounces each) instant butterscotch or vanilla pudding mix
instructions: In a bowl, cut the butter into the flour until crumbly; stir in 1/2 cup pecans.
Press into an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until fluffy.
Fold in 1 cup whipped topping; spread over crust.
Combine milk and pudding mix until smooth; pour over cream cheese layer.
Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes or until set.
Top with remaining whipped topping and pecans.
Refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in a publication, likely a magazine or cookbook, on page 11. It was submitted by Becky Harrison from Albion, Illinois, who notes that it's a popular dessert that disappears quickly when served.

fields.name: Cherry Nut Putting
fields.title: Cherry Nut Pudding
fields.description: A baked pudding with sweet cherries, nuts, and a brown sugar topping.
instructions: Mix dry ingredients (sugar, flour, baking soda, salt).
Add the egg, cherries, cherry juice, nuts, and melted butter to the dry ingredients.
Beat well.
Pour batter into a loaf pan.
Bake for 40 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
While the pudding bakes, prepare the topping: combine brown sugar, flour, butter, salt, and water in a saucepan.
Cook until partly thick.
Pour the topping over the baked pudding.
Return to the oven for 10 more minutes.
Serve warm or cold with whipped cream.
fields.comment: Cherry nut puddings have been enjoyed for generations and offer a delightful blend of flavors and textures, from the sweet cherries and crunchy nuts to the comforting warmth of the baked pudding and rich topping. This dessert is versatile and can be enjoyed throughout the year, either warm in the cooler months or chilled during the warmer seasons.

fields.name: Frozen Hawaiian Pie
fields.title: Frozen Hawaiian Pie
fields.description: A cool and refreshing no-bake pie with pineapple, maraschino cherries, and walnuts in a fluffy filling.
ingredients: 1 carton (12 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: In a bowl, combine milk and whipped topping.
Gently fold in pineapple, nuts, cherries, and lemon juice.
Pour into the crusts.
Freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Remove from the freezer 20 minutes before serving.
Garnish with mint, nuts, and cherries.
fields.comment: This pie is a great make-ahead dessert, perfect for summer gatherings, as it can be frozen ahead of time and garnished before serving.

fields.name: Baked Apple Pudding
fields.title: Baked Apple Pudding
fields.description: A simple yet delicious baked pudding featuring grated apples, spices, and nuts.

meta.Servings: Double the recipe for a larger batch

instructions: Cream together sugar, shortening, and egg.
Add the grated apples to the creamed mixture.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.
Fold in the chopped nuts and raisins.
Pour batter into a greased 8x8 inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 35-40 minutes.

fields.name: Applenut Pudding
fields.title: Apple Nut Pudding
fields.description: A comforting baked pudding with apples, nuts, and warm spices.
instructions: Beat eggs until fluffy, add sugar gradually.
Stir in mixture of dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt).
Add almond flavoring, apples, and nuts.
Bake at 325°F (163°C) for 45-50 minutes.
fields.comment: This recipe appears to be a classic apple nut pudding, a dessert that has likely been enjoyed in various forms for generations.  Variations might include using different nuts like walnuts or pecans, adding raisins, or incorporating a streusel topping.  The use of almond flavoring suggests a historical preference for enhancing flavors that weren't always readily available in fresh form.

fields.name: Frosty Chocolate Mousse
fields.title: Frosty Chocolate Mousse
fields.description: A smooth and silky chocolate mousse that is quick to make and a perfect ending to any meal.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients.
Beat until mixture mounds softly.
Spoon into dessert dishes.
Freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Myra Innes of Auburn, Kansas. It highlights the simplicity and elegance of a classic chocolate mousse, emphasizing its smooth, silky texture and versatility as a dessert.

fields.name: Piecrust
fields.title: Two-Crust Pie Dough
fields.description: A recipe for a simple, flaky two-crust pie dough.
instructions: Mix flour, shortening, sugar, and salt together until mixture resembles cornmeal.
Add egg and vinegar.
Add all the cold water at once to the dry mixture.
fields.comment: Pie crusts are a staple in many cuisines around the world, providing a vessel for both sweet and savory fillings.  Different cultures have unique approaches, from the flaky lard crusts common in America to the buttery, almost cookie-like crusts found in some European traditions.

fields.name: Pecan Pumpkin Dessert
fields.title: Pecan Pumpkin Dessert
fields.description: A layered pumpkin dessert with a pecan topping and cream cheese frosting.
ingredients: 1 carton (12 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: Line a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan with waxed paper and coat the paper with nonstick cooking spray; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, milk and sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle with dry cake mix and drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with pecans.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown.
Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
Invert onto a large serving platter; carefully remove waxed paper.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Fold in whipped topping.
Frost dessert.
Store in the refrigerator.
fields.comment: This dessert is a popular Thanksgiving dish, often shared and passed down through generations.

fields.name: Peppermint Fluff
fields.title: Peppermint Fluff
fields.description: A layered dessert with a peppermint-flavored whipped cream base.
instructions: Crush the chocolate wafers.
Put 3/4 C of crushed chocolate wafers on the bottom of a 13"x9" pan.
Crush peppermint candy.
Whip the cream, add the red food coloring.
Fold the candy, nuts, and marshmallows into the cream.
Spread the mixture over the chocolate wafer crumbs in the pan.
Sprinkle remaining crumbs on top.
Chill.

fields.name: Apple Crisp
fields.title: Apple Crisp
fields.description: A classic Midwest apple crisp recipe.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
Cut in butter until crumbly.
Press half of the crumb mixture into a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish or a 9-in. square baking pan.
Cover with apples.
In a saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, water, and vanilla.
Cook and stir until thick and clear.
Pour over apples.
Sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake at 350° for about 1 hour or until the apples are tender.
Serve warm, with ice cream if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Gertrude Bartnick of Portage, Wisconsin, published in a Country Fair magazine in March 1993.  She highlights the abundance of apples in her region and the simplicity of this recipe as a great way to use them.

fields.name: Raspberry Cheesecake
fields.title: Grandma's No-Bake Cheesecake
fields.description: A simple no-bake cheesecake recipe with cream cheese, whipped topping, and a graham cracker crust.
ingredients: Raspberry or blueberry topping (or choice of topping)
instructions: Blend the softened cream cheese and sugar together until smooth.
Fold in the whipped topping.
Fill the graham cracker crusts, leaving some space at the top for the filling to settle.
Chill for at least 2 hours.
Top with your choice of topping before serving.
fields.comment: This type of no-bake cheesecake was very popular in the mid-20th century, often featuring variations with different toppings or mix-ins like fruit or chocolate.

fields.name: Peach Cobbler
fields.title: Peach Cobbler
fields.description: A quick and easy cobbler made with canned peaches, a cake-like topping, and a warm butterscotch sauce.
instructions: Drain peaches, reserving 1/2 cup syrup for the sauce.
In a large bowl, combine peaches, brown sugar, tapioca, cinnamon (if desired), lemon juice, and vanilla.
Transfer to an ungreased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Let stand for 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt; cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in eggs.
Drop by spoonfuls onto peach mixture; spread evenly.
Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until filling is bubbly and a toothpick inserted in topping comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes.
In a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, flour, salt, butter, and reserved peach syrup.
Bring to a boil over medium heat; cook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened.
Remove from the heat; add lemon juice.
Serve with cobbler and ice cream if desired.
fields.comment: This Peach Cobbler recipe was a runner-up in a recipe contest in November 2005, submitted by Ellen Merick from North Pole, Alaska.  The use of canned peaches makes it a convenient dessert.

fields.name: Hot Fudge Sauce
fields.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
fields.description: A rich and decadent chocolate sauce perfect for ice cream, cakes, or brownies.
instructions: Mix together sugar, butter, and evaporated milk in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips and vanilla extract until smooth.

fields.name: Ice Cream Sundae Dessert
fields.title: Ice Cream Sundae Dessert
fields.description: A cool and smooth ice cream dessert with a ribbon of fudge.
ingredients: 2 quarts vanilla ice cream or flavor of your choice, softened
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, melt chocolate chips with milk and salt; cook and stir until thickened, about 25 minutes.
Remove from the heat; set aside.
Combine wafer crumbs and butter; set aside 1 cup.
Press remaining crumbs into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. pan.
Chill for 10-15 minutes.
Pour chocolate over crumbs.
Cover and freeze for 20-25 minutes or until firm.
Spread the ice cream over chocolate.
Sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Freeze at least 2 hours before serving.
fields.comment: Featured on page 15 of a publication. Contributed by Anne Heinonen from Howell, Michigan, who recalls this dessert fondly from childhood.

fields.name: Dorothy's Jello Dessert
fields.title: Dorothy's Jello Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with a graham cracker crust, a pineapple and nut filling, and a red jello topping.
ingredients: ¼ pound of butter or margarine
instructions: Cream sugar and butter.
Add egg yolks.
Add pineapple and nuts.
Whip egg whites and fold in.
Put graham crackers on bottom of cake pan.
Pour filling on top of crackers.
Prepare two packages of red jello and let set until sort of firm.
Pour over filling to finish setting.
Make 24 hours before use.
fields.comment: This type of layered dessert, often called "refrigerator desserts" became popular in the mid-20th century with the rise of convenience foods like jello and pre-made graham crackers.

fields.name: Apple Pancake
fields.title: Apple Pancake
fields.description: A delicious baked pancake with softened apples, cinnamon, and a hint of sweetness.
ingredients: 3 cups dried apple slices (can use 2 fresh apples)
¼ cup water (omit this item if using fresh apples)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Spray 9x13 pan generously with non-stick cooking spray.
Melt butter in medium sauce pan.
Add apples, cinnamon, sugar, and water (if using dried apples).
