Cook over medium heat until apples soften, approx. 5 minutes. Set aside.
In a bowl, beat eggs with a whisk.
Add milk, and beat until blended.
Add flour and whisk until smooth.
Pour batter into 9x13 pan.
Arrange apples evenly over batter making sure melted butter is evenly distributed and mixed in.
Bake 20-30 minutes until puffy and golden brown.
Immediately upon removing from oven loosen bottom of pancake with spatula.
notes: It sticks like crazy (referring to the bottom of the pancake).

fields.name: Date Dessert
fields.title: Date Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert featuring dates, pecans, ice cream, and vanilla wafers.
instructions: Boil dates in a small amount of water until it forms a pasty substance.
Add pecans and stir, then let cool.
Crush vanilla wafers and line the bottom of a dish.
Add half of the ice cream to the bottom of the dish.
Spread the date mixture over the ice cream and cover with crushed vanilla wafers.
Add the remaining ice cream and let it set overnight.

fields.name: Chocolate Eclair Pie
fields.title: Chocolate Éclair Pie
fields.description: A layered dessert made with graham crackers, vanilla pudding, whipped topping, and a chocolate frosting.
ingredients: 2 pkgs. (3 oz. each) instant French vanilla pudding
instructions: Butter bottom and sides of an oblong pan and line with whole graham crackers.
Mix pudding with milk.
Blend in whipped topping.
Layer pudding and crackers, ending with crackers.
Mix all frosting ingredients together until smooth.
Carefully spread frosting over graham crackers.
Chill 24 hours.
notes: Nestle has a pre-melted chocolate call Nestle CHOCO BAKE

fields.name: Peaches And Cream Cheesecake
fields.title: Grandma's Cream Cheesecake
fields.description: A creamy cheesecake baked with a layer of peaches.
instructions: Mix all ingredients (except peaches) in a large bowl and beat for 2 minutes.
Pour batter into a greased pie plate.
Place drained canned peaches over the batter.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.

fields.name: Fruit Pie
fields.title: Mandarin Orange Tropical Fruit Salad Pie
fields.description: A refreshing no-bake pie with layers of mandarin oranges, bananas, tropical fruit salad, and a creamy coconut filling.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) DOLE Mandarin Oranges, drained
1 tub (8 oz) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed
2/3 cup BAKER'S ANGEL FLAKE Coconut, toasted
1 can (15.25 oz) DOLE Tropical Fruit Salad, drained
instructions: Drain oranges, reserving 2 tablespoons of syrup.
Place half of the drained oranges in the bottom of the graham cracker crust.
Top with half of the banana slices.
Beat cream cheese, reserved orange syrup, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Gently stir in the whipped topping.
Stir in 1/3 cup of the toasted coconut.
Spread the cream cheese mixture over the fruit in the crust.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Arrange the tropical fruit salad, remaining banana slices, and remaining mandarin oranges over the filling.
Drizzle melted apricot jam over the fruit.
Sprinkle the remaining coconut over the pie.
fields.comment: This recipe combines the classic flavors of mandarin oranges and coconut with a tropical twist.  No-bake pies like this one gained popularity in the mid-20th century with the rise of convenience foods and refrigeration.

fields.name: Cherry Roly-Poly
fields.title: Cherry Roly Poly
fields.description: A classic dessert featuring sweet cherries wrapped in a flaky biscuit dough.
instructions: Drain cherries, reserving some juice.
Sift together flour, baking powder & salt.
Cut in lard (or shortening) until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Add 1/4 cup sugar and mix.
Add milk to make a soft dough.
Turn onto lightly floured surface and knead gently for 30 seconds.
Roll into 11x14 inch rectangle.
Place drained cherries on biscuit dough.
Roll as for jelly roll and cut into 1 1/2" thick slices.
Place cut surface down in greased 1 inch square pan.
Mix 1 cup liquid (reserved cherry juice + water), cornstarch, and 1/2 cup sugar. Cook until thick.
Pour sauce over rolls.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes.
fields.comment: Cherry Roly Poly, a traditional British pudding, has variations across cultures. In the U.S., it is sometimes called a cherry dumpling. Its popularity has endured for centuries, likely due to its simple ingredients and satisfying flavor profile.

fields.name: Minty Grasshopper Pie
fields.title: Minty Grasshopper Pie
fields.description: A no-bake pie with a creamy mint filling and a chocolate cookie crust.
ingredients: 1 (14-oz.) can Eagle® Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk (NOT evaporated milk)
16 Keebler Grasshopper Fudge Mint Cookies, coarsely crushed
1 (8-oz.) container frozen nondairy whipped topping, thawed
1 (6-oz.) Keebler® Ready Crust® Chocolate Pie Crust
instructions: With mixer, beat cheese until fluffy, gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk until smooth.
Stir in food coloring, then crushed cookies.
Fold in whipped topping.
Pour into crust. Chill at least 3 hours.
Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers.
notes: Top with chocolate shavings, additional cookie pieces or mint leaves.
fields.comment: Grasshopper pie is an American dessert pie that gets its name from its bright green color and minty flavor, reminiscent of a grasshopper cocktail. It's a popular choice for St. Patrick's Day celebrations and summer gatherings.

fields.name: Snowballs
fields.title: Pineapple-Walnut Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with vanilla wafers, a pineapple-walnut mixture, whipped cream, and coconut.
instructions: Cream together sugar and butter. Add beaten egg yolk and mix well.
Combine crushed pineapple, chopped walnuts and the creamed mixture.
Beat egg white with a pinch of salt until stiff peaks form.
Fold the beaten egg white into the pineapple-walnut mixture.
For each serving, spread the mixture on 4 vanilla wafers.
Cover the outside of each wafer with whipped cream and sprinkle with coconut.

fields.name: Apple Brown Betty
fields.title: Apple Brown Betty
fields.description: A warm dessert made with toasted white bread, sliced apples, and a sweet cinnamon-sugar topping, baked and served with cream.
instructions: Tear toast into bite-size pieces; place in a greased 1-1/2-qt casserole.
Top with apples.
Combine sugars and cinnamon; sprinkle over apples.
Drizzle with butter.
Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour, stirring after 30 minutes.
Serve warm with cream.

fields.name: Orange Delight
fields.title: Grange Delight
fields.description: A layered dessert featuring custard, whipped cream, and angel food cake.
instructions: Boil egg yolks, sugar and milk to custard (till it coats spoon).
Add while still hot - 1 phy orange jello, 2 tbsp lemon juice.
Let jell.
When partially set (partially) add 2 beaten egg whites to jello.
Fold all together.
Cut or break angel food cake into bite size.
Pour jello mixture over the angel food cake.
Cover with 1 cup coconut and 1/2 cup nuts.

fields.name: Peach And Apple Crisp
fields.title: Peach and Apple Crisp
fields.description: A warm and comforting dessert with a crispy, nutty topping and sweet, bubbly fruit filling.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz. each) sliced peaches in extra light syrup, drained
3 cups baking apples, peeled, cored and diced
instructions: Heat oven to 400°F.
Coat a 9-inch square baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large bowl, mix peaches and apples.
Mix sugar and cornstarch; toss with fruit.
Spread mixture in baking dish.
Mix together cookie crumbs, walnuts and margarine; sprinkle over fruit mixture.
Bake for 35 minutes, or until topping is brown and fruit is bubbly.
notes: Salt and pepper were listed in the ingredients, but not used in the instructions.
fields.comment: Fruit crisps are a popular dessert in the United States, especially during the fall apple and peach seasons.  They are known for their simple preparation and comforting flavors.

fields.name: Fruit Cobbler
fields.title: Fruit Cobbler
fields.description: A classic fruit cobbler recipe baked with a sweet biscuit topping.
instructions: Combine fruit, sugar, and water in a saucepan.
Bring mixture to a boil.
Dissolve cornstarch in a little cold water and stir into the fruit mixture until thickened.
Set fruit mixture aside.
In a separate bowl, mix Bisquick, milk, and 1 tablespoon of sugar.
Pour the fruit mixture into a 9x9x2 inch baking dish.
Place spoonfuls of biscuit dough on top of the fruit.
Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes.
notes: The type and amount of fruit are not specified in the OCR text. Please choose your desired fruit.
HC friet and 9x9x2 PaN appear to be OCR errors.
fields.comment: Fruit cobblers are a beloved dessert with a history dating back to early American settlers. They were a resourceful way to use seasonal fruits and simple ingredients.

fields.name: Strawberry Pie
fields.title: Strawberry Graham Cracker Crust Dessert
fields.description: A Danish-inspired strawberry dessert with a graham cracker crust and creamy topping.
instructions: Dissolve 1/2 cup sugar with 1/2 cup water.
Blend cream cheese with powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Whip whipping cream.
Fold together the cream cheese mixture and whipped cream.
Assemble with strawberries and graham cracker crust.
fields.comment: This no-bake dessert is a simple yet elegant way to use fresh strawberries. It's reminiscent of classic Danish desserts with its combination of creamy filling and fruit topping. The variations of using other berries or substituting the graham cracker crust for other bases, showcases the flexibility of the simple recipe.

fields.name: Peppermint Dessert
fields.title: Peppermint Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with whipped cream, marshmallows, pecans, peppermint candy, and chocolate cookie crumbs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup peppermint candy, crushed (or to taste)
instructions: Whip cream until quite stiff.
Add all ingredients except cookie crumbs.
Spread in 9x13 pan and cover well with chocolate cookie crumbs.
Let set in the refrigerator until well chilled (overnight is best).

fields.name: Frosted Banana Bars (2)
fields.title: Frosted Banana Bars
fields.description: A delicious treat with a moist banana base topped with a creamy frosting.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, sour cream and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda and salt; gradually add to the creamed mixture.
Stir in bananas.
Spread into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool.
For frosting, in a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, butter and vanilla.
Gradually beat in enough confectioners' sugar to achieve desired consistency.
Frost bars.
Store in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Peppermint Dessert (2)
fields.title: Peppermint Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with whipped cream, marshmallows, pecans, peppermint candy, and chocolate cookie crumbs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup crushed peppermint candy (or to taste)
instructions: Whip cream until quite stiff.
Add marshmallows, pecans, and peppermint candy to the whipped cream.
Spread the mixture in a 9x13 inch pan.
Cover the top with chocolate cookie crumbs.
Refrigerate until well chilled (overnight is best).

fields.name: Butterscotch Delight
fields.title: Butterscotch Delight
fields.description: A creamy, layered dessert with a buttery walnut crust, a sweet cream cheese filling, a butterscotch pudding layer, and a whipped topping.
ingredients: 1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed, divided
2 packages (3.5 ounces each) instant butterscotch pudding mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, cut butter into flour; stir in the finely chopped walnuts.
Press into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack.
In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and sugar.
Fold in 1 cup whipped topping.
Spread over crust.
In another bowl, beat milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Spread over cream cheese layer.
Spread with the remaining whipped topping; sprinkle with coarsely chopped walnuts.
Chill until set.
fields.comment: This dessert comes from a reader submission from Barbara Edgemon of Belleview, Florida who describes it as a popular dessert.

fields.name: Strawberry Danish Dessert Cheesecake
fields.title: Danish Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with a buttery crust, a creamy lemon filling, and topped with fresh strawberries.
instructions: Mix butter and flour and press in pan.
Bake at 350° for 10 min.
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar, and lemon juice.
Prepare dream whip according to package directions and add to the cream cheese mixture.
Top with sliced strawberries.
notes: Recipe uses less water than typical Danish Dessert recipes, using only 1/2 cup.
fields.comment: Dream Whip, a non-dairy whipped topping, gained popularity in the mid-20th century as a convenient alternative to whipping cream, often appearing in layered desserts like this one.  The combination of lemon and strawberry is a classic pairing, offering a balance of tartness and sweetness.

fields.name: Pumpkin Bars
fields.title: Pumpkin Bars
fields.description: Soft and spiced pumpkin bars topped with a tangy cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Mix everything together. Put in a greased cookie sheet pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 min.
When cool, frost with the following ingredients mixed together.
3 oz. cr. cheese
1/3 C. butter
1 tsp. vanilla
1 T. milk
2 C. powdered sugar
notes: The frosting recipe can be increased by 1 1/2 times for a thicker layer.

fields.name: Peach Cobbler (2)
fields.title: Peach Cobbler
fields.description: A classic dessert of baked peaches topped with a sweet biscuit crust.

meta.Total Time: 20-25 minutes to thicken peach mixture + ~20-25 minutes baking time

instructions: Combine flour, 1 teaspoon sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in 1/4 cup butter.
Stir in 1/4 cup milk and egg until just moistened.
In a separate pan, combine sliced peaches, cornstarch, 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup milk, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon butter.
Cook until thickened.
Pour peach mixture into baking pan.
Spoon the flour mixture over the peaches.
Bake at 400° for 20-25 minutes.
fields.comment: Peach Cobbler, a dish born from resourceful frontier cooking, has evolved into a beloved comfort food.  Its variations reflect regional and personal preferences, with some recipes incorporating spices like cinnamon or nutmeg, while others highlight the natural sweetness of ripe peaches.

fields.name: Pumpkin Surprise Cake
fields.title: Pumpkin Surprise Cake
fields.description: A layered pumpkin cake with a spiced crumb topping.
ingredients: 1 large can Libby's Pumpkin Pie Mix
instructions: Mix cake mix, 1 egg, and melted margarine together.
Press mixture into a 9 x 13 cake pan.
In a separate bowl, mix pumpkin pie mix, 3 eggs, and milk.
Pour pumpkin mixture over the cake base.
Combine reserved cake mix, sugar, unmelted margarine, and cinnamon.
Crumble the mixture over the pumpkin layer.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

fields.name: Pumpkin Pie Squares
fields.title: Pumpkin Pie Squares
fields.description: A pumpkin pie-like dessert without the fuss of a pastry crust.
instructions: Combine the first four ingredients (flour, oats, brown sugar, and butter) until crumbly.
Press the crumb mixture into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Meanwhile, beat filling ingredients (pumpkin, evaporated milk, eggs, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and salt) in a mixing bowl until smooth.
Pour the filling over the crust.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Combine brown sugar, pecans, and butter for the topping.
Sprinkle the topping over the filling.
Bake 15-20 minutes longer or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool.
Store in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Summer Dessert Pizza
fields.title: Summer Dessert Pizza
fields.description: A refreshing dessert pizza topped with a variety of fresh fruits and a sweet glaze.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar; beat in egg and extracts.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture. Beat well.
Cover and chill for 30 minutes.
Press dough into a greased 12-in. or 14-in. pizza pan.
Bake at 350° for 12-14 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and confectioners' sugar until smooth.
Add whipped topping; mix well.
Spread over crust.
Arrange fruit on top.
Combine glaze ingredients in a saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Boil for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Brush over fruit.
Store in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Popcorn Candy Cake
fields.title: Popcorn Candy Cake
fields.description: A fun, kid-friendly cake made with popcorn, gumdrops, and marshmallows.
instructions: In a large saucepan, melt marshmallows, oil and butter until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine popcorn, gumdrops and peanuts.
Add marshmallow mixture and mix well.
Press into a greased 10-in. tube pan*. Cover and refrigerate for 5 hours or overnight.
Dip pan in hot water for 5-10 seconds to unmold.
Slice cake with an electric or serrated knife.
notes: *Editor's Note: A one-piece tube pan is recommended.
fields.comment: This cake offers a unique twist on traditional cake recipes, adding a playful, kid-friendly element that could make for a fun baking project or party treat.  Popcorn-based treats saw increased popularity in the mid-20th century as creative ways to utilize an accessible ingredient.

fields.name: Lemon Raisin Bars
fields.title: LEMONY RAISIN BARS
fields.description: Chewy and sweet bars with a bright, lemony flavor, studded with raisins and walnuts.
ingredients: 1 (14-oz.) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
In saucepan, combine raisins, sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice and lemon rind.
Cook and stir over medium heat just until bubbly.
Cool slightly.
In bowl, combine butter, brown sugar and vanilla; beat well.
Add flour, baking soda and salt; mix well.
Stir in oats and walnuts.
Reserve 2 cups oat mixture for topping.
Press remaining mixture into 13x9-inch greased pan.
Spread raisin mixture to within 1/2-inch of edges.
Sprinkle with reserved oat mixture; press lightly.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool.

fields.name: Pineapple Icebox Pie
fields.title: Pineapple Ice Box Pie
fields.description: A layered dessert with vanilla wafers, pineapple mixture, and whipped topping.
instructions: In a saucepan, mix sugar, flour and baking soda.
Add pineapple juice.
Cook on low heat until thickened.
Add margarine.
Remove from heat; stir in beaten eggs and lemon juice.
Cool.
Stir in crushed pineapple.
Alternately layer pie pan with vanilla wafers, pineapple mixture, and then whipped topping.
Add layers until all is used.
Refrigerate 3 hours.
fields.comment: This recipe was popular in the 1930s and 1960s.

fields.name: Cream De Minte
fields.title: Creme De Minte
fields.description: A refreshing minty syrup perfect for ice cream.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine pineapple juice, sugar, corn syrup, and water.
Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pineapple becomes clear around the edges and reaches 220°F on a candy thermometer.
Remove from heat and stir in peppermint flavoring and food coloring.
Cool and serve over ice cream.

fields.name: Annette's Cheesecake
fields.title: Annette's Cheesecake
fields.description: A classic cheesecake recipe with a graham cracker crust, creamy pumpkin cheesecake filling, and a sour cream topping.
instructions: CRUST: Mix graham cracker crumbs, 1/4 cup sugar, melted margarine, crushed pecans, and 1/2 tsp cinnamon. Line a 10" springform pan with the mixture and refrigerate for a few hours or overnight.
CHEESECAKE: Mix cream cheese and 1 1/2 cups sugar until blended. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Add vanilla and 1/2 tsp cinnamon, and mix well. Pour into crust and smooth.
Bake at 350 degrees F in a preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
TOPPING: Mix sour cream and 1/4 cup sugar. Spread over the cake.
Return to oven for 10 minutes.
Refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
Top with whipped cream. Serve plain or topped with cherries, strawberries, etc.

fields.name: Pumpkin Ice Cream Pie
fields.title: Pumpkin Ice Cream Pie
fields.description: A no-bake pie featuring a pumpkin-spice base swirled with butter pecan or vanilla ice cream in a graham cracker crust, topped with chopped nuts.
ingredients: 1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1 qt. butter pecan or vanilla ice cream, softened
1/3 cup finely chopped pecans or walnuts
instructions: Combine pumpkin, brown sugar, milk, orange rind, and cinnamon in a medium saucepan.
Heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved.
Add lemon extract and set aside to cool.
Fold the cooled pumpkin mixture into the softened ice cream until marbleized.
Pour the mixture into the graham cracker crust.
Combine chopped nuts and sugar, then sprinkle over the pie.
Freeze overnight.
Let stand at room temperature for a few minutes before cutting.

fields.name: Turtle Pumpkin Pie
fields.title: Turtle Pumpkin Pie
fields.description: A layered pumpkin pie with caramel, pecans, and whipped topping.
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 2 Tbsp. caramel topping, divided
1 KEYN MAID Graham Pie Crust (6 oz.)
1/2 cup plus 2 Tbsp. PLANTERS Pecan Pieces, divided
2 pkg (4 serving size each) JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding & Pie Filling
1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed, divided
instructions: Pour 1/4 cup caramel topping into crust.
Sprinkle with 1/2 cup pecans.
Beat milk, dry pudding mixes, pumpkin, and spices with whisk until blended.
Stir in 1 1/2 cups whipped topping.
Spread into crust.
Top with remaining whipped topping.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Top with remaining pecans and drizzle remaining caramel with a fork.
Store leftovers in refrigerator.

fields.name: Easy Peach Cobbler
fields.title: Easy Peach Cobbler
fields.description: A simple cobbler recipe using fresh peaches, pantry staples, and a buttery cinnamon crumble topping.
instructions: In a 9x13 inch shallow casserole dish, combine peaches, sugar, 1 tbsp baking mix, and cinnamon.
In a medium bowl, mix the remaining 2/3 cup baking mix with brown sugar.
Cut in margarine until moistened.
Stir in milk until just combined.
Drop the topping by spoonfuls onto the peaches.
Bake at 400°F for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the crust comes out clean.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
fields.comment: Peach cobbler, a classic American dessert, has variations across the country. From the buttery, biscuit-like topping common in the North to the more cake-like versions in the South, it's a comforting dish often passed down through generations.

fields.name: Chocolate Cream Dessert
fields.title: Chocolate Cream Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert with a nutty crust, a creamy cheese filling, and a chocolate pudding layer, topped with whipped cream and grated chocolate.
ingredients: 1/2 of a 9 oz. carton Cool Whip
instructions: Crust:
Combine flour, margarine, and chopped nuts.
Press into 9x13 baking dish and bake for 20 minutes at 325°F.
Cool completely.
First layer:
Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar.
Fold in half of the Cool Whip.
Spread over the cooled crust.
Second layer:
Prepare both vanilla and chocolate instant pudding according to package directions, combining them after mixing.
Spread over the cream cheese layer.
Top with the remaining half of Cool Whip.
Garnish with grated chocolate.
Chill and serve.

fields.name: Cookie Mix In A Jar
fields.title: Cookie Mix
fields.description: A simple cookie recipe using a pre-mixed dry base.
instructions: Cream 1/2 cup shortening.
Add 1/4 cup milk and 1/4 tsp. vanilla.
Fully add dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, brown sugar, cinnamon, oatmeal, raisins, and oatmeal).
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls.
Place balls 3 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Flatten each ball with the bottom of a glass dipped in water or sugar.
Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove cookies from the cookie sheet immediately.
fields.comment: Pre-mixed dry ingredients packaged in decorative containers and gifted became a popular, cost-effective trend during the mid-20th century for holidays and housewarmings.

fields.name: Windex
fields.title: Winder
fields.description: A simple cleaning solution recipe.
instructions: Fill bottle
fields.comment: This recipe likely refers to a homemade glass cleaner for windows, commonly used before commercial cleaners became widely available.  The measurements "inch" likely refer to the level in a small bottle or container used for mixing and application.

fields.name: Original Chex Party Mix Microwave Recipe
fields.title: Original Chex Party Mix (Microwave)
fields.description: A quick and easy snack mix made with Chex cereal, nuts, pretzels, and a savory seasoning blend.
ingredients: 6-8 cups Chex cereal (Corn, Rice, and/or Wheat)
1 cup Planters Mixed Nuts or Peanuts
instructions: Combine melted margarine or butter, Worcestershire sauce, and seasoned salt in a bowl; mix well.
Pour cereals, nuts, and pretzels into a large Glad-Lock Zipper Bag.
Pour margarine mixture over the cereal mixture inside the bag. Seal securely.
Shake the bag until all pieces are evenly coated.
Pour contents of bag into a large microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave on HIGH for 5 to 6 minutes, stirring thoroughly every 2 minutes. Scrape sides and bottom of bowl while stirring.
Spread on absorbent paper to cool.
Store in an airtight container.
notes: Cooking time may need adjustment due to differences in microwave ovens. These directions were developed using 625 to 700 watt ovens.
See package for conventional oven directions.
fields.comment: This recipe from Ralston Foods, Inc. 1994, highlights the use of Glad-Lock Zipper bags, emphasizing the portability of Chex Party Mix.

fields.name: Pie Crust Shield
fields.title: Pie Crust Shield
fields.description: Instructions for using a pie crust shield to achieve a beautiful pie crust.
instructions: Spray underside of shield with a non-stick vegetable spray.
Place shield over pie crust before baking.
For a crisper, golden crust, remove the shield for the last 10 minutes of baking in the oven.
Hand wash in warm water with liquid detergent.
Dry thoroughly before storing.
fields.comment: Protecting pie crusts from over-browning has been a challenge for bakers for centuries.  Devices like this shield, dating back to the late 20th century, offer a simple solution compared to traditional methods like crimping foil or using paper plates.

fields.name: Strawberry Salsa
fields.title: Strawberry Salsa
fields.description: A refreshing and vibrant salsa made with fresh strawberries, green pepper, onions, parsley, and a hint of spice.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the strawberries, green pepper, onions and parsley.
Stir in the salad dressing, hot pepper sauce and pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Serve with tortilla chips.

fields.name: Pumpkin Seeds
fields.title: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds
fields.description: A simple recipe for roasting pumpkin seeds.
instructions: Wash and refrigerate for two days.
Roast at 350°F.
notes: Refrigerating the seeds for two days before roasting helps them retain moisture.
fields.comment: Roasting pumpkin seeds is a popular way to reduce food waste during pumpkin season. The seeds are packed with nutrients.

fields.name: Refried Beans
fields.title: Refried Beans
fields.description: A simple and flavorful way to prepare refried beans using dried beans, perfect as a meatless meal.
instructions: Cover beans with ample water and let sit overnight. Drain.
Put in crock pot. Cover with 2 quarts of boiling water. Add ½ onion diced and the garlic buds. Cover and cook all day until tender. (8 to 10 hours)
Drain any excess fluid but leave enough to allow for mashing. Mash with potato masher or mixer until smooth.
Heat oil in large frying pan. Fry the remaining diced, ½ onion until tender. Add beans and heat through.
notes: Serve with tortilla shells, salsa, lettuce, and tomatoes.
fields.comment: Refried beans are a staple in Mexican cuisine, offering a versatile and budget-friendly source of protein and fiber. This recipe highlights a traditional method of preparation using dried beans, resulting in a rich and authentic flavor.

fields.name: Beans And Franks Casserole
fields.title: Beans and Franks Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole dish featuring frankfurters, beans, and vegetables.
instructions: Slice frankfurters and brown lightly in butter in a skillet. Remove to a paper plate.
Gently cook celery and green pepper in the skillet until tender.
Add remaining ingredients, including frankfurter slices, blend, and simmer gently for about 15 minutes.

fields.name: Play Dough
fields.title: Playdough
fields.description: A simple recipe for homemade playdough.
instructions: Cook-stirring till thick
Knead on way papertadd food coloring.
fields.comment: Playdough is a classic children's toy that has been enjoyed for generations.  Its malleable nature makes it a great tool for developing fine motor skills and creativity.

fields.name: Chocolate Mug Cake
fields.title: Chocolate Mug Cake
fields.description: A quick and easy single-serving chocolate cake made in a mug.
instructions: Combine all dry ingredients in a mug.
Add the egg, milk, oil, and vanilla extract.
Mix well until smooth.
Microwave for 1-2 minutes, or until cooked through.
Let cool slightly before adding chocolate chips (if using) and enjoying.
fields.comment: Mug cakes gained popularity due to their convenience and minimal cleanup.  Variations include different flavors and mix-ins like nuts, dried fruit or spices.

fields.name: Oven Swiss Steak
fields.title: Oven Swiss Steak
fields.description: A flavorful round steak recipe baked with mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, and tarragon.
instructions: In a large ovenproof skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove, crumble and set aside.
Discard all but 1/4 cup drippings.
Trim beef; cut into serving-size pieces.
Brown on both sides in drippings.
Top meat with mushrooms, tomatoes and onion.
Sprinkle with tarragon and bacon.
Cover and bake at 325° for 1-1/4 to 1-3/4 hours or until meat is tender, basting twice.
Remove meat to a serving platter; keep warm.
Combine cornstarch and water; add to skillet and bring to a boil.
Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat; stir in cream.
Simmer, uncovered, for 3-4 minutes or until sauce thickens.
Serve over meat.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in a contest, submitted by Lorna Dickau from Vanderhoof, British Columbia. She enjoys cooking tasty meals like this for her family.

fields.name: Italian Meat Loaves
fields.title: Italian Meat Loaves
fields.description: Miniature meat loaves made with ground pork and Italian herbs, topped with ketchup and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, divided
instructions: In a large bowl, combine eggs, crumbs, milk, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, onion, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt and 1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning.
Add pork and mix well.
Shape into 10 individual loaves; place on a rack in a greased large shallow baking pan.
Spread ketchup over loaves; sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning.
Bake at 350° for 45-55 minutes or until no pink remains.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in a publication, possibly a magazine or cookbook, as indicated by the mention of it being featured on page 6.  The recipe comes from Patricia Staudt from Marble Rock, Iowa, where the availability of pork likely influenced the recipe's creation.

fields.name: Barbecued London Broil
fields.title: Barbecued London Broil
fields.description: Marinated London broil grilled and served with remaining marinade as a sauce.
instructions: Mix all ingredients for the marinade.
Soak meat in marinade overnight.
Barbecue for about 30 minutes.
Slice thinly against the grain.
Serve with remaining marinade as a sauce.
fields.comment: London broil is a dish, not a cut of beef, and became popular in the mid-20th century.

fields.name: Jeanette's Meatloaf
fields.title: Jeanette's Meatloaf
fields.description: A classic comfort food dish made with hamburger, bread, eggs, and a blend of savory seasonings.
fields.comment: Meatloaf's popularity in the United States dates back to the early 20th century, often linked to its affordability and adaptability with various ingredients. It gained further recognition during the Great Depression and World War II as a practical and nutritious meal. Variations of meatloaf exist across different cultures, showcasing regional flavors and preferences. In some cultures, the meatloaf is served with a sweet glaze like ketchup which complements the savory flavors of the loaf.

fields.name: Easy Pleasing Meatloaves
fields.title: Easy Pleasing Meatloaves
fields.description: A simple meatloaf recipe using Stove Top stuffing mix and barbecue sauce.
ingredients: 1 pkg. (6 oz) STOVE TOP Stuffing Mix, any variety
1/2 cup KRAFT Original Barbecue Sauce, divided
instructions: Mix all ingredients except 1/4 cup of the barbecue sauce.
Shape meat mixture into 2 oval loaves, side by side, in a 13x9-inch baking dish.
Top with remaining 1/4 cup barbecue sauce.
Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes or until center is no longer pink.

fields.name: Chops With Mushroom Gravy
fields.title: Chops with Mushroom Gravy
fields.description: Moist and comforting pork chops baked with a rich mushroom gravy.
ingredients: 6 to 8 boneless pork loin chops (1 inch thick)
1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
instructions: In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Add pork chops one at a time, tossing to coat. Set aside remaining flour mixture.
In a large skillet, saute chops in butter until golden brown.
Transfer chops to a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish.
In the same skillet, saute onion, green pepper, and mushrooms until tender.
Stir in reserved flour mixture.
Gradually add milk until blended.
Bring to a boil, cook, and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice.
Pour gravy over chops.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes, or until meat is no longer pink.
Serve with hot mashed potatoes.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in the Taste of Home June/July 2000 edition, submitted by Loraine Van Broeck from Geneva, Illinois. She considers this a comforting classic after experimenting with many new recipes.

fields.name: Pork Chop Casserole
fields.title: Pork Chop Casserole
fields.description: Tender pork chops smothered in a creamy sauce, baked to perfection.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: In a shallow bowl, combine the flour, salt and pepper; dredge pork chops.
Heat oil in a large skillet; cook pork chops for 4-5 minutes per side or until browned.
Place in a single layer in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Combine soup, broth, ginger, rosemary and 1/2 cup sour cream; pour over chops.
Sprinkle with half of the onions.
Cover and bake at 350° for 45-50 minutes.
Stir remaining sour cream into sauce.
Top chops with remaining onions.
Return to the oven, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
fields.comment: This recipe was a family favorite, often requested by guests who enjoyed it at Nancy Duty's home in Jacksonville, Florida.

fields.name: Potato Pork Pie
fields.title: Potato Pork Pie
fields.description: A hearty and saucy comfort food main dish featuring pork and a mashed potato crust.
instructions: Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with water; bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes or until very tender. Drain well.
Mash potatoes with cream, 2 tablespoons butter, salt and pepper.
Spread 1-1/2 cups of mashed potatoes into a greased shallow 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
In a skillet, saute onion and garlic in remaining butter until tender.
Stir in flour until blended. Gradually stir in broth, mustard, thyme and 2 tablespoons parsley. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Stir in pork; heat through.
Pour over the potato crust.
Pipe or spoon remaining mashed potatoes over top.
Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 35-40 minutes or until the potatoes are lightly browned.
Sprinkle with remaining parsley.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in the Taste of Home June/July 2000 edition, submitted by Michelle Ross from Stanwood, Washington. It offers a unique twist on the traditional shepherd's pie by using pork instead of beef.

fields.name: Spiced Pork Chops
fields.title: Spiced Pork Chops
fields.description: An easy and satisfying pork chop recipe that's perfect for a crowd.
instructions: In a shallow dish, combine the first 10 ingredients; dredge pork chops on both sides.
In a skillet, brown chops in oil on both sides.
Place in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Combine ketchup, water and brown sugar; pour over chops.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour or until tender.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by Joan MacKinnon from Brooklyn, Nova Scotia, who often makes this for family and friends.

fields.name: Broccoli Ham Roll Ups
fields.title: Broccoli Ham Roll-Ups
fields.description: Flavorful ham rolls filled with broccoli and cheese, perfect for a quick meal or potluck dish.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
12 slices fully cooked ham (1/8 inch thick)
instructions: Cook broccoli according to package directions; drain.
In a bowl, combine soup, bread crumbs, cheese, onion, pimientos and seasonings.
Add broccoli; mix well.
Spoon 1/4 cup onto each ham slice. Roll up and place in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Cover and bake at 350° for 40 minutes or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home magazine in February/March 2001 and was a favorite of the submitter's mother.

fields.name: Cranberry Pork Chops
fields.title: Cranberry Pork Chops
fields.description: Sweet and savory pork chops simmered in a homemade cranberry barbecue sauce.
ingredients: 1 package (12 ounces) fresh or frozen cranberries
8 bone-in pork chops (1/2 to 3/4 inch thick)
instructions: In a saucepan, combine sugar and 1-1/2 cups water. Cook and stir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved.
Bring to a boil; boil, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
Add cranberries; cook 5 minutes longer or until the berries pop. Skim off foam if necessary.
Stir in barbecue sauce and remaining water. Mix well; set aside.
Season pork chops with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chops on both sides in oil; drain.
Pour the cranberry sauce over chops. Cover and simmer for 35-40 minutes or until meat juices run clear.
Remove chops and keep warm.
Combine cornstarch and cold water until smooth; add to skillet.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Spoon over pork chops.
notes: One 16-ounce can of whole-berry cranberry sauce may be substituted for the sugar, cranberries and 1-1/2 cups water. Combine cranberry sauce with the barbecue sauce and 1/4 cup water; use as directed in recipe.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted by Joan Dobbs from Evansville, Illinois, who enjoys farming, gardening, playing with her beagles, and crafting in her free time. The editor also provides a helpful substitution using canned cranberry sauce for convenience.

fields.name: Pork And Apple Supper
fields.title: Pork and Apple Supper
fields.description: A Dutch-inspired dish featuring tender pork, tart apples, and potatoes.
ingredients: 10 to 12 small red potatoes (about 2 pounds), quartered
4 medium tart apples, peeled and cut into wedges
instructions: In a Dutch oven, brown pork in oil.
Add water, bouillon, thyme, pepper and bay leaf; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until pork is almost tender.
Add potatoes; cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Add apples; cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until crisp-tender.
Discard bay leaf.
Combine cornstarch and cold water until smooth; stir into pork mixture.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
fields.comment: This recipe originates from upstate New York, an area with a strong Dutch heritage and abundant apple orchards.

fields.name: Country Spare Ribs
fields.title: Country Spare Ribs
fields.description: Country spare ribs are slow-cooked with a sweet and tangy sauce made from catsup, water, lemon, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, vinegar, and chili powder.
instructions: Brown spare ribs.
Add sliced onions.
In a separate bowl, combine catsup, water, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, and vinegar.
Pour sauce over ribs and onions.
Shake chili powder over the ribs and sauce.
Cook at 325° for 2 hours.

fields.name: Pork Chops O'Brien
fields.title: Pork Chops O'Brien
fields.description: Pork chops baked with a creamy potato and onion mixture.
ingredients: 1 can (10.75 oz) condensed Cream of Celery Soup
1 package (24 oz) frozen O'Brien hash brown potatoes
instructions: Brown pork chops in oil in a skillet.
Combine soup, 1/2 of the cheese, and 1/2 of the sour cream.
Fold the mixture into the potatoes.
Spread the potato mixture into a 13x9 inch pan.
Arrange the browned pork chops on top.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and half of the French fried onions.
Cover and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle with the remaining French fried onions. Bake for another 15 minutes, or until heated through.

fields.name: Potato Top Pork Casserole
fields.title: Pork and Potato Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish with pork, potatoes, and cheese.
instructions: Sprinkle pork with salt and brown in oil.
Add sliced onions and paprika, cook until softened.
Stir in flour, then add beef broth.
Simmer for 35 minutes.
Stir in frozen mixed vegetables.
Put pork mixture in a 9x13 inch pan.
Top with mashed potatoes (mix cheese into potatoes before topping).
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes.

fields.name: Peach Glazed Pork Chops
fields.title: Peach-Glazed Pork Chops
fields.description: Peach-glazed pork chops baked over a savory herb stuffing.
ingredients: 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter or margarine, cut into pieces
1 package (6 oz.) Stove Top Savory Herb Stuffing Mix
instructions: Drain peaches, reserving syrup. Add hot water to syrup to measure 1 1/2 cups.
Mix syrup mixture and butter in a large bowl until butter is melted.
Stir in contents of stuffing mix pouch and peaches. Let stand 5 minutes.
Spoon stuffing mixture into a 13x9-inch baking pan.
Arrange chops over stuffing mixture.
Mix preserves and mustard.
Spoon over chops.
Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes or until chops are cooked through.
fields.comment: This recipe combines sweet and savory flavors, utilizing canned peaches and stuffing mix for convenience. It reflects the trend of using pantry staples in creative ways to make weeknight meals.

fields.name: Pork Chops And Sweet Potato Gravy
fields.title: Pork Chops and Sweet Potato Gravy
fields.description: Thinly sliced pork medallions or boneless pork chops are seasoned, seared, and simmered in a sweet potato gravy with onions and pecans.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds pork medallions, thinly sliced, OR boneless pork chops
1 pound sweet potatoes, baked, peeled and mashed, OR 1 can (15 oz.) yams, drained and mashed
instructions: In a small bowl, combine paprika, garlic powder, cayenne, salt and pepper.
Sprinkle both sides of pork with seasoning.
In a large skillet coated with non-stick spray, heat oil and brown pork on each side over high heat.
Remove and set aside.
Add flour, stirring constantly to brown.
Add onions and sauté until almost tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in pecans.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Gradually add sweet potatoes and blend until smooth.
Stir in syrup.
Return pork to pan, reduce heat and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until the pork is done, stirring occasionally.
If gravy gets too thick, add water.
Sprinkle with green onions and serve.

fields.name: Asparagus Ham Rolls
fields.title: Asparagus Ham Rolls
fields.description: Ham slices rolled around asparagus stalks, covered in a creamy cheese sauce, and baked to perfection.
ingredients: 8 thin slices fully cooked ham (about 1/2 pound)
instructions: In a saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour and cook until thick.
Gradually stir in milk and cook until bubbly and thickened.
Stir in cheese, salt and pepper.
Remove from the heat.
Place three asparagus stalks on each ham slice.
Roll up; secure with toothpicks if necessary.
Place in a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan; cover with cheese sauce.
Sprinkle with crumbs.
Bake at 375° for 20 minutes.
notes: Diabetic Exchanges: One serving (prepared with margarine and skim milk) equals 1 meat, 1 vegetable, 1/2 starch; also, 125 calories, 492 mg sodium, 19 mg cholesterol, 11 gm carbohydrate, 11 gm protein, 7 gm fat.
fields.comment: This recipe, shared by Laurie Timm of Minneiska, Minnesota, highlights the use of fresh, local ingredients. It also offers a healthier take on a classic dish by reducing sugar, salt, and fat content, aligning with dietary trends that emphasize healthier eating.

fields.name: Creamy Ranch Pork Chops And Rice
fields.title: Creamy Ranch Pork Chops and Rice
fields.description: A quick and easy recipe for creamy ranch pork chops served with flavorful ranch-style rice.
ingredients: 1 can (10 3/4 oz.) Campbell's Cream of Mushroom or 98% Fat Free Cream of Mushroom Soup
1 pkg. (1 oz.) ranch salad dressing mix
instructions: Heat oil in skillet.
Add pork chops and cook until browned.
Add soup, milk and 1/2 pkg. salad dressing mix.
Heat to a boil.
Cover and cook over low heat 10 min. or until done.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Serve with Ranch-Style Rice.
notes: Ranch-Style Rice: Add remaining salad dressing mix to water when making rice.
fields.comment: This recipe is a classic example of mid-20th century American convenience cooking, utilizing canned soup and packaged mixes to create a flavorful meal quickly.  Campbell's Soup Company actively promoted these types of recipes to busy homemakers.

fields.name: Peachy Pork Picante
fields.title: Peachy Pork Picante
fields.description: Cubed pork loin is browned, then simmered with salsa and peach preserves for a sweet and savory dish.
instructions: Coat the pork loin cubes with taco seasoning.
Brown the seasoned pork in a little oil in a skillet.
Add the salsa and peach preserves to the skillet.
Stir to mix well, cover, and lower heat.
Simmer gently for 15 minutes.
fields.comment: Nutrient analysis was performed using older USDA data, indicating this recipe likely originates from before or around 1991 when Handbook 8-10 was published.

fields.name: Saucy Twist Pork
fields.title: Saucy Twist Pork
fields.description: A simple, flavorful casserole dish with cooked macaroni, ham or Spam, vegetables, and a creamy, cheesy sauce.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups ham, cubed, OR 1 can Spam
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In large skillet, saute onion and green pepper in butter until tender.
Stir in macaroni and remaining ingredients.
Pour into 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Top with cheese.
Bake 30 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this were popular in the mid-20th century as a way to combine affordable ingredients into a hearty, satisfying meal.

fields.name: Different Twist Pork Stew
fields.title: Different Twist Pork Stew
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful pork stew with sweet potatoes and corn.
ingredients: 2 lbs. Pork tenderloin, trimmed of fat and cut into 1½-inch cubes
28 oz. canned Tomatoes, no salt added, with juice
2 lbs. Sweet potatoes (about 4), peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a large pot coated with nonstick cooking spray, brown pork over low heat, about 5 minutes.
Add onion. Cook until softened, about 7 minutes.
Add tomatoes, chicken broth, bay leaves, salt and pepper.
Cook 30 minutes.
Add sweet potatoes and corn.
Simmer until potatoes and pork are tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Remove bay leaves before serving.

fields.name: Pork And Pasta Skillet Supper
fields.title: Pork and Pasta Skillet Supper
fields.description: A quick and easy skillet supper with ground pork, pasta, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 small yellow summer squash or zucchini, sliced
1½ cups (4 ozs. uncooked) hot cooked penne or other small pasta
instructions: Heat non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add pork and onion; cook and stir until evenly browned.
Stir in tomatoes and tomato sauce; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in squash and pasta.
Cook until heated through, 2-5 minutes.
Serve with crisp, green salad and French bread.
fields.comment: Recipes with fewer than 10 ingredients, such as Pork and Pasta Skillet Supper, can usually be prepared quickly.

fields.name: Very Berry Pork Chops
fields.title: Very Berry Pork Chops
fields.description: Pork chops cooked with a sweet and tangy strawberry glaze.
instructions: Dry pork chops with paper towel.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add pork chops, cook and turn until brown on both sides.
Reduce heat to low.
Stir together preserves, mustard and vinegar; pour over chops.
Cover pan.
Cook pork chops for 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
To serve, spoon glaze over each pork chop.
Serve with baked potato wedges and corn.

fields.name: Tortilla Crusted Pork Chops
fields.title: Tortilla-Crusted Pork Chops with Sweet Potato Maple Mash
fields.description: Pork chops are coated in crushed tortilla chips and baked until golden brown, served with a sweet potato maple mash.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Season pork chops with salt and pepper.
Combine tortilla chips and flour.
Dip chops into egg, then into tortilla mixture, thoroughly coating both sides.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Quickly brown chops 1 to 2 minutes on each side; transfer to large baking pan.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve.
notes: The recipe title mentions 'Sweet Potato Maple Mash,' but there are no instructions or ingredients for it. It was likely served as a side dish in the original image.  No changes were made to the output given the request.
fields.comment: Tortilla-crusted pork chops offer a crispy, flavorful twist on a classic dish.  The combination of savory pork and crunchy tortilla chips is a popular example of Tex-Mex fusion cuisine.

fields.name: Spiced Pork Chops (2)
fields.title: Spiced Pork Chops
fields.description: Pork chops baked with apple cider, apples, and raisins, spiced with mustard, allspice, and cinnamon.
instructions: Combine flour, mustard, pepper and allspice; dredge pork chops, reserving remaining flour mixture.
In a skillet, brown chops in oil.
Remove to a 2-qt. baking dish.
To the drippings, add cider, brown sugar and remaining flour mixture; cook and stir until bubbly.
Arrange apples and raisins around chops; sprinkle with cinnamon.
Pour cider mixture over all.
Cover and bake at 350° for 70 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
If desired, combine noodles and caraway seed; serve with pork.

fields.name: Pork Chop Dinner
fields.title: Pork Chop Dinner
fields.description: A slow-cooked pork chop recipe, a favorite of Janet Phillips' husband.
ingredients: 1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
instructions: In a skillet, brown pork chops on both sides in oil; drain.
Place chops in a slow cooker.
Add the onion, green pepper and mushrooms.
In a bowl, combine the tomato sauce, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar and salt.
Pour over meat and vegetables.
Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until meat is tender.
Serve with rice if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe was contributed by Janet Phillips, known as the 'Crock-Pot Queen', and is a family favorite. It emphasizes healthier cooking by using less fat, sugar, and salt, and includes nutritional information and diabetic exchanges, reflecting dietary trends of the time.

fields.name: Quick Ginger Pork
fields.title: Quick Ginger Pork
fields.description: A quick and easy pork stir-fry with ginger, soy sauce, and garlic, served over rice.
ingredients: 1/2 pound pork tenderloin, cut into thin strips
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir-fry pork and garlic for 3 minutes.
Combine soy sauce, sugar and ginger; add to skillet.
Reduce heat to medium; stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
Combine water and cornstarch until smooth; add to skillet.
Bring to a boil; boil and stir for 2 minutes.
Serve over rice.
notes: Nutritional Analysis: One serving (prepared with light soy sauce; calculated without rice) equals 227 calories, 554 mg sodium, 67 mg cholesterol, 5 gm carbohydrate, 25 gm protein, 11 gm fat.
Diabetic Exchanges: 3 lean meat, 1/2 starch, 1/2 fat.
fields.comment: Stir-fries are a popular dish in many cultures, prized for their quick cooking times and versatility.  This recipe highlights a simple yet flavorful combination of ingredients common in Asian cuisine.

fields.name: Savory Pork Chops
fields.title: Savory Pork Chops
fields.description: Tender pork chops smothered in a mouth-watering sauce with a perfect blend of mustard, soy sauce, ketchup, and orange marmalade.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the first four ingredients (flour, ground mustard, seasoned salt, and pepper).
Dredge pork chops in the flour mixture.
In a skillet over medium heat, brown chops in oil on both sides, about 8 minutes.
Combine the sauce ingredients (ground mustard, water, onion, ketchup, orange marmalade, soy sauce, and Dijon mustard); pour over chops.
Cover and simmer until meat is tender, about 20 minutes.
Spoon sauce over chops when serving.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted to Taste of Home by Debbie Terenzini Wilkerson from Lusby, MD.  She loves the tender pork chops and the blend of flavors in the sauce.

fields.name: Pork Chops With Sauerkraut
fields.title: Pork Chops with Sauerkraut
fields.description: Pan-fried pork chops simmered with sauerkraut, onions, and tomatoes.
instructions: In a large non-stick skillet, brown chops on both sides over medium-high heat.
Remove chops from skillet; set aside and keep warm.
Add onion to same skillet; cook, stirring occasionally, 2-3 minutes.
Add tomatoes, sugar, bay leaf, salt and pepper to taste.
Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in sauerkraut.
Arrange pork chops on top of skillet mixture.
Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 1 hour or until chops test done.
Remove bay leaf before serving.

fields.name: Paprika Pork Stew
fields.title: Paprika Pork Stew
fields.description: A hearty stew with pork, potatoes, and a creamy paprika sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 medium onion, cut in half lengthwise and sliced
instructions: Combine flour, paprika, and salt; mix well.
Dip pork in flour mixture. Reserve excess flour mixture.
Brown pork in oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven. Pour off drippings.
Add 1/2 cup water and onion; cover tightly and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add potatoes and continue cooking, covered, 20-30 minutes or until pork and potatoes are tender.
Combine reserved flour with 2 Tbsps. water; stir into pork mixture and cook until thickened, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream.

fields.name: Pork With Apples
fields.title: Pork with Apples
fields.description: Pork chops simmered with broth, white wine, thyme, and served with tender apples.
ingredients: Rome Beauty or other cooking apples, sliced
instructions: Melt shortening in a large skillet; brown chops on both sides.
Pour off fat.
Sprinkle chops with salt and pepper.
Add broth, wine and thyme. (Additional broth may be substituted for the wine.)
Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 50 minutes.
Spoon pan liquid over chops.
Add apples.
Cook 5-10 minutes more, until apples are tender.
Garnish with parsley.

fields.name: Pork Chops
fields.title: Tater Tot Casserole
fields.description: A classic comfort food casserole with layers of seasoned ground pork, creamy soup, and crispy tater tots.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Brown ground pork in a skillet over medium heat. Drain off any excess grease.
In a separate bowl, combine the cream of chicken soup, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce.
Spread a layer of tater tots in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Top with the browned ground pork and then pour the soup mixture over the pork.
Layer the remaining tater tots over the soup mixture.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour, or until the tater tots are golden brown and the casserole is heated through.
notes: Recipe adapted from online resources to specify quantities and steps more clearly.
Consider adding other ingredients, such as shredded cheese, chopped onions, or green bell peppers, to the pork mixture before layering.
fields.comment: Tater tot casserole, also known as "tater tot hotdish," is a popular dish, especially in the Midwestern United States.  It's a relatively modern dish, first appearing in the 1950s when tater tots were invented.  It reflects a trend towards convenience cooking using processed ingredients.

fields.name: Apricot Ham Steak
fields.title: Apricot Ham Steak
fields.description: Ham slices topped with a sweet apricot glaze.
ingredients: 4 slices fully cooked ham (1/2 inch thick)
instructions: In a skillet, saute ham slices in 1 tablespoon of butter until lightly browned, turning once.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan or microwave-safe bowl, combine the preserves, vinegar, ginger, salt and remaining butter; heat through.
Serve ham with the apricot sauce and green beans if desired.
fields.comment: Ham steaks with fruit glazes are a classic dish found in numerous cultures.  Variations exist using pineapple, cherry, or orange marmalade.

fields.name: Pork Chop Casserole (2)
fields.title: Pork Chop Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish with pork chops, potatoes, carrots, and onions, seasoned with a flavorful pork seasoning mix.
ingredients: 2 large onions, peeled and cut in wedges
6 potatoes, peeled and cut in 1-inch pieces
6 medium carrots, peeled and cut in 1-inch pieces
1 envelope Shaken Bake pork seasoning mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.
In a 9x13x2-inch baking pan, melt butter or margarine in oven.
Remove pan from oven.
Place vegetables in pan and turn to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
Coat pork chops with seasoning mix.
Place chops in a single layer over vegetables.
Bake, uncovered, for 40-45 minutes or until chops are cooked.

fields.name: Skillet Pork Chops
fields.title: Skillet Pork Chops
fields.description: Pan-fried pork chops simmered with onions, green pepper, carrots, and milk gravy.
ingredients: 1 large green pepper, cored, seeded and sliced
4 medium-size carrots, peeled and cut in rounds
instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat vegetable oil.
Sauté onions, green pepper and carrots lightly; remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, brown pork chops; season with salt and pepper.
When pork chops are browned, arrange sautéed onion, green pepper and carrots over chops.
Add milk to cover meat and vegetable mixture.
Cover tightly and simmer 1-1½ hours until chops are tender and milk thickens as gravy.
notes: Cooking time will vary with thickness of chops.

fields.name: Pork Loin With Honey-Mustard Sauce
fields.title: Pork Loin With Honey-Mustard Sauce
fields.description: Pork loin chops are pan-fried, then simmered with caramelized onions in a honey-mustard sauce.
ingredients: 2 large red onions, thinly sliced (4 cups)
instructions: In small saucepan over high heat, boil apple juice until reduced to 1/4 cup.
In small bowl, combine honey, mustard, lemon juice and thyme; stir in hot, reduced apple juice. Set aside.
In large skillet, heat 1 Tbs. oil over medium heat. (Season chops with salt and pepper, if desired.)
Brown chops 5 minutes on each side; remove from skillet.
Add remaining olive oil and onions to skillet.
Cook onions, stirring often, until soft and caramelized (15 minutes).
Stir in apple juice mixture.
Return chops to skillet.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, turning pork and basting with onion mixture several times.
Serve.

fields.name: Original Ranch Pork Chops
fields.title: Original Ranch Pork Chops
fields.description: Pork chops seasoned with ranch dressing mix, pepper, and optionally paprika, then baked.
ingredients: 1 packet (1 oz.) Hidden Valley Original Ranch Dressing Mix
instructions: Mix together dressing mix and pepper.
Rub mixture on both sides of pork chops.
Arrange chops in single layer on baking pan or broiler rack.
Sprinkle with paprika (if desired).
Bake at 450°F for 20 to 25 minutes.

fields.name: Ham With Cherry Sauce
fields.title: Ham with Cherry Sauce
fields.description: A baked ham with a sweet cherry sauce.
ingredients: 1 fully cooked bone-in ham (6 to 8 pounds)
1 can (16 ounces) pitted dark sweet cherries, undrained
instructions: Place ham in a roasting pan.
Score surface of ham with shallow diagonal cuts, making diamond shapes.
Combine the brown sugar, syrup and mustard; rub over ham and press into cuts.
Cover and bake at 325° for 1-3/4 to 2 hours or until a meat thermometer reads 140° and ham is heated through.
For cherry sauce, in a saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and water until smooth.
Add cherries.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat; stir in lemon juice and extract.
Serve with ham.

fields.name: Corny Ham Supper
fields.title: Corny Ham Supper
fields.description: A quick and easy weeknight meal featuring ham, corn, and cheese rolled up in warm flour tortillas.
ingredients: 1/4 cup finely chopped green OR red bell pepper
1 (10 oz.) package frozen whole kernel corn, thawed
instructions: In a large skillet, sauté green onion and bell pepper in oil over medium-high heat for 3 minutes, or until tender.
Reduce heat and stir in ham, corn, dressing, and black pepper.
Cook until thoroughly heated.
Stir in cheese and cook, stirring gently, just until cheese is melted.
Spoon ham mixture over tortillas.
Roll up tortillas.
Serve with salsa, if desired.

fields.name: Herb Skillet Dinner
fields.title: Herbed Skillet Dinner
fields.description: A quick and easy one-pan meal with ham, mushrooms, rice, and peas.
ingredients: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and sauté for 4 minutes.
Add ham and cook an additional 2 minutes.
Add chicken broth, pepper, and peas, if desired; bring to a boil.
Slowly stir in rice; cover and remove from heat.
Let stand 5 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed.
Stir gently and serve.

fields.name: Pork Chop And Potato Bake
fields.title: Pork Chop & Potato Bake
fields.description: A creamy casserole dish with pork chops, potatoes, and a crispy onion topping.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
instructions: Brown pork chops and sprinkle with seasoned salt, then set aside.
Combine soup, milk, sour cream, pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt.
Stir in potatoes, 1/2 cup cheese, and 1/2 can of French fried onions.
Spoon mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Arrange pork chops on top.
Cover and bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
Top with remaining cheese and onions.
Bake uncovered for 5 more minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.

fields.name: Caramel Apple Pork Chops
fields.title: Caramel Apple Pork Chops
fields.description: Pork chops are pan-fried, then topped with a sweet and savory caramel apple sauce and pecans.
ingredients: 2 medium tart red apples, cored and sliced into 2-inch wedges
instructions: Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Brush chops lightly with oil and cook for 5 to 6 minutes, turning occasionally, until evenly browned. Remove and keep warm.

In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, salt, pepper, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add butter to skillet. Stir in brown sugar mixture and apples. Cover and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or just until apples are tender.
Remove apples with a slotted spoon and arrange on top of chops; keep warm.
Continue cooking mixture in skillet, uncovered, until sauce thickens slightly. Spoon sauce over apples and chops.
Sprinkle with pecans, if desired. Serve with mashed potatoes, steamed green beans and dinner rolls.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from the Pork Information Bureau, highlighting their efforts to promote pork consumption with creative and appealing dishes.

fields.name: Golden Apple And Pork Saute
fields.title: Golden Apple and Pork Saute (Microwave Method)
fields.description: A quick and easy microwave recipe for sauteed pork with apples and vegetables.
ingredients: ½ pound lean pork strips, cut into 2x2x¼-inch pieces
1 Golden Delicious apple, cored and sliced
instructions: Combine pork with Worcestershire sauce and paprika; let stand 20 minutes.
Microwave pork at HIGH 3 minutes; stir once after 1½ minutes.
Add vegetables and 1 tablespoon water. Cover with waxed paper, microwave at MEDIUM 5 minutes or until pork is tender and vegetables are crisp-tender, stir once during cooking.
Combine cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water, add to vegetable mixture with apple and seasonings.
Cover and microwave at HIGH about 1 minute. Let stand 1 minute.
notes: Recipe can be doubled.

Stir-Fry method: Stir-fry pork in 2 tablespoons oil 2 to 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Add vegetables and continue to stir-fry 2 minutes or until crisp-tender; add apple and seasonings and heat thoroughly. Combine cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water, add to apple mixture and cook about 1 minute or until sauce thickens.
Serving Tip: Golden Apple and Pork Saute is excellent served over cooked rice.
If desired, frozen, thawed pea pods can be substituted.

fields.name: Ham Loaf
fields.title: Ham Loaf
fields.description: A savory ham loaf baked with a sweet and tangy pineapple-mustard glaze.
ingredients: 1 cup whipped Dream Whip or whipping cream
instructions: Beat eggs, add milk, add bread crumbs and mix until all crumbs are soaked.
Add ground ham and mix thoroughly. (Ham is salty enough, do not add any salt.)
Put in 9x5 loaf pan and cover with the glaze.
Glaze: Mix brown sugar, crushed pineapple, 1 tablespoon prepared mustard, and vinegar.
Pour glaze over the ham loaf.
Bake at 375°F for thirty minutes.
Turn down to 325°F and continue baking for one hour (it can simmer slowly for two hours total without drying).
Add other half of glaze during the last half of cooking time.
Serve in slices with some of the sauce or with the horseradish sauce.
Horseradish Sauce: Mix whipped cream/whipping cream, mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon prepared mustard, and horseradish. Let sit for at least one hour before serving.

fields.name: Chicken Breast With Lemon Cream Sauce
fields.title: Large Chicken Breasts
fields.description: Large chicken breasts cooked with onions, mushrooms, lemon juice, and a creamy mustard sauce.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Brown chicken breasts in butter in a heavy pan.
Add minced onions and sliced mushrooms to the pan.
Reduce heat and cook until onions are tender (about 5 minutes).
Remove chicken from the pan.
Add lemon juice to the pan and cook for 2 minutes.
Add heavy cream to the pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Add prepared mustard, salt, and pepper to taste.
Return chicken to the pan.
Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through.

fields.name: Chicken Enchiladas
fields.title: PHILADELPHIA Chicken Enchiladas
fields.description: Chicken, bell pepper, cream cheese, and salsa wrapped in flour tortillas, covered in a creamy cheese sauce, and baked.
ingredients: 2 cups chopped cooked chicken or turkey
1 package (8 ounces) PHILADELPHIA® Cream Cheese, cubed
3/4 pound (12 ounces) VELVEETA Pasteurized Process Cheese Spread, cut up
instructions: STIR chicken, bell pepper, cream cheese and ½ cup salsa in saucepan on low heat until cream cheese is melted.
SPOON ¼ cup chicken mixture down center of each tortilla; roll up. Place, seam-side down, in lightly greased 12X8-inch baking dish.
STIR process cheese spread and milk in saucepan on low heat until smooth. Pour sauce over tortillas; cover with foil.
BAKE at 350°F for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Pour remaining salsa over tortillas.
notes: Before covering a casserole with foil, spray the foil with cooking spray to prevent any toppings from sticking.
If your flour tortillas are a little too stiff to roll up easily, wrap them in a damp paper towel and gently warm them in the microwave oven until they are soft and pliable.

fields.name: Easy Chicken Oriental
fields.title: Barry Checkin Oriental Chicken
fields.description: A casserole-style dish with chicken, cream of mushroom soup, and a biscuit topping.
ingredients: 1 can (10 3/4 oz) cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Combine chicken, vegetables, soup, and water chestnuts in a casserole dish.
Mix baking mix with milk or water until a soft dough forms. Knead 5 times.
Roll out dough and cut into circles.
Place dough circles on top of the chicken mixture in the casserole dish.
Bake in a preheated oven until the topping is golden brown.

fields.name: Scalloped Chicken
fields.title: Scalloped Chicken
fields.description: A classic comfort food dish with cubed chicken, bread, cracker crumbs, and vegetables baked in a creamy sauce.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine bread cubes and 1 cup cracker crumbs.
Stir in broth, eggs, salt, celery, onion, chicken and mushrooms.
Spoon into a greased 2-qt. casserole.
In a saucepan, melt butter; brown remaining cracker crumbs.
Sprinkle over casserole.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
notes: For easy preparation, make everything but the topping a day ahead and then refrigerate it.
Add the topping just before baking.
fields.comment: This scalloped chicken recipe is a family favorite, even among those who don't typically enjoy chicken.

fields.name: Orange Walnut Chicken
fields.title: Orange Walnut Chicken
fields.description: A zesty chicken dish with a flavorful orange sauce, walnuts, and green onions, served over rice.
instructions: In a large resealable plastic bag, combine orange juice concentrate, 2 tablespoons oil, soy sauce and garlic.
Add chicken; seal bag and turn to coat.
Refrigerate for 2-3 hours.
Remove chicken; reserve marinade.
In a skillet, cook chicken in remaining oil until juices run clear.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan, saute walnuts in butter until lightly browned; remove and set aside.
Set aside 1/4 cup green onions for garnish.
Add remaining onions to saucepan; saute until tender.
Add reserved marinade and the next eight ingredients.
Bring to a rolling boil; boil for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5-10 minutes or until sauce reaches desired consistency.
Serve chicken over rice; top with sauce and reserved walnuts and onions.
fields.comment: This Orange Walnut Chicken recipe won the Grand Prize in the Taste of Home Dec/Jan 2000 edition, submitted by TerryAnn Moore from Haddon Township, New Jersey.

fields.name: Dill Chicken Salad
fields.title: Dilled Chicken Salad
fields.description: A hearty, fresh-tasting chicken salad with a delicate dill flavor.
ingredients: 1 package (16 ounces) spiral pasta, cooked and drained
1 envelope (1 ounce) ranch salad dressing mix
3 tablespoons minced fresh dill or 1 tablespoon dill weed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the pasta, chicken, celery, onion, and peas; mix well.
Combine dressing ingredients; whisk until smooth.
Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
notes: If using a terra-cotta or clay bowl for serving, line it with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, or use a plastic bowl that looks like terra-cotta.
fields.comment: This Dilled Chicken Salad was a reader-submitted recipe from Kimberly Speta of Kennedy, New York, featured on page 13 of a publication.

fields.name: Sausage Chicken And Asparagus
fields.title: Saucy Chicken and Asparagus
fields.description: An easy and delicious creamy chicken and asparagus dish baked with a flavorful sauce and topped with cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
instructions: If desired, partially cook asparagus; drain.
Place the asparagus in a greased 9-in. square baking dish.
In a skillet over medium heat, brown the chicken in oil on both sides.
Season with salt and pepper.
Arrange chicken over asparagus.
In a bowl, mix soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice and curry powder; pour over chicken.
Cover and bake at 375° for 40 minutes or until the chicken is tender and juices run clear.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by Vicki Schlechter from Davis, California, who notes its popularity even with her 95-year-old grandmother.

fields.name: Potluck Chicken Casserole
fields.title: Potluck Chicken Casserole
fields.description: A comforting and flavorful casserole with chicken, rice, vegetables, and a crunchy cornflake topping.
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in 3 tablespoons butter until tender.
Stir in flour until thoroughly combined.
Gradually add milk; bring to a boil.
Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened and bubbly.
Remove from the heat; stir in mayonnaise until smooth.
Add chicken, rice, celery, peas, pimientos, lemon juice, salt and pepper; mix well.
Spoon into an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Melt remaining butter; toss with cornflakes.
Sprinkle over casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in a publication and submitted by Ruth Andrewson from Leavenworth, Washington.  It's described as a dish so good, people always go back for seconds, and the submitter always brings home an empty dish.

fields.name: Chicken Stroganoff
fields.title: Chicken Stroganoff
fields.description: A creamy chicken stroganoff served over hot noodles.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/4-inch strips
2 jars (4-1/2 ounces each) sliced mushrooms, drained
instructions: In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings; set bacon aside.
In the drippings, cook the chicken, onion and mushrooms until the chicken is no longer pink.
Add the broth, garlic, salt, paprika, pepper and bacon.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Combine flour and sour cream until smooth; add to the skillet.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Serve over noodles.
Sprinkle with paprika if desired.
fields.comment: This Chicken Stroganoff recipe was created by Laura Schimanski from Coaldale, Alberta as a way to use up roasted chicken and was a runner-up in the Taste of Home June/July 1999 contest.

fields.name: Turkey Rice Casserole
fields.title: Turkey Rice Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and comforting casserole made with turkey, rice, and green chilies.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies, drained
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese, divided
instructions: In a 2-qt. microwave-safe dish, combine the onion, celery and butter.
Cover and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes or until butter is melted.
Stir in milk.
Cover and cook on high for 4-6 minutes or until milk is steaming (do not boil).
Stir in rice.
Cover and let stand for 2 minutes.
Add the turkey, soup, croutons, chilies and 1/2 cup cheese.
Cover and microwave on high for 5-7 minutes or until heated through, stirring once.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Cover and let stand for 5 minutes.
notes: This recipe was tested in an 850-watt microwave.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally intended as a way to use leftover turkey, but is so good it's worth making with fresh turkey.

fields.name: Special Delivery Chicken
fields.title: Special Delivery Chicken
fields.description: A creamy chicken casserole baked with a buttery cracker crumb topping.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
instructions: In a bowl, combine the sour cream, soup and poppy seeds.
Stir in chicken.
Pour into a greased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Combine the cracker crumbs and butter; sprinkle over top.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally created by Ame Andrews from Little Rock, Arkansas, and was featured in Taste of Home magazine in February/March 2002. It was inspired by a meal she made for a friend welcoming home a new baby.

fields.name: Crispy Onion Chicken
fields.title: Crispy Onion Chicken
fields.description: Golden-brown chicken with a crunchy French-fried onion coating.
ingredients: 1 can (6 ounces) cheddar or original french-fried onions, crushed
instructions: In a shallow bowl, combine the butter, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, garlic salt and pepper.
Dip chicken in the butter mixture, then coat with onions.
Place in a greased 9-in. square baking pan.
Top with any remaining onions; drizzle with any remaining butter mixture.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in the Taste of Home August/September 2003 contest, submitted by Charlotte Smith from McDonald, Pennsylvania.

fields.name: Puff Pastry Chicken
fields.title: Chicken Pastry Rolls
fields.description: Creamy chicken, mushroom, and broccoli filling baked in pastry sheets.
ingredients: 1 box Pepperidge Farm Pastry Sheets (1'x3') or 2 cylinders of crescent rolls or phyllo dough sheets
instructions: Cream together the cream cheese and pepper.
Beat well.
Stir in the chicken, mushrooms, and broccoli.
Take pastry sheets out of the freezer 20 minutes before use.
Place one ice cream scoop of the chicken mixture onto a pastry sheet.
Dip filled pastry in melted butter and then roll in bread crumbs.
Pinch the corners of the pastry to seal.
Place the rolls folded side down on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Make gravy from chicken broth.
notes: Recipe can be made in advance and frozen. Thaw for 2 hours before baking.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the convenience foods and cooking styles popular in the 1980s with the use of pre-made pastry sheets and canned ingredients.

fields.name: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
fields.title: Lemon Herb Brilled Chicken
fields.description: Chicken pieces marinated in lemon juice, herbs, and spices, then broiled or microwaved and broiled.
instructions: Place chicken in heavy plastic bag.
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over chicken.
Seal bag.
Marinate in refrigerator for several hours or overnight.
Broil 8-10 minutes per side.
To shorten time: place chicken and marinade in 8x12 baking dish.
Microwave covered on high 10 min.
Broil 8-10 min per side.

fields.name: Chicken Over Rice
fields.title: Chicken over Rice
fields.description: Chicken breasts baked with a creamy celery and mayonnaise sauce, served over rice.
instructions: Boil chicken until tender, using broth or water.
Place cooked chicken in a flat casserole dish.
Combine cream of celery, mayonnaise, and parmesan cheese.
Pour sauce over chicken.
Sprinkle with savory seasoning.
Bake at 350°.
Serve over rice.

fields.name: Chicken Cacciatore
fields.title: Sufit cost chicken
fields.description: A simple chicken dish simmered with olive oil, thyme, and possibly other spices.
instructions: olive oil fry in
Simmer
add Clacton

Cover & Cook
45 min.

fields.name: Chicken Noodle Skillet Dinner
fields.title: Chicken Noodle Skillet Dinner
fields.description: A quick and easy one-pan chicken noodle dinner.
instructions: Cook egg noodles to desired tenderness as directed - drain.
