In large skillet, combine cooked egg noodles and remaining ingredients except parmesan cheese.
Cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 6-8 minutes, or until thoroughly heated.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

fields.name: Apricot Chicken
fields.title: Apricot Chicken
fields.description: Chicken baked with apricot jam, Russian dressing, curry powder, and onion soup mix.
ingredients: 2 frying chickens cut up or 6-8 Chicken breasts
1 pkg (13/8 oz.) dry onion soup mix
instructions: Wash and skin chicken. Pat dry.
Mix dressing, jam, curry powder, and onion soup mix.
Pour over chicken.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour 15 min.
Serve over rice.

fields.name: Broccoli And Chicken
fields.title: Broccoli and Chicken Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy casserole with chicken, broccoli, and a bread crumb topping.
instructions: Simmer Chicken until tender with slices of onion, celery, stick carrots and a pinch of Italian seasoning.
Arrange broccoli sticks on the bottom of a 9x13 buttered casserole dish.
Place cooked chicken on top of the broccoli.
Make the sauce: Combine soup, lemon juice, mayonnaise, and cheese.
Pour sauce over chicken.
Top with bread crumbs and parsley flakes.
Bake at 375° for 25 minutes.

fields.name: Chicken And Stuffing Casserole
fields.title: Chicken Casserole with Stuffing
fields.description: A creamy chicken casserole baked with a stuffing topping.
instructions: Place Chicken in 13x9 pan
Mix soup & sour cream
Pour over Chicken
Spoon Stuffing over that
Bake uncovered at 375° for 35 min.

fields.name: Chicken And Wild Rice
fields.title: Chicken of Wild Rice
fields.description: Creamy chicken and wild rice casserole baked to perfection.
instructions: Line chicken breasts in the bottom of a pan.
Combine cream of mushroom, cream of chicken, and cream of cheese soups.
Add 1/2 cup water.
Add wild rice.
Pour mixture over chicken.
Cover and bake at 325°F for 2 1/2 hours.

fields.name: Chicken Dinner Divan
fields.title: Chicken Divan
fields.description: A classic casserole dish featuring chicken, broccoli, and a creamy sauce.
ingredients: 1/2 cup bread crumbs with 1 tbsp melted butter
instructions: Grease casserole dish.
Cook broccoli and layer on bottom.
Lay chicken over broccoli.
Combine soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and curry.
Pour over chicken.
Top with cheese and bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
fields.comment: Chicken Divan, a popular American casserole, was created in the 1950s at the Divan Parisien Restaurant in New York City.  Its creamy sauce and combination of chicken and broccoli have made it a classic comfort food.

fields.name: Arroz Caldo Chicken
fields.title: Arroz Caldo
fields.description: A comforting Filipino rice porridge with chicken, ginger, and garlic.
ingredients: 1 small Chicken cut in serving pieces
instructions: Sauté garlic in oil until brown.
Add onion & ginger.
Add rest of ingredients & cook, simmering.
Stir once in a while.
When meat is tender & rice cooked, serve with calamansi juice or limes.
fields.comment: Arroz Caldo, a staple in Filipino cuisine, is known for its warming and restorative properties.  It's often served for breakfast or during cooler weather.  Calamansi juice, a common condiment in the Philippines, adds a bright citrusy flavor to the savory porridge.

fields.name: Chicken Casserole
fields.title: CHICKEN CASSEROLE
fields.description: A creamy chicken casserole baked with rice, vegetables, and a buttery bread crumb topping.
ingredients: 1 cup white sauce or 1 cup broth from chicken
instructions: Sauté onion, celery, and green pepper in butter or margarine until tender.
Mix sautéed vegetables, chicken, white sauce or broth, mayonnaise, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, and rice together in a bowl.
Place mixture in a 13x9 inch pan.
Cover with buttered bread crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

fields.name: Chicken With Broccoli Curry Sauce
fields.title: Fine Whale Chicken Breast
fields.description: Chicken breasts cooked in a creamy sauce with broccoli, lemon juice, curry powder, and parmesan cheese.
instructions: Cook chicken breasts in aluminum foil.
Add broccoli florets and cook until tender.
In a separate bowl, combine cream of chicken soup, lemon juice, mayonnaise, curry powder, and paprika.
Pour sauce over chicken and broccoli.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Add diced celery, if desired.

fields.name: Chicken And Artichoke Casserole
fields.title: Chicken and Artichoke Casserole
fields.description: A creamy chicken and artichoke casserole baked with mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms in 2 tablespoons butter and set aside.
Put chicken breasts in simmering chicken broth in a single layer. Cover. Cook 30 minutes. Remove from broth (Save 3/4 cup broth). Cool, skin, and bone chicken.
Arrange chicken slightly overlapping in an 8x12 casserole dish.
Top with artichoke hearts.

Melt 1/4 cup butter. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth. Gradually stir in 3/4 cup reserved chicken broth and 3/4 cup light cream. Cook on medium heat and stir as mixture boils and thickens. Blend in Parmesan cheese and 1 tablespoon water.
Pour sauce over artichokes, covering them.
Sprinkle mushrooms down the center.
Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.
You can assemble the casserole ahead of time. Cover and refrigerate.

fields.name: Chicken Patties
fields.title: Chicken and Mushroom Soup
fields.description: A classic comforting soup with chicken and mushrooms.
notes: The OCR text does not contain ingredient or instruction details
Consider adding specific ingredients such as Chicken, Mushrooms, Chicken broth, Vegetables such as onions, celery, and carrots and seasonings to the ingredient list.
Consider adding instructions such as Sauteing the vegetables, simmering the soup, and adding seasonings to the instruction list
fields.comment: Chicken and mushroom soup is a popular classic known for its creamy texture and savory flavors.  It is often served as a comfort food, especially during colder months.

fields.name: Adobo Chicken
fields.title: Adobo Chicken
fields.description: A classic Filipino dish of chicken braised in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and peppercorns.
instructions: Boil chicken in 2 cups of water until tender.
When water has boiled off, add garlic and peppercorns.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, and water to the pot.
Continue to simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened.
fields.comment: Adobo is a dish that originated in the Philippines. It's known for its delicious blend of sweet, sour, and savory flavors.  Many variations exist using other proteins such as pork or seafood.

fields.name: Crockpot Chicken (2)
fields.title: Crockpot Chicken
fields.description: Tender chicken cooked in a creamy cheese sauce in a crockpot.
instructions: Place all ingredients in crock pot.
Cook on high 2-3 hours.

fields.name: Crockpot Chicken
fields.title: Crockpot Chicken
fields.description: Creamy and flavorful crockpot chicken served over rice.
instructions: Put all ingredients in Crock Pot.
Cook on High 4-6 hrs. Stir occasionally.
Serve over rice.

fields.name: Chicken Enchiladas (2)
fields.title: Chicken Enchiladas
fields.description: A classic comfort food, these chicken enchiladas are made with flour tortillas, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, green chilis, and shredded cheese.
instructions: Cut Chicken (Small pieces)
Fry: Add slightly wet chicken
Add Soup & Sour Cream
Bake on bottom

fields.name: Easy Chicken And Rice Casserole
fields.title: Easy Chicken & Rice Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole dish with chicken, rice, mushrooms, and a creamy mushroom soup base.
ingredients: 1 whole fryer chicken, cut up OR 4 chicken breasts
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Sprinkle rice in a 9x13 pan.
Add chicken parts.
Sprinkle onion soup mix and mushrooms over chicken.
Mix soup with water and pour over the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle with cashews (optional).
Cover with foil.
Bake for 1½ hours.
Remove foil and bake for another 30 minutes.

fields.name: Garlic And Lemon Roast Chicken
fields.title: Garlic and Lemon Roast Chicken
fields.description: A flavorful roast chicken recipe using Lipton Recipe Secrets Savory Herb with Garlic Soup Mix.
ingredients: 1 env. Lipton Recipe Secrets Savory Herb with Garlic Soup Mix
2- to 3-lbs. chicken, cut into serving pieces
instructions: In large plastic bag or non-aluminum baking dish, combine onion and soup mix, olive oil and lemon juice.
Add chicken, turning to coat evenly.
Marinate, in refrigerator 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°
Remove chicken and marinade mixture to 9x13-inch baking or roasting pan or leave in baking dish.
Bake chicken uncovered, basting occasionally, 40 minutes or until done.
notes: Variation: For Lemon Roast Chicken, simply use Lipton Recipe Secrets Golden Herb with Lemon Soup Mix and omit lemon juice.
fields.comment: Lipton Recipe Secrets soup mixes were a popular ingredient in the mid-20th century for creating quick and easy weeknight meals.  These packaged mixes offered a convenient way to add flavor to dishes without extensive preparation.

fields.name: Three Chicken Recipes Using Bisquick
fields.title: Impossible Chicken Taco Pie
fields.description: A savory pie filled with chicken, taco seasoning, and cheese, baked to perfection.
instructions: Heat oven to 400°.
In a medium bowl mix chicken, onion and seasoning mix.
Arrange in a greased 9-inch pie plate.
In a medium bowl whisk together baking mix, milk and eggs until blended; pour into pie plate.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake 1 to 2 minutes longer or until melted.
Serve with lettuce, tomatoes and sour cream if desired.

fields.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken And Pasta
fields.title: Campbell's Creamy Pesto Chicken & Bow Ties
fields.description: A creamy pesto chicken and bow tie pasta dish using Campbell's Cream of Chicken soup.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs cubed boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1 can (10.75 oz) Campbell's Cream of Chicken soup OR 98% Fat Free Cream of Chicken Soup
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat butter in a skillet. Add chicken and cook until browned, stirring often.
Add soup, pesto sauce, and milk. Bring to a boil.
Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until done.
Stir in drained pasta and heat through.
fields.comment: Campbell's soup has been a kitchen staple for generations, offering quick and easy meal solutions. This recipe reflects the brand's focus on simple, family-friendly dishes.

fields.name: Chicken Sausage Skillet
fields.title: Chicken Sausage Skillet
fields.description: A flavorful skillet dish with chicken, sausage, and a variety of fresh vegetables served over rice.
ingredients: 1/2 to 3/4 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
1/2 to 3/4 pound Italian sausage links, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained
instructions: In a large skillet, saute the onion, green pepper, mushrooms and zucchini in oil until tender.
Remove vegetables with a slotted spoon; set aside.
Add chicken and sausage to skillet; cook until no longer pink.
Drain.
Stir in tomatoes, garlic, basil and oregano.
Return vegetables to pan.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until heated through.
Serve over rice.
fields.comment: This recipe embodies the spirit of one-pan cooking, reflecting a trend towards convenience and efficiency in the kitchen, especially during weeknights when time is limited. It also aligns with the rising popularity of skillet meals. Dishes like this highlight the versatility of a skillet for creating complete, satisfying meals, reducing the need for excessive cleanup while ensuring robust flavor. While skillet meals have historic roots as a form of rustic cooking, modern interpretations often incorporate a broader range of ingredients and culinary influences, exemplified in this recipe by the blend of Italian sausages with fresh produce and pantry staples. The 'Taste of Home' origin suggests a focus on home-style, approachable cooking with a touch of familiarity, reflecting the publication's style and target audience.

fields.name: Elegant Chicken Salad
fields.title: Elegant Chicken Salad
fields.description: A colorful and flavorful chicken salad perfect for large gatherings, featuring macaroni, chicken, fruits, and nuts.
instructions: Cook macaroni until tender and drain; cool.
Combine coleslaw dressing and mayonnaise; add macaroni, tossing carefully.
Refrigerate for several hours.
Prepare remainder of ingredients, as listed, tossing carefully with macaroni mixture.
Toss just before serving.
Garnish with lettuce leaves. Serve.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted by Deanne Drake and received an excellent evaluation for its flavor, color, and appeal. It's particularly convenient for making ahead and serving large groups.

fields.name: Pecan Chicken With Orange
fields.title: Pecan Chicken with Orange
fields.description: Tender chicken breasts are simmered in a sweet and savory orange-honey sauce, then topped with a pecan-orange sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup PECAN VALLEY ESSENTIAL PECAN PIECES, finely chopped
instructions: In a large skillet, brown chicken in butter on both sides.
Add orange juice, honey, onion and pepper. Season to taste with salt.
Cover loosely and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken from skillet; reserve drippings. Arrange chicken over rice; keep warm.
For sauce, stir water into flour; blend well.
Add to drippings and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Add orange peel and orange sections. Heat thoroughly.
Immediately add pecans and spoon over chicken and rice.

fields.name: Mexican Chicken
fields.title: Merken Chicken
fields.description: Merken spiced chicken breasts cooked in a crockpot and served in tortillas with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and olives.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with Merken spice.
Add chicken to crockpot.
Add sliced black beans
Pour sour cream over chicken and beans.
Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6-8 hours.
Serve chicken and bean mixture in tortillas with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and olives.
fields.comment: Merken is a traditional Chilean spice blend known for its smoky and slightly spicy flavor. It's a great addition to chicken and other meats, adding a unique depth of flavor.

fields.name: Peachy Chicken
fields.title: Peachy Chicken
fields.description: A sweet and refreshing chicken dish served over rice.
ingredients: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)
instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chicken in oil and butter; remove and keep warm.
Add peaches with juice, brown sugar, orange juice and soup mix to skillet; stir until combined.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat; return chicken to pan. Simmer, uncovered, for 15-20 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.
Serve over rice if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Bill Brown of Haddonfield, New Jersey, who suggests serving this dish to guests. It's a stove-top recipe, making it convenient for weeknight cooking.

fields.name: Peachy Chicken Salad
fields.title: Peachy Chicken Salad
fields.description: A refreshing chicken salad with peaches, grapes, and pecans.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon or 1 teaspoon chopped fresh tarragon
instructions: In a large bowl, stir the mayonnaise, milk, salt, pepper and tarragon until smooth.
Add chicken and toss to coat.
Stir in the grapes, peas, peaches and pecans.
Serve in a lettuce-lined bowl if desired.

fields.name: Hot Chicken Salad Casserole
fields.title: Hot Chicken Salad Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring chicken, rice, vegetables, and a creamy sauce, topped with crunchy almonds and potato chips.
ingredients: 6-8 oz. sliced almonds, roasted in butter
instructions: Place all ingredients except the almonds and potato chips in an 11 x 13 baking dish.
Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees.
Crush potato chips and sprinkle over the top.
Roast sliced almonds in butter and sprinkle over the top.
notes: Cook chicken with carrots, onions, and celery for added flavor.
Consider using less mayonnaise and adding Philadelphia cream cheese or sour cream for a different flavor profile.

fields.name: Easy Italian Chicken
fields.title: Easy Italian Chicken
fields.description: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts simmered in a flavorful tomato sauce with mushrooms, basil, and garlic powder, served over spaghetti.
ingredients: 1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
instructions: In a large skillet coated with nonstick cooking spray, cook chicken for 5-6 minutes on each side or until the juices run clear.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan over medium heat, bring tomatoes, mushrooms, basil and garlic powder to a boil.
Combine cornstarch and water; add to tomato mixture.
Return to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Serve chicken over spaghetti; top with tomato sauce.
notes: Nutritional Analysis: One serving (prepared with no-salt-added stewed tomatoes and calculated without spaghetti) equals 177 calories, 178 mg sodium, 73 mg cholesterol; 7 gm carbohydrate, 28 gm protein, 3 gm fat.
Diabetic Exchanges: 3 very lean meat, 2 vegetable.

fields.name: Cranberry Chicken
fields.title: Cranberry Chicken
fields.description: Tender baked chicken breasts are topped with a festive cranberry sauce made with apple, raisins, walnuts, and curry powder.
ingredients: 6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (1-1/2 pounds)
1 large tart apple, peeled and chopped
instructions: Place chicken in a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine the cranberry sauce, chopped apple, raisins, walnuts, and curry powder.
Spoon the cranberry mixture over the chicken.
Bake, uncovered, for another 20-25 minutes, or until chicken juices run clear.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by field editor Linda Rock of Stratford, Wisconsin, suggesting a home-cooked, community-driven origin.  The combination of cranberries and curry powder reflects a trend of blending sweet and savory flavors in the late 20th and early 21st century American cuisine.

fields.name: Chicken With Dilly Ham Sauce
fields.title: Chicken with Dilly Ham Sauce
fields.description: Chicken breasts coated in breadcrumbs and Parmesan, baked, and topped with a creamy ham sauce.
ingredients: 1/2 cup julienned fully cooked ham (1/4 pound)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a shallow dish, combine bread crumbs and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Set aside.
Pound each chicken breast to 1/4-inch thickness.
Brush both sides of chicken with mustard and coat evenly with crumb mixture.
Place chicken in a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
Bake uncovered for 15 minutes, or until juices run clear.
While chicken bakes, sauté ham in butter in a saucepan for 2 minutes.
Stir in flour until smooth and bubbly.
Add cream, dill, and remaining Parmesan cheese.
Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
Spoon sauce over chicken.
Serve with parsley buttered potatoes, if desired.

fields.name: Chicken Bean Casserole
fields.title: CHICKEN BEAN CASSEROLE
fields.description: A hearty casserole with crisp-tender green beans and leftover chicken, perfect for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 8 cups fresh cut green or wax beans, cooked and drained
instructions: In a saucepan, melt butter.
Stir in flour until smooth.
Gradually add broth, milk, soy sauce, salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat.
Stir in 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese until melted.
Add beans and chicken; toss to coat.
Transfer to a greased 2-qt. baking dish; sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Darlene Markel of Mt. Hood, Oregon, who enjoys this casserole as a way to use leftover chicken.

fields.name: Onion Chicken Stuffing Bake
fields.title: Onion-Chicken Stuffing Bake
fields.description: A savory one-dish meal with chicken, stuffing, mushrooms, and water chestnuts, baked until bubbly.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
1 can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts, drained
instructions: Prepare stuffing mix according to package directions; set aside.
Place chicken in a greased 2-qt. baking dish.
Combine the soup, sour cream and soup mix; spread over the chicken.
Sprinkle with mushrooms and water chestnuts.
Spread stuffing over top.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by Audrey Aldrich from Berlin Heights, Ohio, who considers it her favorite dinner to serve guests.

fields.name: Chicken Veggie Casserole
fields.title: CHICKEN VEGGIE CASSEROLE
fields.description: A comforting casserole with chicken, vegetables, and a creamy sauce.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 can (16 ounces) whole kernel corn, drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the soup, milk, thyme, salt and pepper.
Stir in chicken, corn, beans and potatoes.
Pour into a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 15 minutes or until heated through.

fields.name: Chicken Picante
fields.title: Chicken Picante
fields.description: Chicken breasts baked in a flavorful picante sauce mixture, served over rice.
instructions: Place chicken breasts in baking dish.
Cover with mixture.
Bake at 400° for 50 minutes.
Serve over rice.

fields.name: 7-Up Chicken
fields.title: 7-Up Chicken
fields.description: Chicken marinated in a mixture of soy sauce, oil, 7-Up, and garlic powder, then grilled.
instructions: Marinate chicken overnight in the mixture.
Cook slowly on the grill.
fields.comment: 7-Up chicken is a popular dish in outdoor grilling, known for its unique sweet and savory flavor profile from the soda's citrus notes mingling with the soy sauce.  It's believed to have originated in the mid-20th century with the rise in popularity of backyard grilling and convenience cooking.

fields.name: Vermont Curry
fields.title: House Vermont Curry (Mild)
fields.description: A mild Japanese curry made with beef, pork, or chicken, along with onions, potatoes, carrots, and a pre-made curry sauce mix.
ingredients: 1 box House Vermont Curry Sauce Mix
instructions: Cut the meat, onions, potatoes, and carrot into cubes.
Sauté the cubed ingredients in a saucepan until lightly browned.
Add 4 cups (900cc, 1 qt.) of water and bring to a boil.
Cook for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables and meat are tender.
Remove from heat. Break the curry sauce mix into pieces and add to the saucepan.
Cook over low heat for about 20 minutes, or until the curry thickens.
Serve over cooked rice or noodles.
notes: After opening the curry sauce mix box, store it in an airtight container and keep refrigerated.
fields.comment: Vermont Curry, despite its name, is a popular Japanese curry roux brand.  It's known for its unique flavor profile, often described as slightly sweet and fruity, which comes from ingredients like apples, bananas, and honey in the roux.  While the 'Vermont' name might seem misleading, it's believed to be a marketing strategy evoking images of wholesome, natural ingredients.

fields.name: Crunchy Onion Chicken
fields.title: Crunchy Onion Chicken
fields.description: A simple recipe for crunchy onion chicken using French Fried Onions.
ingredients: 1 1/3 cups FRENCH'S Original or Cheddar French Fried Onions
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 1 lb.)
instructions: Place French Fried Onions into plastic bag. Lightly crush with hands or with rolling pin.
Dip chicken into egg; then coat with onion pieces. Place chicken on baking sheet
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes or until no longer pink in center
fields.comment: This recipe leverages the convenience of French Fried Onions as a breading, offering a shortcut to crispy chicken.

fields.name: Chicken And Vegetable Casserole
fields.title: El Shoestring Potatoes
fields.description: Crispy shoestring potatoes boiled then baked until golden brown.
instructions: Boil potatoes in salted water until slightly tender.
Preheat oven to 350°.
Mix Worcestershire sauce and brown gravy mix in water until it forms a smooth paste.
Mix vegetables and  the mushroom liquid.
Add gravy paste to the vegetables.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss the par-boiled potatoes with the sauce.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
fields.comment: Shoestring potatoes get their name from their resemblance to thin shoelaces, offering a crispy texture and versatility in cooking.

fields.name: Chicken Dressing Casserole
fields.title: Chicken Dressing Casserole
fields.description: A classic comfort dish featuring stewed chicken, savory dressing, and a rich sauce, baked to perfection.
ingredients: 1/2 cup chicken fat (skimmed from cooled stock)
instructions: Place stewing hen in a large kettle. Add 1 bay leaf, 1 stalk quartered celery, 1 quartered small onion, salt, and pepper. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 3 hours, or until tender. Allow to cool in the stock.
When cool, remove the chicken meat from the bones and slice. Set aside.
To make the dressing: Sauté the chopped onion in melted butter until slightly browned. Combine with the rest of the dressing ingredients and place in the bottom of a greased baking dish.
Lay slices of chicken on top of the dressing.
To make the sauce: Melt chicken fat in a saucepan. Blend in flour. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly, and continue to cook until thickened.
Beat eggs and gradually pour the thickened mixture over them, stirring constantly. Return to the pan and heat thoroughly, but do not boil.
Pour sauce over the chicken and dressing in the baking dish.
Top with buttered crumbs (1 cup bread crumbs mixed with 4 tablespoons melted butter).
Bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour, covered for the first part of baking.

fields.name: Turkey Pies With Cheese Pastry
fields.title: Turkey Pies with Cheese Pastry
fields.description: Savory turkey and green bean filling baked in individual dishes topped with a flaky cheddar cheese pastry.
ingredients: 1 quart chicken broth or turkey stock
2 packages (9 oz. each) frozen cut green beans, cooked and drained
instructions: In a medium saucepan, saute onions in butter until tender.
Add 1/2 cup flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper, sage, and thyme.
Gradually add broth; cook, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens, 2 to 3 minutes.
Combine with turkey and green beans.
Pour the mixture into six individual baking dishes (2-cup capacity each) or one shallow 3-quart baking dish.
In a bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups flour and 1 teaspoon salt. Cut in shortening and cheese until uniform but coarse. Sprinkle with water, toss with a fork, and press into a ball.
If using individual baking dishes, divide the pastry into 6 parts.
On a lightly floured board, roll out each pastry portion into a circle 1-inch larger than the baking dishes.
Place pastry on filled baking dishes and cut several air vents in each. Trim and flute edges.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 35 minutes, or until pies are golden brown.

fields.name: Swiss And Chicken Casserole
fields.title: Swiss Chicken Casserole
fields.description: A creamy chicken casserole with celery, croutons, Swiss cheese, and walnuts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Mix all ingredients except walnuts.
Pour into a 9x13 inch casserole dish.
Top with walnuts.
Bake for 40 minutes.

fields.name: Cantaloupe With Chicken Salad
fields.title: Cantaloupe with Chicken Salad
fields.description: A refreshing summer dish of chicken salad served in cantaloupe halves.
ingredients: 1-1/2 teaspoons sugar or sugar substitute to equal 1-1/2 teaspoons
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chicken, blueberries, celery, grapes, and almonds.
In a small bowl, mix all dressing ingredients (mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, lemon peel, sugar/substitute, ginger, and salt).
Pour dressing over the chicken mixture and toss gently.
Spoon the chicken salad into cantaloupe halves.
fields.comment: Chicken salad, often served as a sandwich filling or appetizer, has likely existed in some form since the mid-19th century when mayonnaise became popular. The novel twist of serving it in cantaloupe adds a refreshing, summery appeal.

fields.name: Savory Cranberry Turkey Casserole
fields.title: Savory Cranberry Turkey Casserole
fields.description: A delicious casserole featuring cooked turkey, cranberry sauce, and a savory baking mix topping.
ingredients: 4 cups cooked turkey, cut into ½-inch cubes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.
Grease a 9-inch casserole dish.
Combine turkey, onion and thyme.
Spread evenly on the bottom of the pan.
Break up cranberry sauce until smooth.
Spoon cranberry sauce randomly over turkey.
Combine baking mix, milk and eggs in a blender.
Blend on high speed for 1 minute.
Pour over mixture in casserole.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

fields.name: Chicken Stuffing Casserole
fields.title: Chicken Stuffing Mix
fields.description: Chicken breasts stuffed with a savory mix of vegetables and mushroom soup.
instructions: Prepare Stuffing: Combine stuffing mix with chopped carrots, celery, and onion according to package directions.
Preheat oven to 400°.
In a baking pan, create a 'center' of the prepared stuffing mix.
Arrange the 6 chicken breast halves around the stuffing mix.
Mix cream of mushroom soup with milk.
Pour the soup mixture over the chicken breasts and stuffing.
Sprinkle paprika over the chicken and stuffing.
Cover the pan with foil and bake for 15 minutes.
Uncover and bake for 10 more minutes.

fields.name: Chinese Sunday
fields.title: Chinese Sundae
fields.description: A layered dish featuring cooked rice, Chinese noodles, chicken, gravy, cheese, celery, tomatoes, pineapple, almonds, and green onions, topped with coconut and a cherry.
instructions: Layer the ingredients in a sundae glass or bowl in the order listed, starting with rice and ending with the cherry.

fields.name: Mexican Chicken Casserole
fields.title: Chicken and Green Chile Tortilla Bake
fields.description: A cheesy, comforting casserole made with chicken, green chiles, and tortillas.
instructions: Boil chicken breasts until tender, debone and shred.
Tear up tortillas into small pieces.
Mix chicken, tortillas and green chiles.
Place mixture in a baking dish and top with cheddar cheese.
Bake in a 350°F oven. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe is a modern take on classic Mexican flavors, offering a simple yet satisfying meal.  Variations may include adding other cheeses, such as Monterey Jack, or incorporating different chiles for a spicier kick.

fields.name: Turkey Casserole
fields.title: Turkey Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring layers of stuffing, turkey, vegetables, gravy, and mashed potatoes.
ingredients: 1 (12 oz.) bag Birds Eye Steamfresh® Frozen Mixed Vegetables, cooked according to package directions, drained and cooled
instructions: Spread prepared stuffing evenly into a buttered 9 x 13-inch pan.
Layer turkey, followed by vegetables.
Pour gravy over all.
Spread mashed potatoes on top and dot with butter.
Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 30 minutes, or until heated through.
Refrigerate any leftovers.
notes: Added "cooked turkey" to the ingredient list as it was missing from the original text but is necessary for the recipe.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this turkey casserole have been a popular dish since the early 20th century, offering a convenient way to combine leftovers into a hearty and satisfying meal.  They experienced a surge in popularity during the mid-20th century with the rise of convenience foods.

fields.name: Chicken With Bacon
fields.title: Chicken Breasts Wrapped in Bacon
fields.description: Chicken breasts wrapped in bacon, covered in a creamy sauce, and baked.
instructions: Wrap each piece of chicken breast in bacon.
Cover with sour cream and cream of mushroom soup.
Bake covered for 3 hours at 300 degrees F.

fields.name: Broccoli Turkey Casserole
fields.title: Broccoli Turkey Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy casserole with broccoli, turkey, and a blend of flavorful ingredients.
ingredients: 1 can (10.75 ounces) cream of chicken soup
instructions: Blend soup with flour.
Add sour cream; mix well.
Stir in the ¼ cup grated cheese, salt, pepper, onions, broccoli and turkey.
Pour mixture into a two-quart baking dish.
Heat in 350 degree oven for 20 to 30 minutes.
Garnish with cheese and parsley, as desired.

fields.name: Peach Chicken Bake
fields.title: Peach Chicken Bake
fields.description: Chicken and peaches combine with honeyed sweet potatoes in this one-dish meal.
ingredients: 1½ lbs. sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced
instructions: Heat oven to 375°.
Arrange chicken in one layer in a covered baking dish. Scatter potatoes and onion around chicken, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and bake 30 minutes.
Mix brown sugar, honey and orange juice in a small bowl. Drizzle over chicken and potatoes. Bake, uncovered, 30 minutes, basting occasionally.
Add peaches, gently combining. Bake, uncovered, 30 minutes longer, basting occasionally.
Arrange chicken on serving platter. Surround with potatoes and peaches. Serve.

fields.name: Tex-Mex Soup
fields.title: Chili Con Carne Soup
fields.description: This hearty soup transforms chili con carne into a flavorful and slightly spicy meal.
ingredients: 1 lb. ground beef round or chuck
1 (15 oz.) can kidney or pinto beans
instructions: 1. In a large saucepan brown beef over medium heat. When it begins to change color, add onion and garlic and cook until meat is browned and onion is wilted. Drain off excess fat.
2. Add remaining ingredients to pan, combine well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer, stir and cook 30 minutes. Let set for a few minutes before serving.
fields.comment: Chili con carne, meaning "chili with meat" in Spanish, has a rich history in Texas and Mexican cuisine.  It's often debated whether beans belong in true chili, reflecting regional variations.

fields.name: Fruit Chicken Salad
fields.title: Valley Fresh Fruited Chicken Salad
fields.description: A refreshing chicken salad with peaches, grapes, and a tangy honey-poppy seed dressing.
ingredients: 2 (5 oz.) cans or 1 (10 oz.) can Valley Fresh Premium Chunk White Chicken, drained
1/2 cup seedless green grapes, cut in half
1/2 cup seedless red grapes, cut in half
1 oz reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese, shredded
instructions: Mix together sour cream, orange juice, honey, poppy seeds, ginger, and garlic powder (if using).
Add chicken, peach slices, and grapes. Toss gently to coat.
Serve chilled on lettuce and garnish with shredded Monterey Jack cheese.
Store leftovers refrigerated.

fields.name: Swiss Cheese Chicken
fields.title: Poached Egg with Swiss Cheese
fields.description: A simple recipe for a poached egg topped with melted Swiss cheese.
instructions: Heat the buttermilk in a pan over medium heat.
Crack egg into a separate small bowl then gently slide the egg into the simmering buttermilk and cook for 3-4 minutes to desired doneness.
Remove egg with slotted spoon, and place it on a slice of Swiss cheese on a heat-proof plate.
Place under a broiler to melt cheese or broil in a toaster oven at 325° for 1 minute, until bubbly.
fields.comment: Poaching eggs in liquid other than water, such as milk, buttermilk, or stock adds a subtle depth to the flavor of the egg, and using buttermilk also helps to tenderize the whites of the egg.

fields.name: Curry Chicken With Couscous
fields.title: Curried Chicken with Couscous
fields.description: A flavorful dish featuring curried chicken, couscous, and a mix of vegetables.
ingredients: 1 package (5.7 oz.) curry flavor couscous mix
1 lb. TYSON HOLLY FARMS fresh Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, cut into thin strips
1 1/2 cups BIRDS EYE frozen Farm Fresh Mixtures Broccoli, Cauliflower & Red Peppers
instructions: Remove seasoning packet from couscous mix; set aside.
In large nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in vegetables, water, raisins and seasoning packet; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center.
Stir in couscous; cover. Remove from heat; let stand 5 minutes. Stir before serving.
notes: Serving Suggestion: Serve with toasted pita bread rounds.
fields.comment: This recipe leverages pre-cut frozen vegetables and pre-seasoned couscous mix for a quicker weeknight meal, reflecting modern trends in convenient cooking.

fields.name: Italian Skillet Mushroom And Chicken Stew
fields.title: Italian Skillet Mushroom and Chicken Stew
fields.description: A quick and easy one-pan meal with chicken, mushrooms, and Italian-style stewed tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 lb. fresh white mushrooms, quartered (about 5 cups)
4 ozs. fresh green beans, trimmed and halved
instructions: In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil until hot.
Add chicken; cook until brown, 3-4 minutes a side.
Remove chicken from skillet and keep warm.
To skillet, add mushrooms, onion, celery, and garlic; cook, stirring frequently, until tender, 6-8 minutes.
Add tomatoes, salt, and chicken; top with green beans.
Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through, 5-6 minutes longer.
Serve over hot cooked rice, if desired.

fields.name: Turkey And Stuffing Bake
fields.title: Turkey 'N Stuffing Bake
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring cooked turkey, seasoned stuffing, cream of celery soup, and French fried onions.
ingredients: 1 can (2.8 oz.) Durkee French Fried Onions
1 can (10 3/4 oz.) condensed cream of celery soup
instructions: Combine butter and water; stir until butter melts.
Pour over seasoned stuffing crumbs; toss lightly.
Stir in 1/2 can French Fried Onions.
Spoon stuffing mixture into 9-inch shallow baking dish (1 1/2 quart).
Press stuffing across bottom and up sides of dish to form a shell.
Combine soup, milk, turkey and peas; pour into stuffing shell.
Bake, covered, at 350° for 30 minutes.
Top with remaining onions and bake, uncovered, 5 minutes longer.
notes: Three cups leftover stuffing may be substituted for butter, water, and stuffing crumbs.
If stuffing is dry, stir in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until moist but not wet.

fields.name: Baked Pineapple Chicken
fields.title: Baked Pineapple Chicken
fields.description: Chicken breasts baked with pineapple, lemon, and a savory sauce.
instructions: Drain pineapple, reserve juice. Combine reserved juice with garlic, cornstarch, Worcestershire sauce, mustard and rosemary.
Arrange chicken in shallow baking pan or broiler-proof dish, skin side up.
Broil until browned.
Stir sauce; pour over chicken.
Bake at 400° F, 30 min.
Arrange lemon and pineapple slices around chicken.
Spoon sauce from baking pan over all; continue baking 5 min.
Garnish with fresh rosemary or parsley, if desired.

fields.name: Chicken With Zucchini And Tomatoes
fields.title: Chicken with Zucchini and Tomatoes
fields.description: A simple dish of pan-fried chicken breast with zucchini, tomatoes, and Italian seasoning.
instructions: In a non-stick skillet, heat olive oil to medium-high temperature.
Add chicken and cook, turning until brown on both sides, about 10 minutes. Drain, if necessary.
Add zucchini, tomatoes, Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and cook 20 minutes or until chicken and zucchini are fork tender.
Chicken is cooked when juices run clear. Serve with spiced fruit salad and oven-fresh bread sticks.

fields.name: Crispy Garlic Chicken
fields.title: Lipton Crispy Garlic Chicken
fields.description: Crispy garlic chicken made with Lipton Recipe Secrets Garlic Mushroom Soup Mix, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, and bread crumbs.
ingredients: 1 envelope Lipton Recipe Secrets Garlic Mushroom Soup Mix
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine soup mix, mayonnaise, and cheese.
On baking sheet, arrange chicken. Top with soup mixture; sprinkle with bread crumbs.
Bake 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.

fields.name: Chicken Asparagus Pasta Supper
fields.title: Chicken/Asparagus Pasta Supper
fields.description: A one-pan pasta dish with chicken, asparagus, and other fresh vegetables in a creamy sauce.
ingredients: 1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, cut into 2-inch pieces
4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 pound thin spaghetti, cooked and drained
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add asparagus, mushrooms, broccoli, carrots, zucchini, onions and salt.
Cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Remove vegetables from the skillet and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the skillet.
Cook chicken, stirring constantly, for 5-6 minutes or until it is no longer pink.
Return vegetables to the skillet.
Add peas and cook for 3-5 minutes.
Set aside.
For the sauce, melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat.
Stir in flour to form a smooth paste.
Add bouillon cube.
Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until sauce is thickened.
Season with pepper.
Pour sauce over chicken/vegetable mixture and toss to coat.
Serve over spaghetti.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Ginny Truwe of Mankato, Minnesota, who originally used it as a side dish for gatherings but now enjoys it as a full meal with her family.

fields.name: Hot Chicken Salad
fields.title: Hot Chicken Salad
fields.description: A rich and creamy chicken dish topped with crunchy potato chips and almonds.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, soup, celery, mayonnaise, mushrooms and onion.
Stir in cracker crumbs.
Spoon into a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with potato chips and almonds.
Bake 15 minutes longer or until bubbly and lightly browned.
notes: Reduced-fat or fat-free mayonnaise is not recommended for this recipe.

fields.name: Tex-Mex Skillet
fields.title: Tex-Mex Skillet Chicken
fields.description: A quick and easy Tex-Mex skillet chicken recipe with stewed tomatoes, corn, and cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (14-1/2 oz) S&W Mexican Recipe Stewed Tomatoes
1 can (15 oz) S&W Whole Kernel Corn, drained
1 cup (4 oz) shredded Monterey Jack or Pepper Jack cheese
instructions: Cook chicken, onion, and garlic in oil over medium-high heat for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add tomatoes and corn, simmer for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese and heat until melted.
Serve with rice and garnish with cilantro.
fields.comment: This recipe uses canned ingredients for convenience, reflecting the trend of quick and easy cooking.

fields.name: Salmon Stuffed Pita Bread
fields.title: Salmon Stuffed Pita
fields.description: A quick and easy recipe for salmon stuffed pita bread.
ingredients: 6 3/4 cans of salmon, drained and flaked
1/4 cup soft-style cream cheese with chives and onions
instructions: Spread inside of pita bread with cream cheese.
Mix first 5 ingredients (salmon, peas, Italian dressing, tomato, cucumber).
Divide mixture among pitas.
Top with alfalfa sprouts.
fields.comment: Stuffed pita bread is a versatile and convenient meal option, popular in various cultures for its portability and adaptability to different fillings.

fields.name: Tuna Casserole (2)
fields.title: TUNA CASSEROLE
fields.description: A classic tuna casserole recipe with noodles, vegetables, and a cheesy topping.
instructions: Drain tuna.
Cook noodles.
Sauté onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in 2 tablespoons butter.
Combine tuna, drained noodles, sour cream, cottage cheese, grated cheese, and seasonings.
Bake at 325° for 25 minutes.
Garnish with parsley.

fields.name: Seafood Stuffed Tomatoes
fields.title: Seafood-Stuffed Tomatoes
fields.description: A cool and hearty salad with shrimp, crabmeat, eggs, and rice, perfect for a hot summer day.
ingredients: 2 cans (6 ounces each) crabmeat, rinsed, drained and cartilage removed
instructions: Combine the first nine ingredients in a bowl; set aside.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, dill and pepper; mix well.
Pour over rice mixture; toss gently.
Cover and chill for at least 1 hour.
Just before serving, cut a thin slice from the top of each tomato, or scallop the top with a sharp knife.
Scoop out pulp and discard, leaving a 1/2-in.-thick shell.
Fill each tomato with about 1/2 cup of salad.
Serve immediately.
fields.comment: This recipe was contributed by Gwen Landry from Jennings, Louisiana, whose 12-year-old daughter enjoys making it for guests.

fields.name: Tuna Cashew Casserole
fields.title: Tuna and Cashew Casserole
fields.description: A creamy tuna and cashew casserole baked with celery, onion, mushroom soup, and egg noodles.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Sauté celery and onion in butter until softened.
Combine sautéed vegetables, mushroom soup, canned milk, egg noodles, and cashews in a casserole dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles like this tuna and cashew casserole were popular in the mid-20th century as a way to stretch ingredients and create a comforting, family-friendly meal.  The combination of creamy soup, crunchy cashews, and savory tuna provides a balance of textures and flavors.

fields.name: Shrimp Casserole
fields.title: Shrimp Casserole
fields.description: A creamy shrimp casserole baked with rice, vegetables, and a cheesy topping.
instructions: Melt margarine, add onion and celery, Cook slowly until clear (not soft) about 5 min.
Mix soup and mayonnaise together to make sauce.
Add celery, onions, peas, and shrimp to rice.
Pour into 13"x9 greased pan.
Sprinkle with grated cheese.
Pour sauce over the top.
Bake at 350° for 45 min.

fields.name: Hurry Tuna Curry
fields.title: Hurry June Curry
fields.description: A quick and easy curry dish made with tuna, sour cream, and curry powder.
instructions: Cook onion, green pepper, and garlic in butter until tender.
Stir in sour cream, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
Add tuna and heat through.
Serve over rice.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to originate from a time when convenience and speed were highly valued in cooking, likely from the mid-20th century.  "Hurry June" suggests a quick and easy meal for busy individuals or families.

fields.name: Avo-Tuna Bake
fields.title: Avo-tuna Bake
fields.description: A creamy tuna mixture layered over avocado slices and topped with crumbled potato chips, then baked.
instructions: Slice avocados and place on the bottom of 9x13x2-inch baking dish.
Mix remaining ingredients except potato chips.
Cover avocados with tuna mixture.
Crumble potato chips over top of casserole.
Bake in preheated 350° oven for 15 to 20 minutes.

fields.name: Favorite Tuna Casserole
fields.title: Favorite Tuna Casserole
fields.description: A classic tuna casserole recipe with noodles, vegetables, and a cheesy, crunchy topping.
instructions: Cook noodles in unsalted water; drain.
Saute onion, green pepper, and celery in butter for about 5 minutes; mix with noodles.
Add tuna.
Combine soup and milk, add to cooked noodles and sauteed vegetables.
Stir in pimiento, salt, and pepper.
Spoon into greased 2-quart casserole.
Top with cheese and potato chips.
Bake in preheated 350° oven for 30-35 minutes.

fields.name: Salmon Cucumber Sandwich
fields.title: Salmon-Cucumber Sandwiches
fields.description: A simple sandwich with cream cheese, salmon, and cucumber on pumpernickel bread.
instructions: Mix salmon, cream cheese, horseradish, and lemon juice in a blender.
Spread on pumpernickel bread.
Garnish with cucumber slices and alfalfa sprouts.
fields.comment: Open-faced sandwiches, like this salmon-cucumber combination, gained popularity in the mid-20th century as a lighter, more visually appealing alternative to traditional closed sandwiches.  They are often served as appetizers or for luncheons.

fields.name: Seven Seas Casserole
fields.title: Seven Seas Casserole
fields.description: A seafood casserole with crab, shrimp, and vegetables, topped with buttery crumbs.
instructions: Pour in greased baking dish.
Top with buttered crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.

fields.name: Crab Dip
fields.title: Crab Casserole
fields.description: A creamy crab casserole baked in a buttery casserole dish.
instructions: Combine all ingredients except breadcrumbs.
Pour into a buttered casserole dish.
Sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees.
notes: The OCR text is difficult to interpret in some places. '10 creas' and '17 6. hard' are unclear and may need to be verified or adjusted.
Baking time is not specified. Adjust based on the size of the casserole dish and desired level of browning.

fields.name: Tuna Vegetable Supper
fields.title: Tuna Vegetable Supper
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring tuna, cauliflower, carrots, and a creamy mushroom or celery soup base, topped with crunchy cracker crumbs.
ingredients: 1 can (10½ ounces) condensed cream of mushroom or celery soup
1 can (7 ounces) tuna fish, drained and flaked
instructions: Separate cauliflower into small flowerettes.
Cook cauliflower and carrots in boiling salted water until tender-crisp.
Drain the vegetables.
Sauté onion in butter until tender.
Combine sautéed onion, soup, milk, tuna, and nutmeg; mix well.
Place cauliflower and carrots into a 1½-quart casserole dish.
Pour the soup mixture over the vegetables.
Sprinkle with cracker crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes or until slightly browned.

fields.name: Dilly Tuna And Vegetable Toss
fields.title: Dilly Tuna and Vegetable Toss
fields.description: A refreshing salad made with tuna, zucchini, tomatoes, and a dill-infused dressing.
ingredients: 1 can (7 ounces) tuna, drained and flaked
instructions: In a medium bowl combine zucchini, tomatoes and tuna.
Sprinkle with salt, dill, onion and garlic powders, black pepper and lemon juice; toss well!
Refrigerate until ready to serve, at least 30 minutes.
Serve on lettuce leaves, if desired.

fields.name: Lemony Salmon Patties
fields.title: LEMONY SALMON PATTIES
fields.description: Flaky salmon patties baked in muffin cups and served with a tangy lemon sauce.
ingredients: 1 can (14-3/4 ounces) pink salmon, drained, skin and bones removed
instructions: Combine the first nine ingredients (salmon through pepper); mix well.
Spoon into eight greased muffin cups, using 1/4 cup in each.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until browned.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan; stir in the flour to form a smooth paste.
Gradually stir in milk; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Cook for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat; stir in lemon juice, salt and cayenne.
Serve over patties.

fields.name: Tuna Triangles
fields.title: Tuna Triangles
fields.description: Savory tuna, cheese, and ranch filling baked in crescent roll dough.
ingredients: 1 can (12 oz.) Chicken of the Sea Solid White Albacore or Chunk Light Tuna, well drained and flaked
1 can (8 oz.) refrigerated crescent roll dough
instructions: Combine tuna, cheese and dressing.
Separate crescent dough into four rectangles.
On an ungreased baking sheet, press each rectangle to about 4" x 8".
Cut each rectangle in half to form eight squares.
Mound tuna mixture on a diagonal half of each square, leaving a 1/2 border around the filling.
Fold dough squares in half to form triangles; press edges with fork to seal, and cut a slit in top.
Bake at 375°F for 14 to 16 minutes until golden brown.
notes: If desired, up to 1/4 cup chopped peppers, onion, celery or olives may be added to the filling.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the popularity of convenient canned tuna and refrigerated dough products in the late 20th century.

fields.name: Macaroni And Shrimp Salad
fields.title: Macaroni & Shrimp Salad
fields.description: A cold pasta salad featuring shrimp, cheese, eggs, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 lb. Small macaroni, cooked and cooled

fields.name: Seven Layer Salmon Salad
fields.title: Seven Layer Salmon Salad
fields.description: A layered salad featuring salmon, spinach, bean sprouts, and a creamy dill dressing.
ingredients: 3/4 cup sour cream or dairy sour half-and-half
1 (10-ounce) package frozen French-cut green beans, thawed
instructions: Drain salmon, reserving 2 tablespoons liquid, and break into small chunks.
Combine reserved salmon liquid with mayonnaise, sour cream, and dill weed.
Place spinach in a 3 to 4 quart serving bowl.
Add layers of bean sprouts, celery, water chestnuts, grapes, green beans, and salmon.
Spread mayonnaise mixture over salmon.
Cover and chill thoroughly.
To serve, lift out a portion of all layers.
notes: If using fresh green beans, cook about 2 cups until tender-crisp.

fields.name: Layered Salmon And Vegetable Main Dish Salad
fields.title: Layered Salmon and Vegetable Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and flavorful layered salad featuring steamed cauliflower, broccoli, salmon, peas, and a creamy curry-mayonnaise dressing.
ingredients: 1 can (1 lb.) red or sockeye salmon
1 package (10 oz.) frozen peas, defrosted and drained
instructions: Wash and trim cauliflower, break into flowerets, then cut through stems into 1/4-inch thick slices.
Peel broccoli stems and slice 1/4 inch thick, cut large flowers into halves or thirds.

Arrange cauliflower and sliced broccoli stems on a steamer rack, sprinkle lightly with salt. Cover and steam over rapidly boiling water until barely tender, about 5 minutes; add broccoli flowers the last 1 to 2 minutes. Allow to cool.
Drain salmon and break into chunks.
Place lettuce in a 3- to 4-quart glass serving bowl.
Sprinkle with a few of the green onions.
Top with broccoli, a few more onions; then cauliflower and remaining onions.
Spread evenly with salmon and then with frozen peas.
Blend mayonnaise and curry and spread evenly over top.
Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
Sprinkle with peanuts and serve.

fields.name: Avocado Salad Bowl
fields.title: Avocado Salad Bowl
fields.description: A tangy macaroni salad with avocado, tomato, eggs, olives, and French dressing, served on spinach.
ingredients: 2 cups (7 ozs.) shell macaroni, cooked, drained
instructions: Combine macaroni, avocado, tomato, eggs, olives, onion, salt, pepper and French dressing; mix lightly.
Season to taste with hot pepper sauce.
Serve on spinach-covered plates.

fields.name: Colorful Vegetable Slaw
fields.title: COLORFUL VEGETABLE SLAW
fields.description: A crunchy slaw with chopped apple and walnuts.
instructions: Combine ingredients; toss lightly.
Chill.

fields.name: Better Than Potato Salad
fields.title: Better Than Potato Salad
fields.description: A flavorful, easy-to-prepare rice salad that's a refreshing change from traditional potato salad.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine rice, radishes, eggs, cucumber, celery and onion.
Combine mayonnaise, mustard and salt; mix well.
Pour over rice mixture and toss.
Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour.
fields.comment: This rice salad was a runner-up recipe submission from Susan McCurdy of Elmhurst, Illinois. It's a popular alternative to potato salad, especially during warmer months, offering a lighter and often more budget-friendly option.

fields.name: Lemon Rice Salad
fields.title: Lemon Rice Salad
fields.description: A refreshing rice salad with lemon dressing and fresh herbs.
ingredients: 1/4 cup minced fresh basil or 1 tablespoon dried basil
instructions: In a jar with tight-fitting lid, combine the first seven ingredients (oil, vinegar, garlic, lemon peel, sugar, mustard, and salt); shake well.
In a large bowl, combine long grain and wild rice.
Add dressing to rice and toss.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Add the cucumbers, green onions, parsley, basil, and pepper; mix well.
Chill for 2 hours.
Fold in pecans just before serving.
fields.comment: This refreshing salad is wonderful served year-round. People enjoy the combination of flavors. It can be made ahead and still taste great and fresh.

fields.name: Grandma's Gelatin Fruit Salad
fields.title: Grandma's Gelatin Fruit Salad
fields.description: A refreshing fruit salad with layers of lemon and orange gelatin, pineapple, marshmallows, bananas, and a creamy pineapple dressing, topped with shredded cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (20 ounces) crushed pineapple, liquid drained and reserved
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup boiling water and lemon gelatin.
Add 1 cup ice cubes, stirring until melted.
Add crushed pineapple.
Pour into a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan; refrigerate until set.
Repeat steps 1-4 with orange gelatin, remaining water and ice. Stir in marshmallows after the gelatin and ice have been combined.
Pour orange gelatin mixture over lemon layer; refrigerate until set.
For the dressing, combine reserved pineapple juice, sugar, egg, cornstarch, and butter in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
The next day, arrange sliced bananas over the set gelatin.
Combine the chilled dressing with whipped topping.
Spread the dressing mixture over the bananas.
Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
fields.comment: This recipe is a family favorite, passed down from Wilma McLean of Medford, Oregon, and is especially popular with her grandchildren and sons. It's a great option for both family dinners and potlucks.

fields.name: Seven Fruit Salad
fields.title: Seven-Fruit Salad
fields.description: A refreshing fruit salad with a citrusy twist.
instructions: In a small bowl, combine lime juice, water, and sugar.
Add sliced nectarine and banana to the lime juice mixture.
In a 2 1/2 quart glass bowl, combine the remaining strawberries and grapes.
Add the nectarine and banana mixture from the small bowl to the larger bowl with the strawberries and grapes.
Mix gently.
Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Serve with a slotted spoon.

fields.name: Frozen Cranberry Banana Salad
fields.title: Frozen Cranberry Banana Salad
fields.description: A luscious frozen salad combining the sweet and tangy flavors of cranberry and banana with a creamy, crunchy texture.
ingredients: 5 medium firm bananas, halved lengthwise and sliced
1 carton (12 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: Drain pineapple juice into a medium bowl; set pineapple aside.
Add bananas to the juice.
In a large bowl, combine cranberry sauce and sugar.
Remove bananas, discarding juice, and add to cranberry mixture.
Stir in pineapple, whipped topping and nuts.
Pour into a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. dish.
Freeze until solid.
Remove from the freezer 15 minutes before cutting.
fields.comment: This refreshing salad, with its light pink color and delicate banana flavor, is perfect for special occasions like bridal showers or ladies' luncheons, as suggested by the original recipe contributor.

fields.name: Raspberry Gelatin Ring
fields.title: Raspberry Gelatin Ring
fields.description: A refreshing and visually appealing layered gelatin dessert with cream cheese, sour cream, and raspberries.
ingredients: 2 packages (10 ounces each) frozen sweetened raspberries, thawed and drained
2 cans (8 ounces each) crushed pineapple, undrained
instructions: In a bowl, dissolve gelatin in water.
Stir in the raspberries, pineapple, and salt.
Pour half into an 8-cup ring mold coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm.
Let remaining gelatin mixture stand at room temperature.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sour cream until smooth.
Carefully spread over gelatin in mold.
Top with remaining gelatin mixture.
Refrigerate for 6 hours or until firm.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home magazine in October/November 2001, submitted by Ardis Rollefson from Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

fields.name: Picnic Rice Salad
fields.title: Picnic Rice Salad
fields.description: A refreshing rice salad with chopped eggs, celery, green pepper, onion, pimientos, dill pickle relish, mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, and French dressing, served on a bed of lettuce.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients.
In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, salad dressing, salt and pepper.
Fold into the rice mixture.
Serve in a lettuce-lined bowl.
Refrigerate leftovers.
fields.comment: This rice salad recipe comes from Carol Galow, a cook from Bay City, Texas, whose husband is a farmer. She developed it to promote the rice industry in her area.

fields.name: Peachy Applesauce Mold
fields.title: Peachy Applesauce
fields.description: A chilled dessert made with applesauce, peaches, and whipped cream.
ingredients: 2 tsp fresh lime or lemon juice
Whipping cream, whipped with 2 tbsp sugar
instructions: In a 2.5-quart saucepan, soften gelatin in the carbonated beverage.
Place over moderate heat, stirring constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in applesauce, peaches, and lime/lemon juice.
Stir occasionally until mixture mounds when dropped from a spoon.
Sprinkle peaches with lime/lemon juice to prevent darkening.
Fold whipped cream, mace, and vanilla into the thickened gelatin mixture.
Chill until firm.

fields.name: Oriental Delight Salad
fields.title: Zurak
fields.description: A shredded cabbage and lettuce salad with a toasted sesame seed, almond, and ramen noodle dressing.
instructions: Toast sesame seeds, almonds, and noodles separately under broiler.
Watch carefully so they don't burn.
Stir together and put in a container.
Combine shredded cabbage, lettuce, and diced green onions.
Add dressing just before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe, attributed to Fern Walter, features on a vintage recipe card likely from the 1970s or 80s, printed by CURRENT, INC., COLORADO SPRINGS, CO.  The use of ramen noodles in a salad dressing reflects culinary trends of the time incorporating convenient packaged foods.

fields.name: Tomato Aspic Salad
fields.title: Tomato Aspic Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and savory gelatin salad featuring canned tomato sauce, celery, peas, and shrimp or crab.
instructions: Dissolve jello in hot water.
Add tomato sauce, salt, and vinegar.
Let stand until beginning to set.
Fold in crab or shrimp, celery, and peas.
Pour into a mold.
fields.comment: Tomato Aspic was a popular dish in the mid-20th century, often served as a side dish or salad at luncheons and parties.  Its unique combination of sweet, savory, and jiggly textures made it a conversation starter, though it has fallen out of favor with many modern palates.

fields.name: Hawaiian Salad
fields.title: Rawaiian Salad
fields.description: A refreshing fruit salad with a creamy vanilla pudding base.
ingredients: 1 package (4.75 oz) vanilla pudding (cook & serve type)
1 (15 oz) can pineapple - drained - save juice
1 can mandarin oranges - drained - save juice
1 heaping tablespoon frozen orange juice concentrate
instructions: Mix both puddings together.
Combine the juices from the drained fruits and add enough water to make 3/4 cup.
Cook the pudding mixture according to package directions and let cool.
Fold the cooled pudding into the fruit.
Chill in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Copper Pennies
fields.title: Copper Pennies
fields.description: Copper Pennies are sweet and tangy glazed carrots.
instructions: Let stand for several hours.
Cut your carrots before baking them.

fields.name: Frozen Pink Champagne Salad
fields.title: Frozen Pak Champagne Salad
fields.description: A creamy, frozen fruit salad featuring cream cheese, pineapple, strawberries, bananas, and Cool Whip.
instructions: Mix cream cheese and sugar.
Add pineapple and strawberries.
Fold in Cool Whip.
Pour into a 9x13 pan, two smaller pans, or individual containers.
Freeze for at least 6 hours before serving.

fields.name: Instant Fruit Salad
fields.title: Instant Fruit Salad
fields.description: A quick and easy fruit salad made with canned fruit, pineapple juice, and instant lemon pudding.
ingredients: 1 can (16 oz) pineapple tidbits or chunks, undrained
instructions: Drain fruit cocktail and mandarin oranges.
Combine fruit and pineapple juice.
Sprinkle pudding powder over fruit and stir until blended.
Serve immediately.
notes: Other fruits, such as bananas or seedless grapes, may be added if desired.
Salad may also be made with other flavors of instant pudding - such as coconut, banana, or pineapple.
fields.comment: Instant pudding mixes were introduced in the 1950s and quickly became popular for their ease.  This recipe reflects the trend of using convenience products in desserts.

fields.name: Holiday Ribbon Gelatin
fields.title: Holiday Ribbon Gelatin
fields.description: A festive layered gelatin dessert with lime, lemon, and cherry flavors.
instructions: In a bowl, dissolve lime gelatin in 2 cups boiling water.
Add 2 cups cold water; stir.
Pour into a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. dish; refrigerate until set, about 1 hour.
In a bowl, dissolve lemon gelatin in 1 cup boiling water.
Stir in marshmallows until melted.
Cool for 20 minutes.
In a small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth.
Gradually beat in lemon gelatin.
Stir in pineapple.
Carefully spoon over the lime layer.
Chill until set.
Dissolve cherry gelatin in 2 cups boiling water.
Add the remaining cold water; stir.
Spoon over the lemon layer.
Refrigerate overnight.
Cut into squares.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in a publication, submitted by Jenny Hughson from Mitchell, Nebraska, and highlights the layered appearance of the dessert making it visually appealing for the holidays.

fields.name: Chilled Rice Salad
fields.title: CHILLED RICE SALAD
fields.description: A refreshing cold rice salad with chicken flavor, olives, green onions, green pepper, artichoke hearts, and a curry-mayonnaise dressing.
ingredients: 1 package (6.9 ounces) chicken-flavored rice mix with vermicelli
2 jars (6-1/2 ounces each) marinated artichoke hearts, marinade drained and reserved
instructions: Prepare rice mix according to package directions, except substitute 1 teaspoon oil for butter called for.
Cool.
Add olives, green onions and green pepper; toss to mix.
Cut the artichokes into quarters and add to rice mixture; set aside.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, curry powder and reserved marinade; blend well.
Pour over rice mixture; toss to mix.
Cover and chill for at least 2 hours.
fields.comment: A family favorite summer salad by JoAnn Hall from Waverly, Iowa, often doubled to satisfy everyone's appetite for seconds.

fields.name: Pasta Salad
fields.title: Pasta Salad
fields.description: A refreshing pasta salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, green peppers, olives, artichoke hearts, and zesty Italian dressing.

fields.name: South Of The Border Salad
fields.title: South of the Border Salad
fields.description: A refreshing salad with kidney beans, cucumber, onion, green pepper, tomato, and a spicy mayonnaise dressing, served on lettuce with crumbled bacon.
instructions: Combine all ingredients except lettuce and bacon.
Refrigerate.
Just before serving, tear lettuce into bite size pieces.
Fry bacon until crisp, and crumble.
Combine all ingredients and serve immediately.

fields.name: Fluffy Fruit Salad
fields.title: FLUFFY FRUIT SALAD
fields.description: A light and refreshing fruit salad with a fluffy whipped topping.
ingredients: 1 can (20 ounces) unsweetened pineapple tidbits, drained
1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: In a bowl, combine pineapple, cranberry sauce, and oranges.
Fold in whipped topping and orange peel.
Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.
Garnish with pecans just before serving.
Store leftovers in the refrigerator.
notes: Nutritional Analysis: One 1/2-cup serving (prepared with light whipped topping) equals 138 calories, 10 mg sodium, 0 cholesterol, 23 gm carbohydrate, 1 gm protein, 5 gm fat.
Diabetic Exchanges: 1-1/2 fruit, 1 fat.
fields.comment: This recipe is designed to be lower in fat, sugar, and salt, aligning with health-conscious trends. The inclusion of nutritional information and diabetic exchanges further emphasizes this focus. Fruit salads have long been a popular dessert or side dish, offering a refreshing and naturally sweet treat.

fields.name: Springtime Pasta Salad
fields.title: Springtime Pasta Salad
fields.description: A simple make-ahead pasta salad perfect for picnics, parties, or potlucks.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water.
Place in a large bowl.
Add zucchini, olives, red pepper and onion.
Combine remaining ingredients (mayonnaise, sour cream, dill weed, salt, ground mustard, pepper, and garlic salt); pour over salad and toss to coat.
Cover and chill 2 hours.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Vicki Schrupp of Little Falls, Minnesota, and is perfect for springtime gatherings.

fields.name: Cucumber And Avocado Salad
fields.title: Cucumber Avocado Salad
fields.description: A refreshing salad with cucumbers, avocado, lemon juice, vinegar, and a hint of dill.
instructions: Peel and slice cucumbers.
Peel and slice avocado.
Sprinkle with lemon juice and vinegar.
Chop onion into small pieces.
Toss all ingredients together.

fields.name: Raspberry Jell-O With Sour Cream And Marshmallows
fields.title: Raspberry Jello Dessert
fields.description: A layered dessert featuring raspberry jello, applesauce, sour cream, and miniature marshmallows.
instructions: Dissolve jello in boiling water.
Layer jello, applesauce, sour cream and top with marshmallows.

fields.name: Oriental Style Orange Slaw
fields.title: Oriental-Style Orange Slaw
fields.description: A refreshing slaw with cabbage, oranges, water chestnuts, green onions, ramen noodles, and a sweet and sour dressing.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed shredded red and/or green cabbage
2 navel oranges, peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces
1 (3-oz.) pkg. ramen noodle soup mix, any flavor
instructions: In a bowl, toss together shredded cabbage, oranges, water chestnuts, and onions.
Reserve broth packet from soup mix for another use.
Crumble noodles into salad.
Pour Sweet and Sour Dressing over mixture; toss well to coat with dressing.
Cover and chill 30 minutes or more before serving to allow flavors to blend.
notes: Sweet and Sour Dressing: 1/2 cup rice or cider vinegar
2 Tbsps. granulated sugar
2 tsps. sesame or vegetable oil
1/4 tsp. pepper
Few drops bottled hot pepper sauce
In a jar with lid, combine vinegar with sugar, oil, pepper and pepper sauce.
Cover and shake until well-blended.
Makes about 3/4 cup.
Cook's Tip: To prepare slaw as an entree, add 3 cups chopped cooked chicken.
fields.comment: This recipe reflects the American culinary trend in the mid-20th century of incorporating Asian-inspired flavors and ingredients, often using convenience items like canned water chestnuts and ramen noodle soup mix.  The term "Oriental" is now considered outdated and insensitive. More appropriate terminology includes "Asian-style" or specifying a particular region like "Chinese-style" or "Japanese-style."

fields.name: Festive Cranberry Salad
fields.title: Festive Cranberry Salad
fields.description: A cool and tangy salad with tart cranberries, sweet pineapple, and pecans in a fluffy base.
ingredients: 1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
instructions: In a bowl, combine milk and lemon juice; mix well.
Stir in pineapple, cranberry sauce, marshmallows, pecans and food coloring if desired.
Fold in whipped topping.
Spoon into a 9-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Freeze until firm, 4 hours or overnight.
Cut into squares.
fields.comment: This tangy salad is a popular choice, likely due to its combination of flavors and ease of preparation.

fields.name: Layered Jell-O Salad
fields.title: Layered Jello Salad
fields.description: A colorful and refreshing layered dessert made with different flavored jello and yogurt.
ingredients: 1 small pkg. (3 oz) each of lime, lemon, orange, strawberry, raspberry, and blackberry jello (total 6 pkgs.)
1 (16 oz) container of vanilla or plain yogurt
instructions: Start with the lime jello. Add the jello to 1 cup of boiling water.
Divide the lime jello mixture in half.
In one half of the lime jello, add 1/3 cup of yogurt and mix until smooth.
Pour the clear lime jello into an 8x8x2 inch clear glass pan and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Carefully pour the lime-yogurt mixture on top of the first layer and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Repeat the process for each package of jello, using the order of colors listed above (lemon, orange, strawberry, raspberry, blackberry).
When ready to serve, top with whipped cream or cool whip.

fields.name: Cranberry Salad
fields.title: Cranberry Salad
fields.description: A festive salad with cranberries, celery, pineapple, raspberry jello, and walnuts.
instructions: Dissolve jello in boiling water.
Add remaining ingredients and set.

fields.name: Cinnamon Candy Salad
fields.title: Cinnamon-Candy Salad
fields.description: A sweet and fruity salad with cinnamon candies, lemon jello, and applesauce.
instructions: Dissolve candies and jello in water (Over heat if necessary.)
When cool, add applesauce and lemon juice.

fields.name: Frozen Salad
fields.title: Frozen Salad
fields.description: A refreshing frozen dessert salad with fruit and whipped topping.

fields.name: Fruit Salad
fields.title: Fruit Salad
fields.description: A refreshing mix of Cool Whip, yogurt, mandarin oranges, and your choice of fruits.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Serve promptly.

fields.name: Overnight Salad For Eight
fields.title: Overnight Salad
fields.description: A layered salad with a variety of vegetables, topped with mayonnaise, sugar, and parmesan cheese, chilled overnight.
ingredients: Red and green bell pepper, sliced
instructions: In a 2-quart salad bowl, place the lettuce at the bottom.

Layer the remaining vegetables in the bowl: sliced zucchini, cucumber, chopped onion, sliced radishes, sliced red and green pepper, and cooked peas.  You can use all or a combination of these, or any other vegetables you like. Some other options are canned corn niblets (drained), small diced beets, or chopped green beans. Avoid tomatoes as they are too juicy.
Spread mayonnaise generously over the top of the salad, sealing the edges well.
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar and parmesan cheese over the top.
Refrigerate overnight.

fields.name: Fruit Salad (2)
fields.title: Fruit Salad
fields.description: A refreshing fruit salad with mandarin oranges, pineapple, coconut, marshmallows, and sour cream.
instructions: Make the night before.

fields.name: Cookie Salad
fields.title: Grandma's Primrose Cookie Salad
fields.description: A sweet and refreshing dessert salad made with vanilla pudding, fruit, and cookies.
instructions: Mix together pudding mix and milk.
Add Cool Whip and mix.
Fold in drained mandarin oranges and pineapple tidbits.
Add shortbread cookies and mix gently.

fields.name: Frozen Jell-O Ice Cream Salad
fields.title: Jello Mold
fields.description: A refreshing frozen dessert featuring jello, ice cream, pineapple, and nuts.
instructions: Dissolve jello in hot water.
Add ice cream and stir until melted.
Stir in drained pineapple, mandarin oranges, and chopped nuts.
Pour into a jello mold and freeze until solid.
fields.comment: Jello molds were a popular dessert in the mid-20th century, often served at potlucks and holiday gatherings.  They offer a cool and refreshing treat, especially during warmer months.  The variety of flavors and additions, like fruit and nuts, make them customizable to individual preferences.

fields.name: Fruit Salad (3)
fields.title: Fruit Salad
fields.description: A simple fruit salad with a creamy, sweet dressing.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Marinate overnight.

fields.name: Pineapple Cheese Salad
fields.title: Pineapple Cheese Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and creamy salad with the tropical sweetness of pineapple and a tangy lemon flavor.
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in hot water and add lemon juice.
Cool.
Combine pineapple and sugar, then bring to a boil.
Add pineapple mixture to the gelatin mixture when cool.
Add cheese.
When almost starting to jell, fold in whipped cream.
fields.comment: This type of congealed salad was a popular party dish in the mid-20th century.

fields.name: Cranberry Jell-O Salad
fields.title: Cranberry Jello Salad
fields.description: A sweet and tart jello salad with cranberries, pineapple, celery, and bananas.
ingredients: 1 (20 oz) can crushed pineapple, drained (use as part of the jello liquid)
instructions: Make jello.
When it is slightly set, add other ingredients.
Chill.

fields.name: Jell-O Salad
fields.title: Jello
fields.description: A layered Jello dessert featuring raspberries, pineapple, banana, and pecans, topped with sour cream.
ingredients: 1/8 of a can of crushed pineapple
instructions: Dissolve Jello in boiling water.
Add frozen raspberries, crushed pineapple, sliced bananas and pecans to the dissolved Jello.
Top with sour cream.

fields.name: Reunion Salad
fields.title: Russian Salad
fields.description: A sweet and fruity pasta salad with a creamy dressing.
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup Acini De Pepe (Ronzoni) or Micoroni
1 can mandarin oranges or 3 cans drained mandarin oranges
instructions: Combine sugar, flour, and salt in a saucepan.
Whisk in pineapple juice and egg yolks, Set aside.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Add lemon juice, miniature marshmallows, and pineapple tidbits.
Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and cool.
Combine cooled pasta and the pineapple mixture in a bowl.
Cover and let stand overnight.
The next day, add drained mandarin oranges or crushed pineapple.
Stir to combine. Let sit for a few hours before serving.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to be a variation of what's traditionally called a Russian Salad in Italy. In Italy, such salads don't contain any savory vegetables or potatoes. These are mainly sweet salads, usually based on fruit and pasta or rice, with custard or whipped cream bases.

fields.name: Shell Macaroni
fields.title: Shell Odle Me
fields.description: A recipe from Shell Odle Me.

fields.name: Pineapple Cheese Salad (2)
fields.title: Pineapple Cheese Salad
fields.description: A sweet and tangy retro salad made with lime jello, pineapple, whipped cream, and cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 pint whipped cream or Dream Whip (mixed)
instructions: Boil together crushed pineapple, lemon juice, and sugar for 10 minutes.
Let the pineapple mixture cool in the refrigerator.
Dissolve the lime jello in 2 cups of hot water.
Let the jello set until syrupy.
Add the cooled pineapple mixture to the syrupy jello.
Let the mixture set until it begins to thicken.
Fold in the whipped cream or Dream Whip and the grated cheddar cheese.
Pour into a 9x13 inch pan and refrigerate until firm.
fields.comment: This recipe is a classic example of a mid-20th century molded salad, often served as a side dish or dessert. These salads were popular for their ease of preparation and make-ahead convenience.

fields.name: Taco Salad For A Brunch
fields.title: Taco Salad for a Bunch
fields.description: A hearty taco salad perfect for large gatherings.
instructions: In a saucepan, cook and stir beef and onion until beef is no longer pink and onion is translucent. Drain if necessary.
Stir in ketchup, chili powder, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Cool.
Tear lettuce, then in a large bowl, combine lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, olives and cooled beef mixture.
