Combine mayonnaise and salsa and pour over ingredients in bowl just before serving. Toss to coat. Serve with corn chips.
fields.comment: Taco salad became popular in the United States during the 1960s, coinciding with the rise of convenience foods and casual dining.  It's often served in restaurants with a fried tortilla bowl.

fields.name: Macaroni Salad
fields.title: Macaroni Salad
fields.description: A sweet and creamy macaroni salad with carrots, green pepper, and red onion.
instructions: Cook macaroni al dente; drain and rinse in cold water.
In a large serving bowl, combine the macaroni and vegetables.
In a small bowl, whisk the mayonnaise, sweetened condensed milk, sugar, vinegar, salt and pepper until smooth.
Pour over the macaroni mixture and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
fields.comment: This recipe was shared by Lindy Hatch and served at a memorial meal.

fields.name: Three Salad Recipes
fields.title: BOW TIE PASTA SALAD
fields.description: A fruity and colorful pasta salad with bow tie pasta, craisins, grapes, celery, mandarin oranges, pineapple, and cashews.
ingredients: 1 bunch of red or green grapes, cut in halves
instructions: Cook pasta; drain.
Add ingredients for a main dish.
Add marinated chicken or shrimp.
Coat with dressing.

fields.name: Rainbow Pasta Salad
fields.title: Rainbow Pasta Salad
fields.description: A colorful and creamy pasta salad with a sweet and tangy dressing.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon celery seed or 2 celery ribs, chopped
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Rinse in cold water and drain; place in a large bowl.
Add carrots, onion, green pepper and celery seed.
In another bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
Pour over pasta mixture; toss to coat.
Cover; refrigerate 8 hours or overnight.

fields.name: Sweet Potato Salad
fields.title: Sweet Potato Salad
fields.description: A classic sweet potato salad with mayonnaise, mustard, eggs, celery, and green onions.
instructions: Place sweet potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water.
Cover and boil gently until the potatoes can easily be pierced with the tip of a sharp knife, about 30-45 minutes. Drain.
When potatoes are cool, peel and dice.
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and salt.
Stir in eggs, celery and onions.
Add potatoes; stir gently to mix.
Cover and refrigerate for 2-4 hours.

fields.name: Lemon Couscous Salad
fields.title: Lemon Couscous Salad with Spinach, Scallions, and Dill
fields.description: A refreshing and flavorful couscous salad with lemon, spinach, scallions, and dill.
ingredients: 1 small bunch spinach, coarse stems discarded and leaves washed thoroughly, spun dry, and shredded fine (about 2 cups)
instructions: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil and stir in couscous and salt.
Remove pan from heat and let couscous stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork and transfer to a bowl.
Stir in lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
Cool couscous completely.
Stir in spinach, scallions, and dill.
Chill salad, covered, at least 2 hours or overnight.
fields.comment: From Gourmet SA

fields.name: Bean Salad
fields.title: Bean Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and colorful salad made with a variety of beans, green pepper, onion, and a tangy vinaigrette.
instructions: Combine all bean ingredients in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, combine 1/2 cup sugar, 1/3 cup vinegar, 1/2 cup salad oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper.
Toss the dressing and bean mixture together.
Let stand covered in the refrigerator overnight.

fields.name: Tuna Pasta Salad
fields.title: TUNA PASTA SALAD
fields.description: A refreshing cold pasta salad with tuna, carrots, and a creamy dressing.
ingredients: 1 package (7 ounces) small shell pasta, cooked and drained
1 can (6 ounces) tuna, drained and flaked
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine pasta, tuna, carrot and onion.
Combine remaining ingredients; whisk until smooth.
Pour over pasta mixture and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.

fields.name: Tomato Bean Salad
fields.title: Tomato Bean Salad
fields.description: A refreshing salad with kidney beans, tomato, celery, green onions, and a creamy dressing.
ingredients: 1 cup canned kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a bowl, combine the first four ingredients.
In another bowl, combine mayonnaise, ranch dressing, dill and garlic powder.
Pour over vegetables and toss to coat.
Place lettuce in a serving bowl; add vegetable mixture.
Toss just before serving.

fields.name: Italian Tuna Walnut Toss
fields.title: Italian Tuna Walnut Toss
fields.description: A refreshing salad with tuna, walnuts, and various vegetables tossed in a light vinaigrette.
ingredients: 3/4 cup Marie's refrigerated Lite & Zesty Italian Vinaigrette Dressing
2 cans (6.1/8 ounces each) Chicken of the Sea Albacore Tuna in Spring Water (or 1 12 1/4 ounce can), drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, cucumber, olives, walnuts, tomatoes and dressing; toss to mix well.
Gently fold in tuna.
Cover; refrigerate until serving time, at least 4 hours.

fields.name: Fruit Salad Supreme
fields.title: Fruit Salad Supreme
fields.description: A refreshing fruit salad with a creamy lemon-infused dressing and a pecan topping.
instructions: Mix cream cheese, milk, lemon peel and lemon juice.
Beat whipping cream and confectioners' sugar in chilled small bowl until stiff.
Fold cream cheese mixture into whipped cream mixture.
Mix ½ cup of the cream cheese mixture and apple slices.
Layer melon, apple mixture and grapes in 3-quart bowl.
Top with remaining cream cheese mixture, sprinkle with pecans.

fields.name: Hidden Treasure Strawberry Salad
fields.title: Hidden Treasure Strawberry Salad
fields.description: A layered dessert salad featuring strawberry gelatin, fruit, pecans, and a creamy sour cream surprise.
ingredients: 10 oz. pkg. frozen sliced strawberries, partially thawed
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in boiling water; stir in fruit and pecans.
Pour half of gelatin mixture into 9 x 13 pan.
Chill until firm.
Store remaining mixture at room temperature.
Spread sour cream over set gelatin.
Spoon remaining gelatin mixture over sour cream.

fields.name: Warm Tomato-Potato Salad
fields.title: Warm Tomato-Potato Salad
fields.description: A warm potato salad with tomatoes, bacon, and sugar snap peas.
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh or frozen sugar snap peas
instructions: Core tomatoes and cut into large chunks to make about 3 cups.
In a large saucepan, place potatoes; cover with water and cook over medium heat until tender, about 10-15 minutes. Drain potatoes and set aside.

In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp, 3-5 minutes; stir occasionally. With a slotted spoon transfer bacon to paper towel, drain. Remove all but 1 tablespoon drippings from skillet.
Stir in onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 5-7 minutes.
Stir in sugar, flour, salt, and pepper; stir until smooth.
Stir in vinegar, water, and sugar snap peas; cook and stir until mixture boils and thickens slightly, 1-2 minutes.
Stir in reserved potatoes and bacon.
Transfer mixture to serving plate.
Add reserved tomatoes, mixing gently to coat.
notes: Use tomatoes held at room temperature until fully ripe.

fields.name: Zucchini Apple Slaw
fields.title: Zucchini-Apple Slaw
fields.description: A refreshing slaw featuring zucchini, apples, and a tangy vinegar dressing.
ingredients: ¼ cup thinly sliced green onions
2 to 3 medium red or green-skinned tart apples
instructions: Combine mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and caraway seeds; mix until well blended.
In a large bowl, combine zucchini and onions.
Core apples, peel if desired, and cut into 1/2-inch chunks (you should have about 3 cups).
Add apples to zucchini mixture.
Pour dressing over salad and mix lightly until well coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 4 hours.
With a slotted spoon, transfer salad to serving bowl.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from "Fresh Ways with Salads" by Sunset Books & Sunset Magazine.

fields.name: Nutty Tuna Salad Pitas
fields.title: Nutty Tuna Salad Pitas
fields.description: A quick and easy tuna salad recipe with a nutty twist, served in pita pockets with mixed greens.
ingredients: 1 (6-oz.) can StarkistⓇ Light or White Tuna, drained and chunked
2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon or 1 tablespoon dried tarragon
instructions: In a medium mixing bowl, combine tuna, feta cheese, celery, apples, nuts and tarragon; mix well.
Stir in salt and pepper.
Line each pita bread pocket with 1/2 cup leaf lettuce, fill with 1/4 cup tuna mixture.
fields.comment: Tuna salad became popular in the United States in the early 20th century with the rise of canned tuna.  Adding nuts, like walnuts in this recipe, provides a textural and flavor contrast that elevates the classic dish.

fields.name: Sauerkraut Salad
fields.title: Sauerkraut Salad
fields.description: A sweet and tangy salad with sauerkraut, vegetables, and Italian dressing.
instructions: Mix the sauerkraut and sugar together in a bowl.
Let the mixture marinate for 2 hours.
Drain the sauerkraut mixture.
Add the chopped green onions, chopped green pepper, chopped celery, and pimentos to the drained sauerkraut.
If desired, add a few drops of green food coloring.
Moisten the salad with Italian dressing and mix well.
fields.comment: Sauerkraut salads are a common dish in many cuisines. They offer a unique balance of sweet and sour flavors and provide probiotics from the fermented sauerkraut.

fields.name: Creamy Crunchy Tuna Walnut Salad
fields.title: Creamy Crunchy Tuna Walnut Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and flavorful salad featuring tuna, walnuts, green onions, and creamy ranch dressing.
ingredients: 2 cans (6 1/8 ounces each) Chicken of the Sea Albacore Tuna in Spring Water (or 1 can, 12 1/4 ounces), drained
1/2 cup Marie's refrigerated Regular or Lite & Luscious Creamy Ranch or Sour Cream and Dill Dressing
Sweet pepper, tomato or cucumber halves (optional)
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, green onions, dressing, and walnuts.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
If desired, serve in seeded sweet pepper, tomato, or cucumber halves with additional dressing. Garnish with slivers of carrot and red pepper.
fields.comment: Tuna salad is an American classic, appearing in cookbooks as early as the late 19th century.  The addition of walnuts adds a satisfying crunch and healthy fats.

fields.name: Vegetable Salad
fields.title: Vegetable Salad
fields.description: A marinated vegetable salad with a sweet and tangy vinegar dressing.
instructions: Boil vinegar, sugar, and olive oil until blended.
Let the mixture cool.
Pour the mixture over the vegetables.
Marinate for 2 hours.
fields.comment: This type of marinated vegetable salad, often called 'refrigerator salad,' was particularly popular in the mid-20th century as a make-ahead dish for potlucks and picnics.

fields.name: Swanson Garden Chicken Salad
fields.title: Swanson Garden Chicken Salad
fields.description: A quick and easy chicken salad with salad greens, canned chicken, cucumber, tomato, and Italian or Ranch dressing.
ingredients: 8 cups salad greens torn in bite-size pieces
2 cans (5 oz. each) or 1 can (10 oz.) Swanson Premium Chunk White Chicken, drained
1/2 cup fat free Italian or Ranch salad dressing
instructions: Toss salad greens, chicken, cucumber and tomato.
Top with dressing.

fields.name: Finger Jell-O
fields.title: Finger Jello
fields.description: A simple and fun jello recipe.
instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Pour into molds and chill until set.
fields.comment: Jello molds were a popular dessert in the mid-20th century, often served at parties and potlucks. Their jiggly texture and bright colors made them a fun treat for kids and adults alike.

fields.name: Jell-O Salad (2)
fields.title: Jello Salad
fields.description: A refreshing fruit-filled jello salad with raspberries, pineapple, bananas, and pecans, topped with sour cream.
instructions: Dissolve jello in boiling water.
Add frozen raspberries and crushed pineapple.
Add sliced bananas and chopped pecans.
Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch pan.
Chill until set.
Top with sour cream before serving.
fields.comment: Jello salads were a popular dessert in the mid-20th century, often served at potlucks and holidays. Variations included different flavors of jello and various fruits and nuts.

fields.name: Jell-O Salad Supreme
fields.title: JELLO SALAD SUPREME
fields.description: A layered gelatin salad with a creamy, tangy, and crunchy combination of ingredients.
instructions: Combine lemon and lime jello and dissolve in 2 cups of hot water.
Let the jello mixture start to set (about 25 minutes).
Add canned milk, cottage cheese, crushed pineapple, horseradish, celery, and mayonnaise (or Miracle Whip) to the partially set jello.
Fold in the chopped nuts.
Sprinkle with paprika.
fields.comment: Jello salads were popular in the mid-20th century, often featuring unusual combinations of sweet and savory ingredients. This recipe reflects the trend of that time period with creamy and crunchy additions to create a unique dessert.

fields.name: Egg Salad Peters
fields.title: Egg Salad Pitas
fields.description: A flavorful egg salad made with a unique blend of seasonings, served in pita bread.
instructions: In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, prepared mustard, pepper, celery salt, paprika, dried basil, and salt.
Stir in the hard-cooked eggs, shredded cheddar cheese, chopped onion, grated carrot, and crumbled bacon.
Spoon about 1/2 cup of the egg salad mixture into each pita half.
Add lettuce and tomatoes, if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe was created by Ricquel Stinson from Mt. Orab, Ohio, through a process of experimentation with different seasonings in her egg salad and validated by a friend.

fields.name: Toasted Turkey Sandwiches
fields.title: Toasted Turkey Sandwiches
fields.description: Toasted turkey and ham sandwiches with a special cranberry mayonnaise sauce.
ingredients: 12 slices buttered French bread (1/2 inch thick)
instructions: Make six sandwiches, dividing turkey and ham evenly between bread.
In a shallow bowl, beat eggs and milk.
Dip sandwiches, turning to coat both sides.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter.
Brown sandwiches on both sides.
Combine the mayonnaise and cranberry sauce; mix well.
Serve with sandwiches.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Patricia Kile of Greentown, Pennsylvania, suggesting a regional or personal touch to the dish. The inclusion of both turkey and ham, along with the cranberry sauce, hints at a potentially festive or holiday-inspired meal.

fields.name: Olive Beef Sandwich
fields.title: Olive Beef Sandwich
fields.description: A flavorful sandwich featuring roast beef, a vibrant olive mixture, guacamole, and fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 can pitted California ripe olives, drained and finely chopped
1 pound cooked rare roast beef, thinly sliced
instructions: For olive mixture: stir together chopped olives, sour cream, onion, anchovy paste, garlic and thyme. (Makes about 1 cup.)
To assemble sandwich: split bread in half lengthwise; butter both sides.
Arrange leaf lettuce on bottom half of bread.
Spread a heaping tablespoon olive mixture on lettuce.
Top with 2 tomato slices, about 2 tablespoons guacamole, 1/4 cup shredded lettuce and 2 1/2 ounces roast beef.
Spoon on a dollop of sour cream and a heaping tablespoon olive mixture.
notes: May be served on toasted English muffin instead of French bread.

fields.name: Beef And Cheese Wraps
fields.title: Beef 'n' Cheese Wraps
fields.description: Flour tortillas filled with cream cheese, carrots, Monterey Jack cheese, roast beef, and lettuce, rolled up and chilled.
ingredients: 1 carton (8 ounces) onion and chive cream cheese spread
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1 pound thinly sliced cooked roast beef
instructions: Spread one side of each tortilla with cream cheese; top with the carrots and Monterey Jack cheese.
Layer with beef and lettuce.
Roll up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Cut in half or into 1-in. slices.

fields.name: Cheese Soup
fields.title: Cheese Soup
fields.description: A creamy and comforting cheese soup with vegetables.
instructions: Sauté onion in butter.
Add flour, cornstarch, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes.
Add milk and chicken stock.
Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until thickened and there is no starchy taste.
Add vegetables and season to taste.
Just before serving, add parsley.

fields.name: Cheesy Potato Soup
fields.title: Cheesy Potato Soup
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy potato soup recipe from Fern Walter.
instructions: Combine potatoes, onion, and water in a pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender.
In a separate skillet, melt butter.
Add flour to the melted butter and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture bubbles.
Remove from heat and stir in milk until smooth.
Return to heat and stir until thickened.
Slowly stir the milk mixture into the cooked potatoes.
Cook and stir until thick.
Add cheese and seasonings, and stir to combine.
notes: Added flour and milk to ingredients as they are implicitly used in instructions.
Clarified the amount of water needed as "enough to cover potatoes".
fields.comment: This recipe card likely originates from the late 20th century given the publisher information and stylistic elements, a time when creamy soups and casseroles were household staples.

fields.name: Minestrone Soup
fields.title: Minnestrone Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup with bacon, beans, vegetables, and pasta.
instructions: Brown 6 slices Bacon.
Saute in Bacon grease 2 cups diced onions and 1 cup diced celery.
Add 3 cloves minced garlic and 2 tsp. crushed Basil.
Drain off excess grease.
Add 2 cans Beef Broth Soup, 2 cans Bean with Bacon Soup, and 3 soup cans water.
Add 2 cans of cut-up tomatoes, 2/3 cup uncooked small tube macaroni, and 1 tsp salt.
Bring to a boil.
Add 2 cups chopped cabbage and 2 cups cubed zucchini.
Cook for 15 minutes, or until done, stirring occasionally.

fields.name: Potato Soup
fields.title: Potato Soup
fields.description: A hearty and creamy potato soup.
instructions: Fill pot with water. Bring to a boil.
Add chopped onion and carrots, boil for 20-30 minutes.
Add salt and potatoes, boil for 30-35 minutes.
Mash half of the soup mixture, and add the unmashed portion back in
Add potato flakes to desired thickness.
Add margarine, salt, and pepper to taste.

fields.name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
fields.title: Bronco Cheese Soup
fields.description: A cheesy and flavorful soup featuring broccoli, cheddar cheese, and a hint of onion.
ingredients: 2 c. shredded Cheddar or Swiss cheese
instructions: Heat milk until simmering.
Cook broccoli and onion in milk until tender (10 min.)
Cream together butter and flour until smooth.
Add to milk and stir with wire whisk until blended.
Cook & stir 3 min.
Remove from heat & stir in cheese & salt.
Stir until cheese melts.
Serve immediately.

fields.name: Tomato Soup
fields.title: Tomato Soup
fields.description: A classic tomato soup recipe with bacon and sour cream.
ingredients: 1/4 pound bacon, diced and cooked until crisp
instructions: Cook diced bacon until crisp, drain off all but 1 tablespoon of drippings.
Cook chopped onion in bacon drippings until soft and transparent.
Stir in condensed tomato soup with 1 can of water.
Cut the whole peeled tomatoes into chunks and add to the soup.
Add oregano and sugar.
Cook for 15-20 minutes.
Garnish with bacon and sour cream.

fields.name: Cheddar Vegetable Chowder
fields.title: Cheddar-Vegetable Chowder
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful chowder with cheddar cheese, vegetables, and milk.
instructions: Combine milk, potatoes, carrots, and onion in a large pot. Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Add peas.
In a small bowl, combine flour, mustard, and water. Add to the hot vegetable mixture.
Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and add cheese.
Add Worcestershire sauce and pepper.

fields.name: Cheese Soup (2)
fields.title: Cheese Soup
fields.description: A creamy and comforting cheese soup perfect for Christmas or open house gatherings.
instructions: Cook carrots, onion, and celery, cubed, in water until tender.
Cook frozen peas as directed on the package.
Stand jar of Cheese Whiz in hot water to soften and melt.
Melt butter and add enough flour to form a soft paste. (Note: Amount of flour not specified in original text)
Stirring constantly, gradually add hot water and chicken broth.
Stir until it comes to a boil and thickens.
Add vegetables and cheese.
notes: The original recipe does not specify the amount of flour to use when making the paste with butter.  Start with a small amount (e.g., 1-2 tablespoons) and add more as needed to reach desired consistency.
fields.comment: Cheese soup, often using processed cheese like Cheese Whiz, became popular in the mid-20th century due to its convenience and creamy texture. It's a classic dish for gatherings and holidays.

fields.name: Corn Cheese Chowder
fields.title: Corn Cheese Chowder
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy chowder with corn, potatoes, and bacon.
ingredients: 1 small onion, cut in half and sliced
2 cups Cheddar cheese, cut into small cubes
instructions: Cook bacon until almost crisp; remove from fat with slotted spoon.
Saute onions in hot fat. Remove from fat before they begin to brown.
Cube raw potatoes and cook in 2 cups water just until tender. Drain water and reserve.
Use the potato water to make up the 2/3 cups hot water, adding water as needed.
Put all ingredients, except cheese, in heavy kettle and heat to simmering point.
Remove from heat; stir in cheese and serve immediately.

fields.name: Savory Chicken Stew
fields.title: Savory Chicken Stew
fields.description: A quick and easy chicken stew with taco seasoning, beans, corn, and tomatoes.
ingredients: 3 cups shredded cooked chicken or turkey
1 pkg (1.25 oz.) dry tacos seasoning mix
2 cans (14.5 oz each) S&W Ready Cut Diced Tomatoes, undrained
1 can (15 oz) S&W Black or Kidney Beans, drained
1 can (8.75 oz) S&W Whole Kernel Corn, drained
1 can (4 oz) diced green chilies, drained
instructions: Cook onion and garlic in oil in large saucepan until tender.
Add cooked chicken, taco seasoning, tomatoes, beans, corn and chilies.
Blend broth and cornstarch; add to saucepan.
Bring to boil; reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
notes: For dessert, consider adding S&W Natural Style Sliced Cling Peaches to cheesecake with caramel and nuts. This is not part of the stew recipe.
fields.comment: Stews are a great way to use leftover cooked chicken or turkey.  Adding taco seasoning gives this stew a unique and flavorful twist, reflecting the popularity of fusion cuisine.

fields.name: Lentil And Beef Stew
fields.title: Lentil and Beef Stew
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful stew combining beef, lentils, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 to 1½ lbs. beef stew meat (cut into ¾ inch pieces)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Put vegetable oil and pepper in large skillet or pan.
Place beef in pan and brown meat, drain off fat.
Place beef bouillon granules, water, chili powder and undrained tomatoes in a large pan or Dutch oven and cover with lid or foil.
Bring the mixture to a boil, and bake in the oven for 1 hour. Keep it covered.
Add carrots, lentils, and onion, bake for another 45 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
Add a little more water if the stew gets too thick.
When cooking is complete season with salt and pepper as desired.

fields.name: Creamy Cauliflower Soup
fields.title: CREAMY CAULIFLOWER SOUP
fields.description: A rich and filling soup that can be a meal in itself, or a starter for dinner.
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets (about 5 cups)
instructions: In a saucepan, cook cauliflower in enough water to cover until tender.
Drain and reserve liquid; set aside.
In the same saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender.
Add flour; cook and stir until bubbly.
Add broth; bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat and stir in 1 cup cooking liquid, cream and Worcestershire sauce.
Stir in cauliflower and salt.
Remove from the heat.
Add cheese and stir until melted.
Sprinkle with chives or parsley.
fields.comment: This creamy cauliflower soup, submitted by Angel Berube from Prince George, British Columbia, is versatile enough to be served as a hearty meal on its own with a side salad and rolls, or as an elegant first course for a dinner party.

fields.name: Crab Soup
fields.title: Crab Soup
fields.description: A creamy crab soup with a hint of pineapple and vinegar.

fields.name: Potato Cheese Soup
fields.title: Potato - Cheese Soup
fields.description: A creamy and comforting soup made with potatoes, carrots, celery, onions, and cheese.
instructions: Boil potatoes, carrots, celery, and onions in 3 cups of water until tender.
Make a sauce by mixing together margarine, flour, milk, and Velveeta cheese.

fields.name: Butter Bean Soup
fields.title: Butter Bean Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup featuring butter beans, vegetables, and herbs.
ingredients: 1 1/2 quarts vegetable broth OR chicken broth
2 cans (15 oz. each) large lima beans (butter beans), rinsed and drained, OR 3 cups cooked dry-packaged large lima beans (butter beans)
instructions: In a stockpot, sauté carrots, celery and onion in butter until onion is tender, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Add broth, beans and tomato, heat to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until carrots and celery are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
Stir in parsley, basil, thyme and salt.

fields.name: Baasque Vegetabile Chowder
fields.title: Basque Vegetable Chowder
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful vegetable chowder with lima beans, corn, tomatoes, and a touch of cheese.
ingredients: 4 cans (15 oz. each) large lima beans (butter beans), rinsed and drained, OR 6 cups cooked dry-packaged large lima beans (butter beans)
1 can (16 oz.) whole kernel corn, drained
4 ounces (1 cup) shredded Monterey Jack cheese OR sharp cheddar cheese
instructions: In a stockpot, sauté celery and onion in butter until tender, for 5 to 8 minutes.
Add flour and cook, stirring, 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Add milk and remaining ingredients, except cheese, and heat just to simmering (do not boil); simmer, covered, for minutes.
Place half the broth mixture in a blender or food processor. Cover and blend until smooth.
Repeat with remaining broth mixture.
Return mixture to the stockpot.
notes: The recipe mentions adding bacon and parsley after blending, but these are not listed in the ingredients.  If desired, add them to the ingredient list and incorporate them into the instructions as follows: Sautee diced bacon until crisp.  Set aside, reserving bacon grease. Saute celery and onion in reserved bacon grease. Just before serving stir in bacon and fresh chopped parsley.
fields.comment: While the name suggests a Basque origin, this recipe seems to be a modern American creation.  It reflects trends in American cuisine that embrace convenience with canned goods while striving for a touch of international flair.

fields.name: Sausage And White Bean Soup
fields.title: Sausage and White Bean Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup with Italian sausage, white beans, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs sweet or hot ground Italian sausage
2 medium carrots, peeled and in medium dice
2 medium celery stalks, in medium dice
3 (15.8 ounce) cans great Northern or other white beans, un-drained
instructions: Heat oil in a large, deep sauté pan or soup kettle over medium heat. Cook sausage until well browned; drain fat. Remove from pan.
Add onions, carrots, celery and thyme to the empty skillet; cook, stirring often, until well browned, 8-10 minutes.
In a small bowl, mash one can of beans with a fork into a chunky puree.
Add broth, whole and mashed beans and sausage; cover and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer, partially covered, to blend flavors, 20 minutes.
Let rest 10 minutes, serve.

fields.name: Hearty Chicken And Rice Soup
fields.title: Hearty Chicken and Mini Rice Soup
fields.description: A warm and soothing chicken and rice soup, perfect for when you're feeling under the weather or just want a comforting meal.
instructions: Combine chicken broth, onion, celery, carrots, parsley, pepper, thyme, and bay leaf in a Dutch oven.
Bring to a boil, stir once or twice.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 10-15 minutes.
Add cooked chicken and simmer uncovered for 5-10 minutes, or until heated through.
Remove and discard bay leaf.
Stir in cooked rice and lime juice just before serving.
Garnish with lime slices.
fields.comment: Chicken soup is often considered a traditional remedy for colds and illness, offering comfort and nourishment.

fields.name: Garbanzo Bean Soup
fields.title: Garbanzo Bean Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful meatless soup featuring garbanzo beans, corn, tomatoes, potatoes, and a blend of spices.
ingredients: 10 oz. Corn, white kernel, canned, drained
instructions: In slow cooker, combine garbanzo beans, tomatoes, potatoes, oregano, parsley, cumin, corn, onion, green pepper, chili powder and red pepper flakes.
Cook on low 6-7 hours.
fields.comment: This recipe was submitted to GRIT, a publication known for its rural and small-town focus, by a reader in the 1940s.

fields.name: Christmas Crab Soup
fields.title: Christmas Crab Soup
fields.description: A creamy, festive soup featuring crab, asparagus, and mushroom flavors.
ingredients: 2 large bottles of pimientos, cut in small pieces
instructions: Combine asparagus soup, cream of mushroom soup, whipping cream, milk, chopped green onions, vinegar, crab meat, peas, and pimientos in a large pot.
Add a combination of fruit juices to taste, such as apple, pear, pineapple, and cherry, or use a pre-made blend like the one available at Bill's.
Simmer until heated through.
Serve with cheese sticks.

fields.name: Baked Potato Soup
fields.title: Baked Potato Soup
fields.description: A creamy and comforting soup made with baked potatoes, bacon, cheese, and milk.
ingredients: 16 cup Potatoes, baked, cooled, peeled, cubed (about 4 cups)
instructions: In large soup kettle or Dutch oven, melt butter.
Stir in flour; heat and stir until smooth.
Gradually add milk, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Add potatoes and onions.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat; simmer for 10 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients, then stir until cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.

fields.name: Son-Of-A-Gun Stew
fields.title: Son-of-a-Gun Stew
fields.description: A hearty stew with beef, bacon, and vegetables.
instructions: Fry bacon in a 12-inch Dutch oven.
Add onions and meat.
Saute until brown.
Add vegetables and seasonings.
Cover and simmer about 1 hour or until vegetables are tender.

fields.name: Priscilla'S Vegetable Chowder
fields.title: Priscilla's Vegetable Chowder
fields.description: A hearty and creamy vegetable chowder served in bread bowls.
instructions: Put vegetables, water and bouillon in large soup kettle.
Simmer until potatoes are just tender.
Make white sauce by melting margarine in large bowl in microwave.
With a wire whip, stir in flour.
Cook mixture until it bubbles, about 2 minutes.
Slowly add milk, stirring constantly.
Continue cooking, stirring every three minutes, until mixture thickens.
Add to vegetables.
Simmer combined white sauce and vegetable mixture for 10 minutes longer.
Add cheese, salt and pepper.
Stir to melt cheese and serve in bread dough bowls.
fields.comment: This recipe is from Rhodes Bake-N-Serve, suggesting a tie-in with their bread dough products for serving.

fields.name: Lentil Soup
fields.title: Lentil Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful lentil soup made with beef bouillon, vegetables, and lentils.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in large kettle.
Bring to boiling.
Reduce heat and simmer about two hours or until done.

fields.name: Beef Chowder With Bacon
fields.title: Beef Chowder With Bacon
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful chowder featuring ground beef, bacon, and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 cans (10.75 ounces each) condensed cream of potato soup
instructions: Cook bacon pieces in a Dutch oven or large skillet over moderate heat until crisp and lightly browned, turning often.
Drain bacon on absorbent paper.
Remove all but 2 tablespoons bacon drippings from the Dutch oven.
Add ground beef and cook over moderate heat until lightly browned, stirring frequently.
Add celery and onion and cook until vegetables are softened.
Add cream of potato soup, milk, salt and carrots and heat through

fields.name: Corn And Frank Chowder
fields.title: Corn and Frank Chowder
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful chowder made with bacon, frankfurters, corn, and potatoes.
ingredients: 1 can (1 lb.) whole kernel corn, drained
1 tall can evaporated milk (1 and two-thirds cups)
instructions: Fry bacon in large skillet or kettle until crisp.
Add frankfurters and brown lightly.
Add onion, potatoes, corn, seasonings and water.
Bring to boil.
Cover and cook over low heat until potatoes are tender, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Add evaporated milk and heat to serving temperature. Do not boil.

fields.name: Four Soups From Homemaking
fields.title: Homemade Soups
fields.description: A collection of homemade soup recipes.

Cheese Soup-Print-Shop: 6 oz chicken base or 24 bullion cubes

Minnestrone Soup: 3 cans soup water (likely refers to water added to condensed soup, amount may vary)

Cheese Soup-Print-Shop: Dice carrots, onion, and celery and parboil.
Melt Cheez Whiz in 2 inches of boiling water.
Boil 1 1/2 gallons of water, add chicken base, and simmer.
Make a thickening with butter and flour.
Add thickening to chicken base and water, stir until creamy.
Remove from heat and add melted Cheez Whiz.
Stir in drained vegetables and yellow food coloring.
Add frozen peas and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring often.

Sweetheart Soup: Combine tomato soup, water or milk, blended tomatoes, oregano, sauteed onion, and sugar.
Top with cheese, bacon bits, and sour cream.

Minnestrone Soup: Brown bacon, onion, celery, garlic, and basil.
Stir in soups, water, tomatoes, macaroni, and salt.
Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Add cabbage and zucchini, cook for 15 minutes, or until done, stirring occasionally.

Brattens Famous Clam Chowder: Drain clam juice and pour over onion, celery, and potatoes. Add water to cover and simmer.
Melt butter, add flour, and whisk.
Add milk and continue whisking to prevent scorching.
Once thickened, add to vegetables and clams.

Quick Scones: Scald milk and add shortening. Cool to lukewarm.
Sift dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder, sugar).
Add milk mixture and yeast to dry ingredients. Blend well and knead.
Roll out dough and cut into shapes.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown.

fields.name: Olive Garden Toscana Soup
fields.title: Olive Garden Toscana Soup
fields.description: A creamy, flavorful soup inspired by the Olive Garden classic, featuring sausage, potatoes, kale, and a rich broth.
ingredients: 2 medium potatoes, cut in half length-wise, then cut in 1/4-inch slices
2 cups cavallo greens (kale can be substituted), cut in half, then sliced into 1/16-inch strips
1 1/2 cups sausage link - spicy, pre-cooked, cut in half length-wise, then cut at an angle into 1/2-inch slices
instructions: Place sausage link onto sheet pan and bake in 300 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until done.
Place onions and bacon into 3 to 4 quart saucepan and cook onions over medium heat until the onions are almost clear.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add chicken bouillon, water and potatoes, bring to a simmer for 15 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients then simmer for 5 more minutes and serve.

fields.name: Southwestern Stew
fields.title: Southwestern Stew
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful stew with beef, vegetables, and southwestern spices.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: In a 4-quart Dutch oven over medium heat, brown meat in oil, drain.
Add the water, onion, salsa, garlic, parsley flakes, beef bouillon granules, and cumin; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add carrots, return to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add tomatoes, green beans, corn, and chilies; return to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until beef and vegetables are tender.
Season with hot pepper sauce if desired.
Serve over rice (optional).
notes: Diabetic Exchanges (per serving, prepared with lean meat and low-sodium tomatoes and without salt and hot pepper sauce): 3 lean meat, 1 starch, 1 vegetable, 1/2 fat
fields.comment: This stew, adapted from a recipe by Linda Russell of Forest Lakes, Arizona, offers a flavorful and hearty meal while being mindful of sugar, salt, and fat content.  It reflects the trend of adapting traditional recipes to accommodate health-conscious diets.

fields.name: Cauliflower Ham Chowder
fields.title: Cauliflower Ham Chouder
fields.description: A creamy and comforting soup featuring cauliflower, ham, and a flavorful broth.
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of potato soup
instructions: Cook cauliflower in chicken broth until almost tender (about 10 minutes).
In a separate bowl, combine the cream of potato soup and light cream.
Blend water, cornstarch, and pepper together.
Stir the cornstarch mixture into the potato soup mixture.
Pour the soup mixture over the cooked cauliflower.
Cook and stir until thickened.
Stir in the diced ham.
Simmer over low heat for 10 minutes.
Garnish with parsley.
fields.comment: This recipe combines the heartiness of a traditional chowder with the lightness and health benefits of cauliflower, creating a dish that is satisfying and easy to make.

fields.name: Crab Chowder Supreme
fields.title: Crab Chowder Supreme
fields.description: A creamy and flavorful crab chowder made with condensed potato soup, crab meat, corn, and spices.
instructions: Cook onion and celery in butter until tender.
Add remaining ingredients (except parsley) and bay leaf.
Cook about 15 minutes.
Remove bay leaf.
Garnish with parsley.

fields.name: Oven Stew
fields.title: Oven Stew
fields.description: A slow-cooked stew made with beef, carrots, potatoes, and a creamy sauce.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a dutch oven.
Bake at 275° for 6-8 hours.

fields.name: Potato Soup (2)
fields.title: Perrito Simp
fields.description: A creamy and savory soup featuring bacon, potatoes, corn, and evaporated milk.
ingredients: 1 lb bacon, cut up and sauteed
instructions: Sauté bacon until cooked.
Add onion and cook until transparent.
Add potatoes, evaporated milk, and water to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Add drained whole kernel corn and cream-style corn.
Season with seasoned salt.

fields.name: Taco Soup
fields.title: Taco Soup
fields.description: A quick and easy taco soup recipe.
instructions: Brown Hamburger.
Mix and simmer with canned food.
Pour over taco chips.
Top with grated cheese and sour cream.
fields.comment: This recipe, shared by Jodie Broderick, appears to be a family favorite passed down from Fern-Walter.  It represents a simple and convenient style of cooking, likely popular in the latter half of the 20th century when canned and pre-prepared foods became increasingly accessible. The use of Pace Salsa suggests a preference for a Tex-Mex flavor profile.

fields.name: Sausage Green Chowder
fields.title: Sausage Bean Chowder
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful chowder with sausage, beans, and vegetables.
instructions: In a skillet, brown the sausage and drain off the fat.
In a large kettle, combine everything except the potatoes and green pepper.
Simmer covered for 1 hour.
Add the potatoes and green pepper.
Cook covered for 15 minutes more, or until the potatoes are tender.
Remove the bay leaf.

fields.name: Ground Beef Soup
fields.title: Ground-Beef Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup made with ground beef, vegetables, and simple seasonings.
ingredients: 6 whole fresh tomatoes, peeled and quartered
instructions: Brown beef slowly in hot fat in heavy kettle.
Add onions and cook 5 minutes.
Loosen meat from bottom of kettle.
Add remaining ingredients, except tomatoes.
Bring to boil.
Cover and simmer 20 minutes.
Add tomatoes, and simmer 10 minutes longer.

fields.name: Sausage Bean Soup
fields.title: Sausage Bean Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup made with Italian sausage, beans, tomatoes, and broth.
ingredients: 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) butter beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 tablespoon minced fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil
instructions: In a large saucepan, cook sausage, onion and garlic until the sausage is browned; drain.
Add beans, tomatoes, broth and basil.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle each serving with Parmesan cheese.

fields.name: Cider Beef Stew
fields.title: Cider Beef Stew
fields.description: A hearty beef stew simmered in apple cider, perfect for a chilly evening.
ingredients: 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: In a bowl or bag, combine flour, salt and pepper; add beef and toss to coat.
In a saucepan, brown beef in oil.
Add cider, water, vinegar and thyme; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour and 45 minutes or until meat is tender.
Add carrots, celery, potato and onion; return to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
fields.comment: This recipe was a gift to the submitter, Carol Hendrickson, when she was a new bride and is a cherished winter meal.

fields.name: Party Potatoes
fields.title: Party Potatoes
fields.description: Creamy, cheesy mashed potatoes baked in a casserole dish.
instructions: Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender.
Drain; mash potatoes.
Beat in the cream cheese, sour cream, milk, garlic salt and chives; beat until well blended.
Transfer to a greased shallow 3-qt. baking dish.
Drizzle potatoes with melted butter and sprinkle with paprika.

fields.name: Celery Potato Chowder
fields.title: Celery Potato Chowder
fields.description: A thick and easy soup made with leftover mashed potatoes, celery, mushrooms, and corn.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of celery soup, undiluted
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: In a large saucepan, saute the onion, celery and mushrooms in butter until tender.
Add the corn, soups, milk and potatoes.
Cook and stir over medium heat until heated through.
Garnish with bacon.
fields.comment: This recipe was created by Deborah Johnson of Calgary, Alberta over 20 years ago and has become a family favorite, often made by her daughters.

fields.name: Potato And Cabbage Soup
fields.title: Potato and Cabbage Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup made with potatoes, cabbage, ham, and simple seasonings.
instructions: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, saute onion in butter until tender.
Add the water, cabbage, potatoes, bouillon, pepper and garlic.
Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Stir in ham; heat through.

fields.name: Hearty Garlic Potato Soup
fields.title: Hearty Garlic Potato Soup
fields.description: A comforting potato soup recipe with Italian sausage, garlic, and a touch of parsley.
ingredients: 8 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
instructions: Place potatoes, carrot and garlic in a Dutch oven and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain.
Place 3 cups potato mixture in a bowl and mash. Set aside mashed potatoes and remaining potato mixture.
In a skillet, cook sausage and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain and set aside.
In a soup kettle, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth; gradually add the milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until soup is thickened.
Add the parsley, salt, bouillon, seasoned salt and pepper; mix well. Add the mashed potato mixture; cook and stir until heated through. Add the reserved potato and sausage mixtures. Heat through.
fields.comment: This hearty garlic potato soup recipe was contributed by Beth Allard from Belmont, New Hampshire, who adapted a basic potato soup recipe by adding her own unique touches.

fields.name: Cabbage Patch Stew
fields.title: Cabbage Patch Stew
fields.description: A hearty and healthy stew perfect for a chilly evening.
ingredients: 2 cans (16 ounces each) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook the beef, celery and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink and vegetables are tender.
Add the remaining ingredients; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour or until cabbage and carrots are tender.
fields.comment: This stew is designed to be lower in fat, sugar, and salt, aligning with health-conscious cooking trends. The recipe includes nutritional information and diabetic exchanges, reflecting growing awareness of dietary needs.

fields.name: Garden Chowder
fields.title: GARDEN CHOWDER
fields.description: A creamy and savory chowder brimming with fresh garden vegetables like potatoes, celery, cauliflower, carrots, and broccoli.
instructions: In a Dutch oven or soup kettle, saute green pepper and onion in butter until tender.
Add the diced potato, celery, cauliflower, carrot, and broccoli along with the water, bouillon cubes, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour and milk until smooth. Stir this mixture into the soup pot.
Bring the soup back to a boil, stirring constantly for 2 minutes.
Add the parsley.
Just before serving, stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Darlene Markel of Sublimity, Oregon, highlighting the use of fresh, seasonal vegetables.

fields.name: Easy Sausage Chowder
fields.title: Easy Sausage Chowder
fields.description: A hearty summer soup flavored with fresh basil and smoked sausage.
ingredients: 1 pound fully cooked smoked sausage, halved and thinly sliced
1 medium onion, quartered and thinly sliced
2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley or 2 teaspoons dried parsley flakes
1 tablespoon minced fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil
1 can (15-1/4 ounces) whole kernel corn, drained
instructions: In a soup kettle or Dutch oven over medium heat, brown the sausage and onion.
Slowly add the potatoes, water, parsley, basil, salt and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Add remaining ingredients; cook 5-10 minutes longer or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from Suzanne Ververka of White Cloud, Michigan, suggesting a regional influence on the dish.

fields.name: Hearty Cauliflower Soup
fields.title: HEARTY CAULIFLOWER SOUP
fields.description: A creamy and flavorful soup featuring cauliflower, carrots, smoked sausage, and cheese.
ingredients: 1 pound fully cooked smoked sausage, cubed
instructions: In a saucepan, cook cauliflower and carrots in water until tender; set aside (do not drain).
In a skillet over medium heat, brown the sausage and onion; drain.
Add flour, salt and pepper.
Gradually add the milk; bring to a boil.
Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Add cauliflower, carrots and cooking liquid; heat through.
Stir in the cheese until melted.

fields.name: Cabbage Patch Soup
fields.title: Cabbage Patch Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup with ground beef, beans, cabbage, and spices.
ingredients: 1 can (16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, brown beef; drain.
Add onion and celery; cook until tender.
Add water, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, chili powder and salt; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until cabbage is tender.
Top each bowl with mashed potatoes if desired.

fields.name: Spicy Potato Soup
fields.title: Spicy Potato Soup
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful soup made with ground beef, potatoes, and a spicy kick.
instructions: In a Dutch oven or large kettle, brown ground beef.
Drain.
Add potatoes, onion and tomato sauce.
Stir in water, salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until the potatoes are tender and the soup has thickened.

fields.name: Cheesy Vegetable Bake
fields.title: Tuna Noodle Casserole
fields.description: A classic comfort food dish made with tuna, noodles, and a creamy cheese sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in flour and mustard until smooth. Gradually whisk in milk until smooth and thickened. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in salt, celery salt, and cheddar cheese until melted and smooth. Add tuna and cooked noodles. Mix well.
Pour the tuna noodle mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with bread crumbs. Sprinkle over the casserole.
Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly.
fields.comment: Tuna Noodle Casserole became popular in the United States in the mid-20th century as a way to stretch a budget and use pantry staples. It's still a beloved dish for its simplicity and comforting flavors.

fields.name: Cabbage Beef Casserole
fields.title: Cabbage-Beef Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish with ground beef, cabbage, rice, and flavorful seasonings.
instructions: In a dutch oven, cook beef and onions.
Remove from heat.
Add cabbage, pepper, and 2 1/2 tsp. salt.
Toss and mix well.
Pour rice into a 3-quart casserole dish.
Spoon ground beef mixture on top.
Pour beef broth and 1/2 cup water over the mixture.
Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Mix well before serving.

fields.name: Mom's Stuffed Peppers
fields.title: Mom's Stuffed Peppers
fields.description: A comforting dish of peppers stuffed with a flavorful mixture of rice, vegetables, and ground beef.
instructions: Mix in a bowl: uncooked Minute Rice, 2 chopped or grated carrots, 1 grated small onion, 1 lb. hamburger, 1 tsp. salt, 1 tsp. chili powder, 1 tsp. onion salt, and enough tomato juice to hold the mixture together.
Stuff peppers tightly with the mixture and place them open side up in a pan.
Cover the peppers with 1/2 can of tomato juice.
Cover the pan and steam for 1½ hours at 350 degrees.

fields.name: Cheesy Zucchini Saute
fields.title: Cheesy Zucchini Saute
fields.description: A quick and easy sauteed zucchini dish with cheese, tomatoes, and olives.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons minced fresh basil or 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
instructions: In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until crisp-tender.
Stir in zucchini, basil, salt and garlic powder.
Cook and stir for 4-5 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender.
Sprinkle with the cheese, tomato and olives.
Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.
fields.comment: A refreshing and tasty way to use up an abundance of zucchini, this recipe was a favorite of Doris Biggs from Felton, Delaware, who often made it as a thank-you gift for friends and neighbors who shared their garden produce with her.

fields.name: Zucchini Santa Fe
fields.title: Zucchini Santa Fe
fields.description: A flavorful summer side dish featuring zucchini, onion, green chilies, tomato, and cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies, drained
1/2 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese
instructions: In a large skillet, saute the zucchini and onion in oil for 3-4 minutes or until crisp-tender.
Add chilies, tomato, salt (if desired), pepper and garlic powder.
Cook and stir for 3-4 minutes.
Spoon into a serving bowl and sprinkle with cheese.
notes: This tasty dish uses less sugar, salt and fat.
Recipe includes Diabetic Exchanges.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured from Karen Wingate of Coldwater, Kansas and highlights a popular flavor profile from her mother's Arizona home.

fields.name: Calico Squash Casserole
fields.title: Calico Squash Casserole
fields.description: A colorful and flavorful casserole featuring yellow summer squash, zucchini, and a creamy sauce, topped with crushed butter-flavored crackers and cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 2 cups sliced yellow summer squash (1/4 inch thick)
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts, drained
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp cheddar cheese
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the yellow summer squash, zucchini, onion, green onions, and water; add 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Cover and cook until squash is tender, about 6 minutes. Drain well; set aside.
Combine crushed crackers and melted butter; spoon half into a greased shallow 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Combine cream of chicken soup, water chestnuts, carrot, mayonnaise, pimientos, sage, pepper, and remaining salt; fold into squash mixture.
Spoon the squash mixture over the crumbs in the baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and the remaining crumb mixture.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in a recipe contest, submitted by Lucille Terry from Frankfort, Kentucky.  She highlights the use of fresh squash from her garden, suggesting this dish as a great addition to holiday meals or any occasion.

fields.name: Italian Zucchini Casserole
fields.title: Italian Zucchini Casserole
fields.description: A savory zucchini casserole that even zucchini skeptics enjoy.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive or vegetable oil, divided
1 tablespoon minced fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil
1-1/2 teaspoons minced fresh oregano or 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
instructions: In a large skillet, cook zucchini in 1 tablespoon oil until tender, about 5-6 minutes; drain and set aside.
In the same skillet, saute the onion and garlic in remaining oil for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, basil, oregano, garlic salt and pepper; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat; gently stir in zucchini.
Place in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Top with stuffing mix; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Cover and bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Return to the oven for 10 minutes or until golden.
fields.comment: This casserole, featured on page 13 of its source, is so popular that compliments spread as quickly as zucchini vines grow.

fields.name: Creamed Cucumbers
fields.title: CREAMED CUCUMBERS
fields.description: Thinly sliced cucumbers and green onions are combined with a creamy dressing made from mayonnaise, evaporated milk, vinegar, sugar, and spices.
ingredients: 1 bunch green onions with tops, chopped
instructions: Combine cucumbers and green onions in a large bowl.
Cover and let stand for 1 hour.
Combine all remaining ingredients; pour over cucumber mixture and mix well.
Refrigerate for several hours.
fields.comment: Diane Maughan from Cedar City, Utah, developed this recipe. Although she didn't initially like cucumbers, her mother-in-law's preparation of them changed her view, now regarding it as a favorite.

fields.name: Curried Beef-Stuffed Squash
fields.title: Curried Beef-Stuffed Squash
fields.description: Savory ground beef with aromatic spices, nestled inside tender acorn squash halves, creates a satisfying and flavorful autumn meal.
ingredients: 3 medium acorn squash (about 1 pound each), halved and seeded
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Invert squash halves in a greased 15x10x1 inch baking pan. Bake uncovered for 35-45 minutes, or until almost tender.
While the squash is baking, brown ground beef with chopped onion and minced garlic in a skillet. Drain excess fat.
Dissolve bouillon granules in 1/2 cup hot water. Add to the skillet with the beef mixture.
Stir in cooked rice, parsley, orange juice concentrate, brown sugar, curry powder, ginger, and salt. Mix well.
Turn squash cut side up in the baking pan. Fill each squash half with the beef mixture.
Pour hot water into the baking pan to a depth of 1/4 inch. Cover loosely with foil.
Bake for 20-30 minutes, or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in a recipe contest, submitted by Edna Lee from Greeley, Colorado. Stuffed squash dishes are a popular fall comfort food, offering a balance of savory and sweet flavors.

fields.name: Parmesan Onion Bake
fields.title: Parmesan Onion Bake
fields.description: A cheesy onion bake that adds flair to any meal.
instructions: In a large skillet, saute onions and celery in 3 tablespoons butter until tender; drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt the remaining butter; stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
Gradually stir in milk.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Pour over vegetables; toss to coat.
Pour into an ungreased 2-qt. baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheese and pecans.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in the Taste of Home October/November 2000 contest, submitted by Linda Vail from Ballwin, Missouri.

fields.name: Vegetable And Stuffing Bake
fields.title: Vegetable & Stuffing Bake
fields.description: A cheesy and satisfying vegetable and stuffing bake that's easy to make and perfect for a weeknight meal.
ingredients: 3/4 cup MIRACLE WHIP or MIRACLE WHIP LIGHT Dressing
1 package (6 oz.) STOVE TOP Stuffing Mix
1 package (16 oz.) frozen broccoli cuts or vegetable blend with broccoli, thawed
instructions: Mix dressing, milk and contents of vegetable seasoning packet from stuffing mix.
Stir in stuffing crumbs, vegetables and cheese; toss to coat.
Spoon into 11x7-inch baking pan.
Bake in 350°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
notes: Variation: Add 2 cups chopped, cooked turkey or chicken for an easy one-dish meal.
To Make Ahead: Prepare as directed except for baking; cover. Refrigerate overnight. When ready to serve, bake, uncovered, at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
fields.comment: Stove Top Stuffing, introduced in 1971, revolutionized weeknight cooking.  This recipe capitalizes on that convenience, creating an easy and satisfying meal that can be customized with protein or prepared in advance.

fields.name: Creamed Cauliflower
fields.title: Creamed Cauliflower
fields.description: A Hungarian creamed cauliflower dish, easy to make and flavorful.
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets (about 7 cups)
instructions: Place cauliflower in a saucepan; add 1 inch of water and 1 teaspoon salt.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 6-7 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain.
Grease the bottom and sides of a 2-quart baking dish; sprinkle with 2 tablespoons bread crumbs.
Add cauliflower.
Pour cream over top. Dot with butter; sprinkle with remaining salt and bread crumbs.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until cauliflower is tender.
Garnish with parsley if desired.
fields.comment: This recipe is a Hungarian dish contributed by Peggie De Chick from Auburn, New York. It's noted for its simplicity and versatility as a side dish.

fields.name: Cabbage Tomato Pasta Toss
fields.title: Cabbage-Tomato Pasta Toss
fields.description: An unusual combination of ingredients that blend well together, making a nice side dish for any beef entree.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cider or red wine vinegar
instructions: In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, vinegar, basil and parsley; set aside.
Cook pasta according to package directions, adding the cabbage during the last 2 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute bread crumbs, almonds and garlic in oil and butter for 6 minutes or until golden brown.
Drain pasta and cabbage; place in a large bowl.
Add tomato and crumb mixtures; toss and serve immediately.
fields.comment: Submitted by Alcy Thorne from Los Molinos, California.

fields.name: Zucchini Supreme
fields.title: Zucchini Supreme
fields.description: A casserole-style dish with zucchini, carrots, onions, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and seasoned stuffing croutons.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: In a Dutch oven or soup kettle, bring water to a boil.
Add the zucchini, carrot, onion and salt.
Cook for 8-10 minutes or until vegetables are tender; drain.
In a large bowl, combine the soup, sour cream, garlic powder and pepper.
Fold in vegetable mixture.
Combine croutons and butter; place half in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Top with vegetable mixture and remaining croutons.
Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Uncover; bake 10 minutes longer or until golden brown.
fields.comment: Submitted by Bette Cimino from Vancouver, Washington. Zucchini recipes are popular during its season, and this one offers a pleasant flavor and appealing combination of color and texture.

fields.name: Potato Stuffing Casserole
fields.title: Potato Stuffing Casserole
fields.description: Mashed potatoes mixed with sauteed celery, onion, bread cubes, parsley, and egg, baked until golden brown.
ingredients: 4 to 5 large potatoes, peeled, cooked and mashed
instructions: In a medium skillet, saute celery and onion in 2 tablespoons of butter until tender.
Add bread cubes and stir until lightly browned.
Stir in potatoes, parsley, salt, pepper, milk and egg; mix well.
Spoon into a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake at 350°, uncovered, for 30-40 minutes or until lightly browned.
Garnish with additional parsley.
fields.comment: This recipe is adapted from a Pennsylvania Dutch cookbook, representative of the German cooking traditions in the area. It offers a flavorful alternative to plain mashed potatoes.

fields.name: Potato Spinach Casserole
fields.title: Potato Spinach Casserole
fields.description: A creamy, cheesy casserole with potatoes, spinach, and cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 6 to 8 large potatoes, peeled, cooked and mashed
2 tablespoons chopped chives or green onion tops
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except cheese.
Spoon into a greased 2-qt. casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 15 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake 5 minutes longer.
fields.comment: This recipe was a favorite of Winifred Winch from Wetmore, Michigan, and has been shared at dinner parties and holiday gatherings. It's convenient for parties as it can be prepped ahead and baked when guests arrive.

fields.name: Cucumbers With Dressing
fields.title: Cucumbers with Dressing
fields.description: Creamy cucumbers dressed with mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, and salt.
instructions: In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar and salt.
Add cucumbers; stir to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured on page 15 of the publication it originated from, contributed by Michelle Beran from Claflin, Kansas. It highlights the dish as a summer staple reminiscent of home cooking.

fields.name: Potatoes Squash Casserole
fields.title: Potato Squash Casserole
fields.description: A hearty autumn casserole featuring butternut squash, sliced potatoes, flavorful pork sausage, and a rich, creamy cheese sauce.
ingredients: 4 small potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
1 small butternut squash, peeled, seeded and thinly sliced
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the potatoes, squash and water.
Cover and cook on high for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender.
Place half of the potato mixture in a greased 2-qt. baking dish.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Crumble sausage over potato mixture.
Top with onion and remaining potato mixture.
In a small bowl, combine flour and 1/4 cup cream until smooth; stir in remaining cream.
Pour over potato mixture.
Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Uncover; bake for 20-30 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Sprinkle with cheese; bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
notes: This recipe was tested in an 850-watt microwave.

fields.name: Cauliflower Au Gratin (2)
fields.title: Cauliflower Au Gratin
fields.description: A creamy, cheesy cauliflower bake gratinéed to perfection.
ingredients: 1-1/2 cups (4 to 6 ounces) shredded Swiss cheese
instructions: Melt butter in a large skillet.
Saute garlic and ham for 2 minutes.
Add cauliflower and cook just until crisp-tender.
Combine flour and cream; stir into skillet and blend well.
Add salt, pepper and cayenne pepper.
Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir 1 minute more.
Pour into a 2-qt. baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Place under a preheated broiler until lightly browned, about 2-4 minutes.
Sprinkle with parsley.
Serve immediately.
notes: Broccoli can be substituted for all or half of the cauliflower.
fields.comment: This recipe was originally published in a Country magazine issue in February/March 1993 and was submitted by Jacki Ricci from Ely, Nevada.  She states that it's so delicious that it converts people into vegetable lovers.

fields.name: Butternut Squash Bake (2)
fields.title: Butternut Squash Bake
fields.description: A creamy and comforting side dish featuring butternut squash with a golden crumb topping.
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cubed (about 2 cups)
instructions: Place squash in a saucepan and cover with water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until very tender.
Drain well and place in a large bowl; mash squash.
In another bowl, combine the mayonnaise, onion, egg, sugar, salt and pepper; add to the squash and mix well.
Transfer to a greased 1-qt. baking dish.
Combine the cracker crumbs, cheese and butter; sprinkle over top.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-40 minutes or until heated through and top is golden brown.
notes: Light or fat-free mayonnaise may not be substituted for regular mayonnaise.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home magazine in October/November 1999, contributed by Bertha Johnson from Indianapolis, Indiana.

fields.name: Cauliflower Ham Casserole
fields.title: Cauliflower Ham Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole where cauliflower replaces potatoes, baked with ham, cheese, and a bread crumb topping.
instructions: Place cauliflower in a large saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5-10 minutes or until tender.

Meanwhile, in another large saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cheese and sour cream until melted.
Drain cauliflower. In a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, ham and mushrooms. Add cheese sauce and toss to coat. Transfer to a greased 2-qt. baking dish.
Combine topping ingredients (bread crumbs and melted butter); sprinkle over casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe was a runner-up in the Taste of Home December/January 2006 edition, submitted by Sue Herlund from White Bear Lake, Minnesota. She mentions having made this casserole for 30 years.

fields.name: Colorful Veggie Bake
fields.title: Colorful Veggie Bake
fields.description: A cheesy vegetable casserole with a golden crumb topping.
ingredients: 2 packages (16 ounces each) frozen California-blend vegetables
instructions: Prepare vegetables according to package directions; drain.
Place half in an ungreased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
In a small saucepan, combine cheese and 4 tablespoons butter; cook and stir over low heat until melted.
Pour half over vegetables.
Repeat layers.
Melt the remaining butter; toss with cracker crumbs.
Sprinkle over the top.
Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
fields.comment: This recipe was featured in Taste of Home magazine in October/November 2002 and was submitted by Lisa Radelet from Boulder, Colorado.  It's described as a versatile side dish suitable for any meat and a family favorite.

fields.name: Iowa Corn Casserole
fields.title: Iowa Corn Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring bacon, corn, bread crumbs, onion, and green pepper, baked until bubbly.
instructions: In a skillet, fry the bacon until lightly browned.
Remove bacon and set aside.
Pour 1/8 to 1/4 cup of bacon drippings over bread crumbs; set aside.
Discard all but 2 tablespoons of remaining drippings.
Saute onion and green pepper until tender.
Stir in corn and bacon.
Spoon into a 1-qt. baking dish.
Sprinkle with crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.
fields.comment: This corn casserole has been a favorite for reunions and gatherings for over 40 years, often leaving no leftovers and inspiring long-distance recipe requests.

fields.name: Garden Stuffed Baked Potatoes
fields.title: Garden Stuffed Baked Potatoes
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish of baked potatoes filled with broccoli, onion, ranch dressing, and optional parsley.
ingredients: 1 (10-ounce) package frozen chopped broccoli, thawed, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Microwave pierced potatoes on HIGH for 12 minutes; bake for 15 minutes.
Slice off potato tops. Scoop out pulp, keeping skins intact.
Mash pulp in a medium bowl.
Heat a small skillet over medium heat; add butter. Add onion and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add onion, broccoli, and salad dressing to potato pulp; mix well.
Brush outside of potato skin shells with oil.
Spoon potato mixture into shells, dividing evenly. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake potatoes until heated through, about 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with parsley; salt and pepper to taste.
notes: VARIATION: Add 1 cup Cheddar cheese to the potato pulp mixture or top the stuffed potatoes with cheese before baking in step 4.
Make Ahead: Bored with your lunch menu? Precook these potatoes, then cool to room temperature. Wrap and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Then just reheat in the microwave for 5 minutes.

Cook's PERFECT PARTNER: salsa. Dice any leftover beef, chicken or fish and add to these vegetable-packed potatoes. You'll have an economical, nutritious dinner that includes most of the major food groups.

Rubbing the outside of the potatoes with oil before baking will help them absorb more heat and allows the potatoes to cook more quickly-reducing cooking time by a few minutes. It also makes the skins crisp and nicely brown.

fields.name: Au Gratin Potatoes
fields.title: Scalloped Potatoes
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy potato casserole baked to perfection.
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped chives or onion tops
2 cans condensed cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Alternate layers of potatoes, onion and cheese in a large baking dish.
Season each layer with salt and pepper.
Pour mixed milk and soup over potatoes.
Top with cheese.
Cover and bake in 300° oven for 45 minutes.

fields.name: Green Beans Cream Style
fields.title: Cream Style Green Beans
fields.description: A simple recipe for creamy green beans using frozen green beans, cream cheese, milk, celery seed, and salt.
instructions: Cook green beans and drain.
Combine cream cheese, milk, celery seed, and salt.
Blend thoroughly.
Add the mixture to the drained green beans.
Heat through.

fields.name: Cabbage With Bacon And Dill
fields.title: Cabbage with Bacon and Dill
fields.description: A savory dish of cabbage cooked with bacon, onion, and dill.
instructions: Cook onion in bacon grease.
Add cabbage.
Add seasonings.
Cook until tender.
Crumble bacon and add to the cooked cabbage
notes: Amount of salt not specified
Amount of bacon grease not specified but inferred based on cooking onions in bacon grease.

fields.name: Zucchini Peach Casserole
fields.title: Zucchine - Peach Casserole
fields.description: A simple casserole dish featuring layers of zucchini and fresh peaches, dotted with butter and seasoned with brown sugar, salt, and pepper.
instructions: Layer squash then peaches.
Dot with butter.
Sprinkle sugar.
Add salt and pepper over the top.
Bake approximately 1 hour.

fields.name: Grandpa'S Party Potatoes
fields.title: Grandpa's Party Potatoes
fields.description: Creamy, cheesy, and oniony potatoes baked to perfection.
instructions: In a large saucepan, cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender; drain.
Mash the potatoes with butter, milk, salt and pepper until smooth.
Add cream cheese and onion dip; mix well.
Spread in a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Cover and refrigerate for 81 hours or overnight.
Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 50-60 minutes or until heated through.

fields.name: Spaghetti Squash Salad
fields.title: SPAGHETTI SQUASH SALAD
fields.description: A refreshing and unique salad made with roasted spaghetti squash, onions, celery, peppers, and a sweet vinaigrette.
instructions: Cut squash in half lengthwise; scoop out seeds.
Place squash, cut side down, in a 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan.
Fill pan with hot water to a depth of 1/2 in.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-40 minutes or until tender.
When cool enough to handle, scoop out the squash, separating strands with a fork.
Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl; add the squash and stir well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve with a slotted spoon as a salad or as a relish with burgers and hot dogs.
Store in the refrigerator.

fields.name: Tomato Crouton Casserole
fields.title: Tomato Crouton Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish with baked tomatoes, herbed croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 8 medium tomatoes, peeled and cut into wedges
8 slices bread, crusts removed and cubed
1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, melted
instructions: Arrange tomatoes in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Top with bread cubes.
Combine butter, salt, basil and thyme; drizzle over bread and tomatoes.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until tomatoes are tender.

fields.name: Colorful Vegetable Casserole
fields.title: Colorful Vegetable Casserole
fields.description: A vibrant and healthy casserole featuring cauliflower, carrots, and broccoli baked with a creamy horseradish sauce and buttery breadcrumb topping.
instructions: Place cauliflower and carrots in a large saucepan; add a small amount of water.
Cover and cook for 3 minutes.
Add broccoli; cook 4-6 minutes longer, or until all the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Drain.
Combine mayonnaise, onion, horseradish, salt and pepper; add vegetables and mix well.
Pour into a greased 2-qt. baking dish.
Combine bread crumbs, butter and paprika; sprinkle over vegetables.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe, submitted by Precious Owens from Elizabethtown, Kentucky, showcases a classic way to incorporate a variety of vegetables in a comforting casserole dish.  Casseroles like this have been a staple in American cuisine for generations, offering a versatile and budget-friendly meal option.

fields.name: Zucchini Pancakes (3)
fields.title: Zucchini Pancakes
fields.description: Savory and moist pancakes flecked with zucchini, ideal as a side dish.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the flour, Parmesan cheese, oregano, salt and pepper.
Combine the zucchini, egg, onion and mayonnaise; stir into dry ingredients until well blended.
In a large skillet, melt butter. Drop zucchini mixture by cupfuls into skillet; press lightly to flatten.
Fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side.
Drain on paper towels. Serve with sour cream if desired.
fields.comment: These pancakes offer a delightful savory alternative to traditional sweet pancakes and can be adapted for a supper dish by adding spaghetti sauce and Parmesan.

fields.name: Cheddar Cabbage Casserole
fields.title: Cheddar Cabbage Casserole
fields.description: A creamy, cheesy casserole featuring cabbage, cheddar cheese, and a buttery bread crumb topping.
ingredients: 10 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened, divided
instructions: In a large kettle or Dutch oven, cook cabbage in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain well.
Add 2 tablespoons butter to the cooked cabbage; set aside.
In a small saucepan, melt 6 tablespoons butter; stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
Gradually add milk to the saucepan. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
In a greased 3-qt. or 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish, place half of the cabbage.
Pour half of the sauce over cabbage. Repeat layers.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Melt remaining butter; toss with bread crumbs.
Sprinkle bread crumbs over cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 18-22 minutes or until cheese is melted.

fields.name: Onions Au Gratin
fields.title: ONIONS AU GRATIN
fields.description: Sliced onions baked with a creamy cheese sauce.
instructions: Slice the onions into 1/2-in.-thick rings.
Saute in butter until tender.
Place in a greased 8-in. square baking dish.
In a bowl, stir broth, cream, flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
Pour over onions.
Sprinkle with cheeses.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is golden brown and mixture is bubbly.

fields.name: Cucumbers In Cream
fields.title: Cucumbers in Cream
fields.description: A refreshing side dish made with cucumbers, cream, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
instructions: In a large bowl, gradually whisk the vinegar into the cream.
Gently stir in the cucumbers, salt and pepper.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for a short time.
Serve with a slotted spoon.

fields.name: Creamy Squash Casserole
fields.title: Creamy Squash Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and comforting casserole featuring squash, cream of chicken soup, and herb-seasoned stuffing.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
instructions: Cut squash in half; remove and discard peel and seeds.
Cut squash into 1/2-inch cubes.
Cook squash in a small amount of water for 3 minutes; drain and set aside.
In a bowl, combine soup, sour cream, butter, carrots, and onion.
Stir in 2 cups of stuffing mix.
Fold in squash.
Transfer to a greased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining stuffing mix.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25 minutes or until squash is tender.

fields.name: Potato Salad
fields.title: Potato Salad
fields.description: A classic potato salad made with Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix.
ingredients: 1 packet (1 oz.) Hidden Valley® The Original Ranch® Dressing Mix
instructions: Combine dressing mix with mayonnaise and water.
Add potatoes, celery and onions. Toss to coat.
Chill.

fields.name: Mashed Potatoes
fields.title: Hidden Valley Ranch Mashed Potatoes
fields.description: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with the tangy flavor of Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix.
ingredients: 1 packet (1 oz.) Hidden Valley The Original Ranch Dressing Mix
4 cups unsalted mashed potatoes, with or without skins
instructions: Add dressing mix to potatoes.
Stir well.
Serve with butter or margarine (if desired).
