fields.comment: Hidden Valley Ranch, known for its popular salad dressing, also offers a versatile dry mix used in various recipes, including these mashed potatoes. The ranch flavor adds a unique twist to a classic side dish.

fields.name: Asparagus Smoked Gouda And Ham Melt
fields.title: Asparagus, Smoked Gouda and Ham Melt
fields.description: A warm and cheesy melt featuring asparagus, smoked gouda, and ham, served over croissants or as a fondue.
instructions: Chop asparagus and combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Simmer on low, stirring often.
Once cheese is melted, drizzle over warm croissants or on top of an open-face sandwich.
Can also be served as a fondue if kept warm.

fields.name: Lemony Parsley Carrots
fields.title: Lemon Parsley Carrots
fields.description: A simple and flavorful side dish featuring carrots cooked with lemon, parsley, and a touch of sweetness.
instructions: Cut carrots into 4-inch slices to make about 4 cups.
In a 2-quart covered glass microwave-safe baking dish, cook carrots in 2 tablespoons water on high until just tender, about 9 minutes; stir once during cooking time.
Drain.
Stir in margarine or butter, sugar, parsley, lemon peel, lemon juice, and salt; cook until just heated through, about 1 minute.

fields.name: Taco Stuffed Tomatoes
fields.title: Taco Stuffed Tomatoes
fields.description: Large tomatoes are halved, filled with a seasoned ground beef and corn mixture, topped with cheese, and baked.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded hot pepper Monterey Jack cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.
Use tomatoes held at room temperature until fully ripe.
Cut tomatoes in half horizontally.
With a small spoon, remove seeds and pulp, leaving ½-inch shells.
Place shells in shallow baking pan; chop pulp to make 1½ cups.
In a large skillet over medium high heat, cook beef until brown, about 5 minutes.
Drain beef.
Add taco seasoning, corn, water, and tomato pulp to the beef.
Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes.
Spoon the beef mixture into tomato shells.
Bake until tomatoes are hot.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake until cheese melts.
fields.comment: This recipe appeared in GRIT magazine on July 28, 1996.

fields.name: Taco Tater Rockets
fields.title: Taco Tater Rockets
fields.description: Baked potatoes loaded with a flavorful ground beef taco mixture, topped with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and olives.
ingredients: 4 potatoes, uniform in size (about 6 ounces each)
instructions: Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Prick potatoes with fork and bake in center of oven about 45 minutes until tender when pierced with fork.
In large non-stick skillet over medium heat, break up beef and saute with onions, chiles and garlic until beef loses pink color.
Mix in tomato paste; cook and stir 2 minutes.
Season with salt.
To serve, split and fluff hot potatoes.
Spoon one-fourth of beef mixture onto each potato.
Top with lettuce, cheese and tomatoes, dividing equally.
Garnish with olives.
fields.comment: From National Potato Promotion Board

fields.name: Luminous Lemon Pepper Potatoes
fields.title: Luminous Lemon-Pepper Potatoes
fields.description: A vibrant dish of potatoes cooked with lemon, garlic, and pepper.
ingredients: 1/2 tablespoons butter or margarine, cut into small pieces
1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Place potatoes, butter, lemon juice and garlic in shallow 1-quart microwave-safe dish; toss.
Cover with plastic wrap, venting one corner.
Microwave on HIGH 10 to 12 minutes until just tender.
Mix in parsley, lemon peel and pepper.
Season with salt.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from The National Potato Promotion Board, highlighting the versatility of potatoes in simple yet flavorful dishes.

fields.name: Marinated Vegetable And Pasta Salad
fields.title: Marinated Vegetable and Pasta Salad
fields.description: A colorful and flavorful pasta salad marinated with Italian dressing and fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 pound large shell pasta (curly three-colored is pretty)
1 Bermuda onion, thinly sliced into rings
1 large yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced into rings
1 head cauliflower, separated into small flowerettes
1 (6 ounce) can pitted black olives, drained
1 (0.7 ounce) package Good Seasons Italian dressing mix
1 (16 ounce) bottle Bernstein's Cheese and Garlic Italian Dressing
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; immerse in cold water, drain and set aside.
Wash and cut vegetables; place in a large container suitable for marinating.
Add pasta and sprinkle with dry Italian dressing.
Pour bottled dressing over all, toss and refrigerate for 10 to 24 hours.

fields.name: Creamy Mashed Potato Bake
fields.title: Creamy Mashed Potato Bake
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring mashed potatoes baked with sour cream, cheese, and French fried onions.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine mashed potatoes, sour cream, milk, and garlic powder in a large bowl; mix well.
Spoon half the potato mixture into a greased 2-quart baking dish.
Sprinkle with 2/3 cup French fried onions and 1/4 cup cheese.
Top with the remaining potato mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until heated through.
Sprinkle with the remaining 2/3 cup French fried onions and 1/2 cup cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes, or until onions are golden brown.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from French's French Fried Onions, suggesting it's a classic way to use this popular pantry staple.

fields.name: Spaghetti Squash With Vegetables
fields.title: Spaghetti Squash with Vegetables
fields.description: A healthy and flavorful dish featuring roasted spaghetti squash topped with sauteed zucchini, bell pepper, celery, and tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 large red or green bell pepper, cut into 2-inch cubes
instructions: Microwave squash on high until tender (see note below).
Set aside.
In a 1-quart casserole, combine zucchini, bell pepper, celery, basil, salt, and pepper. Toss to mix.
Dot with butter.
Cover and cook on high for 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes, cover, and cook for another 3 minutes.
With a large sharp knife, cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Transfer squash strands to a serving platter.
Spoon vegetables over top.
Sprinkle with cheese and parsley.
notes: For microwaving the squash: Pierce the squash all over with a fork. Microwave on high for 8-10 minutes, or until tender when pierced with a fork. Let stand for a few minutes before handling.
fields.comment: Spaghetti squash is a winter squash known for its stringy flesh that resembles spaghetti noodles. This makes it a healthy, gluten-free alternative to traditional pasta and a great option for lighter dishes.

fields.name: Two Zucchini Bakes
fields.title: Zucchini Bake
fields.description: A savory baked dish featuring zucchini, cheese, and a biscuit mix.
ingredients: 1 pound zucchini squash, shredded (3 to 4 cups)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease a 9-inch pie pan or 11-by-7-inch baking dish with a non-stick vegetable coating; set aside.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until lightly browned.
Let rest 5 minutes before cutting into 6 servings.

fields.name: Green Bean Casserole
fields.title: Green Bean Casserole
fields.description: A classic holiday side dish made with green beans, cream of mushroom soup, and French fried onions.
ingredients: 2 cans (10 3/4 oz. each) Campbell's Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
1 can (6 oz.) French's® French Fried Onions (2 2/3 cups)
instructions: Stir soup, milk, soy sauce, black pepper, beans and 1 1/3 cups onions in 3-qt. casserole.
Bake at 350°F. for 25 min. or until hot. Stir.
Top with remaining onions. Bake for 5 min. more.
notes: Go Nuts! Toast 2 cup sliced almonds. In step 3, add with remaining onions.
For Cheese Lovers: Omit soy sauce. In step 1, stir in ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, In step 3, add an additional ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese with remaining onions.
fields.comment: Green bean casserole is a Thanksgiving staple in the United States, appearing on tables for generations.

fields.name: "Bingo" Zucchini Casserole
fields.title: Bingo Zucchini Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring zucchini, carrots, cream of chicken soup, and a crunchy Stove Top Stuffing topping.
ingredients: 1 can (10 ¾ ounces) cream of chicken soup
instructions: Saute zucchini and onion until tender.
Mix soup, sour cream, carrots and Parmesan cheese.
Add the soup mixture to the zucchini-onion mixture.
Melt margarine.
Add melted margarine to stuffing and mix well.
Combine stuffing mixture with zucchini mixture.
Top with grated cheese and tomato wedges.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Zucchini Corn Medley
fields.title: Zucchini Corn Medley
fields.description: A cheesy baked dish with zucchini, corn, and green chilies.
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, cook zucchini in water and salt until just tender, about 6 minutes.
Add corn; cook for 1 minute.
Drain.
Stir in chilies; pour into a greased 1-1/2-qt. shallow baking dish.
Melt butter in a saucepan; stir in flour and seasonings until smooth and bubbly.
Stir in milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Boil 3-4 minutes or until thickened.
Remove from the heat and stir in cheese until melted.
Pour over vegetables.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

fields.name: Zucchini Frittata
fields.title: Zucchini Frittata
fields.description: A portable and reheatable frittata perfect for road trips, featuring zucchini, onion, Swiss cheese, and eggs.
instructions: In an 8-in. ovenproof skillet over medium heat, saute zucchini and onion in oil for 2-3 minutes or until tender.
Pour eggs over top; sprinkle with salt.
Cook until almost set, 6-7 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 4-5 minutes or until the cheese melts.
fields.comment: This frittata is designed for convenience, making it a great option for travelers.  The contributor, Carol Blumenberg from Lehigh Acres, Florida, highlights its portability and reheating qualities, perfect for enjoying a warm breakfast on the go.

fields.name: Colcannon-Style Potatoes
fields.title: Colcannon-Style Potatoes
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful dish of mashed potatoes mixed with sauteed onions, cabbage, and carrots.
ingredients: 2 pounds potatoes, peeled, cut into 2-inch chunks
instructions: In a large nonstick skillet, heat butter over medium heat until hot.
Add onions, cabbage, and carrots; cook 20 to 25 minutes or until onion is very soft and lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine potatoes, garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon salt; cover with water.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender; drain.
Mash potatoes until almost smooth using a potato masher or electric mixer.
Add milk, pepper, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt; stir in vegetables.
fields.comment: This recipe is provided by the Wisconsin Potato & Vegetable Growers Association, suggesting a regional influence and focus on promoting locally grown produce.

fields.name: Potato And Broccoli Supreme
fields.title: Potato 'n Broccoli Supreme
fields.description: A creamy potato casserole with broccoli and cheese, topped with crispy fried onions.
ingredients: 3 cups hot mashed potatoes (5 to 6 medium potatoes)
1 can (2.8 oz.) Durkee French Fried Onions
2 packages (10 oz. each) frozen broccoli spears, cooked and drained
instructions: Whip together mashed potatoes, cream cheese, milk, egg, and margarine until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
Fold in ½ can of French Fried Onions.
Spread potato mixture into a buttered 8 x 12-inch baking dish, forming a shell. Bake uncovered at 350° for 25-30 minutes.
Arrange hot broccoli spears in the potato shell, sprinkle with cheese and remaining onions. Bake uncovered for 5 more minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles became a popular dish in the United States during the mid-20th century, coinciding with the rise of convenience foods and the increased availability of refrigeration.

fields.name: Chili Mashed Potatoes
fields.title: Chili Mashed Potatoes
fields.description: Mashed potatoes with a spicy chili twist, topped with cheddar cheese and cilantro.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, cook potatoes in 2 inches of boiling water, covered, for about 12 minutes until tender.
Drain thoroughly.
Shake potatoes in pan over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes to dry thoroughly.
Mash potatoes with an electric mixer or potato masher.
Mix in sour cream, green onions, milk, and chili powder.
Season with salt and pepper (do not overbeat).
Stir gently over low heat just until heated through.
Serve topped with cheese and cilantro.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from The National Potato Promotion Board, suggesting an effort to promote versatile uses of potatoes.

fields.name: Green Bean Casserole (2)
fields.title: Green Bean Casserole
fields.description: A classic holiday side dish featuring green beans, creamy sauce, and cheese.
ingredients: 2 cups canned or cooked French-style green beans
½ cup grated sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Saute onion in melted butter.
Add flour, salt and pepper; mix well.
Add sour cream and heat through. Do not boil.
Blend with cooked beans and pour into shallow baking dish.
Top with grated cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.
fields.comment: Green bean casserole is a popular Thanksgiving side dish in the United States and Canada.

fields.name: Two Potato Dishes
fields.title: Potato Dish
fields.description: A cheesy and creamy potato casserole made with frozen potatoes, green chilies, cheddar cheese, cream of chicken soup, and sour cream.
ingredients: 8 ounces sharp Cheddar cheese, grated (2 cups)
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
Combine potatoes, chilies and cheese, and mix well.
Spread evenly in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Combine soup, butter and sour cream and mix well.
Pour over potato mixture and spread evenly.
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes.

fields.name: Sausage And Apple-Stuffed Zucchini
fields.title: Sausage and Apple-Stuffed Zucchini
fields.description: Zucchini halves are filled with a savory stuffing of sausage, apple, vegetables, and bread cubes, then baked until tender.
ingredients: 1 medium apple, peeled, cored and diced
instructions: Heat the oven to 350 F.
In a large sauté pan over medium-high, melt the butter.
Add the onion, carrot, celery and fennel seeds, then sauté until the onion is transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add the sausage and apple, then sauté until the meat is cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add the stuffing, then mix well.
Drizzle in the broth, then mix well.
Turn off the heat, cover the pan and let sit for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, slice the zucchini in half lengthwise.
Use a spoon or melon baller to scrape out the seedy center of each half, then arrange them on a rimmed baking sheet or in a large, shallow baking dish.
Fill each half with the stuffing mixture, packing it well.
Bake until the zucchini are tender, about 20 minutes.

fields.name: Broccoli Cheese Casserole With Crunch
fields.title: Broccoli Cheese Casserole with Crunch
fields.description: A creamy, cheesy casserole with broccoli, crunchy almonds, and optional pasta.
ingredients: 2 cups pasta, such as elbow OR fussili, cooked (optional)
1 bag (3 oz.) slivered, roasted, Parmesan-flavored almonds, divided
instructions: Butter a 10-inch round OR 8-inch square baking dish; set aside.
Heat oven to 350°F
In a microwave-safe bowl, place broccoli and 1/4 cup water. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes; drain.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat.
Add garlic, onion and celery. Sauté until vegetables are softened, approximately 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and continue to sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in milk and seasonings; cook until milk thickens, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Reduce heat.
Add 1 1/2 cups cheese, pasta (if desired), 3/4 of almonds and broccoli. Stir until cheese is melted and broccoli is well coated
Pour mixture into prepared pan.
Top with remaining cheese and almonds.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until heated through and golden brown on edges.
Cover with foil if mixture is browning too quickly.
notes: For variations, substitute cauliflower for broccoli; top with Swiss cheese instead of cheddar; use rice instead of pasta; OR add chunks of grilled chicken.

fields.name: Company Summer Zucchini
fields.title: Company Summer Zucchini
fields.description: A simple yet elegant summer side dish featuring zucchini, onions, and a creamy dill sauce.
instructions: In a saucepan, combine zucchini, onion, water, salt, bouillon cube, and dillweed.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for five minutes, or until zucchini is tender.
Add butter, sugar, and lemon juice. Remove from heat.
Blend flour into sour cream. Stir half of the hot liquid into the sour cream mixture.
Return the mixture to the saucepan. Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.
fields.comment: This recipe, attributed to Mrs. R. Glen Alleman, showcases a classic way of preparing summer zucchini.  Dishes like this highlight the versatility of zucchini and its ability to be incorporated into both simple and elegant meals.

fields.name: Jojos Potatoes
fields.title: JoJo's Potatoes
fields.description: Crispy potato spears coated in a parmesan and flour mixture, baked until golden brown.
instructions: Wash potatoes. Peel, if desired.
Cut potatoes into spears.
Mix flour, cheese, salt and pepper in a plastic bag.
Add potatoes to the bag and shake to coat.
Melt butter or margarine in a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Place potatoes in the pan.
Bake at 375°F for 1 hour, turning once or twice, until nicely browned.

fields.name: Maple Potatoes
fields.title: Maple Potatoes
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring thinly sliced potatoes and sweet potatoes baked in a creamy maple-infused gravy and topped with Swiss cheese.
ingredients: 1½ lbs. potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
1½ lbs. sweet potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
instructions: Layer potatoes in 2-quart baking pan.
Sprinkle layers with salt and nutmeg.
Combine the gravy with the half-and-half and maple syrup; pour over potatoes.
Cover and bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
Uncover, sprinkle, top with grated cheese and return to oven to bake an additional 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

fields.name: Zucchini Casserole
fields.title: Zucchini Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring zucchini, carrots, and a creamy sauce, topped with croutons and cheese.
ingredients: 5 cups unpeeled zucchini, cut in chunks
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F.
Grease a 1 1/2-quart baking dish; set aside.
In a large saucepan, melt margarine.
Add zucchini, carrots and onion; sauté slightly.
Add croutons, sour cream, soup, salt and pepper, mix well.
Pour into prepared dish.
Top with additional cheese and additional croutons.
Bake until bubbly.

fields.name: Vegetable Medley
fields.title: Vegetable Medley
fields.description: A simple vegetable medley with mushrooms, green beans, and stewed tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 (9-oz) package frozen cut green beans, thawed
instructions: Melt margarine over low heat.
Brown mushrooms lightly in margarine; season with oregano.
Separate green beans with a fork.
Add beans and stewed tomatoes to mushroom mixture.
Cover and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes.

fields.name: Heartland Been Bake
fields.title: Heartland Bean Bake
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful bean bake with ground beef, onions, and a blend of beans in a sweet and smoky sauce.
ingredients: ¼ cup firmly packed brown sugar
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.
In a skillet, brown ground beef with onion; drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine great northern beans, pork and beans, chili, barbecue sauce, ketchup, and brown sugar.
Stir in ground beef and onion.
Ladle mixture into a 2-quart casserole.
Bake, uncovered, for 30-35 minutes or until hot.

fields.name: Summer Squash Casserole
fields.title: Summer Squash Casserole
fields.description: A creamy and comforting casserole made with summer squash, onion, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, and herb-seasoned stuffing.
ingredients: 2 lbs. crookneck or zucchini squash, sliced (7 cups)
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Cook summer squash with onion in small amount of boiling salted water till crisp-tender.
Drain well.
Combine soup and sour cream.
Stir in carrot.
Fold in drained squash and onion.
Melt butter; toss with stuffing mix.
Spread half of stuffing mixture in 12 x 8-inch baking dish.
Spoon vegetable mixture on top.
Sprinkle with remaining stuffing mixture.
Bake at 350° till heated through, 25 to 30 minutes.
fields.comment: Casseroles rose in popularity in the United States in the early- to mid-20th century, coinciding with the advent of commercially-produced condensed soups and other convenience foods.

fields.name: Sweet Potato Maple Mash
fields.title: Sweet Potato Maple Mash
fields.description: A simple and flavorful side dish featuring sweet potatoes mashed with butter, milk, and maple syrup.
ingredients: 4 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and quartered
instructions: In a large saucepan with lid, place sweet potatoes in cold, salted water to cover.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Drain.
Mash potatoes. Mix in butter, milk and maple syrup. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

fields.name: Summer Squash Casserole (2)
fields.title: Summer Squash Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole featuring summer squash, creamy soup, and a herb-seasoned stuffing topping.
ingredients: 2 lbs. crookneck or zucchini squash, sliced (7 cups)
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Cook summer squash with onion in small amount of boiling salted water till crisp-tender.
Drain well.
Combine soup and sour cream.
Stir in carrot.
Fold in drained squash and onion.
Melt butter; toss with stuffing mix.
Spread half of stuffing mixture in 12 x 8-inch baking dish.
Spoon vegetable mixture on top.
Sprinkle with remaining stuffing mixture.
Bake at 350° till heated through, 25 to 30 minutes.

fields.name: Company Summer Zucchini (2)
fields.title: Company Summer Zucchini
fields.description: A creamy and flavorful zucchini dish perfect for a summer gathering.
instructions: In a saucepan, combine zucchini, onion, water, salt, bouillon cube, and dillweed.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for five minutes, or until zucchini is tender.
Add butter, sugar, and lemon juice. Remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, blend flour into sour cream.
Stir half of the hot zucchini mixture into the sour cream mixture.
Return the combined mixture to the saucepan.
Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.
fields.comment: This recipe, credited to Mrs. R. Glen Alleman, evokes the classic flavors of summer and showcases zucchini as a versatile ingredient.  Bouillon cubes, popular in mid-20th century cooking, add a savory depth.

fields.name: Zesty Carrot Bake
fields.title: Zesty Carrot Bake
fields.description: Tender carrots baked in a zesty horseradish sauce and topped with melted cheddar cheese.
instructions: Cook carrots until tender on the stovetop or in a microwave oven.
Place carrots in a 1-qt. baking dish.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, water, minced onion, horseradish, and pepper; mix well.
Pour mixture over carrots.
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter; sprinkle on top.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
Bake 2-3 minutes more or until the cheese is melted.

fields.name: Squash And Potatoes
fields.title: Squash and Potatoes
fields.description: A savory dish featuring squash, potatoes, and bacon, seasoned with dill.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon fresh minced dill or 1 teaspoon dill weed
instructions: In large skillet, cook bacon until crisp.
Remove bacon; drain, discarding all but 2 tablespoons drippings.
Add potato; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add onion, zucchini and yellow squash; cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Return bacon to skillet; sprinkle with dill, salt and pepper.
Cook and stir for about 1 minute.
fields.comment: This recipe was inspired by Lillian Child's German grandmother, who used bacon drippings in many of her dishes.  It reflects a resourceful approach to using fresh garden vegetables, common in traditional cooking.

fields.name: Acorn Cabbage Bake
fields.title: Acorn Cabbage Bake
fields.description: A fall-inspired side dish or luncheon entree featuring acorn squash, cabbage, sausage, and a blend of spices.
ingredients: 1/2 pound pork sausage, cooked and drained
instructions: Cut squash in half and remove seeds.
Place squash cut-side down in a 13x9x2 inch baking dish with 1/2 inch of water.
Cover and bake at 400°F for 20 minutes, or until tender.
Cool squash and scoop out pulp (about 4 cups).
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Sauté cabbage, onion, and apple for about 5 minutes, until tender.
Add cooked sausage, almonds, salt, sage, thyme, and pepper to the skillet and mix well.
Remove from heat and stir in the squash pulp.
Transfer mixture to a greased 2-quart casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, or until heated through.
fields.comment: This recipe, submitted by Alene Lundberg from Cedar Falls, Iowa, presents a delicious way to utilize acorn squash, a popular fall vegetable. The combination of savory sausage, sweet apple, and earthy spices creates a balanced flavor profile.

fields.name: Skillet Cabbage
fields.title: Skillet Cabbage
fields.description: A quick and easy cabbage side dish with cream cheese.
ingredients: 1 green pepper, cut into thin strips
1 package (3 ounces) cream cheese, cubed and softened
instructions: Melt butter in a large skillet.
Add cabbage and green pepper and toss to coat.
Stir in water, salt and pepper.
Cover; simmer for 8-10 minutes or until cabbage is tender.
Add cream cheese; stir until melted.
fields.comment: This recipe is a great example of a simple, yet flavorful side dish that can be made quickly. Cabbage is a versatile vegetable that can be cooked in many ways, and this skillet method is a great way to add flavor and texture to a meal.

fields.name: Winter Vegetable Chili
fields.title: Winter Vegetable Chili
fields.description: A hearty and flavorful chili perfect for cold weather, featuring butternut squash, carrots, black beans, and warming spices.
ingredients: 2 medium butternut squash(es), peeled and cut into cubes
1 (4 ounce) can chopped mild green chiles
2 (15- to 19-ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil. Add butternut squash and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden; remove.
In same Dutch oven heat 2 more teaspoons olive oil; cook carrots and onion until well browned. Stir in chili powder; cook 1 minute, stirring.

Add tomatoes with their liquid, chiles with their liquid, vegetable broth, and salt; over high heat, heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally with spoon to break up tomatoes.

Stir in black beans and butternut squash; over high heat, heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 15 minutes or until squash is tender and chili thickens. Stir in cilantro. Serve with sour cream if you like.

fields.name: Zucchini'N Rice Bake
fields.title: ZUCCHINI'N RICE BAKE
fields.description: A cheesy and comforting zucchini and rice bake made with cream of celery soup and cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (10-3/4 oz) condensed cream of celery soup
instructions: In large saucepan, parboil zucchini in boiling water for 3 minutes; drain WELL.
In large bowl, combine zucchini with remaining ingredients, blending well.
Pour zucchini mixture into shallow 1½ quart baking dish.
Bake at 350°F. for 40 to 45 minutes.
Garnish with lemon cartwheel twists, if desired.

fields.name: Spaghetti Squash Two Ways
fields.title: Spaghetti Squash in the Microwave
fields.description: Two variations of recipes using spaghetti squash as a pasta substitute or a side dish.

ingredients: 1 large red or green bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

instructions: Pierce squash with a fork in several places. Place on a double thickness of paper towels in the microwave. Zap on high for 12 to 15 minutes, or until flesh is tender when pierced with a fork, turning over once halfway through cooking. Wrap in foil and set aside.

In a microwave dish, place crumbled sausage and onion. Cover with paper towels and zap for 5 to 7 minutes, until meat is no longer pink, stirring often to break up lumps. Add green pepper, tomatoes, tomato paste, and basil. Stir to mix. Zap on high for 15 to 18 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt.
Split squash in half lengthwise and discard seeds. With two forks, lift out strands of squash and transfer to a warm platter. Spoon sauce over top and garnish with basil.
Microwave squash (see above).
Set aside.
In a 1-quart casserole, combine zucchini, bell pepper, celery, basil, salt, and pepper. Toss to mix. Dot with butter. Cover and cook on high for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes. Cover and cook for 3 minutes.
With a large sharp knife, cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Transfer squash strands to a serving platter. Spoon vegetables over top. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley.

fields.comment: This recipe was originally published in the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and is from Woodene Merriman's cookbook "Zap It Again," which focuses on microwave cooking.

fields.name: Cauliflower Au Gratin
fields.title: Cauliflower au Gratin
fields.description: A creamy and cheesy cauliflower casserole baked to perfection.
instructions: Cook cauliflower in a small amount of salted water for 5-6 minutes, or until tender, then drain.
Melt butter in a saucepan. Add flour and cook until smooth, creating a roux or blond.
Gradually whisk in milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Stir in salt, pepper and mushrooms.
Place cauliflower in a buttered casserole dish.
Pour a layer of the cheese sauce over the cauliflower, then sprinkle with grated cheese.
Repeat layers, ending with the sauce.
Top with buttered breadcrumbs and grated cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
fields.comment: Cauliflower au Gratin, meaning cauliflower with cheese, is a classic French dish.  Variations exist using different cheeses or adding other vegetables.

fields.name: Sloppy Joes
fields.title: Sloppy Joes
fields.description: A classic comfort food recipe for Sloppy Joes made with hamburger, onion, chicken gumbo soup, catsup, and mustard.
instructions: Brown hamburger and chopped onion, then drain grease.
Add chicken gumbo soup, catsup, and prepared mustard.
Salt to taste.
Simmer 45 min. to 1 hr., stirring occasionally.

fields.name: Tater-Tot and Hamburger Casserole
fields.title: Tater-Tot and Hamburger Casserole
fields.description: A comforting casserole dish featuring ground beef, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and tater tots.
instructions: Brown hamburger and drain off fat.
Add soup and sour cream.
Put in casserole dish with tater tots.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
notes: You can use tomato soup instead of cream of mushroom soup if you desire.

fields.name: Orange Refrigerator Cake
fields.title: Orange Refrigerator Cake
fields.description: A refreshing and easy-to-make cake with a citrusy flavor, perfect for warm weather.
instructions: Bake cake as directed on the box in a 9x13x2 inch pan.
Cool cake for 20-25 minutes.
Poke deep holes with a meat fork about 1/2" apart.
Dissolve gelatin in 3/4 cup boiling water and let it cool to room temperature.
Add 1/2 cup cold water to the gelatin.
Slowly pour gelatin mixture into the holes in the cake.
Refrigerate the cake while making the topping.
Topping: In a chilled, deep bowl, blend whipped topping mix, instant pudding, cold milk, and extract for 3-8 minutes.
Immediately frost the cake.
Garnish with orange slices, if desired.
Store the cake in the refrigerator and serve chilled.
notes: Other cake mix and gelatin flavors can be used, such as orange cake mix, white cake mix, strawberry cake mix, cherry cake mix, lemon cake mix, pineapple cake mix, orange jello, lime jello, strawberry jello, cherry jello, lemon jello, etc.
For a chocolate variation, use chocolate pudding.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Brochure #1
fields.title: Betty Crocker Peppermint Chip Chiffon Cake
fields.description: A light and rich chiffon cake flavored with peppermint.
instructions: Preheat oven (see pan sizes and temperatures below).
Sift an ample amount of GOLD MEDAL "Kitchen-tested" Enriched Flour onto square of paper.

STEP 1: Measure (level measurements throughout) and sift together into mixing bowl the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Make a well and add in order the oil, egg yolks, water, and peppermint extract. Beat with spoon until smooth.
STEP 2: Measure egg whites and cream of tartar into large mixing bowl. Whip until whites form very stiff peaks. DO NOT UNDERBEAT.

STEP 3: Pour egg yolk mixture gradually over whipped egg whites, gently folding with rubber scraper just until blended. DO NOT STIR. Sprinkle red food coloring over batter and fold in with only 3 or 4 strokes to streak, not blend.
Pour into ungreased 10-in. tube pan, 4-in. deep, or 9x13x2-in. oblong pan.
Bake 55 min. at 325°, then increase to 350° for 10 to 15 min., or until top springs back when touched. (For oblong pan: 45 to 50 min. at 350°).
Immediately turn pan upside down, placing tube part over neck of funnel or bottle, or resting oblong pan edges on 2 other pans. Let hang until cold.
Loosen cake from sides and tube with spatula. Turn pan over and hit edge sharply on table to loosen.
notes: Be sure to use peppermint extract as oil of peppermint is much stronger.
fields.comment: This recipe is from a vintage Betty Crocker advertisement emphasizing the cake's unique texture and the importance of using Gold Medal flour.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Brochure #2
fields.title: Cocoa Divinity Cake
fields.description: A rich and decadent chocolate cake made with cocoa and buttermilk.

meta.Bake: 30 to 35 min. for layers; or 45 to 50 min. for sq. cake.
meta.Pan Size: Two 8" round layer pans (1¼" deep), or one 8½" sq. pan (2" deep)

ingredients: 2 cups minus 2 tbsp. sifted SOFTASILK Cake Flour
⅔ cup high grade vegetable shortening
½ to ⅔ cup unbeaten eggs (2 large)
instructions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, salt, and cocoa into a bowl.
Add shortening and buttermilk.
Beat vigorously with a spoon for 2 minutes or with an electric mixer on slow to medium speed for 2 minutes.
Add eggs and beat for 2 more minutes.
Pour batter into prepared pans and bake.
notes: See general directions above for preparing ingredients and pans.
To save sugar: Use ½ cup granulated sugar and 6 tbsp. brown sugar and ¾ cup plus 2 tbsp. (½ cup) corn syrup. Reduce milk to ¾ cup. Add syrup with milk to dry ingredients.
fields.comment: This recipe utilizes the "New Method" from Betty Crocker, which emphasizes a quicker and easier approach to cake baking without creaming shortening or beating eggs separately.  This method reflects the mid-20th-century trend of simplifying baking processes for the modern homemaker.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Brochure #3
fields.title: Chiffon Cakes
fields.description: Light, moist, and flavorful cakes that are easy to make with a simple mix-and-fold method.
instructions: Mix the dry ingredients, liquids, and egg yolks together (do not beat the egg yolks separately).
Fold in the stiffly beaten egg whites.
Follow the Chiffon Cake recipe on the back of the package.
notes: Variations:

Orange Chiffon Cake: Omit vanilla. Substitute grated rind of 2 medium-sized oranges (about 3 tbsp.) for lemon rind. If desired, orange juice may be substituted for half the water; then bake at 325° for 65 to 70 min.
Banana Chiffon Cake: Omit lemon rind. Mash 1 medium-sized ripe banana through a sieve. Add mashed banana and only 1 tsp. vanilla to water.

Black Walnut Chiffon Cake: Omit lemon rind and vanilla. Proceed as for Betty Crocker Chiffon Cake. Just before pouring batter into pan, carefully and gently fold 1 cup very finely chopped black walnuts into batter. If black walnuts are not available, use English walnuts and add ½ tsp. black walnut flavoring or 2 tsp. vanilla to the water.
Helpful Hints:
Preheat oven for 10 to 20 minutes.
Use a portable oven thermometer for accurate temperature.
Use dry measuring cups for dry ingredients.
Whip egg whites at room temperature.
How to Serve:
Whip egg whites just before using.
Fold gently to avoid deflating the batter.
If your tube pan has a removable bottom, run a spatula under the cake.
To loosen cakes from loaf pans, gently pull from the sides.
Chiffon Cake is delicious uniced! Serve with whipped cream and berries, ice cream, or your favorite dessert sauce.
Toppings:

Orange Fluff Topping: Mix 3 egg yolks and sugar in a double boiler. Stir in orange juice and rind. Cook over hot water, stirring constantly, until thickened (about 15 minutes). Cool. Fold in whipped cream, almonds or coconut. Makes about 3 cups.
Hawaiian Fluff Topping: Beat cream until stiff. Blend in confectioners' sugar. Fold in pineapple, coconut, almonds, and cherries. Makes about 5 cups.
Chocolate Fluff Topping: Mix cream, confectioners' sugar, cocoa, and salt. Chill for at least 1 hour. Beat until stiff. Makes about 4 cups.
fields.comment: This recipe is from a vintage Betty Crocker advertisement, showcasing the popularity of chiffon cakes in the mid-20th century.  Chiffon cakes, known for their light and airy texture, were a trendy dessert during this time, offering a delicate alternative to denser cakes. The recipe emphasizes the ease of preparation, highlighting the "mix-and-fold" method as a key selling point.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Brochure #4
fields.title: Medality Silverware Offer
fields.description: Redeem coupons from General Mills products for silverware.
instructions: Mail coupons with a letter specifying desired pieces.
Print your name and address.
Send to COUPON SERVICE of General Mills, Inc., Minneapolis, Minn.
For faster completion, consider the part-cash offer.
Small coupon groups: Send via first-class mail.
Large coupon groups: Send via parcel post with a 3c stamp on the letter attached to the package.
Ensure sufficient postage on the package.
Make large remittances by postal money order or check.
fields.comment: This offer likely reflects wartime rationing and material shortages during World War II, encouraging consumers to save and reuse resources.  Promotional offers tied to food products were a common marketing strategy during this era.

fields.name: Cranberry Salad Two
fields.title: Cranberry Salad
fields.description: A refreshing and festive cranberry salad with oranges, celery, and nuts.
instructions: Grate rind from oranges.
Put cranberries and oranges through food chopper.
Add rind to cranberries and oranges and let it sit for 3 min.
Dissolve the gelatin with 1 cup cold water and add to the hot mixture and cool slightly.
Add celery and nuts.
Place in mould and serve on lettuce.

fields.name: Graham Cracker Pudding
fields.title: Graham Cracker Puddings
fields.description: A chilled and frozen dessert made with graham crackers, milk, gelatin, and vanilla.
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in cold water.
Scald Pet milk over boiling water.
Add softened gelatin to scalded milk and stir until dissolved.
Chill the milk mixture until icy cold.
Roll graham crackers into fine crumbs.
Set graham cracker crumbs in a pan.
Chill 2 cups of milk.
Beat egg white until stiff.
Gradually add sugar to egg whites while continuing to beat.
Fold in chilled milk and vanilla.
Pour mixture over graham cracker crumbs.
Freeze without stirring.

fields.name: Feather muffins
fields.title: Feather Muffins
fields.description: Light and fluffy muffins perfect for breakfast or a snack.
instructions: Sift the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar together three times.
Add the milk to the beaten eggs.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir only until the flour disappears.
Add the melted fat and mix well.
Fill oiled muffin tins 3/4 full.
Bake for 25 minutes at 425 degrees.
fields.comment: Recipes like this one, emphasizing a light and airy texture, were popular in the early to mid 20th century when baking powder became a common household staple.

fields.name: Fruitcake
fields.title: Fruit Cake
fields.description: A rich, spiced fruit cake packed with candied fruits.
ingredients: 1 lb assorted candied fruits (from mixed peel to cherries and pineapple)
1/2 cup of the dry ingredients (for dredging fruit)
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C).
Grease and flour a loaf pan and line with wax paper.
Place a shallow pan of water on the bottom rack of the oven.
Dredge the candied fruits in 1/2 cup of the dry ingredients.
Cream together the shortening and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the beaten eggs and Karo syrup, mixing well.
Add the orange juice and mix well.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining dry ingredients (flour, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, baking powder, and salt).
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the dredged candied fruits.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 4-5 hours, depending on the size of the pan. Remove the pan of water from the oven during the last hour of baking.
Let the cake cool in the pan for a while before removing and cooling completely on a wire rack.
Wrap and store. Fruitcake improves with age, so prepare well in advance.

fields.name: Grape conserve
fields.title: Grape Conserve
fields.description: A sweet and fruity conserve made with blue grapes, walnuts, raisins, and citrus.
instructions: Crush grapes with a wooden spoon.
Cook over slow heat until skins separate from the pulp and the juice flows easily.
Press through a sieve fine enough to separate the seeds and the tough part of skins.
Add sugar, orange, and lemon.
Boil until mixture is thick like a mass when a little is placed on a cold plate.
Add coarsely cut walnut meats five minutes before removing from fire.
Boil briskly.
Pour in sterilized jelly glasses and cover with paraffin.

fields.name: Green tomato pickle
fields.title: GREEN TOMATO PICKLE
fields.description: A tangy and flavorful pickle made with green tomatoes, onions, cauliflower, and cucumbers.
instructions: Cut the green tomatoes, onions, cauliflower, and cucumbers into 1/2" to 1" pieces.
Cover the vegetables with water, sprinkle with salt, and let them stand for 24 hours.
Pour off the liquid and wash the vegetables in cold water.
Heat the vinegar and water in a pot.
Add the brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, celery salt, mustard seed, and allspice (you can put the spices in a spice bag if you prefer).
Add the spiced vinegar mixture to the vegetables.
Bring the mixture to a boil.
Seal the hot pickle in sterilized jars.

fields.name: Icebox rolls
fields.title: Ice Box Rolls
fields.description: A simple recipe for delicious, make-ahead rolls.
instructions: Put the sugar, salt, and fat in a bowl.
Add the scalding hot milk and stir until dissolved.
Cool to lukewarm.
Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water.
Add the yeast mixture to the lukewarm milk mixture.
Add the beaten eggs.
Add the flour and beat well.
Put in a large oiled bowl, cover, and put in the ice box overnight.
Next day, roll out the dough 1/4 inch thick.
Shape into Parkerhouse, butter horn, butterflake, or clover leaf rolls.
Let rise in a warm place for 2 hours.
Bake 10-15 minutes at 400°
fields.comment: Icebox rolls, also known as refrigerator rolls, were particularly popular in the mid-20th century.  They offer convenience for busy schedules, allowing the dough to be prepared ahead and baked fresh the next day. This method was especially helpful before readily available frozen doughs.

fields.name: orange kiss-me cake
fields.title: Orange Hire Me Cake
fields.description: A delicious orange-flavored cake with raisins and walnuts, topped with a citrusy glaze.
instructions: Combine raisins and walnuts.
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Cream together sugar and shortening.
Beat in milk.
Beat for 2 minutes 30 seconds at medium speed until batter is well blended.
Add eggs.
Fold in the orange-raisin mixture into the batter.
Pour into a well-greased and lightly floured pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40 to 50 minutes.
While cake is still warm, drizzle 1/3 cup orange juice over it.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and chopped walnuts.
Decorate with orange slices.
fields.comment: The name "Hire Me Cake" suggests this cake was popular to bake and share during job searches or celebrations of new employment.

fields.name: Peanut butter cookies
fields.title: Peanut Butter Cookies
fields.description: Classic peanut butter cookies made with simple ingredients.
instructions: Cream together the peanut butter, shortening, and sugars gradually.
Add the beaten egg and vanilla.
Sift together the dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, and salt).
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Chill the dough.
Mold the dough into balls the size of walnuts.
Place the balls on an oiled baking sheet.
Flatten the balls slightly with a fork.
Bake at 375-400°F until golden brown.
fields.comment: Peanut butter cookies are an American classic, popular for their simple ingredients and satisfying flavor.

fields.name: Sweet pickles
fields.title: Sweet Pickles
fields.description: A recipe for sweet pickles involving a multi-day process of soaking cucumbers in various solutions.
instructions: Wash and dry cucumbers thoroughly.
Pack cucumbers in a stone crock and cover with salt water (1 part salt to 1 gallon of water).
Let stand for 1 week.
Drain the salt water.
Cover with boiling water and let stand for 24 hours.
Drain the water.
Cover with alum water (2/3 block alum to 1 gallon of water).
Let stand for 24 hours.
Drain the alum water.
Cover with syrup (recipe not provided).
Reheat syrup daily for 7 days.
After the first reheating of the syrup, add 1 cup of sugar, and optionally, vinegar and cinnamon.
notes: The recipe mentions 'reheating syrup daily for 7 days,' which is a crucial but undescribed part of the process.  More information is needed on how to make and reheat the syrup.
The quantities for many ingredients (cucumbers, alum, sugar, vinegar and cinammon) are unclear. Additional information may be needed.

The use of alum in this recipe is a traditional pickling method but isn't common in modern recipes due to safety concerns around aluminum consumption. It's best to consult updated pickling recipes or resources for alternatives or safe usage guidelines if considering using alum.
fields.comment: Alum was historically used in pickling for its crisping effect, but modern recipes often avoid it due to health concerns. This recipe offers a glimpse into older pickling methods.

fields.name: Banana nut bread
fields.title: Banana Nut Bread
fields.description: A classic moist and nutty quick bread.
instructions: Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add eggs one at a time and beat well.
Add mashed bananas.
Sift together dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt).
Add dry ingredients to the creamed mixture.
Add nuts.
Pour into a buttered loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour in a moderate oven at 375°.
fields.comment: Banana bread became very popular during the Great Depression in America due to bananas becoming more accessible, and the need to avoid wasting overripe bananas.

fields.name: Butterscotch drop cookies
fields.title: Toll House Scotch Drop Cookies
fields.description: A classic drop cookie recipe featuring butterscotch, coconut, and nut meats.
instructions: Cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the egg thoroughly.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined.
Stir in the butterscotch chips, coconut, and nut meats.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto a greased baking pan.
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
fields.comment: Toll House cookies, originally called 'Toll House Crunch Cookies,' were invented by Ruth Graves Wakefield in the 1930s.  The recipe gained popularity when it was included in Nestle's semi-sweet chocolate chip packages. This recipe adapts the classic by using butterscotch chips, adding a unique flavor profile.

fields.name: Chocolate cake
fields.title: Chocolate Jean Spr
fields.description: A simple chocolate cake recipe.
instructions: Add 1 cup milk.
Beat together with rotary beater.
notes: The OCR text is unclear in some parts. The exact amounts for some ingredients may not be right.
It is assumed that "mizacle this may over" is likely an OCR error describing how to mix the wet ingredients and is omitted because it is unclear.
It is assumed that "2 spread baking chores later on sheltered" and "14 cup bp of milk reptere not" are OCR errors and these lines have been omitted.
fields.comment: This recipe seems to be a variation of a simple chocolate cake, possibly using baking powder as the leavening agent instead of yeast.

fields.name: Cranberry salad
fields.title: Cranberry Salad
fields.description: A festive cranberry salad with pineapple, celery, orange, and nuts.
instructions: Put cranberries through food chopper.
Put cranberries with sugar and bring to boil.
Remove from stove and let cool.
While hot, add crushed pineapple.
Soften Knox Gelatine in 2 tablespoons of cold water.
When cranberry mixture is cool, add softened gelatine, pineapple, Jell-O, and celery.
Add nuts and ground orange.
Cool until set.

fields.name: crisp sugar cookies
fields.title: Crisp Sugar Cookies
fields.description: A simple recipe for crisp sugar cookies with a creamy filling.
instructions: Sift then measure flour, sift again with the baking powder, salt & sugar.
Cut shortening into the dry ingredients until fine like cornmeal.
Combine milk, slightly beaten eggs and vanilla.
Add dry ingredients to the liquid ingredients and mix until smooth.
Cover dough and chill.
Cream filling:
Blend cornstarch, flour, sugar, and salt with 1/2 cup milk.
Stir constantly and blend with 1 1/2 cups scalded milk until thickened.
Cook 10 minutes in double boiler.
Add 3 egg yolks or 1 whole egg + 1 white.
Cook 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from fire and add 1 tsp vanilla.

fields.name: Helpful Hints 1
fields.title: Kalács (Hungarian Sweet Bread)
fields.description: A traditional Hungarian sweet bread often made for special occasions.
ingredients: 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
1 egg, beaten with 1 tablespoon water (for egg wash)
Optional: Raisins, chopped walnuts, or poppy seeds
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the warm milk, 2 teaspoons of sugar, and yeast. Let stand for about 10 minutes, until foamy.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, 1/2 cup of sugar, and salt.
Add the yeast mixture, eggs, and melted butter to the dry ingredients. Mix until a soft dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, until smooth and elastic. Add more flour if needed to prevent sticking.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into three equal pieces. Roll each piece into a long rope, about 18 inches long.
Braid the three ropes together and place the braid on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Cover and let rise for another 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Brush the risen braid with the egg wash and sprinkle with optional toppings, if desired.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool on a wire rack before slicing and serving.
notes: If using raisins, soak them in warm water for 10 minutes before adding to the dough.
For a richer flavor, use milk instead of water for the egg wash.
The dough can be made ahead of time and refrigerated overnight. Let it come to room temperature before shaping and baking.
fields.comment: Kalács is a traditional Hungarian sweet bread that is often served during holidays and special occasions. It is characterized by its braided shape and slightly sweet, eggy flavor.  Variations exist across different regions of Hungary and neighboring countries, with some adding fillings like walnuts, poppy seeds, or even a sweet cheese filling. It's a beloved treat that represents celebration and togetherness.

fields.name: Helpful Hints 2
fields.title: Tips for Removing a Cake from a Pan
fields.description: A helpful hint for easily removing cakes from pans.
instructions: Plunge a cloth into boiling water.
Wring it.
Place it under the pan.
Repeat the process several times if needed.
fields.comment: This helpful hint addresses a common baking problem - cakes sticking to the pan.  The boiling water loosens the cake by heating and slightly expanding the pan, making it easier to release baked goods intact.

fields.name: Helpful Hints 3
fields.title: Helpful Hints for Removing Grease from Soup
fields.description: Tips and tricks for removing excess grease from soups, especially for those watching calories.
instructions: Drop a chilled lettuce leaf in the soup and when it has absorbed the grease, remove it.
Skim the soup with the end of a rolled paper towel; when the end is saturated, cut it off and start over.
Place an ice cube in a cloth and place it under the surface.

fields.name: Layered cheese and pineapple salad
fields.title: Layered Cheese & Pineapple Salad
fields.description: A layered gelatin salad with cream cheese, pineapple, and walnuts.
instructions: Add boiling water to Jello and stir until dissolved.
Add lemon juice and salt.
Divide Jello into two equal parts.
Chill both parts until slightly thickened.
Add pineapple to one part of the Jello.
Beat remaining Jello with an egg beater until the consistency of thick cream.
Add cream cheese and mix well.
Pour cream cheese mixture over pineapple layer.
Top with whipped cream and walnuts.

fields.name: My favorite recipe - cookies
fields.title: Mother's Soft Cookies
fields.description: A simple cookie recipe designed for soft, chewy results.
ingredients: A little more flour if needed to handle dough
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add egg and mix well.
Combine flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients.
Add a little more flour if needed until dough is manageable.
Roll out and cut into desired shapes.
Bake until lightly golden.

fields.name: Pet Milk Meal 1
fields.title: Meat Balls with Noodles
fields.description: Ground beef and pork meatballs simmered in vegetable soup and served over noodles.
instructions: Mix together beef, pork, ¾ cup milk, bread crumbs, onion, 1½ teaspoons salt and pepper.
When milk is absorbed, wet tips of fingers with water and shape mixture into 18 small balls.
Roll balls in flour.
Cook until brown on all sides in hot fat.
Pour mixture of soup and water over balls.
Cover and cook slowly for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, boil noodles 20 minutes, or until tender in boiling water and remaining 2 teaspoons salt.
Drain, then arrange noodles on platter leaving a hollow in center.
Remove meat balls, arranging around the noodles.
Stir remaining cup milk into liquid remaining in pan.
Heat, but do not boil.
Pour sauce in center of noodles.
Serve at once.
notes: Two cups of broken macaroni or spaghetti may be substituted for the noodles. Rinse in boiling water after cooking.
fields.comment: This recipe was broadcast on the radio by Mary Lee Taylor on November 30, 1939, as part of her show demonstrating delicious food.

fields.name: Pet Milk Meal 2
fields.title: Garden Casserole
fields.description: A creamy vegetable casserole with cauliflower, carrots, and a breadcrumb topping.
instructions: Break cauliflower into flowerets.
Put in saucepan with carrots, water, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt.
Boil, uncovered, 15 minutes, or until tender.
Drain and save liquid.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in saucepan.
Blend in flour, pepper, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt.
Stir in 3/4 cup vegetable liquid slowly.
Boil 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Stir in milk, then add drained vegetables and heat thoroughly.
Put into greased 8-inch baking dish.
Sprinkle top with mixture of bread crumbs and remaining 2 tablespoons butter which have been melted.
Bake in hot oven (425° F.) 5 minutes, or until crumbs are golden brown.
Serve at once.

fields.name: queens Taste
fields.title: Queen's Taste Macaroni Delicious
fields.description: A hearty macaroni dish with veal, pork, and mushrooms.
instructions: Cook the macaroni 10 minutes in boiling salted water and drain.
Fry the onion, garlic and meat in the butter till lightly browned.
Place all in a heavy tight top kettle, with 1/2 cup hot water and simmer 45 minutes.
fields.comment: This recipe comes from a collection of Queen's Taste pasta recipes, showcasing the versatility of their products in creating both simple and elaborate dishes.

fields.name: RAISIN CAKE
fields.title: Raisin Cake
fields.description: A moist raisin cake with a creamy brown sugar icing.
instructions: Add baking soda to raisins and 2 1/2 cups water in a heavy skillet.
Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until 1 cup of liquid remains.
Pour raisins and liquid into a greased 9x13 inch flat pan and cool.
Cream together butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until fluffy.
Beat in egg.
Measure flour 3 times, sifting the last time with cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.
Add dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the cooled raisin liquid, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
Mix well.
Toss raisins with a little flour to coat.
Add floured raisins, walnuts, and maple flavoring to the batter.
Mix well.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 375° for 40 minutes.
For the icing: Combine brown sugar and cream in a heavy skillet.
Stir and bring to a boil, but do not boil.
Remove from heat and beat with a spoon until thick enough to spread.
If the icing hardens too soon, reheat without boiling.

fields.name: Pepper relish
fields.title: Pickled Onions
fields.description: A tangy pickled onion recipe.
instructions: Peel onions and slice thinly.
Place sliced onions in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let stand for 30 minutes, then drain.
Combine vinegar, sugar, salt, mustard seed, and black pepper in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Pack drained onions into sterilized jars.
Pour boiling vinegar mixture over onions, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
Seal jars tightly and process in a boiling water bath for 12-15 minutes.
fields.comment: Pickled onions are a popular condiment in many cuisines around the world, adding a burst of flavor and acidity to dishes.

fields.name: Chocolate nut diamonds
fields.title: Chocolate Must Diamond Cookies
fields.description: A rich and decadent cookie with chocolate, nuts, and spices.
instructions: Sift flour, baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder together 3 times.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the chopped walnuts, raisins, coconut, and chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

fields.name: clover leaf back
fields.title: Seasonable Clover Leaf Recipes
fields.description: A collection of recipes featuring Clover Leaf Milk.

ONIONS BAKED IN MILK: Wash onions, boil in salted water for 30 minutes.
Peel onions, place in buttered baking dish.
Dust with crumbs, salt, and pepper.
Pour Clover Leaf Milk over onions, dot with butter.
Bake in moderate oven for 1 hour, or until tender.
Sprinkle with cheese and crumbs, brown in oven.

CREAMED CRABMEAT: Make a cream sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
Add chopped egg white and parsley.
Serve on toast, sprinkle with grated egg yolk.

CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING: Scald milk and bread in double boiler.
Add butter and melted chocolate, stir.
Combine with beaten egg and sugar, add vanilla.
Pour into buttered dish, bake in water bath for 45 minutes, or until knife comes out clean.

fields.comment: These recipes highlight the versatility of Clover Leaf Milk, showcasing its use in savory dishes like onions baked in milk and creamed crabmeat, as well as sweet treats like chocolate bread pudding.  The emphasis on "Seasonable" suggests these recipes were likely promoted for a specific time of year, possibly during the colder months when comfort foods were desired.

fields.name: clover leaf front
fields.title: Historical Clover Leaf Milk Advertisement
fields.description: An advertisement highlighting the affordability and nutritional value of Clover Leaf Milk, especially during a time of rising food costs.
fields.comment: This advertisement reflects a specific time in history when milk was becoming recognized for its nutritional value, and public health campaigns like Vitamin D irradiation (addition) were common. The emphasis on cost also points to the economic climate of the period.

fields.name: Curry fried tomatoes
fields.title: Curry-Fried Tomatoes
fields.description: A simple recipe for pan-fried tomatoes with a curry twist.
instructions: Cut tomatoes into about 12 slices (or 2 per person).
Sprinkle each side of tomato slices with salt, pepper, and monosodium glutamate.
Combine flour and 1 teaspoon of salt.
Dip tomato slices into flour mixture, coating each side well.
Heat butter or margarine in a large skillet.
Stir in curry powder.
Add tomato slices and brown on each side.

fields.name: Applesauce cake
fields.title: Apple Sauce Cake
fields.description: A moist and spiced cake with applesauce and raisins.
instructions: Cream together shortening and sugar.
Add the egg and mix well.
Stir in the applesauce.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, nutmeg, baking powder, and allspice.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in the raisins.
Bake for 1 hour at 350°F (175°C).
fields.comment: Applesauce cake is a classic recipe that has been enjoyed for generations. It's a great way to use up extra applesauce and the spices make it perfect for fall.

fields.name: Upside down cake
fields.title: Upside-Down Cake
fields.description: A classic upside-down cake with caramelized brown sugar, butter, and pineapple topping.
ingredients: 1/2 cup milk (added according to cake mix instructions)
instructions: Melt butter and brown sugar in the pan the cake will be baked in.
Arrange pineapple slices on top of the melted butter and sugar.
Pour in the plain cake batter.
Bake until golden brown.
fields.comment: Upside-down cakes have been a popular dessert since the early 1900s, gaining widespread popularity with the introduction of canned pineapple.  Variations include using different fruits like peaches or cherries.

fields.name: Shrimp cocktail
fields.title: Shrimp Cocktail
fields.description: A simple chilled shrimp appetizer with a tangy tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Drain the can of shrimp and remove the veins if needed.
Chill the shrimp.
In a separate bowl, combine the tomato sauce, horseradish, sugar, and salt to make the sauce.
Top the chilled shrimp with the prepared sauce.
fields.comment: Shrimp cocktail has been a popular appetizer since the early 20th century, often served in elegant glassware or as part of a seafood platter.

fields.name: Oven barbecue
fields.title: Oven Barbecue
fields.description: Baked spam with a sweet and savory barbecue sauce.
instructions: Cut Spam lengthwise, not quite through, in 8 slices.
Place in a greased baking dish.
Combine tomato sauce, water, brown sugar, onion, and Worcestershire Sauce.
Pour over meat.
Bake in a moderate oven (375° F) for 25 to 30 minutes, basting occasionally with sauce.

fields.name: Chili sauce
fields.title: Lavon's Chili Sauce
fields.description: A sweet and tangy chili sauce made with tomatoes, peppers, onions, and spices.
instructions: Put tomatoes, peppers, and onion through a food chopper.
Boil all ingredients together until right consistency.

fields.name: Orange Cookies
fields.title: Bringe cookies
fields.description: A simple cookie recipe with a hint of orange.
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add beaten egg and orange zest.
Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt.
Fold in chopped nuts.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 8-10 minutes.

fields.name: Bitter sweet
fields.title: Bitter Sweet Salad or Dessert
fields.description: A refreshing gelatin dish featuring grapefruit, adaptable as a salad or dessert.
instructions: Stir gelatin and sugar in hot water until dissolved.
Cool.
Add grapefruit, both juice and fruit.
Stir occasionally until cold.
When ready to serve as a salad, cut in squares and serve on salad greens, topped with mayonnaise.
When ready to serve as a dessert, serve with sweetened whipped cream, topped with a cherry.

fields.name: Banana Oatmeal Cookies
fields.title: Banana Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: Soft and chewy cookies made with ripe bananas, oats, and a blend of spices.
ingredients: 1 cup mashed ripe bananas (2 to 3 bananas)
instructions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon into mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Add egg, bananas, rolled oats and nuts. Beat until thoroughly blended.
Drop by teaspoonfuls, about 1½ inches apart, onto ungreased cookie pans.
Bake in a moderately hot oven (400°F) about 15 minutes, or until cookies are done.
Remove from pan immediately.
notes: Use fully ripe bananas - yellow peel flecked with brown.
fields.comment: Oatmeal cookies, particularly those with fruit, were a popular treat during the Great Depression and World War II due to their affordability and nutritional value. They remain a classic comfort food today, offering a balance of sweetness and wholesomeness.

fields.name: Broiled supper sandwiches
fields.title: Broiled Tuna Supper Sandwiches
fields.description: Tuna, cheese, and vegetables are combined, spread on buttered buns, and broiled until bubbly.
instructions: Combine the flaked tuna, grated cheese, onion, parsley, green pepper, lemon juice, salt, and mayonnaise; blend.
Spread buns with butter.
Toast the buns or slip them under the broiler to brown lightly.
Spread tuna mixture atop lower half of each bun.
Broil until the mixture bubbles and the cheese melts.
Add toasted tops and serve sandwiches immediately.
fields.comment: Open-faced tuna melts became popular in the United States during the mid-20th century as a quick and easy meal.  Adding the top bun makes it more portable and less messy.

fields.name: Fiesta peach upside down cake
fields.title: Fiesta Peach Upside-Down Cake
fields.description: A delicious honey-spice cake topped with caramelized peaches.
ingredients: Betty Crocker Honey Spice Cake Mix batter (follow package directions)
1 (2.5 can) cling peach halves, thoroughly drained
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F (325°F for glass pans).
Melt butter in a 9x9x1.5 inch square pan.
Stir in brown sugar.
Arrange peach halves and, if desired, a few maraschino cherries on top of the butter-sugar mixture.
Pour half of the cake batter over the peaches.
Bake for about 35 minutes.
Invert pan onto a serving plate.
Serve warm.
Bake the rest of the batter in another pan according to package directions.

fields.name: Chocolate chip oatmeal cookies
fields.title: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
fields.description: A delicious treat perfect for dessert or a between-meal snack.
instructions: Simmer raisins in water 10 minutes, drain water and save.
Cream shortening and sugars, add eggs and beat well.
Add liquid from raisins and the rest of the ingredients.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet and bake in a 400-degree oven for 10 minutes.
notes: Added eggs to the ingredient list based on the instructions.
fields.comment: This recipe won the 'Recipe of the Week' prize in a contest submitted by Mrs. Ruby Nielsen of Salt Lake City.  Recipes with this level of detail provide a glimpse into the baking culture of the time.

fields.name: Peanut Candy
fields.title: Peanut Candy
fields.description: A simple candy made with peanuts, sugars, and syrup.
instructions: Boil sugar, syrup, and water until 280 degrees F (soft-crack stage).
Add butter and peanuts when nearly done.
Remove from fire, and pour in greased pan to harden.
fields.comment: This type of candy, with variations in ingredients and methods, has been a popular treat for generations, often made around holidays.

fields.name: Cherry Pudding
fields.title: Cherry Pudding
fields.description: A delicious baked pudding with cherries and nuts.
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar together.
Blend in well-beaten eggs.
Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together three times.
Add the dry ingredients alternately with the milk to the creamed mixture.
Blend in cherries and nuts.
Pour into a greased pan.
Bake for 45 to 50 minutes in a moderate oven (350°F).
fields.comment: Cherry pudding, often called cherry cobbler, buckle or slump, is a classic dessert enjoyed throughout the year, especially during cherry season.  It's a versatile dish with many variations, often passed down through family recipes, making it a beloved comfort food in many cultures.

fields.name: Cherry Sauce
fields.title: Cherry Sauce
fields.description: A simple cherry sauce thickened with cornstarch and flavored with almond extract.
instructions: Mix sugar, salt and cornstarch.
Blend in cherry juice and water.
Stir constantly until thick.
Add almond extract.
fields.comment: Cherry sauce is a versatile topping that can be used on ice cream, pancakes, waffles, or even as a filling for cakes and pies. The use of almond extract adds a unique depth of flavor that complements the sweetness of the cherries.

fields.name: Bread For  Summer Salads
fields.title: Banana Raisin Loaf
fields.description: A fruit bread perfect for summer salads and sandwiches, featuring bananas, raisins, and orange rind.
ingredients: 1 cup mashed ripe bananas (2 to 3 bananas)
instructions: Rinse and drain raisins.
Cream shortening and sugar together.
Add egg and beat well.
Blend in banana and orange rind.
Sift flour with baking powder, salt and soda.
Blend into creamed mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in raisins.
Turn into greased loaf pan (about 8½x4½x2 inches).
Bake in moderate oven (350 degrees F.) about one hour.
Let stand five minutes.
Turn out onto wire rack to cool.
fields.comment: This recipe was published in a newspaper during the summer, emphasizing its pairing with summer foods like salads and sandwiches.  It highlights the refreshing and convenient nature of fruit bread during hot weather.

fields.name: Cookies
fields.title: Cookies
fields.description: Classic cookies made with simple ingredients.
instructions: Cream shortening.
Add sugar gradually and egg.
Dissolve baking powder and salt in sour cream.
Add to mixture alternately with sifted flour.
Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Says
fields.title: Betty Crocker's New Method Cake
fields.description: A quicker and easier method for baking delicious cakes using Softasilk and the Betty Crocker Speed Method.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (adjust for high altitude as needed).
Prepare baking pans as directed in the specific recipe.
Sift Softasilk cake flour and measure.
Measure and add other dry ingredients to the sifted flour.
Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.
Add shortening and part of the liquid (including flavoring) to the dry ingredients.
Beat vigorously with a spoon or electric mixer on slow to medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping the bowl frequently.
Add remaining liquid and unbeaten eggs.
Continue beating for 2 more minutes, scraping the bowl frequently.
Pour batter into prepared pans and bake as directed in the specific recipe.
notes: For high altitudes, adjust baking powder and sugar, and increase baking temperature as follows: 3000-4000 ft: Reduce baking powder by 1/4 tsp, no change to sugar or temperature. 4000-5500 ft: Reduce baking powder by 1/2 tsp and sugar by 1/4 cup, increase temperature to 375°F. Over 5500 ft: No change to baking powder, reduce sugar by 1/4 cup, increase temperature to 375°F.
Batter for some cakes may be quite thin.
fields.comment: This recipe highlights the introduction of a new, quicker cake baking method by Betty Crocker, emphasizing convenience and ease for home bakers.  The use of "Softasilk" cake flour suggests a move towards specialized ingredients for optimal results.

fields.name: Betty Crocker Fluffy Gold Cake
fields.title: Fluffy Gold Cake
fields.description: A light-as-a-cloud golden cake made with the 4-minute Betty Crocker method.
ingredients: ½ cup High Grade Vegetable Shortening
⅓ cup Egg Yolks, unbeaten (4 medium)
instructions: Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add 1½ cups of sugar, ½ cup of shortening, 1 cup of milk, lemon extract, and vanilla.
Beat for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining ⅓ cup of milk and egg yolks.
Beat for 2 minutes.
Pour batter into two greased and floured 8-inch round cake pans lined with greased parchment paper.
Bake at 350°F (moderate oven) for 30 to 35 minutes.
Let the cake stand in the pan for a moment before loosening the edges and turning it onto a wire cooling rack.
Peel off the paper while the cake is still hot.
fields.comment: This recipe utilizes the 4-minute Betty Crocker method, emphasizing speed and ease.  The use of SOFTASILK cake flour suggests a focus on achieving a tender crumb.

fields.name: Pineapple Salad
fields.title: Pineapple Salad (Frozen)
fields.description: A sweet and savory frozen salad with crushed pineapple, marshmallows, cheese, pecans, and a creamy dressing.
instructions: Mix together all ingredients except whipped cream.
Fold in whipped cream and mayonnaise.
Place in refrigerator container and freeze.
Serve on lettuce leaf with additional mayonnaise.

fields.name: Butterscotch Bread
fields.title: Butterscotch Bread
fields.description: A sweet quick bread flavored with butterscotch chips and brown sugar.
instructions: Combine dry ingredients.
Add melted shortening, sour milk, and butterscotch chips.
Let stand for 20 minutes.
Bake.
fields.comment: Butterscotch chips are a relatively recent baking ingredient compared to traditional butterscotch candies and sauces. Their invention and incorporation into baking recipes have made it significantly easier to make butterscotch-flavored treats at home.

fields.name: Orange Pineapple Conserve
fields.title: Orange Pineapple
ingredients: juice and rind of three oranges
notes: Based on your list of ingredients, a Pineapple Orange Freezer Dessert, a variation of a classic homemade ice cream or slush, is the most likely recipe. The combination of fruit, sugar, and milk points toward a frozen treat.
fields.comment: The recipe title 'Mind of Three' suggests a combination or play on three elements, possibly flavors or textures, with oranges being one of them.

fields.name: Hardy Salad Bowl
fields.title: Hearty Salad Bowl
fields.description: A colorful and healthy mix of salad greens, vegetables, and heartier ingredients like shrimp and asparagus tips, dressed in a flavorful Wesson Oil vinaigrette.
ingredients: 1/2 head lettuce broken in 1-1/2 inch pieces
instructions: Measure seasonings into salad bowl.
Press the yolks of the eggs through a sieve and mix into the seasonings.
Stir in a tablespoon of the Wesson Oil.
Add remaining oil and vinegar, beating until well blended.
Add the vegetables, chopped egg white, and shrimp and turn over and over lightly with a fork and spoon until well mixed.
If you like a touch of garlic, rub bowl lightly with clove of garlic before mixing seasonings.
fields.comment: Salad bowls gained popularity in the mid-20th century as a way to incorporate more fresh produce and protein into meals.  Wesson Oil, a popular vegetable oil brand at the time, often featured recipes like this one to promote their product's versatility.

fields.name: Pear Conserve
fields.title: Pea Conserve
fields.description: A sweet and fruity conserve made with pears, pineapple, oranges, and lemons.

fields.name: Wheat Bread
fields.title: WHOLE WHEAT BREAD
fields.description: A simple whole wheat bread recipe using yeast, honey or brown sugar, and whole wheat flour.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons of honey or brown sugar
instructions: Dissolve the yeast in a little warm water.
Warm the milk to blood heat.
Add the sweetener (honey, brown sugar, or maple sugar) and olive oil to the warmed milk.
Add the yeast liquid to the milk mixture.
Add the flour a little at a time and mix thoroughly.
Put the dough into greased tins, filling them half full.
Let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk.
Place the tins in a very hot oven.
After 5-10 minutes, reduce the oven to moderate heat.
Bake for about an hour.

fields.name: Brown Sugar Cake
fields.title: Brown Sugar Cake
fields.description: A sun-tanned favorite brown sugar cake with a smooth, fine texture.
ingredients: 3 tsp. double-action baking powder (e.g., Clabber Girl, Davis, Calumet)
3/4 tsp. phosphate-type baking powder (e.g., Rumford, Dr. Price's)
1/2 cup high-grade vegetable shortening (part butter for flavor)
instructions: Grease and flour two 8 or 9-inch round layer cake pans.
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt into a mixing bowl.
Add brown sugar.
Measure shortening and milk. Add vanilla to the milk.
Add softened shortening and milk to the dry ingredients.
Mix with an electric mixer on slow to medium speed (or beat with a spoon) for 2 minutes. Scrape bowl frequently.
Add unbeaten eggs. Continue mixing for 2 more minutes, scraping bowl frequently. (Total mixing time: 4 minutes.)
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35-40 minutes for 8-inch layers or 25-30 minutes for 9-inch layers.
Let layers stand in pans briefly, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Frost with desired icing after cooling.
notes: When mixing by hand, let the batter rest, but maintain the total 4-minute mixing time.
fields.comment: This recipe highlights the use of SOFTASILK cake flour, emphasizing its soft texture due to the tender gluten from winter wheat.  The recipe also demonstrates the different measurements needed depending on baking powder type.

fields.name: Marble Cake
fields.title: Stunning Marble Cake
fields.description: A streamlined version of an old favorite marble cake, made simple with a unique two-batter method.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Shortening (high grade vegetable), using part butter for flavor
instructions: Thoroughly grease and flour one 8-inch square pan (2 1/2" deep).
Measure sifted SOFTASILK, baking powder, salt and sugar into sifter, and sift together into mixing bowl.
Measure shortening and milk. Measure vanilla into milk.

Add soft shortening and 3/4 of the milk to the dry ingredients. Mix with an electric mixer on slow to medium speed (or beat with a spoon) for 2 minutes. Scrape batter from sides and bottom of bowl frequently during mixing.

Add remaining milk and egg whites (unbeaten). Continue mixing 2 more minutes. Scrape batter from sides and bottom of bowl frequently. (The total mixing time is 4 minutes.) Batter will be thin enough to pour easily.
